description:
This place has great views and great atmosphere. I came here with some friends for happy hour, and they had some pretty great deals! Oysters for $1, truffle devil eggs for $3- those were super good but kind of expensive in my opinion. 

We got a pitcher of the moscow mule, which came with a lot, but it was not that strong. I don't think I would get it again. It was interesting because they put bitters in it, which they apparently do in a lot of drinks. My friend got a French 75, which also had bitters in it, and she didn't like it at all.

Overall, would definitely come back.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Great spot for happy hours, particularly on nice days since the space has a lot of natural light. You can also hang out outside if you're a larger party. 

I love the French 75 here. Some coworkers have complained about the service but I've never had an issue with them.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Good oysters and drinks, service was just ok. Went on a weekday at around 6pm to catch the end of their happy hour. The hostess was very friendly but she seemed a little confused about the flow of seating and it seemed like they were low on menus. We were seated and given 2 menus, and a few minutes later she came by to take one of them for another table. I noticed this happening to others throughout the evening. 

Our server was friendly, but being on the patio, it seemed like he was in charge of the whole outside so we didn't see him often. Once we got our drinks and oysters, we were pretty much on our own. Putting an order in took a while as well. 

Overall, loved that there is a patio option, yummy happy hour oysters, good drinks.
author: Brianna S.

description:
B's Restaurant & Bar was ehhh. Though fine, it also wasn't spectacular, and though the location and the patio setting were really pretty, as a whole I wasn't exactly floored with the food considering its pricepoint.

Oysters ($1 Happy Hour per Oyster) - (Fun fact- It was also my first time having oysters! So yay, shoutout to that.)
 Well seeing as it was my first time having oysters, I didn't really have a gauge of what to expect. It was fine, and the sauces complimented the oysters nicely, though the oysters seemed kinda small. 

Truffle Fries ($8) - I mean I've had yet to ever say no to truffle fries. Pretty good, though the wait for these to come out was a tad long. I'd recommend them, but I don't know who wouldn't ever recommend truffle fries to begin with either.

The B Burger ($16) -  I mean this was okay, but kinda fell flat for me. It just tasted pretty average, and though it was okay, for the pricepoint I wouldn't order this again considering it was kinda small, though it was somewhat filling.

Thrilla in Manila ($12) - Rum, Passion Fruit, Campari, Pineapple, Lime, and Maraschino Liqueur. Really loved this drink!  Sweet yet strong, and the pineapple chunk also ties in perfectly as an accent. Definitely a recommend, and I loved this.

The location itself is gorgeous in the Yerba Buena Gardens, with it's nice landscape setting, and the patio itself is also gorgeous. I went to go sit indoors inside the restaurant, but when I came there were a lot of flies buzzing around where I sat, which was a tad offsetting. 

Service here was really good, and my waiter was super attentive. I also didn't have to wait too long when I went during the beginning of Happy Hour, so that was a plus too.

Tl:dr; B Restaurant & Bar kinda is a meh for me. It sits at a pretty average 3.5 for me, but leaning more towards a 3 because while I thought it was decent, it also wasn't doing anything too special for me either. Though it does offer a nice setting for the food and beverage provided, it's priced slightly up there for food that didn't exactly wow me as a whole.
author: Allison O.

description:
Came here for some small bites and drinks on a Friday night. My friend made a reservation for 7:30 for our group of 7, but we didn't need it as the restaurant was surprisingly pretty empty when I arrived early around 7.

I loved the ambiance, as the indoor area is very open and airy with modern decor. There is a lot of outdoor seating seating as well.

I wish we had made the happy hour, which they offer 4:30-6:30 daily, as it includes great deals on drinks and dollar oysters. Regular price for all cocktails is $12, and prices for food are on the pricier end, as you would expect for a restaurant in this area.

I settled for ordering their Thrilla in Manila cocktail, which has rum, passion fruit, campari, pineapple, lime, and maraschino liqueur. It was a deliciously sweet (and strong!) drink, which is exactly how I like it :)

For food, I ordered the PEI mussels served in a tomato broth ($16) and honestly wasn't too impressed. This was the first mussel dish I've had that I didn't like, as the sauce tasted a bit weird to me and had a lot of ginger in it which I ended up picking out.

Overall, this was a good place to come on a Friday night as it wasn't too crowded or loud. I'm glad we came here so we didn't have to deal with crowds, even if the food was a bit lacking.
author: Dianna H.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Thursday around 5:30. (HH is until 6:30) There's an outdoor seating area, which was not crowded because it was a little cool outside. But the view is pretty nice! Overlooks Yerba Buena. 

Happy hour prices are alright, under $10 mixed drinks so it's pretty standard. No happy hour pricing on food other than the $1 oysters (minimum 6 per order). Everything came out in a timely manner and the waiters were very attentive to our table outside. 

My favorite was the truffle fries. So yummy! Comes with an aioli sauce and ketchup on the side. The sangria is pretty good too, and pretty strong. 

Will come back for happy hour!
author: RachEl L.

description: Awesome happy hour prices from 430-630pm (like $7 glass of wine and $1 oysters). If Yerba Buena is no longer under construction and the weather is nice, I love sitting outside. It is very relaxing. The inside is also nice (all glass walls). I recommend this place for happy hour for sure!!
author: Annie S.

description:
I had a glass of wine and tried many different food items.

I have to say, I was impressed. The sliders were very good - bread was nice and toasty, the chicken (?) was crispy, and the sauce was great. The pork taco was also delicious, although I'm not sure what the meat was marinated with.
The cheese and ham plate was great as well.

A bit pricey but if that's not an issue you won't be disapponted.
author: John L.

description:
Love this restaurant! I usually come here after work to get their dollar oysters which are v worth just splitting with a friend. 
- Sangrias are great, never got the big version cause there's lots of places to bar hop outside.
- Fries are a MUST GET and usually that and oysters will fill you right up. 
I will say that on days that are emptier, I wish that staff were more efficient! Overall, this place is a must go if you're craving oysters right after work.
author: Julia T.

description: This restaurant has the best views in SOMA but the service is inexcusable. I have NEVER dined somewhere where a more condescending wait staff who made it the diners problem for wanting to split the check... what year is it? People dine out together and they use credit cards to pay. In what world does the restaurant actually think it is ok to treat their customers like second class citizens for wanting to split a bill. Btw, this place is completely overpriced. Definitely skip it.
author: Gianna D.

description:
B has what almost no other restaurant in SF has. A patio. Seriously. What's with the lack of patios in this town? Is it because the weather is biting cold dampness 87% of the year? Well, on those other 13% of the days... patio, dammit! 

B has been a fixture in YBG for a long, long time. Ever since I've been visiting for work. And as my office is situated nearby, I've been a few times for team lunch, but mostly on those rare sunny days when a patio beckons for happy hour. 

This little gastro-pub (is that the right word for it?) offers a mix of food a cocktails sure to keep anyone happy. The drinks are tasty and while not cheap, not excessively expensive either. The food is good enough to come back again. Bartender service has been on point on my few visits. And overall, it's a solid experience. 

The setup is where it shines. The front of house is almost all glass, letting tons of light in. There's a solid patio overlooking YBG and the church across the street. Even if all the tables are full you can grab a cocktail and hit one of the benches outside immediately to the southwest of the bar.

Definitely a sunny afternoon staple for SOMA food and drink.
author: Don B.

description: Great place to grab a quick meal and pregame for anything you're going to do in the city - I found this place quiet and somewhat of a secret spot! Food and service was great!
author: Erika D.

description: Great outdoor options, fun for apps and drinks. Order the hummus plate. Good service!
author: Vicki L.

description:
Honestly I hate when people write reviews about prices but this place is whack with their price points.

Good drinks. Food is meh. Get the burger and fries. 

Happy hour pitchers and oysters are legit.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I LOVE B RESTAURANT & BAR. Fave happy hour (4:30-6:30pm) spot in the city. 

First off, it's located at the top of the Yerba Buena gardens. So beautiful! I had no idea this place existed. I personally adore the feel of this place -- lots of open space with modern sleek glass windows and tons of outdoor seating. Never once had to wait for a table. I can't wait to be back on a nice sunny summer day.

$1 DOLLAR OYSTERS. Quality oysters for the price. You can order as many as you like... I think we ordered 36 at a time. Truffle fries. Sangria. Get them all. 

One thing to keep in mind, SF loves their dollar oysters so get there early and get your order in so they don't run out! :-(
author: Caroline K.

description: If you order the B burger, order it well done.  Ours were too  raw.  Strawberry salad dressing was tasteless.  Strawberries were blah.   Truffle fries were delicious as well as iced tea.  Shrimp was good.
author: Joy T.

description: I loved this place. The view was fantastic. The staff is very friendly. It's closed on Sundays! Watch out for that. The sangria is to die for and the devil eggs are a must. Kids friendly. Definitely    this place.
author: Glorimar A.

description:
Disclaimer: I went here only for happy hour. Decor is pretty and it's nice outdoor seating. The prices were fair and service was alright (kept forgetting to bring us water). Happy hour is only drinks. For food we ordered a peach/burrata pizza, fried chicken sliders, and truffle fries. All the food was good but nothing to write home about. The only thing that stood out was the pizza. 

The most annoying part about this restaurant was that after seating us at 6 and letting us order, they told us the restaurant would be closing at 6:30 for a private event. They let us linger until 7 but I still find this to be unacceptable. Tell us that before we start our time at the restaurant. Three females need longer than 30 minutes to drink and eat.
author: Sonali M.

description:
I'm surprised that B restaurant doesn't have a better overall rating. I had such a good time coming here for happy hour + appetizers. The space itself is absolutely beautiful - a glass box at the top of Yerba Buena gardens, overlooking the entire park, quite nice! 

There is a lot of outdoor seating, so I highly recommend for you to come on a sunny day - the only issue is, you might find the restaurant a bit crowded on a sunny day since a lot of others may have the same idea as you (drink outside, duhh). If you come and its crowded and the bar is packed, then put yourself on a waitlist for a table - it's worth it! 

Come for happy hour. DO IT.  4:30 - 6:30 pm, daily. 
Order drinks by the pitcher $45 (both the moscow mule & kentucky stud are excellent choices). 
Order the truffle fries $8.
Order the crispy brussels sprouts w/ spicey maple glaze $9.
Please order the seared ahi nachos (omg divine) $16.
Do not order the chicken wings $14 (too dry and not enough meat).
Do not order the pork ribs $15 (bad cuts of ribs - too fat and barely any edible meat).

Enough said. Please a friend or two, your boss, your whole team, your SO. DO ITTTT!
author: Dana Z.

description: I'm highly disappointed in the customer service of this restaurant. The food was good and the bartenders are gracious, but the host and waitress could use some redefining. My friend and I came to this restaurant eager for the experience and were treating less than. Our table remained water-less while tables sat after us received their water immediately, they left us sitting for 10-15 minutes before acknowledging us to take our order and walked past our table numerous times without clearing the empty dishes. Im definitely going to be careful about recommending this place of business to others.
author: Alan D.

description:
Pro: This place has a great vibe, nice looking setting and great food. 

Con: The service sucks. The bartenders are over whelmed and it takes roughly 20 mins to get a drink at happy hour time. They also ran out of oysters at 4pm on a Friday. So that stinks.
author: Tati C.

description: What's that? Happy hour dollar oysters and truffle fries? Table for 2 please! You get a nice view of Yerba Buena gardens from this open terrace. But... yeah we got sick from the oysters here. Bubble guts for days :(
author: Lorrie A.

description:
-- Decent seafood with surprisingly good sliders --

Have visited this place quite a few times and it's a solid 4 star for sure. The dollar oyster during happy hour is surprisingly fresh at its price (most SF oysters tend to be on the salty side, FYI). The crab meat toast is well flavored with butter, garlic and herbs, bringing about a sensational first bite. The truffle fries is also satisfying. I could imagine myself passing 2 hours with just the fires and a gintonic for a Saturday afternoon. 

But what I'd highlight here is the fried chicken slider. The meat is tender and well seasoned, fried to perfection, while complemented with chopped cabbage and miniburger bread. Such a delightful and playful dish.

Extra points for the convenient location, the view and the vibe. Very biz casual, very SF. Negative points for the service (overall understaffed so service is slow). 

Will I visit again?

For sure! The menu is short but changes frequently. With a convenient location (close to Powell Station) and reasonable price, I'd very much look forward to my next visit

Attaching my standard of 1-5:
5 - so good that you should fly there just to try it. Innovative and delicious. Strong menu overall.
4 - outstanding in its category locally. Would worth up to 1h drive. Strong dishes here and there.
3.5 - great food here and there but unstable quality. Would be a good choice for take-out but definitely not constitute a good date night dinner.
3 - if you come with expectation of 3-star food you won't feel disappointed. Mediocre at best.
2 - subpar food / service. Something might come out to ruin your experience.
1 - no, just no.
author: Karmán M.

description: Came here for some drinks and appetizers after work. They didn't have many vegetarian options, but the sangria was to die for!
author: Halley N.

description:
If I'm paying $6-$14 a beer, pretty sure I shouldn't see Hot pink lipstick on my glass. I'm pretty sure my lip hurts because I'm freaking out that my glass was straight up dirty and never cleaned, but still my lip feels gross and that's just not the feeling you want here. All I got was a new glass.   I should have stayed at pink elephant tho. 

Update I told my real server and he said they're bringing me truffle fries to make up for it. I mean. I just had truffle fries and don't want them at all
author: Joshua M.

description: Great hidden gem in downtown San Francisco. Very good food, great atmosphere, great selection, great service and very good music too. Been here 3 times, and its so consistent. We even had our company event here- they handled it well. Easy to deal with and very accommodating. Very good view too in-spite of the ongoing construction.
author: Art M.

description: Great rooftop happy hour! $1 oysters, truffle fries and a mule. Great way to finish off the day!
author: Amanda G.

description: Such a cute rooftop spot on top of the Moscone. The inside is actually pretty small but the outdoor seating is great on a nice day. Pitchers of sangria and a charcuterie board is the way to go!
author: Lillian B.

description:
One of the best places for HH (4:30 to 6:30 pm) in the city! Not a lot of people pass by it because it's tucked away at the top of Yerba Buena gardens. Just up the stairs towards the waterfalls! The location has a beautiful view of the garden and surrounding Fidi skyscrapers, and there are flowers & water & sun & wind. 

I have had many great memories here - from a seagull pooping on me to the wind so strong an umbrella slammed into my friend (they were so nice and had half of our meal comped). I've come here with groups, company events, and dates. This place accommodates all! 
DO get the HH pitcher of Moscow mule. So delicious and not overly sweet! For $45, you can get a good 8 to 10 glasses in. I have tried everything on their HH menu (thank you corporate life!) and they are all of good quality and flavor. Meatballs, taocs, charcuterie, oysters (juicy), TRUFFLE fries (these steak truffle fries have a great amount of truffle and big portions). 

Lots of outdoor seating, though it does get crowded so come early. People end up making use of the ledges around the flower gardens if they are just drinking. Highly recommend coming here! Great vibes. Bring back the fried mac n cheese tots!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
My favorite happy hour spot! 

Dollar Oysters EVERYDAY from 4:30-6:30. 

I came here to try the shakshuka fries and sadly they just discontinued them. 

The truffle fries were a good backup. 

I love the Moscow mules and I heard they even make their own ginger beer.
author: Nicole S.

description: B Bar has such an amazing ambiance and location is KILLER. I came here with a group of about 15 for a birthday Happy hour on Friday. Boy was this place poppin! Lively bar with a nice eclectic diverse crowd. Looked like there was also a wedding party going on. Jason was my bartender and I asked him for a sweeter whiskey drink, idk what it was but WOW it was one good cocktail. The night was fun and young so we didn't stay too long, but I will come back for bites and more cocktails soon!
author: Troy R.

description: Fantastic food, drinks, ambiance, service, etc. It doesn't get much better than this. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the city. I came here with my roommate and his sister on the whim. We wanted something with a great view as boy did this place have everything we wanted and then some. Fresh flowers greet you as you walk up to the entrance. We were seated outside and it was hot but the cocktails were lovely and refreshing! I definitely plan on returning again, next time with more friends!
author: Raynecia G.

description: This space is absolutely gorgeous situated in Yerba Buena Gardens. I love all the greenery, open space, glass windows --just an overall beautiful atmosphere, especially on a sunny day. We decided to just grab a seat at the bar to pass the wait for a table. Since it was late afternoon and I wasn't too hungry, I just got an order of the truffle fries ($8), which took forever and a day to come out. They must've been picking the potatoes from the garden to take so long for my fries, although I did notice one of the server took attention to why my fries took such a long time. This is a nice spot, but don't understand why my fries took longer than a burger.
author: Cindy Z.

description: Stopped by for happy hour and enjoyed cocktails and apps on the patio. The ambience, cocktails, and service were great.  I ordered beef tacos and they made me extremely SICK! The meat also was not the best quality.  Just stay away from the beef tacos if you go here, everything else was great.
author: Shenna J.

description:
Happy hour on Saturday too!? Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was happy hour too! What a pleasant surprise :) not sure if that's a new policy since on their website it still states Tue-Fri 4:30-6:30pm.

Loved the atmosphere! Spacious, great natural lighting, and right next to the waterfall at Yerba buena garden! 

$1 oysters were fresh, clean, and buttery! Truffle fries were also very crispy and delicious!

Our servers were very welcoming and sweet, but not the type to come at awkward times or too often to ask if everything's ok :P would definitely come back again!
author: Mandy H.

description:
This restaurant and bar has a gorgeous interior and is located right next to the Metreon and Yerba Buena Gardens. A beautiful city view, especially during happy hour! But unfortunately, the mediocre service and average food quality did not offset the high prices for me. 

Happy hour is Tuesday through Friday from 4:30-6:30pm. You can get $1 oysters, $6 sangria, or $45 pitchers of sangria or cocktails (8 servings). It can be quite a wait though to get a table in the inside of the restaurant - we were told that it was going to be around a 45 minute wait for 4 people around 6pm. However, they do have outdoor seating with limited service that you don't have to wait as long for. We opted for the outdoor seating at first, and asked if we could be notified if any of the indoor tables opened up. 

We had one person order at the bar when we arrived (we got both food and drinks), and our order was actually prepared pretty quickly. We ordered a pitcher of Moscow Mule, which was pretty good and just the right amount for 4 people. The seared ahi tuna nachos were quite yummy, but the oysters and truffle fries were not as satisfying. All of the portion sizes (and the oysters themselves) were really small! 

Views from the outdoor seating were absolutely gorgeous, and the atmosphere/vibe was what I liked best about B Restaurant. It was quite cold outside though, which made some people in our party uncomfortable and the food rather cold quickly. Luckily, a small 2-person table opened up on the inside of the restaurant about 45 minutes after we had been seated, and we were able to squeeze the four of us on to it, although by that time, we were mostly finished with our meal. 

Overall, a nice vibe, but not the best happy hour in the city!
author: Kathy C.

description:
Quite disappointed...Came here on a Friday at 5:30 before their happy hour ends at 6:30. I was so excited about the $1 oysters until we sat down and found out they had sold out of all of them. How can you offer dollar oysters for happy hour and sell out before your happy hour is even over? Doesn't make sense to me.

We opted for the pitcher of sangria which was $50 for happy hour (super pricy IMO albeit tasty) and the charcuterie plate which came with 3 types of meats, a handful of hazelnuts, 3 pieces of bread, and a couple olives and apple slices (super small portions). The entire "happy hour" "meal" with tax+tip came out to be $80, which is insane. 

The place was way too pricy especially for "happy hour," the portions were small, and the service was not up to par for the price we were paying. When we had just sat down, our waiter kept hounding us on what drinks we were going to order and after we ordered, he kept hounding us on what food we were going to order. After that, he vanished and was walking around but never attended to us. My water cup was left empty for a good 30 min until we asked for a pitcher of water to pour ourselves. Ridiculous for the price we were paying. Will NOT be back.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Came here for dinner after work around 6PM. It was such a nice hot day and decided to go somewhere outdoors with a nice view!

We ordered:
Oysters: OK, not the best oysters I have had
Truffles Fries: Loved it! Hot and crispy! 
PEI Mussels: The broth is so yummy! I kept dipping it with bread!
Roasted Cauliflower: Delicious and creamy and flavorful

Happy hour is before 6:30PM! It's a pretty good deal, $1 oysters and pitchers of sangrias! 

The only complaint I would have had is that the staff is SO slow, otherwise, good place for drinks and good with a great view!
author: Natalie L.

description: I'm all about those happy hour oysters! Unfortunately, the oysters were a bit small and had a slight after taste for some of them. Still, the environment is quite pleasant on a nice afternoon and sitting out on the patio, you can get a nice breeze and view of uh, other patrons, and somewhat of a skyline. The sangria wasn't the best in my personal opinion.
author: Diana C.

description:
A nice, airy, glass-lined venue overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens. Food items like burgers, pizza, and seafood - as well as the service - are all OK enough, but the real draw is that the long bar area makes it a perfect spot for happy hour with large groups. 

I wouldn't necessarily make this a special dining destination, but if you're looking for a place that can fit lots of people, this isn't a bad choice.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Love B Bar's happy hour! They have dollar oysters and discounts on wine, and pitchers of sangria and cocktails. 

My friends and I ordered 2 dozen oysters, and split the truffle fries and the charcuterie board as well. Oysters were standard, they were on the smaller side, but ya can't complain for the price! The truffle fries were delish. They were super truffley and came with aioli and ketchup. The charcuterie board was yummy too, but for some reason they only gave us 3 slices of bread! So the ratio of meat to bread was way off hahaha. At one point we were just eating meat. I also wish they had a mixed cheese and charcuterie board, but you could only pick one or the other. 

Just one thing before you go, be sure to check their social media networks because often times they have private parties! And you won't be able to eat there. It's happened to me more than once, lol!
author: Tara A.

description: Really fun place. Came here on a Wednesday night to meet a date for happy hour. There were only a few other diners there and it was totally chill. Menu was good, drinks were tasty, oysters were refreshing. I liked how mellow it was and I was able to actually hear my date to have a conversation with! Hard to do in a happy hour in sf. Beautiful scenery, cool staff. They were fighting over which music to put on but I got a kick out of it. I didn't know what to expect because it was my first time. I was looking for somewhere to go before my movie started at the metreon but there's nothing good around that is in perfect proximity to not missing the movie. Totally coming back! Expectations pleasantly exceeded. Thanks guys!
author: P P.

description: We were looking for a Oyster Happy Hour near 5th Howard.  We found B Restaurant & Bar HH 4-6PM Fresh & Grilled Oysters for $1, Truffle Deviled Eggs. Although the Oysters were small the flavors were excellent.  We ordered their mussels in a tomato broth off the regular menu, it was excellent.  I wished there was soft bread to dunk in the broth, it was served with crostini type of bread.  They had a nice selection of cocktails, beer & wine for HH.  The restaurant was rustic, lots of light and comfortable.  They had really nice outside seating looking over Yerba Buena park.  This was a perfect place for HH.
author: Alett B.

description: First of all I want to begin with how awesome the happy hour is. The oysters are only a dollar and the service is impeccable. They were so delicious. The servers are extremely nice super funny, and all around great. I love this place, it's also very close to my job. So when I've had a long day I know exactly where I'm going. The Ambiance was a little Tech nerdy for me, but you cannot beat a deal like dollar oysters and beautiful scenery. I was kind of disappointed that the oysters do not come from the Bay Area but, they were amazing nonetheless. They also have $5 racer 5 beers and when I eat something besides the oysters, I will definitely review again. I will be back again and again and again. I think this might be the new spot.
author: Jess s.

description:
I came here with a big group and we basically filled up the entire bar section, but hey, oyster happy hour and convenient location - can't beat that! They're located off this walkway on top of Moscone Center West and Yerba Buena Gardens (and near the Metreon). Overall, it was a relatively small bar (and because of the rain, people couldn't stand outside either), but the bartender was nice and attentive, making sure to ask around in our group to see if everyone got a drink (who wanted one), and the drinks were surprisingly strong :) 

Also, the oysters and finger foods were pretty good, and they do certain drinks by pitcher, which was great for big groups like ours. A little crowded for large groups, but great ambiance and location for happy hour.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Came here on Thursday for happy hour ($1 oysters, $6 moscow mule) and was slightly disappointed to see that oysters were the only food option on the HH menu. The oysters were not very fresh, but they were edible. I guess you can't be picky when they're only $1 each. The moscow mule was delicious! We also ordered the fried artichokes on the regularly-priced menu and were surprised by the 3 small pieces of artichoke hearts. They were tasty but definitely not worth the price for how much (or little) food you get. Add 1 star for the cute ambience with lots of natural light coming through the glass walls. However, given the numerous other options in SF, I doubt I'll be coming back here.
author: Tina H.

description:
Prior to my most recent experience, I've tried to come 3 times. Keyword being tried, since every time I came, they were closed for an event! It's a bit traumatizing after the third time it happened, but I'm glad I finally got to try their HH menu! I've heard such great things about their dolla oysters, I couldn't wait to try em myself! They were pretty normal sized, nothing crazy, but I think my favorite would be their truffle fries - VERY truffle-y and VERY tasty!

We also ordered the charcuterie board which was fun to try, but only came with 3 small slices of bread... which wasn't enough to layer on all the meat.. so at the end of rationing our bread, we were stuck just eating whole slices of meat.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Friend and I went here on Wednesday night around 6:30/7 for dinner. We were seated right away and the hostess was very accommodating of our request for a table with a view. 

The food was a disappointing. We ordered the artichoke jalapeño dip, fried chicken sliders, and sun choke tacos. The artichoke jalapeño dip was very tasty but it was cold so it was more like a cream cheese spread than a dip. It also came with toast that was not warm. The sliders were very flavorful (reminded us a little of pot pie) but the buns were completely cold even though they looked toasted. The sun choke tacos were burned and not very good. 

They had a nice wine selection but we were accidentally over charged. The waiter was great about fixing it. 

With all the other restaurants San Francisco has to offer I will not be returning here.
author: Terri E.

description:
Service was great but the food was above average - not amazing . You won't be disappointed but don't come with high hopes. 


The burgers can definitely be split between two people . 

As for the cocktails; I was surprised NOT be to be delighted by the DEVIL's Kiss given such a wonderful name and presentation. 

Brussel Sprouts you can't ever go wrong with .
author: Lesley M. C.

description: Me and my co-workers waited 45 minutes to get a table and when we finally got the table, they said they ran out of oysters. I would expect host to tell people ahead since they have a 1$ oyster deal and everyone just comes for that. Waste of my time!
author: Hazel I.

description:
I would give this place more stars, but mainly for the appearance plus if they had more oysters.  However, it was still a beautiful bar and restaurant.

We ordered our $1 oysters which ran out since we got the last plate!  Darn it, cause it was smooth and buttery to my palates!  We ordered their Asian Style Chicken Wings, Charcuterie Board, and Roasted Cauliflower along with our drinks.  The chicken wings were nice and crispy, but the sweet and spicy sauce really reminded me of cheap sweet & spicy $1 Asian food sauce; okay, but not for the price.  The meat board was nicely plated as it should and the meats and breads would have been perfect if I had ordered wine, but I was drinking an IPA; looking back this would have made since; blasted!  Finally, what's up with the tahini and cauliflower combo that I'm starting to see!? I just hate it, but my buddy ordered it so hey I tried.  It's always just too dry and felt liked eating crumbly powder. - Enjoy!
author: Bao H.

description:
Ambiance and decor was great. We sat on the outdoor patio. Ordered truffle fries, tacos, spinach artichoke dip, and the flatbread platter. Food was OK. 

Service on the other hand was not great. They were not polite, took a long time to take our order, and overall did a poor job in checking if our meal was going well. Would avoid this place if you're new to town, unless you like overpriced cocktails and sub-par cuisine.
author: Jason D.

description:
Great happy hour! 

Came in with some friends and enjoyed the dollar oysters while they lasted. 

This is one of the few places in the city that keeps the freshest oysters. The server mentioned that they shuck their oysters fresh daily. I got my oysters tonight, but they ran out by the time I was ready for a second round. A little disappointing, but the service totally makes up for it! 

They even gave me fries as a consolation! What a great place.
author: Jessica W.

description:
This review is solely on their happy hour cause, well, I've only been here for happy hour. (Not an alchy, I promise!)

Happy Hour: Tuesdays through Fridays from 4:30p - 6:30p
- $1 oysters
- $6 sangria
- $45 pitcher of sangria (white, white sparkling, red, or red sparkling)
- $45 cocktails pitcher (moscow mule or kentucky stud)

My former coworkers took me to B Restaurant and Bar for my going away celebrations a month ago. Located in the Yerba Buena Terrace, it overlooks the gorgeous gardens, so you get a nice view with your drinks.

Since the weather in the city was really nice that day, we asked to be seated outside. Then, we started in on those pitchers! (Each pitcher pours about 8 portions.) After some pitchers, there were shots, and then what the hell happened...? Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description:
I've been wanting to do oyster happy hour for many months now and only just got around to it recently. For anyone who's interested, Thrillist and SF Eater both have lists/maps of $1 oyster HH's in SF :)

B Restaurant is a great place for happy hour, especially if the weather is nice. It's located in Yerba Buena so there's a very peaceful, relaxing vibe, and the restaurant has glass walls/windows so there's a beautiful view both indoors and outdoors.

HH is Tuesday through Friday from 4:30-6:30pm. The HH menu is limited to just $1 oysters for food, but that's not really anything to complain about. Alcohol is $5-7 or you can get a pitcher of sangria or moscow mule for $45.

My friend and I ordered 6 oysters first because we weren't sure about the quality, but they were definitely solid so we ended up ordering another 6. We also got the TRUFFLE FRIES ($8) and a CHEESE BOARD ($17). The truffle fries were DELICIOUS. Thin cut, perfectly crispy, lightly salted and seasoned with thyme, parsley and chives. The truffle oil is really the star though. The cheese board was solid and consisted of 3 cheeses, a few slices of bread, pear slices, candied walnuts and fruit preserves. I'm not a huge cheese person and I'm not really sure how to properly enjoy a cheese board, but I liked the cheeses. The bread wasn't very good though - kind of stale and chewy. I wish they had served the cheese with crackers or a crunchier bread.

Service here could definitely have been better. Pretty slow and inattentive. It took a while for someone to take our order and the server walked away to put our order in before we had actually finished giving him our order. We asked someone later about ordering the rest of our food and the girl said she'd let the server know, but that didn't happen for a while.

Still a solid spot for happy hour though. I'll definitely be back for the $1 oysters and the truffle fries!
author: Jessie L.

description: Kinda pricey but i really wanted oysters! xD It was very crowded (firday night) so we sat outside so it was kinda cold and dark lolol. They have happy hour deals for drinks and food until 6pm so go before then! :)
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
Meh!

This place was lame and the customer service lacking, the only redeeming feature was the space itself and the views you got from the patio. 

Arrived with coworkers for HH, seated quickly. Later on a few more co-workers joined us, necessitating that we borrow some chairs from a single-occupied table nearby. This apparently was a No-No, because shortly there after the seating hostess came over to ball us out. One thing to politely ask to return the chairs, but it's a completely different thing to throw shade at a group that wound up spending over $600 (in a 1.5 hour time, which is damn good money for this bar to make). 

The brusque hostess aside, the service was crap. When our food/drinks were finally brought to us, the servers basically threw it down on the table and walked away. No napkins, no utensils, nothing! Our server was scarcely seen and never bothered to check in to see if we need to order more pitchers or food. A true money loser for the bar, since we would have continued to order more had they returned. 

The food was nothing special, the best thing might have been the tacos, certainly not their fried chicken slides, Mediterranean platter, fries, or the absolutely terrible fried artichoke hearts (emphasis on the choke part). 

Now, I get that this is a bar-trap for those visiting the Moscone center and that we should have known better than to hit this place up, but it was sunny out and we wanted a view. 

Bottom-line, this place is not worth visiting. AVOID!
author: Brandon J.

description: I have been here a few times for lunch.  This is a beautiful place set in even more beautiful garden.  I like sitting outside on a nice day.  Each time I've been, my waiter was Kyle and he is excellent--very polite and attentive.  Not a huge menu for a vegetarian but I don't need a huge meal at lunch.  I usually go for the seasonal soup they have and whatever veggie dish is on the menu.  The menu is seasonal and changes which I think is great.  I did try the cheese plate and wasn't super impressed, but at least Kyle was good about refilling the crostini and marmalade.
author: Megan M.

description:
I don't often go to a restaurant simply because it's close to where I am, but when with hungry friends at SFMOMA, I did just that. Turns out the food was fresh and yummy! Sure they charged me $16 for a beef/lamb patty and some lettuce, but it is what it is. My friends enjoyed the vegetarian French onion soup, salad and some yummy chicken-y thing. 

We sat outside which was lovely and watched a group of young Asian pop (singer?) dancer girls practicing or filming their routine on a beautiful SF day. Everyone's food looked good, people looked happy, and I'm surprised that B didn't have a higher rating nor was it very busy at lunch.
author: Thalia F.

description:
The view from this place is pretty. The service was also fast and the staff was friendly. We had just missed happy hour but I believe it's from 3-6:30 pm. 

My friends and I ordered a dozen oysters, ribs, chicken meatballs and shakshuka fries (a MUST order). Everything was okay but the fries were the best part. The only thing I didn't like was the raspberry lemonade. I believe they use some kind of simple syrup because the taste was so overwhelming every time I took a sip. Also, the women's restroom only had one stall while the other was full of chairs and other pieces of furniture. 

Overall I did like this place and would return.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Thanks God for Kyle! Our wonderful server is truly responsible for turning our 3-star lunch into a 4-star experience.

My co-workers took me here the other day for my 3-year Yelpiversary lunch. Located in Yerba Buena Gardens, B Restaurant's downtown views are pretty hard to beat. So if you're looking to impress an out-of-town guest at a SOMA spot, you should definitely bookmark this restaurant.

As soon as our party of six was seated, it was time for the Kyle show. This guy was an energetic one-man show. In addition to promptly taking our drink orders and explaining his menu favorites, he entertained us with stories about his family and other amusing anecdotes. It wasn't just our table - this guy really knew how to work the room. I swear - if there was ever a class on how to be a great waiter, Kyle should be the professor. He's that good!

As for the food, it was good (though not entirely memorable). To be honest, the menu was a bit confusing to me because most of the lunch entrées seemed more like appetizers (eg Chicken Meatballs, Po' Boy Sliders, Carne Asada Fries, and Fried Mac & Cheese). Don't get me wrong, these dishes were tasty but seemed more like over-priced bar bites. 

I wound up getting the Po' Boy Sliders (3 mini-sandwiches made with fried chicken, spiced remoulade, pickles). Unfortunately, my order somehow got lost in translation. So while my co-workers received their meals in a timely manner, I had to wait another 10 minutes while the kitchen fired up my sliders. At the end of the day, it was an honest mistake. No harm, no foul. And Kyle made sure to take care of things and keep the mood light. I was surprised to discover that they took my meal off the check (that's pretty stellar customer service). For what it's worth, the Po' Bo Sliders were crispy and filling. I'd definitely order them again.

My co-workers all seemed to enjoy their dishes, but the overall consensus seemed to be that the portions were a bit small (especially given the price). That being said, I would totally return to B Restaurant for an afterwork happy hour. Their cocktail menu looks pretty amazing, and their food seems to be more suited for their bar program.

If you do wind up going, be sure to request Kyle as your server. He's awesome!
author: Kevin B.

description: Dollar Oysters and beautiful view at the heart of downtown SF. Great Happy Hour selection :) some food items are ok, but can't beat dollar oysters!
author: Love R.

description:
B R & B is one of my favorite spots for happy hour.

It's located at the corner of 3rd & Howard, situated at the top of the Yerba Buena Gardens waterfall.  Whether you sit at the bar or tables inside you can see a great view of the city skyline through their large glass windows.  I love to sit outside on their patio on a warm sunny day.  Their outdoor seating works great for larger parties.

Nice staff,and quick service even when they're busy.

I enjoyed their house cocktails called "Hop Scotch" (bourbon, scotch, plum liqueur, egg whites, bitters, & Pilsner).

For group HH I recommend their dollar oysters (get there early as they ran out early one night), truffle fries, and wash I down with a pitcher of Moscow mule.

Cheers!
author: Janice C.

description: Review for happy hour only:  $16 full pitchers of beer or $5 pints and $1 oysters.  The oysters were perfect and had no shell chips and were absolutely clean.  The location is cool with lots of glass and a decent view.  If in the neighborhood for HH, stop by!
author: Mike D.

description: This is a light airy space in SOMA at Yerba Gardens.  I like to stop in for a drink before or after a visit to MOMA.  The truffle fries are thin and crispy.  This is more of a drinking spot for me. Early afternoon is better.  Later in the afternoon it can be a tad too warm on a sunny afternoon.
author: Andrew S.

description:
A friend of mine fell in love with B Restaurant and Bar with it's outdoor atmosphere. For her birthday a few years ago, she gathered all of us for happy hour.

*Oysters http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b-restaurant-and-bar-san-francisco#P99hPODiMH2rWOk0Tyo-Uw
*Fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b-restaurant-and-bar-san-francisco?select=T_2Hud3lvks_7MNoyNP18w#T_2Hud3lvks_7MNoyNP18w
*Charcuterie Board http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b-restaurant-and-bar-san-francisco#AFK8L35oHxF3uZkNS7pfKg
*Pizzetta Lyonnaise http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b-restaurant-and-bar-san-francisco#I3odXNUnM-0XsCrRACE6dQ

So I'm pretty sure I drank my way through HH instead of eating, so I can't really comment on the food. But who doesn't love HH oysters?! I think they were either $1 or $1.50 each. For drinks, we got sangria. I'm normally not the biggest fan of white sangria, but they make a really nice refreshing one with sparkling wine. Plus the pitcher is really pretty with all the fruit!

On a nice day, their patio is amazing. You don't think much of it since you're not very high and it doesn't really look like much walking by. But if you sit outside while having a drink, you have a nice view of Yerba Buena and the surrounding buildings. It's actually very lovely. A great place to enjoy drinks and apps!
author: Elena N.

description: Happy hour was great and the views were amazing! Drinks are a bit on the pricier side but definitely worth it for that treat yourself kind of friday
author: Olivia G.

description:
First restaurant I tried for my trip in SF... I got here and sat here and waited for my friend...  They did not tell me that oysters were sold out...  When I finally was ready to order... Just before 6pm, when their happy hour is until 630.


"oh sorry,  we're out... Of oysters...  Sorry I forgot to tell you" 


Jeez. total bull shit.  If you told me when I sat down, I wouldve changed locations to a spot that actually has what I want... 

Don't even bother with my drinks... 

My friend ordered a beer and same thing happened... they said they ran out of that beer too...

Do they have anything?! 0/2 for the items my friend ordered.
 What a waste of time.
author: A T.

description:
Had only a glass of wine with a friend here during happy hour on a Wednesday.
Wait staff was super friendly and gave us tips on wine selection.
They also checked on us often, super attentive.

Would come back again for happy hour as it was quiet enough to hear our conversation and great service!
author: Mary H.

description:
OYSTER HAPPY HOUR!

B Bar is indisputably my favorite HH spot in San Francisco. It helps that I'm a skip and a hop away since I work down the street, but they have $1 oysters and great deals on mixed drinks, wine, and sangria. They also serve sangria and beer in pitchers.

The mixed drinks are quite strong; sangria is pretty fruity; wine is decent. I've only ordered small plates here: the fries are good (thin), brussels sprouts dish is great, charcuterie board is notable, roasted cauliflower was a pass for me (others liked it), edamame falafel was surprisingly tasty. 

The view is nice and if the weather permits, it's a real treat sitting outdoors.
author: Michelle K.

description: Fella and I went here for happy hour. Dollar oysters (Hammersley WA the night we went) 4:30-6:30, drink specials as well. Oysters were drained of the sea water, which was a bummer for me. Mignonette was fine. I like that it came with a little spoon. Mignonettes that don't come with a spoon really get us down. We had a pitcher of Unibroue for $20, six glasses total. Great happy hour value. Bartenders were slightly friendly, but didn't go out of their way to chat. That was okay, since I was hardcore deleting emails from 2014 until my fella showed up. Menu is small. We decided not to stay for dinner, but I could see this becoming a usual happy hour spot if I end up working in the city.
author: Melanie H.

description: Good beer, good food and its a hidden jewel in downtown specially for a friday night to have your drinks n food in a little quite with some good views.
author: Suman D.

description:
This place is the definition of A-OK - perfectly fine but at the same time, a little bit forgettable. We were looking for somewhere to have a seat, a drink and maybe some food and came here because Samovar had a wait. 

We were able to sit out in the sun which was really nice, and service was fine. The food was just ok - I ordered a salad and for the price it was kind of measly. There's lots of nice places in the area so I wouldn't rush back here to be honest. It was also really hard to get the bill when we wanted to leave and we ended up just going up to the bar to pay.
author: Briony C.

description: Returned for a drink and appetizer for three on a Friday nite at 5:30.   Great service, bright and fun atmosphere - interesting collection of boutique gins, whiskeys and ryes (we sampled the aromatic barreled blade gin) and had meatballs and a few other apps.  Maitre'd was very accommodating (we all arrived in stages).  Bartender was very knowledgeable in his boutique selections.  Highly recommend this place for a place to grab a bite between afternoon and evening events.  Will be back!
author: Bill H.

description: I was here mostly for drinks, but had a few of the food items on their menu.  B Restaurant is certainly a good spot if it's sunny and warm.  Seeing how that's hardly ever the case in San Francisco, it's no surprise that when it comes around, this place gets packed.  A few friends and I met up for some after-work drinks on a weekday.  Even on a Wednesday, the place was hopping! We had a few cocktails and glasses of wine, in addition to an order of brussels sprouts, roasted chicken meatballs w/ roasted plum tomatoes, and arugula & endive salad.  The brussels sprouts were OK, and the salad was literally...salad.  The chicken meatballs, however, were fantastic. Service was OK, albeit a little slow.  They were gracious enough to let us move to outside once the crowd dispersed but without any heat lamps or lights, sitting outside gets really old once the sun goes down.
author: Lisa I.

description:
What a gorgeous restaurant - floor to ceiling glass windows with a beautiful view of the city lit up at night.  The happy hour oysters were fresh and delicious!  The happy hour menu also includes 2 beers, 2 wines, sangria, and pitchers of 2 different cocktails. I think it lasts till 6:30 pm.  

We got the fried mac n cheese which was good, the truffle fries and truffle risotto which I loved (but I love anything truffle), Brussels sprouts that were firm and flavorful, and something else that I can't remember which means it wasn't that good.  I really like this place overall.  The only thing is that I've given their cocktails so many chances, and I'm always disappointed.  The drinks are imaginative with interesting ingredients, but somehow they are always poorly executed.  This is still one of my favorite places to meet friends; going forward I'll just be ordering wine and beer instead of cocktails.
author: Jaching H.

description:
I can see this place calling to me from my office.   It is on top of Yerba Buena and its just across the corner.   I might have given it an extra star for the convenience but regardless.  Here are the other good reasons. 

$1 dollar oyster HH at 430 to 630   The oysters are actually pretty good size and pretty fresh they must run through them a lot.  My coworker who will rename nameless has been known to just go here and buy the 5 oysters.   Thats it.  Now thats when you know its good to satisfy a craving. 
$5 dollar Racer 5 IPA or Scrimshaw   Beer
$7 Wine
I forget how they do Sangria you can get a pitcher or a glass and how much.  
Plus for a great view on the patio.  Awesome view.  

Thats pretty much it for HH.
author: Homer S.

description: They're supposedly voted the best happy hour, but don't come here if you're drinking wine. $7 gets you the weakest HH pour in town! When did this place get so cheap?! And the service is horrible - it's not even busy! This experience has been the worst and I'm so disappointed. I used to love this place.
author: Vicente G.

description:
I didn't even know this place was THERE, up in the upper levels of Yerba Beuna Gardens.

We asked for a reservation 30 minutes before and was seated with no problem or wait at our reserved table outside. The weather was nice and sunny, even as the wind was picking up. Staff was attentive even though it was a busy Thursday with a packed Happy Hour crowd inside.

We got beer and 2 orders of dozen oysters and man, these bad boys were so plump and juicy. We asked for hot sauce, and we didn't think it could get any better.

But it DID.

Server comes up to us with some truffle fries and said: "this is on the house." For real?!! What a sweet gesture. Thank you B Restaurant for the hospitality and meal, I would definitely come back for the wonderful service and juicy oysters.
author: Brenda L.

description:
My oyster coach (yes, that's a thing) gave me a training outline.

It basically goes like

......(3)
....KEEP
....CALM
......and
.....EAT
OYSTERS

That thing at the top is an oyster, btw.

Polite service (read: they put up with me as I ate 5 trays of a dozen $1 oysters).

Unlike places whose main feature is seafood or oysters, B has a single daily type of oyster. Yet the oysters I ate lacked flavor consistency to the point that I initially thought I was eating several varieties. If you're an oystfishionado #terriblepun, this may not be to your liking.

iOysta luego, oystmigos!
author: Dan B.

description:
Super stylish place but was just okay. 
Love the area!

Enjoyed the house made ginger beer but that's all. 

The friend had oysters,we shared the chicken sliders and the pork sandwich. All were good but not mind blowing. 

We spent hours chatting and having a good time catching up. Perfect for drinks and conversation.
author: Sonya T.

description:
This place lost points because of service. I had lunch here in the afternoon, the place was not packed. It took quite some time before we were even helped by the server. The restaurant was out of oysters.  Everything just moved too slow. Drinks were never refilled. I mean, come on, we're outside in the hot sun, gotta stay hydrated!

The final straw was the fact that the wrong food item was brought to us. My friend ordered meatballs, and instead received chicken wings. It took another 10-15 minutes until the mistake was fixed. We should have been comped for the screwup, but we weren't.

Looking past the issues on service, the food was delicious. Also, the surrounding outside aroma was really cool. It's nice looking out over the park while you eat and drink in the sunshine.  I just wish the service could be better.
author: Jerad L.

description:
One dollar oyster happy hour 430 to 630 on a sunny patio in a bucolic cosmopolitan setting that could be in some sort of futuristic neo-Tuscany Star Trek fantasy. Jesus Christ, why didn't anyone tell me about this place before? This will be a regular destination anytime I am near the future Star Fleeet headquarters from now on. 

Mind you, I am systematically going to every single one dollar happy hour offering in the bay area every time I come up here from LA. But this place is so fantastic instead of exploring a new destination I may have to return to my home planet.

What's more, I hear they have truffle fries, and pitchers of sangria at insanely cheap prices and so many more delights I need to bring friends next time in order to enjoy things properly.
author: David A R.

description: I loved this place! I happened upon it for happy hour on a tuesday night and it was so fun! Great atmosphere, open and airy, great view and even better drinks. They have pitchers and a full bar and some great food options. This place is awesome!
author: Ashley R.

description:
On your first visit to B, I suggest kicking yourself before you settle into their swanky digs. Because you really should have discovered this sunny patio, happy hour menu, after-work lounging spot sooner. 

Hidden atop Yerba Buena gardens, next to Samovar Tea Lounge, B is the perfect spot to celebrate SF sunshine with friends. They have lovely patio seating, surrounded by gardens and skyscrapers in the distance. It feels like a secret slice of San Francisco, something tourists and locals would be giddy to stumble upon. 

The indoor area is equally inviting with modern furniture and big glass walls, like a sexy greenhouse. The happy hour offerings are extra nice, including a selection of $6 beer, wine, and cocktails. Usually happy hour wine means Chardonnay and Merlot -- not here! They offered Torrontes (white) and Pinot Noir (red)...the stuff you would order anyway. Approved! 

I loved the chill, non-touristy, almost un-discovered vibe here. On the next clear day, I'll be peer pressuring my co-workers into sunset drinks at B!
author: Nique F.

description:
#11 of 100 Reviews Challenge of 2016

A coworker and I had a great time here enjoying the San Francisco sun in February before we went to a Washington wine event at the Metreon. We had a great view of Yerba Buena Park and the people that walked by. We had the privacy to chat about business and the service by Kyle was wonderful. He was attentive and friendly.

We had the soup, truffle fries, Brussel sprouts, grilled Caesar with steak, a double espresso and the apple crumble. The best part for me was the steak on the Caesar. Flavorful. And you can go wrong with fries. They were thin and perfectly salted.

I have always wanted to go here because of my name. Check! We should be back at some time or another.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
I came here for Happy Hour with a group of friends. If you are bringing a large party, definitely call ahead and give them a heads up. Luckily you can always find seating on the patio if it's a nice day outside. Regardless, bring your sunglasses if the sun is out because the sun WILL get in your eyes whether you sit inside or outside.

The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. I got there ahead of time, and they asked me several times if I needed anything. I just enjoyed a refreshing glass of their Happy Hour sangria ($6) while I waited for everything else. We mainly came here for their $1 Happy Hour oysters (which do taste like $1 oysters) and they were not terrible. Their sauces are disgusting though. Everyone avoided the cocktail sauce like the plague, and we had to ask for their horseradish three times before someone actually brought it over... but it was gross too. Tabasco sauce and their other hot sauce just does not do oysters justice. It was passable for Happy Hour. Plus if you order enough pitchers of beer and sangria (holy crap they have pitchers of Moscow Mule too!!) then you will be fine. 

Our waitress asked us like FIVE TIMES if we wanted to order their fries. I was getting super annoyed that she was being pushy but our group finally caved in and ordered the fries. Okay the pushiness was deserved. The fries are so good. I'm definitely getting those next time. Because this place is so conveniently located (at the top of beautiful Yerba Buena Gardens) I would come back here, but once I find a better Happy Hour for oysters, goodbye B Restaurant!
author: Stefanie C.

description: I finally came back on a Saturday afternoon to B Bar. I used to go there pretty often a few years ago, especially for the Oyster happy hour and a delicious mushroom risotto that is now off the menu. I love their Oyster happy hour! It is probably one of the few places near downtown with happy hour during the weekends. We came yesterday and indulged on over 3 dozens of oysters and white wine. The oysters could have been fresher, but it was still a pretty good deal and we had a wonderful afternoon.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
This place often closes for private events and tells no one.

The first time it happened, a group of 12 friends agreed to join me for oysters. I showed up 5 minutes before the event started to find out they were closed.

I called ahead twice after that happened. Once about a week ago asking about why I wasn't told they'd be closed. The guy politely said to check the restaurant's Facebook page, as it announces when it'll be closed for events.

Well another 7 friends agreed to try again at B Bar today. No Facebook post saying the restaurant would be closed. Thankfully, I called about an hour before the event started, so at least I have more time to salvage the fact that they are CLOSED, YET AGAIN.

B Bar -- I've been a loyal customer for a few years now. I've recommended you to dozens of people. But we're done with this shit, lest you have a $100 gift card to give me for all of this embarrassment.

Y'all should try Farallon for HH oysters. They're nearby and at least they're open. Oola has decent $1.50 oysters, a good atmosphere, nice staff, and they're also open when they say they will be.
author: David S.

description: Cute little spot that's tucked away above the Yerba Buena Gardens (right over top of the MLK waterfall). There's indoor and outdoor seating and also spots at the bar if you want something even more casual. Nice selection of local craft beers.
author: Derwood A.

description: I love the happy hour here, with $1 oysters and half-off wine.  The quality of oysters and wine was excellent.  It's not a big place but there is a lot of seating in the patio. The service was very quick and friendly.  I enjoyed sitting outside in the patio area overlooking buena yerba center and garden.  It also has a good view of the city.  It feels like almost a secrete garden patio from the hustle and bustle of the busy city while enjoying what the city offers.
author: Celia G.

description:
I wouldn't make B restaurant my go to spot because it's pricey for a weekday lunch,  but this was a special lunch indeed! we celebrated winning a free trip to Vegas courtesy of KOIT 96.5! (shamelessly plugging lite rock, less talk!)

We wanted to have a long lunch and ordered a bunch of plates. The ceviche tasting came with fried plantains, but the manager informed us beforehand that he was going to exclude the squid and double up the salmon belly and tiger shrimp portions instead, because the squid wasn't up to par. I appreciated their honesty and also making sure not to serve us mediocre seafood. 

Their cocktails are yummy, but it needs work. Wait a minute, drinking before noon?!? Well, if it's an Aviation made with real creme de violette, then it's totally acceptable. A little heavy on this ingredient which made my cocktail on the sweet side. Their pisco sour isn't authentic looking, but it tastes like one, so we'll let it slide. 

For lunch, I balanced the asparagus, shaved fennel and grilled shrimp salad with a bowl of extremely addicting truffle fries. Why, yes! I even managed to effectively block bf's attempts to steal some.  

He reports that the burger is cooked like the way he wanted, but the bun is a bit hard... (um? That's how I like it!! LOL)  oh sorry, what were we taking about?! I blame it on the booze!  ;-)

Andrew is a joy of a server, totally attentive but not smothering. Very efficient too even when it got busy. 

Food/drinks are really 3.5 stars but the awesome staff bumps this up to a 4. Highly recommended if you're looking for a fancy lunch with views of the Yerba Buena gardens.
author: Janice C.

description: Ate here after a morning at SFMOMA.  Great location, reasonably priced and great service. Kyle was friendly and attentive, quickly switching out a flat glass of champagne he served me.  The food was fine and the menu is decent, but it is the location that can't be beat!  I will return!
author: Betsy C.

description: Place is packed during HH, particularly on Fridays. Oysters are $1 and they also have other bar bites. I've been here several times over the years but never tried much besides fries and oysters. Based on those items, it's a good spot to hang out and relax. Service can be slow and flagging down a bartender can be difficult when they're busy.
author: Julie L.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing!! Accidentally stumbled across this place and I have to say it saved the night! 
A low key night ended up being a memorable one with the help of Derek and Annie! 
Some of the nicest people I've met in a while. 
And amazing bartenders great/genuine service. 
Also Derek has skills!!! 

I would definitely recommend coming here. 

I live in San Mateo and I will make the trip back here no questions.
author: Gabriela R.

description:
I'd been here before on a quick corporate occasion, but had never given this place much attention in the past.

I chanced upon it again on an Easter Sunday. I had been wandering the empty footpaths of the city all day, and the road just sort of randomly led me here.  

Earlier in the park, I had received a random nastygram from a random OKC bi-girl who was upset that I'd dared to have the balls to refer to her as a 'cutie'. (As the modern male parlance states: she went all Jezebel on me.)  

Must confess that the note spoiled my otherwise glorious walk through our beautiful city.

"I'll order the 'Feisty Flirt' cocktail," I said to the cutie bartender who nursed my wounds as soon as I entered this bar. The speaker played a soothing French electronica tune called "I Can't Help Thinking About You' by Variety Lab.  SoundHound found it, and I downloaded it almost immediately. 

I looked around, and to my left and then again to my right - two cutie lesbian couples downed their drinks.  

All is well with the world again, lads.  No hating.  As men, it's in our karma to try and to never complain.  

Just order a damn Feisty Flirt and enjoy the shrimp cocktail.
author: Kanishk P.

description:
This place is really nice on a warm day as the open air patio over looks downtown SF, especially when the sun is setting behind the sky scrapers!  

The food is good, but on the pricier side for what it is, even during HH.  Go for the Meatballs or Roasted Cauliflower that was surprisingly delicious  The HH deals are pitchers of Sangria or Kentucky Buck.  ($10 off regular price)  Again it was a bit pricy for what it is, maybe if the Buck was stronger!  

Service was okay.  At one point the server spilt ketchup on my friends blazer and didn't offer up more than an oops, sorry.
author: Veasna H.

description:
After a long day at work, I stopped by this beautiful spot overlooking Yerba Buena for some drinks. We originally planned to go to a bar closer to the Giants game, but we decided to escape the craziness and walk a few blocks. 

The wait time was around 30 minutes for a table when we arrived at 6PM. While we waited, we sat indoors at the bar and chatted. Plenty of space and good selection.

Once seated, I decided to give their burger a try because I haven't had a burger ($15) in a while. We also ordered some truffle fries ($6ish) per the recommendations on Yelp. 

So the food: the burger was prepared well, but it was a fairly standard burger. It comes with a salad, but the combined value of the salad and burger definitely does not add up to $15. The truffle fries were expensive as well, but I would definitely try them out if you get the chance. They were really fantastic.

Overall, I gave this a 4 because it really is a nice spot. The food is fairly expensive, but not absurdly expensive. I do think that combination of the food+the location makes the price worth it. Would recommend as a potential date spot if you are looking for a nice setting that won't break the bank.
author: Derek L.

description: Quite a nice surprise with this place! The area is packed with chains and I wasn't expecting to find such a pleasant setting. The restaurant is very nice with its huge windows and provides an awesome view on the neighbourhood. It felt very relaxing to sit there. The staff was very friendly and the food was great. I went for a lentils curry soup and a salad and my friend opted for the muffuletta which was huge. We both had a nice lunch time and continued our visit of city with a positive feeling.
author: Laura N.

description:
I went here after work one evening & enjoyed some oysters, arctic char crudo, & cauliflower roasted with some tahini sauce.  Here are my perspectives:

1.  The food was OK.  The oysters were fine & the arctic char was creative.  It was served with some cashews, green apple, & avocado sauce.  The cauliflower I could've done without.  

2.  The service was pretty good.  The waitress was accommodating to our interest in moving from outside to inside & was quite attentive to filling water & bringing out our food.  They ended up bringing out the cauliflower with the breadcrumbs on it (after I mentioned a gluten allergy), which was not great.

3.  Location is great.  Yerba Buena is one of my favorite areas downtown.  The views are incredible, especially on a clear & sunny day!

Not a place I feel the need or desire to go back to again, but it's a fine choice if you're in that area & looking for a nice place to eat with incredible views.
author: Mary L.

description: Here for the Football experience downstairs!  We are from the East Bay and I have never heard of this place!  Great service and excellent food!  Definitely a place we will be coming back!  I feel like a part of a family member here!! Have I said the service a food was excellent?  IT WAS AMAZING AND GREAT!
author: Sandy H.

description: My family was visiting from out of state and it was recommended to go to B Restaurant. The service was phenomenal the entire time from when we stepped in the doors. The atmosphere was very welcoming and the food was some of the best I've ever had. I highly recommended the B Burger and the Truffel Fries. Thank you for making my family feel so welcome!
author: Travis G.

description: Went for happy hour on Friday - their only happy hour food deal is the $1 oysters, but can't be too mad about it, as the oysters are pretty good! But the star of the show were DEFINITELY the truffle fries. Oh my God. They're basically right in between fries & chips - I love how crunchy they are! Sangria was too sweet for me, but other than that, not too shabby. Nice view, too.
author: Amy L.

description: I was excited to have oysters and a cocktail on a Friday evening.  Hostess took our name for a table and we were told one group was ahead of us and there would be a 20 min wait. After seeing the group ahead of us seated, we thought we would get the next table which would have been inside. The fog was coming in and it was getting a bit chilly.  The brusque hostess seated a party with 2 dogs ahead of us inside. We were left with the leftover outside table, which was very windy and cold. We were offered an inside bar table, but no chairs. Very disappointed and left to go somewhere else.
author: Julie Y.

description: Great find on a sunny afternoon in in SOMA. The space is great - very relaxed and comfortable with great light. There is indoor and outdoor seating, but even the indoors has an outdoor feel to it as the place is so open an airy. The food was fresh and good. The fresh catch app was amazing, as were the truffle fries. I would definitely come back.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Happy hour was on point! Oysters and service great. Just say no to the sliders!  Dry and no flavor. Disappointment to otherwise a great night out.
author: Julie O.

description:
Had a few Beers and Cocktails with my Cousin while I was out in S.F on Business 4/13/2016.

The spicy mussels definitely worth licking your fingers!!

The meat board was Ok!
author: Prem K.

description:
My husband and I walked in for brunch.  We were quickly seated, which was great because I was starving!  They have a limited brunch menu, but there's a little bit of everything so one should find something to eat here.

Looking at the cocktail list, the Southern Belle (elderflower liqueur, grapefruit, creole bitters, sparkling wine) sounded good so I ordered it and indeed it was!  For food, I had the Grilled Asparagus Salad and Truffle Fries.  The asparagus were nicely grilled and charred.  With the egg, it was surprisingly a fulfilling salad.  The truffle fries were one of the best I've had.  Had enough truffle flavors to keep me digging into that bowl!  It's definitely enough to share for two people.

My husband ordered the Tortatta (potato, egg, spinach, onion, peppers, avocado and radish salad) with a side of bacon.  Bacon was $5, but it came with 4-5 strips so it was worth it.  Overall, great food and great service.  No food left behind which means this place deserves 5 stars!  Next time, I'll have to try the fresh oysters and the burger!
author: Erica S.

description:
The setting is a beautiful hidden little oasis in the city. You are on the terrace next to water, flowers and great views of the city. There is some internal seating available as well but I highly recommend sitting outside. 

The menu is pretty small, I got to try the pear with goat cheese and bacon appetizer and the fried chicken with greens. Would have been a higher rating but the food was just OK and our waitress was more sour than sweet.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Nice outdoor seating right above Yerba Buena Gardens. The setting is perfect for those rare sunny SF days. However, even if the weather doesn't permit sitting outdoors it's not a complete loss sitting inside as the tall, large windows lends to a nice outside view. 

Unfortunately, that's really all that is memorable about B Restaurant for me because their food was the classic example of "mediocre at best". My husband who loves burgers couldn't even bring himself to finish his $17 underseasoned burger. Truffle fries weren't all too impressive either and I have never come across truffle fries that I did not love. The risotto was a bit grainy and boring. 

I might return but it would be more for the ambiance on a warm day and for drinks only.
author: Esther A.

description:
Need to unwind after a day at work? Come for the Happy Hour (HH) here! 

Try: 
+ $1 oysters (love the sauces available for dipping)
+ Racer Five IPA Draft for a lighter beer 
+ Moscow Mule 
+ Truffle fries (not on HH menu but still yummy, especially with the white truffle oil)

I wish they had a more expansive HH menu that included more food and drink choices but it's still a great deal -- $5 beers on draft, $6 glass of red sangria, and $7 glasses of wine and cocktails.

I simply adore the airy atmosphere here. There are huge bay windows that lets in sunlight (in the rare case of sunny days in SF!) and you overlook Yerbua Buena gardens. If it's nice outside, go sit on the patio. Otherwise there are lots of small tables inside for more intimate parties or dates. 

I'm already looking forward to my next visit here after a long day in the office.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I was sold on the truffle fries. I will not say no to truffle fries.

I came here with a dear friend and, we being svelte people that don't eat that much, decided to share a bunch of appetizers and plates together.  The portions that they give you here are generous so if you and your friends like eating a variety of dishes, I would say go for it.

Service was good, bathrooms were clean.  The atmosphere is geared towards young professionals.

We tried the following dishes: 

-Truffle fries: very crispy and a bit oily.  I love thin fries.  The truffle oil made the fries smell so good.

-Charcuterie plate: Decent although I was expecting a bit more cuts of meat. They had what looked like salami and proscuitto.  I guess the main focus was the liver pate.  I don't like liver pate and most charcuterie plates I've eaten in the past did not have pate in it, so I might be biased.  They also give you one solitary piece of fruit... and refills on the bread!

-Fried mac and cheese: It's literally cubes of fried mac and cheese with some sauce and arugula on the side.  Good, but I actually don't like mac and cheese too much.  The inside was just straight mac and cheese while the outside was fried batter.  I did appreciate the arugula though.

Total came out to ~$20 per person (not including drinks).  Like I mentioned before, if you like sharing small plates, this place is not a bad deal.  You also get a nice view of the city in Yerba Buena Gardens since the place is a bit elevated.
author: Danielle C.

description: What a cute little place with a beautiful atmosphere and great happy hour specials. We had the oysters, which were just ok, cheese plate and truffle fries which were awesome! The service was good and it wasn't too crowded when we showed up on a Monday around 5:45. Happy hour is until 6:30. Definitely will come back to try the regular menu.
author: Ness V.

description:
B surely must stand for Business lunch because this restaurant knows how to execute a beautiful meal, and quickly!

On a warm, sunny day, the B Restaurant & Bar patio is the place to be. Our group easily found a table and within minutes, we were perusing the leather-bound menus full of healthy and indulgent fare alike. So many tasty options abound, making a decision difficult - however, a colleague and I decided to go in on an order together and we split the burger and the chicken sandwich. 

More on that burger and fried chicken breast sandwich: the burger is topped with lettuce, caramelized onion, tomato and house pickles (the addition of cheese brings the burger to $16) and the chicken sandwich is a better value at $12. With applewood smoked bacon, avocado, early girl tomatoes, arugula, and aioli, this is not your average sandwich. I enjoyed both dishes, but preferred the chicken to the burger!

Everyone else in my party seemed pretty happy with their selections, too. Also impressive: we were in and out within an hour, though lunch still managed to feel leisurely due to the efficient service!

Definitely adding B to my regular lunch rotation when dining out with a group. I've also heard stories of a magical happy hour? I will be investigating... to be continued!
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Dish (& its star ratings):
- Truffle fries w/ tartar sauce (3.5): delicious.  Wish fries were bit crispier.
- Shrimp sandwich (n/a) (friend = 3): good enough
- Vegan pizzetta [roasted mushrooms, squash, tofu, chimichurri sauce] (4): Good, surprised given simplicity of both the presentation and ingredients.  Atop focaccia bread.

Decor: Love the floor-ceiling windows on all sides.  Modern decor (clean, sleek lines).  Outdoor patio is perfect but not the night we went...freezing & windy.

Crowd:  Mostly after-work business crowd looking for good HH.  Bar was crowded.

Service: 3.5 stars, fair.

Overall: 3.5 stars.  Wouldn't mind coming back for few drinks & fries.
author: Sandee T.

description: Stopped by here for a quick bite after going to an event at Moscone. Service was great..our waiter was super nice and casual and easy to talk to. We ordered the oysters, salad and one of their boards (with meat) to share. The oysters were amazing, however the rest of the food was meh. Caesar salad tasted a bit weird...the dressing had this really strong cheese smell that was very different from the normal caesar dressing and the lettuce was bitter!
