Maybe some people like that but not me. The board was alright...the salami and prosciutto were good but the rest of the board was not good. We barely were able to finish anything. Definitely not worth it...I should have gone with the fries or cauliflowers..can't go wrong with those. Another thing was that we didn't order drinks and this place is more known for their drinks and HH so maybe that would've made the experience better. I won't be back as it is out of the way for me and if I were to go to an event at Moscone again, I would probably opt to walk a bit further for better food.
author: Kristine L.

description: Loved the location and service was good,  but food wasn't. We ordered the burger, chicken meatballs, truffle fries,  and pork belly. Only the truffle fries were good,  but how hard is it to mess up truffle fries?
author: Tasha R.

description:
I loved sitting up and dining here as much as I loved it at Samovar next door.  But unfortunately, the food doesn't measure up.

Let me tell you that it's definitely more bar than food.  Only 25% of the menu had food items so I felt stuck having to choose between a select few.  

I ended up getting the duck confit which the waitress said was laid on a bed of greens.  Not quite a salad but sort of because there's a dressing and croutons.  That looks like a salad to me.  

The two worst things about the duck:
1. Too salty
2. Meat was dry

The best thing about this dish:
1. The egg was poached and nice and gooey!  Unfortunately there wasn't a carb in the actual dish (besides the side of bread) that was there to soak up the yoke.

Thankfully, the waiter asked me if I wanted some accompanying bread which helped tame the saltiness.  My coworker had the chicken salad sandwich with a side of potato salad and that was much better!  That was one of the $9 lunch specials.

I'll be down to give this place another try but only if my first intention is to get drinks.  It just doesn't seem to be a place to travel to for food alone.
author: Shannon L.

description:
B Restaurant is our tweet-up secret Saturday/Sunday brunch go-to place. Its location in Yerba Buena Gardens is a bit off-the-beaten brunch crowd track, but is worth seeking out on a bright, warm day when you can sit outside. Unfortunately this last time it was a dreary and wet day, and the cold wind whipped through the glass-enclosed restaurant every time the door was opened. Our table of 9 took up about 1/3 of the indoor chairs.

The wait staff was friendly and accommodating, even when some in our party were over 45 minutes late. We passed the time with appetizers, mimosas and well-made Bloody Marys with a nice spike of heat. 

This was the second time I ordered the Spinach & Avocado Benedict which once again was pretty awesome. Two perfectly poached eggs, half an avocado, brioche, Hollandaise sauce and spinach. Divine! The brunch menu is not extensive, but there is something for everyone, from citrus and garden salads to burgers to a *clutch-your-heart* 4-egg B-Omega omelet.

We hope to return during happy hour for their $1 oyster specials.
author: Jerry C.

description: Awesome place- The bartender is really nice and the food is amazing too. Try the feisty flirt great cocktail. Little pricy so don't forget your wallet but totally worth the money!
author: Ryan H.

description:
Three complaints, you can decide what's worse.
1) The place gets a lot of sun, which I love, unless you leave the unopened wine bottles basking in it.
2) It took 20 minutes to get service while seated at the bar. Then when one person successfully ordered the bartender pleasantly walked off... leaving two other people without drinks. 
3) There was a very obvious and large cockroach touring the shelves of the restaurant. Gross.
author: Danny D.

description:
Wow this place is gorgeous when the weather is right. Their beautiful patio is to die for and i could spend hours in the sun. Company footed the bill for a happy hour here and it was a great place to unwind. The sangria pitchers they made were great, and I had some sort of vodka- strawberry drink with a heart in it. 

My one thing I would have changed would be the event food. We were given fries, oysters (not for everyone) and a cheese plate. As you can imagine, after hours of drinking in the sun this wasn't really substantial sustenance. I'm sure that's what our event planner ordered, but there aren't really that many options in terms of small bites for events. 

Service was nice, friendly, and they put up with our rowdy group.
author: Alyssa J.

description: #Glamarattiguide : Wear relaxed attire paired with pearls * order the sangria x truffle fries x the classic burger x cheesecake for dessert * sit in the window and snap plenty of IG images * excellent setting x enjoyable service * #societythings
author: Ashley B.

description: We were so excited to celebrate our friend's birthday at this little gem with $1 oyster Happy Hour on a school night. We got a bottle of champagne with a dozen of oysters. But when we got the oyster, they were so tiny...so so tiny that it's like eating oyster skin. Extra star for great location.
author: K T.

description:
On a rare sunny warm day in San Francisco, I can't imagine a better oasis than lounging outside at B Restaurant & Bar. 

They have a gorgeous view of the city accompanied by the serenading sounds of a waterfall backdrop. There is a good solid happy hour to keep the happy vibes going and the staff are friendly. 

Overall Thoughts

A hidden oasis in SF well worth visiting, especially on warm days
author: Eddie W.

description:
So chic! I was so impressed just approaching the place.  I went for a ladies lunch and it was amazingly gorgeous outside so we chose to sit outside to enjoy the sun.  The inside looked amazing from what I saw of it.

For drinks, we went with a pitcher of sangria and it was crisp and delightful. I also had a lemon like mojito and at first it was a little bitter but then I warmed up to it and it was refreshing. 

We saw truffle fries and we had to start with that for the table.  They tasted great and they were extremely light. They had a special for lunch which was bowtie pasta with bacon and tomatoes and a light cream sauce, #FTW! Loved it, almost licked the bowl.

Overall, awesome spot for a lovely lunch.
author: Colleen B.

description: Great spot for drinks with colleagues and friends.  Nice outdoor setting and service is friendly and sincere.  Will def return.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Came here for drinks only during a trip up north from LA. 

Service was great (Thanks Lissa!) and the drinks (I tried the Southern Belle/Sweaty Flamingo and the house red Sangria) were amazing.  The Sangria was especially delish.  

The space is gorgeous, tons of light.  Perfect place for a Sunday Funday drink.
author: Laura L.

description: Fried mac n cheese.... Amazing! Oysters, fresh and their house hot sauce is a must try, better than tabasco... Came across the place by chance. The drinks were very well made and strong. Feisty flirt is a must try... Great place to have drinks and some upscale bar food..
author: Linn H.

description: Great spot right on top on the convention center. Nice view and quality menu - will be back.
author: Emily C.

description:
B Restaurant and Bar gets an extra star for an amazing location and outstanding views on their outdoor seating area, with pretty good food to boot.

I came out for a Sunday brunch with a few friends at 11:30 and there was hardly a soul around, even by the time we left. The chairs were comfortable enough, and while I can't attribute the perfect 68 degree day to the place, it really made everything shine.
Service was good, if a little too honest and assuming that drink was a big part of our lives. Had to wait a few times, longer than I'd like, but we were chillin' so it was OK. 

Food was pretty darn good, but overpriced. My potatoes were very good, and a large quantity of them with peppers and onions (wasn't feeling well enough to have more). My friend really loved her shrimp and grits, which had large prawns with a nice sauce. The benedict was pretty lame, since they didn't have english muffins and it was on regular bread/toast. We were the first ones there, and already out? Scramble on the other side was good but unremarkable.

Overall, I suggest coming out here on a really nice day and enjoy the scenery of the gardens, which is the main reason it would be worth your money.
author: Jim A.

description: I came here Super Bowl weekend, so of course it was busy! Bartenders were fun and carried a conversation with each customer. I enjoyed their hard cider and my boyfriend went with his Jameson. Prices were great for SF. We ordered a side of fries and they were huge! SO delicious as well. I can't wait to come back and order a meal!
author: Taylor C.

description: So I went here for Happy Hour after a long work day to celebrate hump day. It is located in Yerba Buena Center.  They have dollar oysters and their happy hour is from 4 pm to 6 pm! The oysters were pretty small but I'm pretty sure it's not the season for it. The place is really nice and we had a nice view looking over Yerba buena. Their drinks here are really good and the sangria is a must try!
author: Jacky S.

description: Fun! My husband and I walked in jar as happy hour was ending (6:30) and the honored the happy hour specials. We split a pitcher of beer and a dozen oysters. Fresh oysters, big, no grit and I love the sweet chili sauce with them. The house beer was an IPA I hadn't heard of and was really good as well. Place was packed but we were able to find a place at the bar.  Overall win! Plus, the view is gorgeous! Good date place.
author: Alison M.

description:
Goal: Try a different spot each week with Happy Hour Oysters.

After finally finding this place, we were quickly seated inside. (If you have trouble finding this place like we did, just go upstairs and walk all the way past Samovar) The glass windows all around provide some gorgeous scenery on a sunny day. 

The menu was a lot smaller than we expected but between 3 people we split the Burger, 30 oysters, 1/2 dozen fried oysters, the sausage pizzetta and truffle fries. The Pizzetta and Truffle Fries are my favorite. The Sangria was a little lacking but its $5 well drinks from 4:30 to 7.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Food: average, nothing very exciting. It LOOKED  good but didn't taste very fresh or flavorful. I had the lox benedict and it was the most uninspiring benedict I've ever had including the time I made the dish myself. 

Decor: sleek and modern

Music: wtf?not very easy listening and too loud for what is supposed to be a decently classy brunch spot in my opinion 

Service: our server was nice but dressed poorly as in it was actually distracting me from my dining experience. wow, never thought I would say something that prissy but there it is. It was very unprofessional. 

I think they suck people in because it's such a great location, overlooking Yerba Buena park and because they offer bottomless mimosas but really, I wouldn't come back here to spend my money with so many other great places in the city.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Really down for their $1 oysters --- super fresh and delish. 
Cocktails are great, atmosphere great...all ruined by the fact that our waiter was a total dick.

He tried to carry our 5 cocktails with his hands; spilling .75 worth of beverage from a $12 drink. It seemed like he didn't want to take our order which seems weird because that's his job. He never checked on us, slammed water down and maybe said 5 words total to us. There was a lot of unnecessary attitude mixed with annoyed looks.

I hate that we all work in the service industry and still tipped him 20% (on a bill that was much over $100) and shit happens but his actions and poor service pissed me off enough to write this review.

The only people that looked pleasant were the bussers. 
Management should look into having them be the servers instead.
Or maybe hire servers that don't act like they're better than "serving"
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Fantastic food with the worst service I have ever had!!!!!
I never write yelp reviews but I found it necessary to start as a SF native. I do not have much time off but I thought I'd stop into this restaurant during happy hour for a quick bite and a cocktail a couple of months ago. My first impression made it seem like just a place for hungry desperate convention goers to go and get a drink.  It seemed a little dirty and my boyfriend and I were not seated right away even though we were standing in the doorway for a good 2 min. We almost left. All of the servers looked uninterested in doing their jobs and had their backs faced to the dining area looking annoyed at  the thought of even being at work. So when we were finally seated we were given some thrashed looking menus and were told that one of the specials was a blueberry pork mousse. Um that sounded weird....yet interesting so I decided to try it. Are you kidding me server! It was so much more then that. This place would make a fortune off of foodies if they got their service right!!! This dish was so complex and so delicious. It even had succulents as a component with tossed popcorn and a corn mousse next to a piece of blueberry glazed pork belly. I would love to describe it further but all the server gave me was blueberry pork mousse? WTF. Lastly my boyfriend felt this place has a really terrible beer list and some boring outdated cocktails. This is SF!! We have so much to offer in terms of culinary, craft cocktails and beer.  You have such a killer location to have an amazing restaurant. Maybe it is your goal just to make money off of your pitchers of booze which are great but what else do you have to offer?? 

I even went back a SECOND time and it seems like the service was WORSE and the restaurant was empty. If I ever saw my staff eating and hanging out instead of serving customers I would have a melt down. The same server came out and said the special was spiced scallops. On my way out I caught one of the kitchen staff which turned out to be the chef. Her scallops had this amazing puree and I had to ask what it was! Stone fruit  puree with grilled okra and a complex spice rub. It was amazing to say the least. I told her that. I saw her heart drop when I flat out told her the service was garbage. Get a new job chef!! You are too good for convention center tourist restaurants. Or get it together owner because you have some gems in your kitchen.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
B Restaurant does happy hour right (4:30-7pm). Unlike so many happy hour spots in SOMA/FiDi, you do not have to fight for a space at an over-crowded bar. Not only that, but it's a stunning place to unwind after a long week as floor-to-ceiling windows provide the brightly lit backdrop that is SOMA. 

My girl, Kiki I. and I gabbed for two hours over their $5 sangrias, which were garnished with big wedges of citrus. We split a platter of loaded fries which were true to their name - delectably crisp fries topped with short ribs (yes, RIBS), parmesan and tomatoes. 

On my next visit, I plan to try their chocolate ganache cake with banana flambe and creme fraiche. It's a shame we didn't leave room for dessert :(
author: Mariela D.

description: One of my fav spots for a casual drink in SF.  Love staying at their bar although the bar tender doesn't smile at all all the all the time:-) It's hard to say what would be the recommendation at this place but I just come here a lot... Maybe for the nice view in the front and the opportunities to meet new friends.
author: Joyce S.

description: Do not go here. They promised us a table for 12 for a team lunch at 1130. We walk over and showed up on time and they filled up the slots. The wait staff is terrible and was not helpful at all.
author: Elliot H.

description: B Restaurant & Bar is chi-chi spot in Yerba Buena Gardens.  Nice ambiance with option to eat in, or outdoors with nice views.  Great place went its a nice day in SF.  I thought it was a little pricey for lunch with small selection of items to choose from ranging from salads, sandwiches, and pastas.  I settled with the fried chicken breast sandwich and side of truffle fries, though not much truffle oil to make a distinction between standard fries.  They used quality ingredients in the sandwich but overall was okay.  Additionally got the chocolate dessert, which was really rich and fudgey, good if you love fudge.  Service was friendly and helpful.
author: Nova P.

description: What a great place when you've been trapped in the conversation center that lies below. It's my oasis in the trade show grind. There is an angel that works here and she knows who she is. The food is inspired and the staff is a pleasure. I can't wait until I return. To the angel, let your hair down. Screw the a-holes that think otherwise...and I'm out.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
B gets an A for food, but a D for service.

I came to B yesterday with a handful of colleagues for a team lunch. It's close by, and the menu looked great so we trotted over and were able to sit outside on a beautiful day--big plus. We were seated by some haggard host who looked like  he was still nursing a hangover from the night before. With his shirt barely tucked in and a not-so-friendly face, he assured us, "I'm leaving you with X, he's the best server we have--you'll be in excellent hands."

Maybe 15 minutes later, we were finally greeted by this so-called wunderkind. We ordered a bunch of plates since we're all close and decided to share just about everything on the menu.

The food came out one by one, in extremely spaced out increments. At least five minutes between each plate. An entire order of fries was forgotten. Our water decanters were constantly empty.

Something else that bugged me was the fact that there were *six* items on some plates (chicken po'boys, meatballs). There were *seven* of us at the table. If I were a courteous server, I would tell my table "Hey guys, I know there's seven of you. Only six meatballs and six sandwiches come on this plate. Want me to just add one more on each for you guys?" One could only hope.

tl;dr Fantastic nibbles, small portions, disappointing service.
author: Tyler H.

description:
Been here a few times for lunch and haven't had a bad meal yet.  Your meal needs to start with their Truffle Fries which are simply yummy.  I've had the Burger, Blue Ribbon (Chicken sandwich which had Applewood Smoked Bacon, Granny Smith Apples and a Jalapeno Aioli).  I've also enjoyed the New Porker (Pulled Pork with Fennel Slaw).  Each sandwich came with a refreshing Cesar salad.  

The staff is also friendly and the service is quick.
author: Lon H.

description: It was a sunny day in sf so I choose to be in the outdoor seating. The atmosphere was very elegant, charming and clean. I ordered the truffle fries which were amazingly fried perfect with truffle oil served with mayonnaise and ketchup, giving a European touch. I also ordered the clams. Steamed to perfection with a sauce  at the bottom with bites of ground beef in between. For a drink I ordered the bourbon and berry which was very nice one of their signature cocktails. Service was amazing everyone was helpful and courteous. Would definitely go again!
author: Rubin S.

description: Cool little spot overlooking Yerba Gardens. Look for this place upstairs. Happy hour with a friend. Very trendy.
author: Yvonne H.

description:
The Happy Hour is on point especially with the $1 oysters. I'm a french fry fan so their truffle fries are a go to with the burger! The reason why I gave 4 stars is because when I sat at the bar the bartender took awhile to take my order and it wasn't just the first time when I sat down it was after I was finished eating each round of my $1 oysters. It took at least 5 minutes to get his attention. I noticed the other people being served before me and it wasn't crowded or anything, idk maybe I wasn't being aggressive enough who knows lol 

Anyways, other than that I'll be back maybe with a different server/bartender this time haha
author: Mariah T.

description: I was contacted a few days after my initial review by Gloria C. explaining what happen in regards to my birthday plans at the restaurant being unacceptable, and asking if I would accept their offer to throw me a birthday party. I accepted, additionally informing coworkers that we would be celebrating afterall. Well, I never heard back from Gloria. I eventually called and spoke with Annie who said she would look into it, and contact me the next day. I never heard back from her either. Now being in the month of April, having a birthday party for March is not going to happen. What sucks most is, I informed Gloria I had several bad consecutive experiences with not so good birthday's, and she reassured me they would make this years birthday a good one. More than anything, this has been heartbreaking, and it also made me look kind of bad with failed plans at work.
author: Terrence P.

description:
I know the owner to this restaurant. And I come here often with my co-workers & friends. My favorite time to eat here is happy hour = $1 oyster, $4-$6 pilsner, frites and cheese n meat platter options. Good margaritas and quirky candy cane straws.

This particular visit,  I don't know if it was my tattoos or because the bartender sprayed draft beer at us... But I swear both the bartenders were ignoring us. We ordered a lot. 

We wanted to order one more round of beer and margarita but for the life of us could not get the bartenders attention.  The gentlemen who came after me even had to keep his pointer finger out so he could get recognized.  Of course, he got served but I was not in the mood to point my finger out.

Instead we waited patiently and eventually we past the desire of tryna get buzzed.  Instead waited, stared at both the bartenders .  At this point both our drinks including our glasses of water is empty  and we decide to get our bill.

15-20 minutes past and we watch both the bartenders scramble to get our bill.  Finally, they say it's on the house!

HolyMoly! What a surprise!! I don't carry cash and so we decide to get some dough in the Metreon! 

Cashed out and went back to b-bar because we were so grateful.  We are right in the middle of the bar.  Hard to miss us. We wait for 10 minutes watching as...... Hmmm.... Swear they are ignoring us again.

We just want to order one more pilsner before happy hour ends and leave you the rest as tip. 

At this point, wifey and I are frustrated with the deliberate indifference.  And so on our way out, I stop the waitress to get change so that I can give a $10 tip. I would leave the $20 but we did not get satisfactory service.

Anyway long story short, we love this place and we are writing this review to let the bartenders know that we are grateful but at the same time prefer satisfactory service over a free meal. 

4 stars for my other visits. Minus 1 star for tonight's lack of care.
author: Shenni C.

description:
My beau and I came here for lunch after a stroll in Yerba Buena Park with our dog since it was conveniently located nearby. We sat outdoors and the ambiance was perfect and beautiful on this sunny day. The service was really good and the staff were all very friendly and assistive. They gave my pup a cute water bowl! 

The truffle fries were bomb and the serving size for that was generous. The sliders, in my opinion, were not worth the price for its tiny portion. However, the sandwich was really good, unfortunately the salad that came with the meal was not fresh... If it wasn't for that, this place would have been a perfect five star for me!
author: Riva L.

description:
Great location near a small park. Food is good And service very friendly.
Crowdy in case of event at The Moscone Center.
author: Frederic G.

description:
Even five years -- to the MONTH -- later, this place is still amazing. Remember hitting this spot back in June 2009, sharing a plate of oysters and fries, and enjoying some early summer sangria. 

When I returned just a couple weeks ago, I was with a similar group, and had pretty  much the same thing -- no wait, exactly the same thing, and loved it. We sat outside and enjoyed the warm weather and the people watching that comes with weather like that + Yerba Buena. I love Oysters, and these were fresh and perfectly offset the truffly, salty fries. 

Way to go, B, for being super consistent in a city that's always changing.
author: Megan S.

description:
Pros:
- great atmosphere
- decor is beautiful
- $1 oysters 
- attentive staff
- outdoor seating 
- bomb fries

Cons:
- no big groups unless you want drama from the hostess or don't mind sitting outside 

Seriously, you'd think if the restaurant is half empty and a large group of 15-20 people come in and want a table, you would be a little more accommodating. We tried to call to get a table but were told no reservations for HH. We show up and are told we can't have a table because the wait staff can't handle large groups? That's bullshit. So then we try to take a sitting area that had a table so we start sitting around it and are shooed away by the same hostess. Then another part of our group shows up who actually care if they get a table but are also told by the hostess that they can't have a table if they're with us. After deciding whether or not it's even worth it to stay, we ask the hostess what her logic is to not give a table. She had no valid reason and then did a total 180 and gave us a table inside. She went from saying 'no table for you' to 'how many more seats do you need?' I get that large groups wanna split the bill and it may inconvenience you a bit. But money is money. And service is appreciated when it's given. 

Probably not gonna come back here again. That was way too much drama for an after work happy hour.
author: Kaydee D.

description: Great location across from SFMoMA.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.  It was about 11:45, and only about 1/4 of the tables were in use (I don't think that is typical).  They have a fairly small menu, but there's enough variety that anyone should find something they like.  I ordered an arugula and endive salad with grilled chicken.  It normally comes with apricot-prosecco emulsion as a dressing, which sounded too sweet for my taste and the server happily offered a few choices they could substitute.  I think it is important that my food smells good, and this did not disappoint.  Lots of different flavors and the ingredients were clearly very fresh.  I will say the portion was somewhat small for the $$, so was still a little hungry when I left, but overall had a very nice lunch and will definitely be back.
author: Alan R.

description: We were on the way to Samovar but got confused and sat at a table in B restaurant. My husband and I did not regret it though! We had hot green tea, artichoke soup, endive salad, and a burger( served with salad). Everything was very good, service is attentive, fast, kind, and caring. And the view is nice if you sit outside.
author: Kristina K.

description:
A PICTURESQUE HAPPY HOUR ON A RARE, SUNNY SAN FRANCISCO DAY...

B Restaurant & Bar is located on the Yerba Buena Terrace that oversees the beautiful lush garden and cascading waterfall. Other than the amazing views of the gorgeous landscape, B Restaurant & Bar has nothing else to offer. 

HH MENU (Tuesday - Friday, 4:30 PM - 7:30 PM)
*$1 Oysters (6 order minimum)
*$5 Well Cocktails
*$40 Pitcher of Sangria 

P R O S
*Nice ambiance with amazing views
*$1 Oysters till 7:30 PM which is late compared to other places
*Not crowded

C O N S
*It's more a "bar" with very little dining tables and a limited menu. 
*The Oysters are NO BUENO! Some weren't properly cut from the shell while some had a bitter aftertaste to them.
*The food is mediocre ate best. We ordered the following:
--Truffle Fries ($6): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jfeOjuMf-kaQm5aaJEGWKA?select=cwRRNE2EfwhWDJ4nP5y8Pw The best thing on the menu, the skinny fries were salty, crispy and earthy. 
--Ceviche w/ Avocado, Cashews & Wonton Chips ($12): 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jfeOjuMf-kaQm5aaJEGWKA?select=EZkbFbBjvyPvT1kbgd8drw Very bland with no citrus flavors to brighten up the dish. The wonton chips were over fried and not enough was given for the ceviche.
--Crab Rigatoni w/ Ricotta Cheese & Arugula ($15): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jfeOjuMf-kaQm5aaJEGWKA?select=tqrcY0PlDWr_LmBEQIBzqw Pedestrian; tasted like a warm pasta salad. 
*There's only one chef in the kitchen so food service is SLOW.
*Crowd is a mix of mature yuppies and conference attendees (not necessarily a bad thing just not my scene)

OH BUT I MUST TELL YOU....

If you're looking for a nice start to a ROMANTIC evening, here it is:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jfeOjuMf-kaQm5aaJEGWKA?select=OIqZ4Ch7-jAdGbzJemv65g

*WINK WINK*
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This place has great outdoor seating overlooking the Yerba Buena Gardens. Came here with the wife as we enjoyed their bottomless mimosa and bloody marys. FYI- bottomless bloody marys is a horrible idea...the acidity from the mix did not bode well with my stomach.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Ask for Sarah the bartender. She's full of great info and makes the best drinks ever. This place is pretty awesome so if you're supposed to be at an conference downstairs at the Moscone center and you need a break, pop up here. Honestly I'm surprised the place isn't packed.
author: Brenda W.

description:
Probably my new favorite place for happy hour. 

I LOVE their $1 oysters and happy hour drinks.  Sangria for $6 and Moscow mule for $7, and they also have really good truffle fries that my friends and I snack on in between oysters. 

The view is of course beautiful on top of the Yerba Buena Center, and it's lovely inside the actual restaurant as well. 

Plus all of the waiters are so friendly and attentive even when it gets busy. 

Definitely a must have on my list.
author: Michelle L.

description:
When it comes to happy hour choices in the SOMA, they're darn near a dime-a-dozen. Nabbing those parched suits with a scintillating incentive to eat and drink at the stroke of 5:00pm can occasionally make or break a bar, so competition is fierce! But in my opinion, few do happy hour in the 'hood better than B.

$5 well drinks from 4:30 - 7:00, as well as a few nice bites, and my favorite: $1 oysters! I'm quite fond of consuming those boogery molluscs as often as possible, and when you have a deal like that staring you straight in the face, it's hard to avoid slapping down $12 for a dozen. 

In addition to the food, on a sunny day in the city, few places are more appropriate than B. With the completely open glass window decor (even on the roof!), as well as a palatial outdoor patio, when the fleeting summer months make that occasional appearance, B is the place to be!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Figured out, rye, bitters,fig pickling juice with cloves,bay leaf, brown sugar and citrus zest. In your face booze,  i need it! Oysters were the size of my pinky nail. At $1/apiece they must be $1,000./lb
We were attending the third thurs celeb in yerba buena and if u picked up a wristband featured cocktails were $6...a bargain for the quality. 
Also tried a rum drink with lavender and it was fab as well. Pisco cocktail well received by hubby. 
Porcini fries overpriced at $8, but from what i saw all food was overpriced.
Visit this view restaurant, overlooks YB gardens and St patrick's/Jewish museum plaza, for drinks and eschew the food. Plenty of choices nearby.
BTW, this was the only watering hole with a patio that participates in the third thurs. events. Good for meebo our dog, she loves to go out and enjoy the evening. Especially loves target, which is next door.

Great drinks, go elsewhere for food.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Bottomless Mimosas.  That's all you really need to know.

Okay, I lied.  You need to know more.  You need to know that for Sunday Brunch you can order bottomless Mimosas.  But here's the thing.  YOU. DON'T. EVEN. HAVE. TO ASK.  As soon as my delicious raspberry mimosa reached the bottom mark a new one magically appeared!  Dangerous, but amazing!

I ordered my old brunch standby, Eggs Benedict.  It came on a thick cut Italian loaf of bread, poached eggs and asparagus.  The hollondaise sauce was nice and light, not too heavy.  You could opt to top it off with either bacon or prosciutto as well.  It also comes with a bountiful helping of potato wedges.  They were perfectly cooked to the point where there was no mush factor and seasoned just right that it wasn't too salty (often that can happen).  

You also can't beat the open interior with huge glass windows all around and a beautiful deck to sit out and enjoy the tiny park outside.  Just a lovely little place!
author: Rachel C.

description: Exceptional customer service, delicious food, and perfect location. Don't hesitate--go grab a bite to eat.
author: Beto E.

description:
B happy, B outside or inside, B thirsty, B hungry, B with your dog.  You can't B-eat B's setting in Yerba B-uena on a B-eautiful day.  

B-Happy hour B-OK! They have some pretty fine cocktails for $6 (third thursday special - not all the time).  They are Balanced, flavorful and most importantly will make you forget the Bad traffic at 3rd and Folsom.

Our advisor - hate to just say server, because she really knows her food and drink! - was super-friendly.  Big Plus!  Water for our dog, another big plus.

The truffle fries are a great complement to the cocktails.  Sadly, too easy to eat.  A good reason to bring your (Big) dog.

Suggest avoiding the $1 oyster happy hour offer.  More like Mala Pecoras than Malpeques.  No no, not Bad, but get out your magnifying glass.  You know when stores have sales on 2nds?  These were maybe 3rds or 4ths...

But let's not let little ersters get in the way of some solid appreciation.  

So B on ur way w/ BFs to B!
author: Bob K.

description:
Ambiance: stellar

Food: just fine

Service:  HORRIFYING

I just finished lunch here and experienced all three of these to a T.  But wait, there's a kicker!  When our bill came it was half as much as it should have been.  We thought, oh how nice of them to comp part of our meal for being so horrible.  We tipped (well!), signed, and were about to happily leave when they came back and told us they charged the wrong table.  They needed our cards back, and both charges would be on there for 24 hours, OOPS.

I may still come here for a glass of wine, but if it wasn't for the great patio, this spot would be dead to me.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Drinks made with love. 

A bit pricey, but you do get fancy/pretty cocktails (see photo). 
Nice location & good service.
author: Helen D.

description:
I so wanted to enjoy my brunch here and the meal was really good but the service not so much.  The hostess sat us outside behind a skylight which was hidden so no waiters came over to us until my wife had to get up and tell tell we were ready to order about 20 minutes after.  The french toast I had was really good and the apricot jam really made it.  Unfortunately we ordered sides and they were delivered almost after we were down with our entire meal.  The waiter gave us a free dessert which was a nice gesture though.

Bummed because this place is so close to our house that I thought I could become a regular.
author: Blake B.

description:
Came here for brunch NOT happy hour, so ill give you a quick update on the type of food they have to offer. 

Portions are small, they all come out on this plate/bowl thing. If you order a eggs benedict, its more like egg (singular) benedict. Presentation is nice, fresh ingredients and its very tasty and good. 

Prosciutto and avocado benedict: one of the more popular dishes
Salmon benedict: Love the salmon, very versatile and goes great with anything. 
Salmon tartine: Too much fresh mustard, that was all I tasted. The side salad was nothing special: leaves tossed in olive oil. 
Truffle fries: delicious, but not the best I've ever had. The fries are on the thin, crunchy side. I would have preferred it to be a little thicker. 
Burger: 12 dollars and it does not come with fries or any sides. Pretty pricy for a burger. 

Drinks: 
Mango ice tea: taste just like regular ice tea (no refills)
Mimosa: This was delicious 
Coffee: french pressed. Looks cool but gets cold throughout the meal

Great location, great scenery: can't argue with that.
author: Amy L.

description:
After scrambling to eat dinner somewhere decent downtown on a Friday night, without a reservation (my nightmare), we found B Restaurant & Bar.  I suspect that its three star standing worked in our favor.  It's probably got mixed reviews over its brunch, dinner, and happy hour offerings.  You'd be happiest here for happy hour and unhappiest for brunch, based on reviews here.

I had dinner and I fell in the middle, and it warrants a four.  The burger and fries were pretty good.  I was craving truffle fries, this place had it and could seat a table of four immediately.  

Sometimes that's all you need.
author: Erika C.

description:
Stopped here after work on Friday with a coworker. We each had a cocktail at the bar. 

-1 star for no stools.

-1 star for my friend's drink which was listed as containing "home made ginger ale" which turned out to be a can of Canada Dry.

-1 star for a nasty lime that must have been cut hours earlier because the edges were turning brown and it looked dry.

This was my second time going, I definitely won't be going back.
author: Noah K.

description: Staff were so nice! Loved my truffle fries! But AVOID ceaser salad! It's not what you expect! It's anchovy dressing! Yuck D:
author: Mii L.

description:
Note: Don't sit outside on windy days ~_~ water from the fountain will own you.

Sip, nibble, mingle, while taking in the view.  

Happy hour menu is enticing ~ appetizers for ~$5 and fun cocktails!  Definitely recommend the Love cocktail (so cute and the heart stays in-tact as you sip!!  I'm easily amazed...) ... their cocktails are pretty stiff.  
Truffle fries were well-seasoned and crunchy (ketchup and horseradish sauce) ~ spicy shrimp appetizer was succulent and the flavors paired nicely with the dipping sauce.  Small portions~small restaurant (don't recommend for large groups of 8+...) but excellent service, yummy food, and DELICIOUS cocktails.

The best part... LOCATION!  XYZ is RIGHT across the street... and you know how much I adore XYZ... (see review..)
author: Kat C.

description:
Had a late breakfast here. There was no seating on the patio, so we agreed to go inside. The inside of this place was way too hot, and there were flies buzzing around. I understand they leave the front open, so it's bound to happen, but it was just unappealing.

We asked to be moved outside. The man who had seated us was very nice about this, and said he would move us when a table became available. Our waiter was incredibly rude and had attitude once we told him we were relocating. In the end, it didn't matter, cause he was our waiter out there too.

We ordered wine and food. Our wine sat at the bar for an eternity, while our waiter took care of everybody except for us. He was really one of the worst waiters I have ever had.

For breakfast I ordered the soft scrambled eggs with chanterelle mushrooms and fromage blanc. The food was amazing. One of the best breakfasts ever! My friend got the truffle fries and their burger. I tried the fries and they were awesome, didn't have the burger, but she enjoyed it.

The patio was a really nice place to sit and enjoy the day, the food was great, but that waiter was so terrible that I have to give them three stars.
author: Randi B.

description:
I'm surprised as to how the ratings are so low, but I guess it make sense when everybody has different experiences and this place can get pricey.

I went during their happy hour, and got 15 $1 oysters! They were probably one of the best oysters I've had, but that's probably because I'm from LA and SF is incomparable in their seafood. 

However, I got one of their cocktails for $12 and it was in the smallest glass you can ever imagine. It's like a shot with some extra flair I guess. 

Their truffle fries are good and their scenery is amazing. It's on top of the MLK waterfall so I got to see the sunset while enjoying my oysters. 

My waitress was also really nice and sweet. She always checked up on us and made her best recommendations. 

So aside from the pricey cocktail for the amount you get, this is 5 stars in my book. (4 stars if I include the cocktail that wasn't that good).
author: Alex S.

description:
So if you just have to sit outside and enjoy the park, okay. But be prepared for some pricey food, slow service and an undercooked burger. Truffle fries were decent but the other shortcomings makes this a venue only visit. 

Grab a burrito at tropiseuno nearby and sit in the park. Done.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
It has been a week and I still have not forgiven B Restaurant & Bar for failing to remember that they are both a restaurant and a bar. Drumroll, please!

1. It took FORTY MINUTES to get our drinks. My one glass of white wine of Argentinian descent was presumably collecting air miles on its way to our table. My guy friend's Captain and coke arrived in a similarly lackadaisical fashion- although whatever it was that he ended up drinking was not a Captain and coke. We decided it was best not to complain as it would only end up being another journey around the world in 80 days with little promise of success. 

2. My dish was okay but my friend's was not. He ordered a hamburger med rare and it came out med well. Then they ran out of potatoes.

3. Not related to me but at a different table: I saw a waitress seat someone, give her a menu, take her drink order, and then return 20 minutes later with her drink to inform her, "Well, I don't know if we can do a salad. We closed a while ago." 

What pisses me off the most about these inattentive oversights suggesting an unequivocal disregard for employment is that the entire purpose for my being in the Financial District right then and there was because I was trying to get one more visit in to the SFMOMA before leaving San Fran. Didn't happen.
author: Charle M.

description: Happy hour is a delight. Thank you to Mr. New Guy (Come Aug 2015) and the gracious host. Attentive service and ideal location. I am a frequent customer.
author: John G.

description:
- Update 3/2/07 

Okay I have to admit it, B and I are back together. We broke up after a rocky start, but she addressed her issues and I'm falling for her. Great place for a business lunch, there is always space and sitting outside is awesome on a beautiful day. The menu has been tweaked and I'm now much happier.

Full Disclosure: They're now a  Yelp advertiser. I've been here several times since my original 3 star review and I left it intact until I was certain they deserved a rating upgrade.

- Original Review

The interior design kicks ass, if you ever shut this place down for a high-class cocktail affair please invite me. Just like it's neighbor Samovar, B benefits from sweeping views of downtown visible through large panels of glass. It's hard to describe, but trust me it's a cool space.

The food and service on the other hand are still under construction. I've been here for lunch twice. The first time I had the "jerk chicken sandwich". Not to be a jerk (heh), but the sauce was more of a spicy mayonnaise then a real jerk sauce. Also our food took about 50 minutes to arrive, argh. The next time I came in I ordered the burger (medium). It arrived very rare, but I downed it anyways. If I had enough time I would have sent it back (and no I'm typically not a "send-it-back kind of guy").

Sorry B it's not you, it's me. I'm just not ready for a steady relationship. I'll keep checking back and maybe we'll end up getting together in a few months when you get yourself sorted. Until then, kisses.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Came here for a work lunch. Great space! Lots of light, nice and airy.

However, I ordered the beet salad with shrimp and it was probably one of the smallest salads I've ever seen. It came with four nice big shrimp but a handful of argula and 5-6 pieces of beet. It was $18. 

The truffle fries were good and my co-workers' burgers looked awesome...totally regretting my choice and will definitely be hungry in about 30 minutes...
author: Emily H.

description:
So was 'A' taken?...I mean what's with the alphabet branding?
...and what about overachievers who feel peckish? Would they feel comfortable dining in a place called 'B'?
...and what about your friends who show up pissed two hours late because they thought you meant B44 in Belden Place?
...and what about your attention-deficit spouse fuming because he (and let's face it...it's a 'he') thought you meant A16 in the Marina?
A16...B44...B...hell, what's the difference?

But enough about the name...the isolated location makes it feel a bit, well, sad. I don't think I'm the only one who forgets the place is up in the setback on the elevated part of the Yerba Buena Gardens that nobody walks by unless they're completely drunk on the way from Moscone Center to the Metreon. It's a nice enough place, prairie-style and open-air...but somehow lacking, oh I don't know....charisma? How else do you explain last Saturday when throngs of people are lined around the block for Fan Fest at Moscone West and just across 4th Street, nary a body at this place?

It's a shame because the food is pretty darn good. Brunch is the deal. I had the $13 Poached Eggs over Catfish Fillets and Purple Potato Mash. Delish...even though the fish was retaining a bit of water. Jamie W. was having the $8.25 Chicken Salad Sandwich, a winner as this is apparently one of their specialties. It consisted of chicken mixed with olive oil, citrus, basil, thyme, rosemary, red onion and a "touch of mayo". Definitely not what you'd get at Lee's Deli.

They have a nice terrace that wraps around a Moscone Center skylight, but be careful as it gets blinding on a sunny day since they seem averse to putting up the patio umbrella. It may be better to try the indoor tables where you may notice that most of the chair arms have broken off...hmmm, IKEA anyone?

FOOD - 3.5 stars...good food, especially that chicken salad...brunch is a good deal
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nice and airy though Siberia may be close by
SERVICE - 3 stars...gee, do they have a lot of turnover?...the waiter was nice but oh so new
TOTAL - 4 stars...I feel generous here, more 3.5...but I say give them a try despite the bad generic name and the remote Himalayan location
author: Ed U.

description:
We came here for a birthday lunch. Since it was such a gorgeous day, we got a few tables outside. Service was amazingly fast, friendly, and pretty awesome. Menu is varied, some awesome looking cocktails, and the food that's good isn't just good, but amazing. On top of that, you can order pitchers of cocktails!

There were two things that I wasn't crazy about: the soup of the day sounded and looked amazing but was actually pretty bland; and as a vegetarian, there wasn't a lot of options available for me. I was very happy with the grilled mushroom sandwich though, and even being veg, the fried chicken sandwich looked *amazing*. Apparently that was a huge hit for several of my coworkers.

It's a pretty neat place to check out if you're in the area. A bit pricey for lunch, but not bad if you're looking for a nice place for a lunch or dinner.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
3 stars because I'm coming back for the convenient location, dollar oysters, and lovely patio for nice days in sf. 

1 star for the service though.  It's crap and they know it.  They're not going to change it.  I've been going here for 3 years now, same crap service, just different faces.  

By the looks of it on yelp, others have had the same experience.
author: Kristine S.

description:
The waiter was nice enough to offer us a combo charcuterie & cheese board bc we couldn't decide which to order.  Such a generous bargain for $12!  We shared it & were satisfied.  

On another night the $1 oysters were fresh & yummy!  And of course we couldn't resist the truffle fries.

The cocktails are both pretty & delicious.
author: Kim S.

description: Great view, lots of windows, open air and great place to get brunch on a sunny day. Also a well kept secret and there never seems to be a wait for table. I ordered the burger for lunch, but try the fried chicken and salad dish.
author: Ronnie S.

description:
Usually people say good company makes a place, twas is true. However, B Bar made this place it's own place. Regardless of my great company, I think I would've enjoyed myself either way because everything was amazing.

From the 430-730pm happy hours, $5 well drinks, $1 oysters, $40 pitchers of red, white, & sparkling sangria, truffle fries, cheese plate, cured meat board, meatballs, & chicken. Great service from the talented bartenders, cute cocktails with red hearts, rooftop bar, bumpin' music, and dangerously delicious shots, I couldn't ask for more.

Closed this place out, it was THAT good.
author: Alysha K.

description:
Went there last Friday night for HH and the place was packed! Despite the chaos, our server and the gentleman who appeared to be the manager were super nice. We got seated within 15 minutes. The HH appetizers were super inexpensive but delicious. The truffle fries were a far improvement from what I remembered. The clams were drenched in a sinful, buttery sauce. The short ribs weren't on HH but we had to try it. I like the open layout of this place...would love to come back.
My only beef with the joint is that it's not open on Sat and Sun evenings.
author: Mimi T.

description:
This place was a nice small bites dinner joint for the bf and I on a Thursday night. Great atmosphere, good service, good food.

Details:
I ordered a glass of Cab, and boy ordered a beer, and we settled in with our truffle oil french fries appetizer. My first thought was these fries have great flavor, but they are a bit soggy (well, not soggy, but not crisp). I wasn't going to say anything, but our bartender/server asked how I liked them, and I said they were good but not very crisp. He immediately took them back and then came out with a new plate (though I think they might have been the same fries re-fried) that were much tastier. I'm glad he asked because it definitely boosted the experience/taste.

For our main plates I ordered the mushroom risotto with goat cheese and scallions and the boy ordered the prosciutto burger. Again, I was the clear winner (seems to happen a lot in our relationship...). He said his burger was good, but just kinda lacked greatness. My risotto, however, was delish! My only complaint was that there was not enough goat cheese. There were only 2 or 3 bites that had a chunk of goat cheese on them, and they were absolutely divine. More goat cheese! I'd definitely order this dish again.

Portions were a bit small, but prices were decent. I'd come back though because it was definitely a nice after work dinner in SOMA.
author: Krista S.

description:
Food is MEH but the view and service is awesome.

I'm a brunch whore. Well anything with all you can drink, I am ALL OVER! So of course I had to try their brunch.

Salmon benedict: Meh. Salmon was too salty and tasted old. Hollandaise too sour and not creamy/rich enough. 
Blackstone benedict: Boring. No flavor.
Polenta and prawns: Polenta was creamy and delicious, so called "prawns" looked more like bay shrimp. Tiny little things. Fried eggs were overcooked and hard. 
Truffle fries: Ok but need more truffle oil and a dash of salt. 
Housemade sausage: Tastes very strongly of fennel. I'd pass.

The burger though.....  was AWEEEESOMMME. Perfect medium rare (added bacon & fried egg), thick and juicy (That's what she said), caramelized onions were rich and sweet. This thing was fucking good!!!  

Side note: Mimosas are weak and they're slow to refill but overall, you can get pretty trashed if you're patient enough HA!
author: Beverly T.

description: Today stone fruit salad plus added chicken and the cheese plate was 100% on point for a light lunch for 2.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I've had a lot of "last times" lately. The last time I see my stupid anti-breakfast exbf. The last time I drive while talking on a cell phone (thank you very much, Mr. police officer for my ticket) and (probably) my last time using my iphone 4 (thanks for jacking it after I left it in your cab, Fog shitty cab driver.) 

But I've also had a lot of "first times," too. Tuesday night, I went to B for my first "Yelp elite" event, and the whole slew of "firsts" I experienced there were magic. 

My first time at this bar was excellent! I had my first-ever oyster, and it was amazing! The first bowl of truffle fries we ordered was so delicious I needed a second! And I had my first sip of Rye! 

My first time was so fabulous, I can't wait to do it again!! Perhaps for brunch- I do love a good Sunday morning romp.
author: Emily D.

description: The girly girl in me goes to B Restaurant & Bar for the "love on" cocktail because they make it with a heart design. Pretttty!!!! It does taste really good though! The wine list is good as well is the beer selection. I've only tried their charcuterie and cheese plates and some of their desserts. If it's a nice day out, B is a good place to stop by for a drink/snack. Also ideal for happy hours. The restaurant is enclosed with glass walls, so there's tons of sunlight pouring in. You also have the option to sit outside overlooking the Yerba Buena Center. After spending a morning at the MOMA, I head to B to have a drink, something to nosh on and soak up some rays. How ideal is that?
author: Liv A.

description:
This place upsets me, so much potential but yet not quite able to deliver. We came here for a work lunch a little after 12pm and were suprized to find the place completely empty. 

The Yerba Buena garden, where B Bar is located, is a fantastic oasis right bang smack in the middle of the City so the setting definitely gets a BIG TICK. I also appreciate what they have done to take advantage of this - floor to ceiling glass walls create a light/open space and there's a heap of outdoor seating for when its nice out. 

I ordered the vege s/w with roast capsicum, eggplant, zucchini and pesto. It was O.K, a bit on the bland side and the side salad was limp and well-over dressed. The highlight was definitely the truffle fries - prefectly salted with just the right amount of truffle oil.

Without a doubt the most concerning part of the experience was the waiter. He looked at though he hadn't slept in days - scruffy hair, shirt in desperate need of an iron and half tucked in, big bags under his eyes. It definitely wasn't a good look. 

With so many great lunch spots in San Fran, I doubt i'll be back anytime soon!
author: Alex D.

description: Went here with co-workers for happy hour on a Wed evening. We enjoyed several pitchers of Pilsner and sangria along with many bowls of fries. Because they are located on the top level of the Yerba Buena Gardens, it is super cold and windy! Bring your overcoat. Also, I think that many organized events are held at B Bar so they are often reserved for special occasions. We were encouraged to wrap up at 8pm, which I think is not an uncommon occurrence.
author: Amy G.

description: Went for happy hour. Naturally expecting to wait with the crowd. But that didn't happen. Both the servers were beyond attentive the minute we were at the bar. I don't know what all the fuss is about poor service, they must have hired all new staff. They were so apologetic when we waited nearly  five minutes for our oysters order on a hectic night, which were yes, amazing. I'm from New Orleans I'm a food snob,they were perfect. And the bar tender is at the top of her profession.
author: Marissa B.

description:
We came for Happy Hour, and were a bit disappointed in the small menu - $1 oysters (kitchen only had six left), no other dishes on the HH menu, standard $5 charge for draft beers, but a nice deal on the $7 wines.  Just wish they had more appetizers on the menu.  We ordered some food off the regular dinner menu.  Fries were great.  

TIP: Take a look at the Cocktail PDF file on the website for the happy hour list.  Also, no reservations during Happy Hour - it's first come, first serve.  Standard fare, nice staff, just make sure to walk up the stairs from the gardens in order to find this place.  It's not in the Metreon or ground level.
author: Desiree C.

description: I stopped by for lunch and sat outside on a lovely day. I needed some protein and veggies so had the Caesar salad with shrimp. Came quickly and was delicious. No wait for lunch on a Thursday. Accommodating and friendly wait staff.
author: Susan R.

description:
Hosted a private party for about 100 people, 10p-2a, in early December 2012.

Owners are AWESOME to work with. Made everything easy, worked on drink and food menu, extremely accommodating.

Not many people seem to know this location. It is a beautiful bar, a classy place to host an event or eat a meal or just have a drink.
author: Scott S.

description:
BEAUTIFUL restaurant with lalalooovely outdoor seating with a beautiful view of downtown SF. Gorgeous place for a weekend brunch. Def will be coming back!

Came here for brunch for my birthday with a party of 7. The staff was very friendly-- everyone was really pleasant & nice. Very accommodating. 

Parking: park in the Moscone Center Garage, its the closest parking structure.

NOTE: they no longer do bottomless mimosas, BOOOO.
author: Thy N.

description:
ok it is at a great location. Amazing view of the city buildings by the fountain- on a good day, you can sit outside and love SF and life! 
Inside space is a little on the smaller scale- menu is not too exciting- not bad but not a lot of options.
I had the burger- it was good. and asked for the truffle fries, boy, does truffle oil make everything taste good or what? =)) loved it!

Good for bar/happy  hour but cuisine wise, meh.. good but not fireworks.
yes, i would come back here b/c i love the location and Semovar Lounge next does ndoes not serve alcohol! lol=)
author: C A.

description:
Cocktails: Standard. Nothing special to write home about; nothing horrible.

Food: They don't do a whole lot of it, so one would think they could perfect what they do offer, which is quite boring. Lots of fried things. Not so great oysters. I had a polenta thing with shrimp, I think...can hardly remember. The polenta almost tasted industrial, like it had been pre-frozen. The special squash blossom appetizer was not as good as I'm used to at better Bay Area establishments.

And happy hour is like a BAD LOUD DISCO. If you want to relax with friends and have an audible conversation it's NOT happening here. I won't be returning.
author: Stephanie P.

description: We stopped by for lunch. The staff was very friendly, the restaurant was clean, the food was good. The roasted cauliflower was delicious as well as the butternut squash soup.
author: Sandra H.

description: We came here on a bright sunny day, it was amazingly nice so we had to sit outside. Waiters were incredibly accommodating the entire time. We got the meatballs, sliders, and brussel sprouts. My favorite thing was probably the sprouts, they come with caramelized onions, pancetta and almonds, WOW. So sosososo good. It gets busy especially if there is a convention going on in the city.
author: Kevin K.

description: Food, view, drinks, all top notch.  I've been here twice and was impressed both times.
author: Charles B.

description:
Yes, after coming here consistently in the last 3 years. I had enough. 

Great location, great view, okay food, okay drinks, and terrible service.

When I talked to manager about not able to get a drink after standing there for 15 mins, and the bartender acting like a class A hole, I was told there is nothing they can do. 

Great, you don't need my money, and I don't need your attitudes.
author: Alice C.

description:
Happy hour WOULD be cool, if there's wasn't a $25 minimum. What's the point of happy hour when you need to spend at least $25? There isn't one IMO.

Also, when you order food, they literally tell you not to walk away. They said they wouldn't bring it to me, and that if I went away and someone ate my food, I still would be charged for it. Seriously? 

Food is pretty good, customer service and general human-understanding, sucks.
author: Colin G.

description:
I have been procrastinating a bit on my San Francisco reviews but figured they were all so memorable it would not be a problem at all.  I have started at the beginning of our trip and hope to proceed in order.  We stopped at B Restaurant & Bar for our first lunch in San Fran based on a Yelp recommendation and were not disappointed one bit.
The staff was ultra friendly and the food was scrumptious.
I had a bowl of the seasonal soup (butternut squash) and it was as delicious as you can get with a soup. My husband and I shared a side of the Truffle Fries and they were perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and almost creamy on the inside. We also had some delicious sandwiches from the kitchen. 
I have heard and read many great things about their brunch but simply did not have time to go back.  Will definitely make a point of it on our next visit.
author: Marta H.

description: This bar is in such a nice location, right on the rooftop of the Moscone center.  They have two beers on tap, but it seems like most people come here for their pitchers of mixed drinks.  That's right - they will pour up a full pitcher of your desired beverage.  Great for after work happy hours, as many the pitcher can pour many cups.
author: Andrew H.

description: I've been going to B for years now. In fact I've made it a yearly birthday brunch for myself and other friends. We love the food. My favorites are the Shrimp and Polenta, and yes they are regular big prawns, the eggs benedict and the current selection of the ceviches. The drinks are always perfect, specially when they have some specials on the menu. I would recommend to anyone, its a great location, awesome views and nice open space. Don, the owner is absolutely wonderful. He is a lot of the reason why I keep going back. He's always on top of things and plays great music. I will continue to be a fan! -Thanks
author: Claudia J L.

description:
My husband and I came here for brunch this past weekend, and had purchased a Gilt City coupon for the meal.  For $39, we were able to get two entrees, two sides, and two bottomless mimosas.

I really didn't know what to expect going into it, other than it was a great location (we've been to other restaurants in the area and we love this part of the city), and that it was a nice day to be outside.

But, the food and service here is FANTASTIC.  Would we go back if we didn't have the coupon?  YES.  For entrees and sides, I had the polenta and prawns with potatoes, and he had a benedict with brioche.  I was also curious about the ceviche, so I asked for a half order (which they were able to accommodate) of the salmon belly.  The fried polenta was still a bit too creamy for my taste, but it did end up going well with the ceviche on the side.  SO MUCH FOOD, and SO good!  Their mimosas are made with fresh-squeezed orange juice.

So, I think it was great value for the money.  It was a beautiful day outside, so paired with some amazing service, it was a perfect experience altogether.  Thanks, B Bar!  Highly recommend!
author: Cheryl V.

description:
We came here for the first time with a voucher from gilt, and we have since returned for delightful outdoor weekend dining. Both times we've had no wait, great service, and delicious fare.

Bloody marys are quite tasty with a citrusy flavor, and the truffle fries...well, clearly they are the marriage of two delicious entities: fried potatoes and truffle oil. We also had the dungeness crab, the steak tartare, and the heirloom salad with grilled shrimp. All were quite good; the tomatoes on the salad a bit firm, but our mistake for ordering off season. 

We'll be back.
author: Gabrielle A.

description: Really saw this place and wanted to come in! Hostess was so nice and accommodating, however we sat right by the bathroom and was really grossed out. Waitress  seemed like she didn't want to be there and gave off a super standoffish vibe. Ordered happy hour oysters which i do not eat but my partner is, he asked the size and she comes and says med-large and he responds well lets try for medium.  We both work in fine dining restaurants as servers so of course we really have high expectations when we go out and know where servers make mistakes. The oysters came out and were Huge! It was clear that the server didnt even put in the modification or try. We orderd a charcuterie  plate and was grossed out! The mustard meats and sauce came clearly out of a can and the bread was beyond stale! It was gross and i didnt want to finish it! The waitress never came back to check on us. I was really off put and upset. The bill was okay, but we just were bummed that the service sucked. Wont be back for a while.
author: Hazel M.

description:
Stopped by for a quick Yelp event on a random Wednesday after work.

Ambiance: Small trendy restaurant, about 70% bar, 30% sit-down restaurant. Cute decor everywhere & big rustic mirrors. 

Location: Located high above w/ a wonderful garden view, on the top floor of Yerba Buena Garden/Moscone Center, snuggled between the Art Exhibit Center & Samova.

Service: Friendly & prompt bar servers, kept the beer and sangria flowing for the 2hours spent there.

Drinks: Tried both the Sangria & Wildmer beer. The Sangria was prepared differently in that it included rum & brandy. It was different & good, but am still stuck on ChaChaCha serving my favorite sangria. The Wildmer beer was good, but after the first one I couldn't drink anymore. ((Burp!!)) Beer can be so heavy!

Bar Food: ABSOLUTELY enjoyed the Truffle Fries: thin, crispy fries splashed w/ some delicious truffle oil. It was really, really different, but wonderful...something about that truffle oil that set the dish off right! It came w/yummy aioli and tomato sauce for dippin' pleasure. I also tried the brushetta....really yummy, too, w/a heaping portion of chunky tomatoes and onions. I also saw crab cakes & halibut ceviche on the menu. I'll be sure to try those on my next visit. =) What else really caught my attention, as well as my senses, was the aroma of bacon trailing throughout the lounge. Ooooo yum! I wonder what dish that was.

Bottom line: I am definitely coming back to try the rest of the appetizers & other entrees on the menu. 

Tip: HH is from 4pm-730pm. They have better deals if you order 3 appetizers at a time. For example, truffle fries, bruschetta, and cheese platter sell for $15, as opposed to it being $6 a plate.
author: Joy A.

description:
Happy hour until 7:30. They change their HH specials every few months. Go early to snag a table inside. Sometimes they reserve the indoor seating for dinner guests though, but there's always the bar. Otherwise grab a table outside overlooking the gardens.

- Ginger Rickey: refreshing and light
- Sangria: sweet & fruity
- Truffle Fries: my favorite dish! crispy, slightly salted and good
- Oysters: $1! sometimes they run out. top off with a bit of the fresh lemon juice and slurp away
- Marinated Olives: ok, nothing special
- Prosciutto Board: love prosciutto! your average deli meat spread
author: Linda C.

description:
I love going to B Bar early in the spring or late in the fall, when there is a bit of sun to be had. The all glass building gives a nice view of Yerba Buena garden and part of the skyline. The crowd is a little older, but I think it just goes with being one of the nicer establishments near the convention center. 

The happy hour is great, with $1 oysters, and a variety of cheap drinks and appetizers. The bartenders know their trade, and are willing to cater to amorphous and un-defined libation desires, so long as there isn't a crowd. It does tend to get quite busy sometimes, and the out door seating is great when the weather is nice.

However, they are often closed for private events, so it is usually a good idea to check their Facebook page to find out if they are closed to the public before going.
author: Alejandro V.

description:
What I like about B Restaurant & Bar is undoubtedly the decor/ambience (when inside you are encapsulated by these modern high-ceiling glass walls; there's also an outdoor area overlooking the Yerba Buena garden) and location (conveniently by Metreon and the Union Square shopping stores). 

I used to really like their food (my previous visits were a few years ago before living in LA for 2 years), but today's visit left me feeling underwhelmed. The truffle fries which was one of my favorite items here barely had a hint of truffle (skimping on ingredients or is Sunday's cook not on his/her game?). The beets hummus on bread item wasn't bad -- it was kind of interesting for the first few bites.. Not sure I'd order it again though.. For the price of food, I'd expect better quality/taste.

Lastly, one of our waitresses (the main one for our table) was a bit too pushy - besides trying to push me to get a mimosa (no thank you, I drank enough last night) she also kept on coming to check in (I appreciate the attentiveness, I really do, but there's no need to come every 10 minutes to hover).
author: Nora Y.

description:
Taking a big bite of a hearty chicken sandwich, with fresh juicy- just cut avocado, while sampling truffle fries - as the sun beams through the large glass windows of B Restaurant; I am reminded of how lucky I am to have this place so close to our office.

From their sweet happy hour drink specials, including killer fruity cocktails and sangria, to their solid lunch options, to their personable and hilarious bartenders, B Restaurant and Bar delivers.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
INCREDIBLY DISAPPOINTED. 

You know when a friend takes you out and they RAVE about the place, but of all days, it happens to be the day he takes you there that the food is blehhh and the service sucks. This is one of them.

Lets start. We ordered our food and then a party of say 25 came in. (Keep in mind our order was already taken) Our food came AFTER the large party got theirs. It's lunch time and having to sit there for over an hour to just get our order, what kind of service is that!

Once the food came, my chicken sandwich was super bland and my friend's burger was overcooked. We brought it to the waitress' attention and she apologized for it, but then she came back and looked at his burger closely and had the nerve to say, "Uh, the burger IS medium rare. See it looks a little red." It was medium to well done - learn your meat!!

The two stars is only for the location and decor. I actually liked that part aside from sitting by a window on a hot day. I recommend not sitting next to a window - there's not enough sunscreen to help you out there.
author: Kathy N.

description:
Although I grew up in this city, I've never worked in the city. Well, besides summer jobs foaming lattes or folding sweaters. So I've never had the chance to experience the working person's life...or lunch. Until this week! I went with some coworkers to this cute, quiet cafe in Yerba Buena for a quick lunch. While it's obviously geared toward office dwellers on breaks, I still felt like B had a nice ambience, with friendly service, waiters in ties and leather bound menus. 

I ordered the BLT, which was absolutely delicious. The bacon was thick, the lettuce was crispy and the ciabatta roll was wonderful. And as you know (or if not, you should)..I'm a sucker for aioli. 

The table also shared a dish of marinated olives, which were lemony and nicely oily. 

Next time I'm going to leave time to have a nice cup of Blue Bottle coffee after my meal!
author: Christina P.

description:
I wish I could like this place more. The bartender was nice. I wish they would use real fresh lime juice and not the kind in the bottle.

Pros: Delicious truffle fries. I ate the WHOLE BOWL, each and every crumb.
author: Jeanne C.

description: My wife got bad food poisoning there on May 3rd.....barely able to get on the plane the next day...took her 10 days to recover
author: William T.

description:
Wow a pitcher of sangria came out to about $70. Granted, it was really good sangria with fresh strawberries and grapes mixed in but too steep of a price to tempt me again! 

What I did like about this place was the atmosphere. It's in the Yerba Buena gardens with a good view and sturdy wooden outdoor seating with some foliage for shade. Inside gets plenty of natural sunlight as the walls are all glass. Was pretty packed when I went around happy hour time. Expensive place though!
author: Sandy L.

description:
I love trying new places but I also find myself returning to restaurants I've been to and ordering the same thing time and time again... 

And despite being in San Fran for only one week this current trip, I went to B not once, but twice for lunch!  And guess what? I ordered exactly the same thing both times!

I sat inside my first visit with Christina Y and Don B... we had a lovely lunch together.  We shared the warm marinated olives to start; they were delicious!  If memory serves, they both had sandwiches.  I went with the Caesar Salad, and I had them add shrimp and avocado.  Yum!

And since it was so tasty and the perfect filling lunch, I brought Katie S back with me today.  We sat outside since the weather allowed.  Nothing like some fresh air and sunshine, great food, and conversation too!  Katie went with the tomato soup special of the day and I went for it again... exactly the same salad!  Again, it was perfect!

In addition to the olives and the Caesar Salad, I also recommend the mango iced tea at B.  I'll be back!
author: Gabi M.

description:
I absolutely love this restaurant! I can always count on excellent service, delicious food, and the most amazing views - whether its brunch, lunch, or dinner. Whether for a business lunch or relaxing night with my husband, I can never go wrong with B. aBsolutely wonderful! 

Oh and the pitchers of Moscow Mules...BEYOND!!
author: Alex L.

description: Get a charcuterie platter and a glass of wine and watch the world go by in Yerba Buena park.  The food is good if a little spendy, but on a sunny evening in the city it's a marvelous place to be.
author: J F.

description:
Everything was perfect --bottomless mimosas ordered, we sat back on the beautiful patio in the warm sun with great friends. I felt bad that, as starving college kids, we couldn't afford their 10$+ brunch menu, so I ordered some truffle fries and planned on tipping well (my dad had given me 50$ for the occasion...I didn't want to waste daddy's plastic on food, prefer to tip). 

The three of us downed 5 mimosas, and about an hour later, our two friends showed up to order the same. They each received one before the older, blonde waitress (who had, up until that point, been the only unpleasant part of the experience) informed us that the bottomless deal only comes with a brunch entree. Without the deal, each mimosa was TEN DOLLARS. 

NUH UHHH we said, we hadn't been informed of this. We were ready to put up a fight, which I guess she sensed, because she said she would charge us the bottomless price, but that the deal ended NOW. Well, we could have made a bigger fuss because our friends had only had 1 each (10$ instead of 12$), but we decided to cut our losses and head out to the pride parade to enjoy our day.

Anyway, I can't speak to the food, but the service was disappointing and the mimosas were.NOT.bottomless. Shape up, B Restaurant & Bar, shape up.
author: Marlen K.

description:
This is a really fun place for happy hour! The main special is $1 oysters and they are so delicious and fresh - main tip is to get there early because they tend to run out. I also love the truffle fries (but who doesn't?) You'll also want to get there early to snag a seat, there's very limited seating inside (and outside can be pretty windy depending on the weather.)

They also have some great drink specials and stock pretty decent beer/wine selection.

But the main attraction is the view, full glass wall/windows so you can see out over the park, just beautiful when it's a nice day and it's heading towards sunset.

Only reason it's not full 5 stars is I found the choice of food beyond the oysters and fries to be pretty limited - and very expensive. Not somewhere I would go for a full dinner again but I can definitely see coming back for happy hours!
author: Katie V.

description:
My coworker and I ate here a few weeks ago when we were attending a workshop nearby.  The location is awesome - sitting above Yerba Buena Gardens with views of downtown and the park.  

There were only two other occupied tables in the restaurant so the service was prompt and friendly.  I had the burger (which came with a small side salad), my coworker has the prawns and polenta and we split truffle fries.  Thank goodness for the truffle fries because not only are they delicious, but the portion size of the prawns and polenta entree was closer to a small appetizer.  I ended up giving about 1/3 of my burger to my coworker so that he wouldn't be starving during the 2nd half of the workshop.

The food was good and the prices reasonable (particularly given the location) aside from the one small portion (prawns and polenta).  I also hear they have happy hour so I'll have to go back sometime and try it!
author: Liz H.

description: Jason is the best manager! You must go!!! Great service! Excellent atmosphere!!! Food is deliciousssss!
author: Princess R.

description: I come here for happy hour oysters, which are served from 4:30 to 6:30, and you really get a bank for your buck. Pair this with truffle fries and a couple of Moscow Mules, and I am in complete heaven. I highly recommend this place for after-work happy hour. They sometimes run out of oysters so it is a good idea to get there early.
author: Douglas M.

description:
Go here for drinks on a nice day (I probably shouldn't tell you that because it's one of my favorite places to go when the weather is nice and it already gets too packed).  Very good happy hour as well.  $1 oysters are awesome and the mussels are good as well except lately, they have been a little over cooked but I think that's because they just got a new chef.  

Note:  Don't walk into the glass walls after one too many...  Trust me, you'll look like an idiot and everyone will see it............
author: Alyse S.

description: Food came out all at different times. Even when it was the same order. 5 orders of fries for 11 people. One order came out at a time. Took 30 to get first through 5th. Service speed was bad. Food ok. Out of mussels and oysters and we got there right at opening. Lame sauce. Never again
author: Synnora B.

description:
If you're looking for brunch in SOMA, look no further, kids: B Bar is the bee's knees, indeed. 

Why, you ask? One simple reason: Bottomless Mimosas. Again: Bottomless Mimosas! Raspberry or original, they just keep 'em coming till you yell 'uncle.' Well, not really - you can politely decline, as well. 

I had the classic brunch item Eggs Benedict, but theirs has a twist with asparagus and a choice of prosciutto, bacon or neither.
