I had the meatless version, and was pleasantly surprised by the fluffy toast my perfectly-poached eggs sat atop, as well at the light Hollandaise that was more of a foam than a heavy, thick sauce. Scrumps. 

B Bar itself is lovely - especially during the daytime. Sunlight streamed through the windows all around us, and the service was impeccable. I'd happily return for cocktails, lunch, and dinner.
author: Hilary H.

description:
To be completely honest, I haven't had any food from the B Restaurant and Bar. But that's probably because I haven't had any service either. I'd tried to eat here over the holiday break, hunted it down in the maze that is the Yerba Buena gardens, and finally located it, only to discover that they were closed for the holidays. Whooops. My bad. No biggie. I'll just come back when the new year commences.

So tonight I grab the husband and we skibble to Yerba Buena to experience the B Restaurant and....our experience sorta dies a death of boredom before it can even begin. 

We make our way to interior of the restaurant. There's a little sign that says Please Wait To Be Seated. We stand next to it. We wait. We wait. We wait. We kill some time by being door-policed by some drunk asshole who yells at us to shut the door when the waitress is going in and out---dude, it's not like she's gonna rearrange her molecules to walk through the glass so you can have a shut door. (It's not even THAT cold outside as the couples dining al fresco can attest.) We wait. We wait. We wait. We see a completely different waitress file some checks at the counter. We see a bartender sorta make long-distance eye contact over the bar. We shrug at the sign. We wait. 

So, eventually we give up. And fortunately, I have a back-up plan. So we leave. And I have no idea if the food at B Restaurant is any good. 

But I can tell you, they have a long ways to go on service.
author: Lis M.

description:
Food was okay but service was horrendous. Basically you need to be mentally prepared with the fact that you're simply paying for the idea of al fresco dinning in a central place with a nice city view. If you are looking for a nice San Francisco food experience, you probably won't find it here.

The service was repulsive, staff was not friendly or attentive at all. Not to make things personal, but our server didn't seem he needed his job and came across cognitively confused at times. He was quite willing to ignore us through most of our brunch even though the restaurant was not busy (we were among the early patrons of the morning). We think he just didn't feel we were worthy customers since we declined to order any alcoholic beverages...I did order a cappuccino, which took 20 minutes to arrive and only after I flagged down the server to follow-up.

I ordered the asparagus eggs benedict with prosciutto - it was alright. Asparaguses were nicely seasoned and grilled, poached eggs and prosciutto were fine but the accompanying bread was partially burnt black and not edible.   my companions ordered a chicken sandwich and salmon frittatas. Apparently the chicken sandwich was tasty, though poorly presented. The salmon frittata did not look appetizing - they simply dumped some smoked salmon and a large spoon full of cream cheese on top it the overly-cooked eggs.

While the food wasn't great, the service made the former look pretty good.
author: Critic X.

description:
Happy Hour is super awesome!! (4.30pm to 7pm)

Love love love. I needed to make a reservation for a party of 12 (they only accept reservation for 6+ via email) and Ross responded immediately (kudos!) and confirmed my reservation and answered all my Qs (friend's birthday, cake, etc.)

I got there a lil late, showed the corner closest to the kitchen, which was a blessing in disguise (though at first I was a tad puzzled - was expecting a table). My friends trickled in, we ordered a bunch of their happy hour cocktails (SERIOUS YUM!), pretty good sangrias (MMMmm), a couple dozens of dollar oysters and champagne, vegan pizzas, meat-eater pizzas -- and MAN we were in bliss!!

And the best thing was our server ROCKED! He was so great. Wished I remembered his name, he was attentive, fun and was just great. A couple of times, the drinks or food felt like they were a bit slow, but there were many of us and many orders, so I give him that. I'm a happy client, for sure will be back. We ended up being pretty happily drunk and full. And thanks for finding the candle for the cake!

So happy to have found this place. Gorgeous view, delicious drinks, good food... so relaxing. If the weather wasn't blustering, we probably would have loved to sit outside, but the inside is comfy and chic. Yay!
author: Azmeera M.

description:
If there's a better happy hour in SoMa, someone please tell me where! At B, you'll find $1 oysters, $5 fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice and vodka cocktails and plenty of sunshine, if you're lucky!

Plus, the barkeeps are sweet.
author: Miriam W.

description:
B was built for beautiful SF afternoons and people that like to enjoy their meals outside in that weather. Luckily we choose to go here on a day when the weather was more than happy to accommodate us. As we watched people turned away with the saddest expressions my lunch group looked at my a bit worriedly. Not to worry though for I made reservations! And I highly recommend you do the same if you want to guarantee yourself a table here.

Now down to the food. When a place puts anything with truffle oil in it on the menu I'm pretty much ordering it. When it's fries with truffle oil I might be ordering two. So we got the fries to share as a table. Then I ordered a Caesar salad and the cheese tray for my main meal. Sure, sure, these two things are not what they considered a lunch entrée, but I can eat cheese for pretty much any meal and be happy.

And what a selection of cheeses this was. It came with four varieties that I cannot remember the names of for the live of me. I called them, delicious, deliciouser, deliciousest, and the most delisiousest. The salad doesn't come in a smaller size to let you know so if you want a side salad you're out of luck.

Others at my table ordered the BLT and pulled pork sandwich lunch specials and both looked great. The only snag was our service toward the end lagged a little. When we were finished with our plates we found ourselves waiting for the check for a while. But, since I was in good company it wasn't too big of a deal.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
SLOWEST happy hour service ever!

Friday evening was absolutely lovely.  The outdoor seating at B Restaurant would be a natural choice; just splendid on a night like that.  

But WTF?  In my attempt to take advantage of the happy hour, I actually became annoyed.  The bartenders took waayyyy too long moseying around in back of the bar.  So much for being happy.  Yes, it was busy.  But my friends and I had front row at the bar--unacknowledged--for over 45 minutes.  

Disgrace.  

We were so turned off that we couldn't even imagine the wait for food.  Oh wait, there was one plus...the fresh squeezed grapefruit and orange juice (added to vodka) was really yummy.  

I am ready, willing, and able to return on another nice day.  I'll keep my fingers crossed that those bartenders get their act together.
author: Angella S.

description:
Yuppies find refuge and booze in this glass box of a restaurant amidst the tall towers of the financial district.

We were here for happy hour and a groupon that was expiring.  Although the groupon couldn't be used during happy hour, we were staying for dinner.  On a thursday around 5:30 it was hopping and the indoor area was filled.  We ended up starting our happy hour experience on the patio.  As always, it was chilly in SF. Surprise. Surprise.  I don't remember there being heat lamps, so bring a little coat and scarf.  But a couple glasses of wine and intense catch up sessions with girlfriends, we warmed up quick.

The menu was plentiful, but had some definite hits and misses:
-  Dollar Oysters During Happy Hr:  These were ok.  I wouldn't come back for oysters and instead were would rather hit up Hog Island or Hyde Street Oyster Bar instead if thats what you are jonesing for.
- Polenta Fries:  Dang! I love me some polenta fries.  And these were no joke.  Perfectly seasoned and with that great contija cheese, a nice twist.
- Arancini:  Another great twist to a classic italian dish.  Instead of ground beef in the inside, these risotto balls had crab and roasted corn.  Quite delicious.
- Burger:  This was alright.  We split it up, but we all found the burger to be dry and uneventful.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing.  

I would definitely be back for small bites and wine.  They had a great wine list and the service was fantastic.  We started the night outdoors, but when a table freed up inside, they moved us in.  A nice change of pace that is a bit off the beaten path.
author: Natalie G.

description:
This is a cool place located at the top of Yerba Buena. I like how they have a lot of outdoor seating (for a nice SF day) and a full menu with happy hour options. I ordered the Blue ribbon fried chicken breast sandwich, applewood smoked bacon, granny smith apple & jalapeno aioli which was really good and I highly recommend it if you're there. It is a $14 sandwich though so be prepared.

The happy hour oysters are $1 each and they're disgusting. I don't know what was going on with my oyster but it tasted like rotting seafood and the texture was half normal oyster texture and half I-don't-know-what.

For a $14 sandwich - you better get something good and you can probably get that good something elsewhere so that's the route I'll be taking.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Celebrated my friends birthday at this wonderful place! The service was excellent and the food was extremely delicious!!! The view is amazing and they really made the experience a special one! 

You cannot go wrong here! ENJOY!
author: R To The P.

description: The "B" - A bastion of pleasure for food (oysters), libations, conversation and glances. The atmosphere is chill with a warm relaxing vibe and stirring views. A great place to get away and enjoy yourself.  A wow experience!
author: James G.

description:
2.5 stars for the location, 0.5 stars for the food. 

My entree was ok, but overly greasy. My wife's burger was unexceptional filler.

But the problem was the oysters she had for an appetizer. Yup. You guessed it. Extended potty time a few hours later. 

Even not considering that (sometimes stuff happens) they're overpriced relative to the quality of the food they serve. You're paying for location not quality here.
author: Uncle F.

description:
Delicious Burgers!! I joined a couple of friends here for lunch and drinks -- the weather was amazing out. It wasn't too hard to get a table outside, however the service was sub par. There were multiple times that we ordered something and had to remind the limited outdoor wait staff to bring.

Back to the food -- everyone really enjoyed their meal, we all got big tasty burgers with all the trimmings. The drinks were cold and refreshing. I would definitely go back here for a business lunch when the weather is nice.
author: Jason M.

description:
Got a groupon to come here.  We got there, and the place looks nice.  However, it took quite a long time to get seated and get our food.  Our waiter not only gave us the wrong order, but did so to the two tables sitting near us.  He also gave us the wrong bill.  Overall, the service here was pretty poor- they sat almost the whole restaurant at the same time, which of course means all the food orders go in at the same time, so we had to wait extra for our food.  Also, they ran out of the potatoes that I ordered and he replaced them with fries- and still charged us for them!  The food was good- but definitely overpriced.
The pros:  very pretty view of the gardens.  Truffle fries were good.
author: Allyson S.

description:
Great little find during my lunch hour. I had no idea there were restaurants in this little area by the Metreon.  The exspansive outdoor area allows people to enjoy their lunch/dinner/happy hour with great views of Downtown SF. 

My coworkers and I ordered the truffle fries for an appetizer and they were delicious!  You have to order them. They are served with 3 dippings sauces that are matched perfectly.

I ordered the chicken caesar and the chicken was just  yummy. Perfectly grilled and the portion size was perfect.  Service was attentive, quick and affordable.
author: Theresa N.

description:
Hey, you know the MoMa is closing for 3 years on June 2nd? That's why we went, that and to see The Clock, what a cool exhibit!

Starving, and we all know how terribly I act out when I am hungry...I suggest B, "B"ecause their fries are delicious.

Friday I also learned that their hamburgers are pretty bomb and the soup (Tomato and bread) was satisfying and hit the spot.
When the waiter brought us a sandwich we didn't order he was quite gracious and told us to eat both...nice, except we don't really like chicken, the bacon on it we ate because that's another thing.

I give 4 stars so that they know that we appreciate having a good order of fries and the view of Yerba Buena Gardens can't be beat...right across the street from the museum.

Full belly, empty restaurant, good service---yay!
author: Violet J.

description:
B Restauraunt & Bar has a very pleasant outdoor seating area.  I had a very good grilled chicken sandwich, truffle fries with aoli sauce & ketchup.  My buddy had a meatball sandwich that also looked pretty tasty.  I'll definitely be headed back and will try that one next time.  Table service was nicely attentive to our needs.

There is also a nice inside bar area for happy hour or Friday evening after work.
author: Joel E.

description:
Great place to spend a time.
Great personality and crew. 
Friendly atmosphere and food is great too.
author: Albert D.

description: Fantastic, best brunch ever. Polenta, shrimp, and eggs a favorite. Truffle fries amazing as well.
author: Rich R.

description: Slow service. Better order drinks in a bunch because it may take a while before they arrive. Didn't order any food but their garlic fries looked good. Location is pretty awesome, on top of Yerba Buena gardens, Make sure to wear shades though if it's sunny because it can get bright if you are sitting outside. I would go back mainly for the location, but I'll most likely enjoy the drinks too. A cool spot.
author: Vol T.

description:
Downgrade alert!!! while the atmosphere is hip and charming as ever, and the location is perfect.. we had a pretty bad dining experience last night.
My drink order was wrong , and the waiter seemed dismayed when i asked him to change it. so i kept it, but after a sip, realized it didn't even have alcohol.. sent it back, got what i wanted but got charged for both drinks. 
My friend's meatball appetizer tasted and smelled like hotdogs... aggh. i know that great meatballs are made by adding some pork to the beef, but this was just Not Good.
I would still come back  for a bar drink , i suppose, but there are too many great restaurants nearby to consider eating here again. sorry b, you've gone from  4 stars to 2 for me!!
author: audie b.

description:
Come here if you're in the mood for oysters. Their oysters are super fresh and tasty. A dozen + a side of truffle fries is usually good for me for lunch. If you're lucky, they'll give you the happy hour price ($1 oysters).

Great view of Yerba Buena, you have the option for indoor or outdoor seating if it's a nice day. Decently quiet. One of the better options for a one-on-one.
author: Labs P.

description:
The "B" is one of the of the best kept outdoor dining secrets in the city.  Healthy menu, great wine list, and s spectacular view looking north over the Yerba Buena Park.  

The service is first class - the pricing is very reasonable and the salads are fresh, healthy and creative.  Came for an hour lunch and stayed for two hours.  

Next time the sun is out on warm afternoon - make sure you look the "B" up and give it a try -
author: Dyke H.

description:
I was advised by my SF dining companion that the chicken sandwich is very "California." And when in Cali...

I ordered it as well as the truffle fries to split. They may as well be called crack fries, because I practically inhaled them. The sandwich came on thick bread with a crusty bite, and had red peppers, greens, and lemon aioli. Good, fresh. My companions tried the coffee and tea, which come in press pots. Service was not rushed (made for a long 1.5-hour lunch), but pleasant. Enjoyed my lunch, and would come back. Need a fry fix now!
author: Christina G.

description:
We damn near ordered everything on the happy hour menu--minus the olives and alcohol. Plates are $5 a piece and are super model small!

Truffle fries=yum, but you can't really screw up fries
Citrus salad=dry and boring...rather have a plate of the fruit without the greens
Iron skillet meatballs=small, juicy balls in thick sauce---I've had better and the bigger the balls, the better! Haha! No, I'm serious...
Fanny Bay clams=gross--left a weird taste in my mouth
Confit honey-mint chicken wings=best thing on the HH menu 

Notes: 
* HH is Tue-Fri 4-7:30p
* Tiny-ass spot! But it's freakin' gorgeous--like eating in a greenhouse. Claustrophobics beware!
author: Kristine W.

description:
This is probably a one sided review here, but as much as its a nice setting, in fact, a perfect setting to sit on the patio sipping on a drink on a warm night after work, the whole experience is probably shot down by the taste of warm beer.  Why is there warm beer?  Who would defy the laws of beerology and serve such a nectar of the gods in a warm glass?  

And I don't know if its because they're understaffed (why should you be understaffed?)  Hire a few extra people or turn on the fan when you wash your dishes because as clean as I like my glass to come out of the dishwasher, the heat kills the beer.  90 degree hot glass coming out of the dishwasher, filled with 30 degree cold beer ends up tasting like 60 degree beer that's been sitting out overnight . GROSS.  And twice that happened as if its a staple.
author: Vincent K.

description: I came here with my girls for Happy Hour. I ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio and 15 pieces of $1 oysters. The oysters are fresh but it was not cleanly shucked because I found some barnacles in the oysters. The pizzeria is good but it doesn't have the WOW factor.
author: Sherry C.

description: Loved the brunch.  It's a bit pricey, as you're paying for the proximity to the Yerba Buena Gardens, but sadly there isn't a lot of outdoor seating.  I had originally planned to give B Restaurant four stars, but I can't actually remember what I ate there, so given that it must not have been that memorable, I've bumped it down to 3.  But to be clear, nothing was wrong with the experience, just nothing seemed too above average given the price.
author: Greg B.

description:
A full two years now since my last B review, and I'm still lunching here weekly. 

B really does set the standard, at least for me, of what a lunch meeting spot should be. Namely:

- Uncrowded & relatively fast
- Beautifully designed
- Simple menu, well executed
- Friendly, attentive service
- Relatively inexpensive
- Amazing outdoor seating on those sunny days

I get the Chicken Panini or Burger along with Truffle Fries almost every time, though I've tried most of the other menu items too and they are plenty good. And I'm usually out of there for $12 or $13 a head at lunch.

If they bring over the Turkey and Artichoke Panini from Boxed Foods, I'll round up to 6 stars. ;-)
author: Geoff D.

description:
I had the best time here last night with some of my grad school buds! 

We ordered a ton of food and dessert and the bill was only $75 (gratuity not included).  

I will definitely be back for happy hour soon. Loved it and loved the fun music in the background while we enjoyed our dinner.
author: Christine P.

description:
surprised i haven't rated this place. i work right across the street and we come here for happy hours pretty often. this is the perfect locale for when the weather is nice. 

the drinks and hh food are pretty decently priced except there are usually only two bartenders so it's pretty slow

i've also been here for brunch and had the eggs. Pretty standard but a bit on the pricier side...i think you can get better brunch elsewhere in the city but it does have a nice outdoor seating area...priorities matter here..
author: Janet Y.

description: Blah -- food's a couple bucks too expensive for the quality and the restaurant is usually packed (or closed for private events during Moscone events).  While the fish-bowl interior is kinda cool, and there are lots of outdoor seats, I'd look elsewhere.
author: Bill H.

description:
I came here with 3 girlfriends for a catch up dinner on a Friday evening.  They don't take reservations for parties less than 6, so we met a the restaurant at 7pm.  The restaurant has a long bar and only a few tables inside.  The wait was long for a table inside, since there was a party of 7 and another of 8 ahead of us, so we opted to sit outside.

We sat at a fairly secluded area, which was nice since it was quiet.  The only con was that they were very understaffed that evening so we perhaps did not get as much attention as you would sitting inside, for example.  It was ok though, since we had much to catch up on.

We ordered a pitcher of sparkling sangria to start, which was really refreshing.  I can certainly see myself enjoying these on a warm (indian) summer day.  I ordered the pizzetta lyonnaise, which comes topped with roasted pork belly, chicories, quail egg, and mustard vinaigrette.  The pizzetta was more like a tasty focaccia topped with more goodness.  The crust/focaccia was delightfully crisped at the edges, and the pork belly was prepared very well.  All of the components came together pretty well, and I particularly thought the mustard vinaigrette was a great complement to the whole thing.

My friend ordered the vegan pizzetta and enjoyed it as well.  My other two friends ordered the pork sugo, but when the food brought out it was a beef shortrib dish.  Naturally, we were a little confused.  Apparently they had run out of the pork sugo but the waitress had forgotten that detail at the time we ordered.  My friends just went with the shortrib tagliatelle dish, which they did like.  

My friends ordered 2 chocolate ganache cakes (2 people split 2 and my other friend had one herself).  I had a bite and it was really really good.  Good chocolate flavor without being too rich, and the cake portion was light and airy too.

Despite the pork sugo snafu, I really liked this place.  Maybe it was because we had a wonderful table outside and it wasn't actually freezing cold, or because I just love pork belly that much.  In any case, I would certainly recommend this place to others for a very reasonably-priced and delicious meal.  I also hear their happy hour specials are pretty great, so I want to come check that out some time too.
author: Naoko M.

description: Impossible not to like this place. Simple menu with nothing but quality. Great selection of draft and bottled beers. But the best part... The location.  On top of Moscone Center and overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens... just beautiful!
author: Jon L.

description: I hosted a private party at the B Restaurant & Bar last night and can't say enough about this place. It's a stunningly beautiful location atop the Mascone Center with views of the city on 3 sides through floor-to-ceiling glass. The staff was wonderful, the service was great, the bartenders were on point and the food was delicious, especially the bacon wrapped scallops with Yukon potatoes. Manager Misty Rasche made planning easy and delivered exactly what was ordered: A high end event with all the trimmings. Next time you're in San Francisco do yourself a favor and stop by.
author: Laura B.

description:
I have NEVER in the history of dining out failed to leave a tip. So my experience here has yielded a rather unpleasant first. THAT'S how bad the service and food was!
We went here after taking our kids to the Yerba Buena Gardens playground specifically for the bottomless mimosas. If you have small children then you understand lol. Bottomless mimosas don't come cheap here. We had to BEG people and find people to fill our glasses. I finally just gave up. By the way, the mimosas were served in SMALL glasses so it's not like we were pounding 8 oz drinks...try 4-6ozs and the 6oz is being generous. I had TWO when all was said and done. I ordered the shrimp and polenta...I got 3 tiny shrimp atop some lackluster polenta that thankfully was sitting on sauce that gave it some flavor. My friend got a burger minus a bun with extra lettuce. She ordered it medium rare. What they gave her was charred on the outside and RAW on the inside. We like steak tartare, sushi and a wide variety of raw food...this was inedible. She politely called the waiter over and pointed out the discrepancy with what she ordered and with what was served. He SHUSHED her!!! She wasn't yelling. She wasn't rude. He literally said "Shhh! Shhh! (like one would to an errant child) We aren't doctors here...no one's going to die!" My mouth actually dropped open in shock. My friend actually IS a doctor and it was the rudest thing I've ever heard said in a restaurant. He took the burger back and half an hour later (after we'd all finished our meals) returned THE SAME burger (it was recognizable from the fact it was in two pieces with the single bite missing) charred to a crisp and completely devoid of flavor, tenderness...ANYTHING. Did this burger make it on the bill? YES. I was so completely disgusted at the inattentive service, rude staff (more than one was heard muttering under their breath about their tables) and horrible food that I was the lone person at our table that didn't tip. The other two tipped horribly but I was THAT disgusted with the way we'd been treated. 
NEVER coming back.
author: Jill D.

description: Do you love fried chicken? Of course you do! Do yourself a favor and order the Fried Chicken Breast sandwich at lunch. It will not disappoint. The outdoor seating has also been proven to lift spirits and brighten moods. On a glorious, sunny day in San Francisco, it doesn't get better than this place!
author: Gina T.

description:
This restaurant deserves high marks for the food and low marks for the weirdness we experienced with our waiter this past weekend.  For the good marks, the food is good and reasonably priced. I had a citrus salad with chicken and the citrus were so sweet, the arugula was fresh and the chicken was tasty and not dry. Everyone else liked their brunch items and the prices were all around $9 - $13. 

For the weirdness, the waiter kept pushing us to buy sangria. None of us actually wanted to drink, but after he threatened to hold our cheese plate hostage, we agreed. Then I opened the menu and the pitcher of sangria was $55. I took a double take and wondered if that could be correct when all of their bottles of wine were $35, cocktails were $8-10 and wine by the glass were $8. So, we canceled it because sorry, no sangria is worth that price.  

What I'd really like to know from this restaurant is why is their sangria so awesome that it is worth to be charged $55 for a pitcher? I've discussed this with several people and all had the same reaction. $55 for sangria? WTF.
author: Natalie S.

description:
One time four stars, my only visit here. Had lunch here with my son and K during one of her shopping adventures. She claims she "saved" enough money to pay for lunch.
O.K. whatever.
Mussels were excellent as was the service, sunny day, sat outside. We'll go back and "save" even more money.
author: Michael F.

description:
On a sunny and warm afternoon/evening, this has got to be one of the nicest places to spend a couple of hours for Happy Hour.  With glass windows all around, and situated above the Yerba Buena garden, you can take in some great views while you relax and dine.  

Most of the menu is adequate to above average, though there are certainly a handful of plates that do stand out.  Of all the things I've ordered, the French Fries with Truffle Oil are by far and the away the best I've had.  Sure, they are just french fries...but have you had them with truffle oil before?!  Didn't think so...cuz otherwise, you wouldn't doubt that the truffle fries are fantastic!  

Beyond that, the Duck Confit is delicious, and the apples do a fantastic job of lightening up the flavors and refreshing the pallet.  The Buffalo Mozzarella plate is also a highlight, with the cheese and salami with olive oil, salt, and herb seasoning.  Toss that onto some toasted bread, and talk about an appetizer.  They also have $1 oysters, which is hard to complain with, a Prosciutto Panini with Augula salad that really hits the spot, and carafes of sangria.

The big knock against them is that even when you do come here and get their drinks and appetizers knocked down by a few bucks, you can still rack up quite a bill.  The most recent trip with a party of six still tallied a bill that was over $200.  In the end, you'll still be satisfied with your meal and drinks, but just remember this a nicer sort of happy hour.
author: Mike L.

description: This is a great hidden little bar.  Nice views of the San Francisco skyline and the staff is very friendly and prompt.  I attended a corp event here which provided appetizers, which were AWESOME.  Combined with a Bourbon tasting, this was a great event and a perfect place to hold it.
author: Darren S.

description:
On the rare occasion that we have sunshine and no fog, and the even rarer occasion that I'd commute downtown - this is a lovely place to B!

It's beautifully located on the little bridge connecting Yerba Beuna to Metreon and its a really nice stroll with the view of the park, the church, and pretty plants!

The food is decent; can't go wrong with Truffle Fries! 
Note this was a last year: I forgot what I had but I remember the portion was rather small. I ran over to meet up some friends over a quick lunch since I only had about 45 mins for lunch. Sadly, I waited over 30mins for them to come out with appetizer dish so I scarfed down my meal in 10 mins to get back to work. Their bread and butter is good! Taking account that this consisted of most of my meal there hahaha. It's a nice place and I want to give this place another try when I have leisure time.

Can't wait to come back for a great Happy Hour deal - $1 Oysters
HH is from 4:30 - 7:30pm and 5$ Well drinks!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Can't wait to return!

Came here last Friday for happy hour and was very I impressed with their food, drinks, and most of all, the SERVICE.  When we arrived, the host asked if we had a reservation, we didn't, but he smiled and said "no big deal, I think that table by the window has your name on it". Five minutes later we were seated, at a great spot next to 25' window overlooking the park. Our server, Bianca, was the best. Mentioned the specials, made sure to remind us to get our orders in before 7 to get the happy hour price, and also managed to score us the last dozen oysters that they had in the place. Guess our timing was perfect. We also ordered the pizza and truffle fries, and both were fantastic.  The gin Ricky's were also epic...all four of em!

B bar is a fantastic place to unwind after a long day or week.  The venue is very sleek and has a cool vibe.  The drinks and the food are solid, and the service, even on a busy Friday, was top notch.  Put it all together and this place is deadly....can't wait for daylight savings!
author: Barrett F.

description:
Bad experience twice. 

First time: I make a reservation for a group of 8 girls for a saturday lunch (we were seeing a movie at the Metreon after). I get there on saturday and the place was closed for a private event. They didn't even call me to cancel my reservation

Second time: I decided to try once more since I was again hosting a meet up of 10 gals. I get there and they had lost our reservation for 10 people as well as the reservation for another table of 8 people. We waited 45 minutes for our table and were late for the movie. Once the food actually arrived, it was all quite disappointing. My risotto was drowning in oil and the rice was overcooked. The truffle fries were good as well as the raspberry mimosas. 

As convenient as the location is, I will not be going there anytime back...
author: Isobeth Z.

description:
This place was a 5 star establishment...

Until they took away the Drifter's Compass. Which is by far my favorite mixed drink in San Francisco.

When I see the Drifter's Compass back on the menu, this review will return to 5 stars.
author: Russell W.

description:
Came for my Yelp Elite Newbie event...yaaay me!! =) 

Love the location and from what I've heard, that's what it's all about, right?? I got to try their sangria, beer, truffle fries, and bruschetta and all were very good.  

It's fitting that this restaurant/bar is above the gardens of Yerba Buena since it reminds me of a greenhouse...complete with all glass walls (sidenote: I'm aware that most greenhouses are not made of glass but that's how I picture them to be more beautiful from the outside, so in my world they're real! LOL).  

Seems like it would be mainly a happy hour spot since the bar takes up most of the indoors.  Though I'd love to try their outdoor seating one beautifully sunny SF day.  And several of their cocktails just sound enticing...the Love On, Caipirinha, Don Riley.

Definitely a spot I'd like to revisit one day.
author: Ninja H.

description:
We came here for my boyfriend's dinner along with about 10 of our friends and the experience was amazing. The decor of the restaurant itself was elegant and simple; to say the least it had a very romantic and tasteful feel to it. The inside seating was rather limited (and I mean that once the 10 of us sat down there were only about another 5 tables for 2 left. There was seating outside too but the wind had picked up so that wasn't an option. Since the restaurant walls were made of glass and it was, earlier in the day, a warm day in San Francisco, it acted like a greenhouse and kept all the warm air inside. Though I have to admit, it was a welcome change from the still frigid breeze outside. We didn't get the chance to enjoy the view but we did enjoy everything else.

We all started out with cocktails--the Don Riley, the Asian Pears, the Dirty Martinis. All of them were pretty good, it had the subtle taste of the fruits and the alcohol was not on the weak side. For the price, it was worth the price for a nice night out with friends. The atmosphere was divine especially considering the wait staff, who was very attentive and very accommodating to our requests. 

We started off the food portion of the night with one and a half dozen of oysters, it was delish. They were plump, juicy, and they gave us some innovative toppings that helped bring the flavor of the oysters out. It was goooooood. We all ordered different things, I ordered the chicken threeway and my bf ordered the flank steak. The chicken threeway was good esp the tempura, which was a creative and unique method of cooking up some chicken meat. It was seasoned perfectly. The flank beef was a bit on the chewy side and wasn't as tender as I had hoped it would be. The scallop appetizer had a delicious sauce that was perfect for dipping the bread. The chocolate cake with cherries was fantastic and the raspberry mousse was light and fluffy. 

Thanks to one of our friends who is a master at networking, she was able to thank the chef personally for the wonderful meal, resulting in all of us going out on the patio to smoke some cigars. They proceeded to bring some complimentary shots of mint & raspberry for us to warm us on the frigid city night. All in all, great restaurant. I will definitely, definitely be back for happy hour. Next time I'm bringing the girls for a night out.
author: Ellen C.

description:
On the most perfect warm, sunny day in SF my lunch companions and I found ourselves at B Restaurant & Bar. I think everyone else in the area also had the same idea to enjoy this beautiful day with a leisurely lunch outside at B's because the waiters definitely couldn't handle the crowd. We waited forever for our food and during the few times we inquired about it the waiter got a bit defensive.  But I forgive them because the pear sandwich I had may have just been one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. And the walnut bread it came on was absolutely delicious!

A few people at my table opted for the burger, which they wolfed down within moments...it was either really good or because of the long wait we had just a few moments to get back to lunch. I also stole a few fries from someone and boy were those good- truffle oil makes everything so much better! 

If the service is always this slow I wouldn't recommend going when in a rush, but if you've got some time to kill this is a very good lunch option.
author: Andrea R.

description: Nice location, right on top of the Moscone Center.  Nice view of the small park.  Reasonably good service.  Cheeseburger was just ok and overpriced, but given the location and convenience, not terrible.
author: Dylan S.

description:
Last Friday we ventured to B Restaurant and Bar for Happy Hour and it was a fantastic find. B restaurant is a not-so-hidden gem atop Yerba Buena Gardens in SOMA. B Restaurant is a contemporary bar and restaurant offering delicious cocktails and food with killer views. The restaurant sits at the top of Yerba Buena Gardens overlooking the gardens and waterfalls as well as offering panoramic views of the city. The best part is B Restaurant has a spacious terrace opening off the main dining room with plenty of room to relax and take in the sunshine after work. 

B Restaurant's Happy Hour specials are amazing. Happy Hour begins at 4pm and ends at 7:30pm Tuesday through Friday, providing plenty of time for you to sample their specialty cocktail list and appetizers.  Happy Hour drink specials include a "Ginger Ricky", a concoction of gin, fresh lime and house made ginger ale; $5 well drinks; $4 Trumer Pilsner and $5 red wine sangria. In addition to individual drinks, you can also get a table side pitcher of red, white or sparkling sangria for $40. The table side sangria presentation is sure to please everyone at the table (and get them a bit tipsy). Happy Hour food specials are just as tempting as the drinks and include dollar oysters and your choice of small $5 plates such as truffle fries, confit honey-mint chicken wings, marinated olives, baby gem ceasar and salmon rillette. 

B Restaurant is a great Happy Hour for locals as well as out of town guests. The stunning views and relaxed atmosphere are a great way to decompress after a hard day of work or shopping.
author: Alice S.

description:
This place has one of the best views of the city skyline for the best price for some of the best food. Also, they serve Chimay in large wine glasses--though not ideal, better than a pint glass. 

If you want to sit outside be sure to bring your jackets; it gets chilly outside around this time of year in downtown SF.
author: Jae K.

description:
Everything was fantastic aside from the manager who seemed irritated to be seating and serving patrons. 
It was a beautiful day while visiting San Francisco and unusually warm for the time of year. The outdoor seating was perfect to enjoy after a few hours at MOMA. We enjoyed wine, olives and scrumptious fries. 
The server didn't help much with wine selections and the the prices were a little more than I would have liked. The wine we chose wasn't all that impressive but the food made up for it.
author: sara m.

description:
This is the place to go to in the afternoon or during happy hour.

+1 Happy Hour! Oysters for only $1 each.
+1 Food is great. Not too pricey. Must try their truffle fries and mussels.
+1 Atmosphere. Cute vibe but can get hectic during happy hour though.
+1 Location. It's right by the Metreon. They have an outdoor seating area, it's great for sunny weather.

-1 Be sure not to sit next to the food cart when outside. There are flies everywhere.

They use to have sangria in a carafe size, costing about 10 dollars. Now it's only a glass or pitcher ($40). :(
author: Binh H.

description:
Couldn't be more impressed. Beautiful sunny Sunday in SF. Table outside. Oysters and Prosecco - the oysters were lush and creamy. 

Truffle fries. Done to perfection. Light and just the right crispiness. 

The salmon tartine!!!! 

Brilliant.
author: David K.

description:
top shelf bourbon and whisky a plenty and they make it right...mixers are great, but the happy hour menu is awesome. $1 oysters till 730 is a big plus. definitely coming back when the rain stops.
cheers! 5/5 judochops!
author: Dustin G.

description:
DRINK:
1.) Mimosa!


ATMOSPHERE:
omg! This bar is cool! It's in Yerba Buena garden! Second floor... right next to Samovar... Nice outdoor seating, overlooking the YB Garden, what with the MLK waterfall, green rolling mini grass mounds. Def gon go back. 1030
author: Angela L.

description:
I think they should change their name to "D Restaurant & Bar" instead of "B" - it was clearly NOT a B graded place, a barely passing D+ to be generous. 

We sat down a hour before our movie, put in our orders immediately knowing that it might take a while for some simple dishes to come -  a carafe of sangria, a dozen oysters, fries, and mussels. It took them at least 15 minutes to bring us the sangria, and 40 minutes for the rest, really?! Turned out the waiter forgot to put our orders in, thanks! There was no apology or any kind of compensation. We had to literally run to the theatre. 

The food was decent actually. This would be a one-star review if wasn't for the food. The oysters were very creamy, mmm! The mussels came with a tasty broth, and it would be nice if they gave us some bread, but no.

Lastly, if you are going to have outdoor seating, shouldn't you have some kind of heat lamp? Especially when you are in San Francisco? So yeah, to conclude our experience at this place - we were freezing, starving, and late to our movie. Thanks!!
author: Kai Z.

description:
I fell in love with this place! 

We stumbled upon this gem at the beginning of happy hour, so there were few people, other than ourselves, there. We ordered the brie and pear wontons, which were the best appetizer I have ever consumed....EVER! The staff was friendly, the food was quick to arrive and the drinks were wonderful and reasonably priced. 

The location is what sold me! It's nestled at the top of the arts building, and is surrounded by beautiful gardens and fountains. The floor to ceiling windows let natural light in, so you feel like you are sitting outside, even if you are not. They do have an outdoor patio, but it was too chilly for us the day we were there. 

Many people that day told me that their brunch is to die for; I only wish we could have experienced it while we were there!
author: Marie L.

description:
Being new to the SF area, I took friends who were visiting and staying at the St. Regis across the street to the Yerba Buena where we grabbed cocktails and lunch/dinner at B!

It was a beautiful, sunny day and we sat outside with cocktails. It was a perfect afternoon. We started with the truffle fries which were enjoyed by all!  I ordered the spinach, strawberry salad with champagne vinaigrette and was underwhelmed.  It was a fine salad but nothing too amazing or recommendable!  My friends got the Eggs Benedict and the burger with blue cheese and loved both their dishes.

We had a great time but it is on the pricey side. Once I know the city better, I don't think this will be a "go-to" spot!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Ohhhhh I wish I hadn't just had my pay cut because spending $12 on an entree (although thats not expensive) and a cocktail would have been, what is now "expensive" for me right now.  

First of all, I LOVE the ambiance.  High ceilings, gorgeous tables and padded brocade covered chairs.  Rad!  3 walls are all glass, so if you are seated inside, you feel like you are outside.  I imagine it is just as beautiful at night.

Everything on the menu looked sooo fantastic.  I would have ordered the Eggs Benedict with Proscuitto, but I got the seasonal soup instead.  It was white bean with proscuitto, basil, and other herbs.  I am such a sucker for soup, and it definitely lived up to my expectations.  The bowl was small, but I wasn't even able to finish it.

I would definitely go back in the future, the restaurant looks so classy that I was worried that the prices would also be very expensive, but this place is totally affordable.  They also had a cheese plate on the menu, which if paired with the right wine... sounds like a perfect thing to share on a swanky date ;)
author: Jenna B.

description:
We had a great day in San Francisco yesterday with a friend from NY. Weather was so hot that we really wanted an outdoor lunch. We had plan to visit the MOMA, so we voted on B as we needed to try the place. Fantastic views, it was late lunch so very calm.
We had a chardonnay bottle at 35 dollars. The mussels and Fries, the Cheese steak sandwich, the ceviche and the starwberry salad. 

The food was great but small portionned. It was a bit slow for the service considering we were alone in the restaurant, but the waitress was very nice. I would say it is a tiny bit overpriced for the portions size but considering the location it made it worth it.

Id go back there anytime.
author: Christophe K.

description:
Let me just say, I have no complaints about the food. Everything our table of four received was really tasty - loved my arugula salad.

One problem is our food took an about hour to arrive. There were no apologies, we had to ask for bread about 30 minutes in and no one came out to apologize. We requested another water as one of the original ones had some stuff floating in it - we had to re-ask - twice. Final issue: they couldn't bring two of us the tea we ordered (something about all the french presses already being used/dirty), so our waitress offered free mimosas to us. We each ordered one ( so at least two should have been comped based on the tea order). Only one was comped, so we asked to have that corrected and if possible additional compensation (as in a free mimosa for each of us) based on the ridiculous wait time for our food. Our server was really kind and said she'd asked the manager, but he had not approved it. So, we said we'd be happy to speak with him to make the request directly. She went back to him - he made the adjustment and did not come to speak to us.

We are pretty easy going gals. We placed easy, uncomplicated orders without substitutions or anything weird. And we were totally entertaining ourselves and having a fine time. I just felt that the lack of acknowledgement about our wait time showed a poor level of service by the manager. We understand that mistakes and missteps happen and all it takes is an apology and some bread to tide us over. B is a beautiful place to have a meal and the kitchen was on point, but I won't eagerly return.
author: Mac M.

description:
I brought my Mom here for lunch yesterday cuz she couldn't resist the sunny outdoor seating. 70 degrees in SF in November, how could we possibly eat lunch inside?

The host & waitstaff are very welcoming & chatty. They kept referring to us as "girls".  Of course my Mom loved it.  I'm fine with it, just don't call me "ma'am".  Ugh, that makes me feel sooo old.  Our waiter offered up suggestions but wasn't pushy about it. Mom ordered a beer & I debated...can I drink beer on my lunch hour? My boss is out today...hmmmm... I decided to stick with water. 

Yesterday was $1 oysters ALL DAY and you know I love me some oysters. I ordered some Marin Miyagi & they were plump, cool, & delicious. I could have made a meal out of them but decided to go for the roasted chicken salad sandwich instead. We also ordered a side of truffle fries. Yum!

Oh and the bread pudding is awesome.
author: Erin S.

description:
Our company came here for a happy hour one day to mix it up. I thought it was a nice change from Shroeders, but I don't know if it was worth the price. The drinks were well made and we did get a great view of the city. 
However, it was very chilly sitting in the patio. It wasn't a particularly cold day, but the wind just happened to be very strong coming through. The service was a little slow, but not terrible. I suppose I would only come back on one of those very rare HOT days we have in San Francisco.
author: Angela L.

description:
I came here a few times for happy hour and this was my first time for their brunch. I think the main attraction of this place is the view/location. It is located in Yerba Buena Gardens (bit tricky to find but if you are walking down 3rd towards Howard, go into YB Gardens and it's to your left, up the stairs). 

The brunch was okay, I got the salmon tartine and it was standard. Again, would just come here for the ambiance.
author: Tif L.

description:
I have been to B Restaurant a few times for dinner or happy hour and always had a great time.  Recommended it to friends and family, but after this past Sunday, will without a doubt, steer people as far away from here.  I have worked in the industry for almost 20 years, and this was the first time where my experience left me speechless.  We arrived for brunch around 12, and know that there would be a wait, since it was a nice day.  We were the first name on the list and told about 30 mins.  After waiting around we noticed another group of ladies who asked to get their bottomless mimosas while they were waiting, and were now happy and waiting patiently, and so of course we followed suit.  Time passes, and now we have been waiting about 45 mins for a table and 15 mins for our mimosas.  Still ok, they are busy and we see people wrapping up their meals.  About ten minutes later we are sat at our table, still no mimosas, and the host informs us that they are running out of mimosas, but getting more oj and champagne, but if we would like to have bloody marys we can have them now, and not have to wait, but we cannot switch back, so we decide to wait.  About two minutes later, two servers come out with full pitchers of mimosas and go around to all the tables around us, including a table who sat right after us, and give everyone refills, and the first round to the couple seated after us.  There was obviously plenty of mimosa to give us four glasses.  We bite our tounges and wait for another 10 minutes and watch as the servers continue to refill glasses and ignore us.  Now we are just thirsty, so we grab a server passing by and explain that we have now been waiting for almost 40 mins for our mimosas.  He apologizes and in a couple minutes he returns with glasses and we are happy.  
The B Brunch menu only has about 5-6 entree items and 4 side dishes.  The four of us decide on stuff to share and when our server gets there, we order with her only to be informed that they don't have any more sausage, one of their sides.  Since the other sides are potatoes (which come with every entree), toast, or bacon, we decided to all get bacon.  Minutes later, she returns and informs us that two of our entrees are no longer available, so again we switch, a little bothered now, since they have been only open since 11, and its now 1am, they have done one turn, but almost 30% of there menu is unavailable.  
The food comes, its ok, not great, but not horrible, at least until my friend spits something out on her plate.  We poke at it with a fork and realize that it is a sticker that was most likely on the red peppers in the potatoes.  Ok, I know stuff happens, hair gets in food, etc.  But we want to point it out, so they can realize the mistake.  Unfortunately we never saw our server again, so we grabbed the host.  Her exact words when we pointed it out was, "oh, thank you.  thank you."  Grabbed the plate and left.  No apology.  We actually laughed because that seemed like such a strange reaction.  We asked for the check and then proceeded to sit there for 15-20 mins.  We thought at least they would probably get us out fast, but nope, no server no check.  We actually all got up and stood near the host stand for about 5 mins before someone asked if we needed something.  I got the check, and because I don't believe in stiffing a server, but wanted to express my dissatisfaction of the whole experience, asked to speak to a manger so I could give them the check and let them know I was super disappointed.  The manager took the check book and she listened as I explained everything that had happened. She nodded and interrupted me as I finished telling her about the sticker in our food by simply saying "i'm not going to make any excuses" and then started to walk away.  No apology, no sorry.  I grabbed her because I wanted to say something else, but I was speechless, I seriously tried to say something, but all that came out was nonsense.  
I have worked in restaurants when it is busy, understaffed, food come out wrong, and I have always been told to apologize and try to turn the experience around somehow.  I don't know what their philosophy is at B, but it seems like it is
1.  never apologize
2.  if something is wrong, it will get better by just avoiding the table
3.  never apologize
there are too many good places to eat in the city.  avoid this place.  yes I am bitter about this experience, but I am not over exaggerating anything.  i have simply recapped my experience in hopes that it whoever reads this, will be saved from having a similar one by eating somewhere else.
author: Andrew B.

description:
BRUNCH review - not a great experience

_I made a reservation for 5 but the table was not set up properly, they ended up squeezing a chair in the middle of the walk way so my friend sat uncomfortably.  Even with our own effort to move the table to accommodate her, there simply was not enough room.
_toast was either burnt or cold or both.
_yogurt and granola - half hour - the order got mixed up? - not sure what happened
They did try to make up for the things that went wrong by offering us complimentary truffle fries and a sparkling wine.  

It should just be B Bar and skip the 'Restaurant'. Brunch was not enjoyable for our group.
author: Kali F.

description: This place wins with their outdoor seating, looking over Yerba Buena Gardens. Perfect spot on a nice day. Unfortunately the food was a bit expensive ($45+ for two salads and iced teas) and nothing memorable. Think it would be a better spot just for cocktails after work and not for a full meal. The service was also very slow.
author: Sarah R.

description:
3.25

The dollar oysters during happy hour (ends 730) is the claim to fame of this place. Im not a huge raw oyster fan but the one i had was really clean and smooth as they gutted the oysters. The rest of the happy hour menu was pretty lame as the portions were small and mediocre. The mussels werent anything special, the fries were just fries. The san gria was decent as the wine taste was masked and with a jug being $10 (about 5 glasses) its a decent buy. 

Bottomline: if you like raw oysters I would highly recommend this place, if not i would pass
author: Robert Y.

description:
The Pluses:
the setting - upstairs at Yerba Buena - in the sun (hopefully)- great spacious view -
handsome stonework and glass inside
the cocktail  - Love
the burger and fries - perfect
extras - salami, cheese

The Minuses:
the staff - very uneven: they've been smarmy, forgetful, absent, strangely aloof, great, kind, friendly. Very weird with the staff.
author: Carolyn R.

description:
Our waiter was a jerk.  With an automatic gratuity for our party of 8, he could barely contain his impatience with our indecision.  Could he not figure out that we had to change our decisions when he came back THREE TIMES to tell us they were out of one thing or another?

It was 7 PM on a Saturday night, and they were out of the Riesling, the stout, the duck confit, lamb stew, and there were only four salmon entrees left because "it was a busy night."  Yeah, it was so busy that there were two open tables next to ours.  

The salmon was barely warm and tasted fishy.   The Hefeweizen was flat. 

The one star is for the view.
author: Daisy C.

description: Completely underrated brunch spot. They don't have a lot of options on the menu but the ones they have are all stellar. Make sure you order the side of bacon.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
B Restaurant is somewhat hidden behind the Yerba Buena gardens, so if you were just walking by, you might not ever know it exists. The view from B Restaurant is beautiful - a nice view of the tall tall buildings of downtown San Francisco.

We got there around 8pm, so unfortunately, happy hour was over. I ordered a beer, the cheese plate and the truffle fries. I thought the truffle fries were quite tasty. The cheese plate was alright.

The atmosphere was a bit strange. I think there was a private party going on, so their group required a bit of attention, as a result the bartenders looked really tired, and I felt the need to finish my beer and leave. 

I think I would have had a better experience if I had:
a.) gone during happy hour and paid less for the experience
b.) gone on a different day when there wasn't a private party going on

I might be back, since my friends really like this place, but I don't think I'll ever suggest it.
author: Tatiana J.

description:
When the B Bar is open, it is the best eats in the area.  The food and drinks are made with care and creativity, the service is top notch, and the location is perfect.

Where they have failed for me repeatedly are their funky hours.  Sometimes they are closed for private events, other times they close at random times.  

Just this last Saturday I walked over there at 5:15 pm and saw them working the locks at the door.  The sign by the door said Saturday hours were 5: 0 pm to 10: 0pm with the blanks left in between the numbers.  I asked if they were opening at 5:30, and the worker who was locking up said they were closing for the day.  I would not pay too much attention to this if it had been the first time, but this was third time in the past year they have been closed when their stated hours said they would be open.  

It is too bad that such a great place, serving great food and drinks with a smile and in the perfect location is so sketchy in their operations.  I guess they must believe the recession doesn't affect them.  I will not return.
author: Karl S.

description:
I took a break from walking around Wondercon's dealer floor and came here.  I remember coming back to this bar since one of the Yelp Elite events was held here a year ago or so.  

This time, I was able to try the truffle fries without other people grabbing it, and it was still just as good as before.  I also grabbed an order of the short rib omelette, and enjoyed every bite!

For a bar that specializes in drinks, their food isn't too shabby.  If I'm in the area, I'd definitely come back.
author: Ren L.

description:
2 stars for B.. Even though I adore its interior decor and prime location at Yerba Buena... Meh. I've experienced better. 

Nothing special for the food, the brunch menu are mediocre, the benedicts doesn't look like the 'actual egg benedict', the panini and burger are too hard to chew, the salad is okay. Luckily some sweets (french toast, chocolate cake, strawberry napoleon pastry) and side menu (baked fingerling potato & truffle fries) are excellent.

I came in with a bunch of girls to have lunch together, we had rsvp before because we're quite a large party and seated inside as the wind blew outside. I don't know maybe it's only us who treated like this, but the service was poor. 

In addition for the slow service, the manager/owner/waiter seems to act shady. They never smile at us, which makes me think "what have we done wrong?". We didn't share our food, everybody got their own order, we didn't mess with the chair or table or breaking any glassware. But they kept staring at us in an unfriendly manner which made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome.

The only reason I could think of is maybe we asked them too much; like refill our water, add more orders (which I thought they supposed to be happy), and last but not least, take picture of all of us. Duh, that's normal for girls day out rite ? I've been to lots of places and the waiter always willing to take pics without frowning. I'll be considerate if the bar was very busy, but in this case, it was not. 

There was one guy I-don't-know-who but more likely to be the manager/owner because he didn't wear uniform like others did, but I'm sure he works there because he served us food too. He made spiteful remarks when we politely asked him to help us take pic. He did it anyway with no smile, without saying like "ready? 1 2 3", put down the camera on the table and just walk away without looking after we said "thank you so much!" 

Hello? That's unacceptable ! We were paying the same amount like everyone. I sensed some racist issue here since we're not natives. Well, maybe the waiters (and that guy) just had a bad day.. Though I wish they should've been more professional to the customers.
author: Jazzleen H.

description:
If you are going to SFMOMA and it is a nice day, this is a good place to eat lunch outside. The view from the upper terrace is terrific. 

They make a killer Bloody Mary and yes those truffle fries with aioli were finger licking good. The arugula garden salad was fresh and tasty. I liked the way they used very thinly shaved parmesan cheese. 

One friend ordered the soup of the day and said it was creamy delicious especially with the crumbled bacon floating on top. The other tried the Cesar salad and liked it. 

I saw several people eating the mushroom risotto so I assume it is good as well. 

Service was fine, it was busy but not crowded around 1:30 in the afternoon.
author: Eileen H.

description: Great place for lunch. Must get: Steak tartare and tomato bisque. Loved their French press coffee! Too bad our server was really slow getting what we needed (our coffee was cold by the time we got the creamer). Best place to get seated would be outside especially on a nice day!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Get the burger!  I ordered it medium rare topped with cheddar and bacon.  I was finished with half of it before I even added the condiments and toppings that came on the side.  The taste of the beef, bacon, and cheddar was excellent.  Slightly charred outside with a pink moist center.  It's now my favorite burger in the city.  

Truffle fries were crisp and tasted like McD's.  I didn't care for the tangy dipping sauce.  The star here is the Niman ranch burger!
author: MTBer I.

description:
Came here again for brunch using a livingsocial deal. 

Overall a great outdoor dining experience, but that was despite the service and partially the food. I ordered the spinach and avocado benedict and it was way too much avocado and not enough flavor. I tried some of my cousin's french toast though which was actually surprisingly good. But nothing can make up for how awkward our server was. 

I want to like this place more! Hire better servers please!
author: Richa A.

description:
Against my better judgement, I returned. We were at the Metreon for an IMAX, there was a group and I was out-voted. We learned our lesson. All we wanted was a drink after the movie and to go our way.
There were like 8 kitchen staff, 5 bus boys and 1+ server - the bartender was also the maitre'd was also the waiter (absolutely not enthusiastic to be there), all the while he was training another guy. The other guy was super nice, but couldn't pour drinks or run the credit card. And what restaurant/bar has only rose sparkling wine available?!? I think not. Srsly, ppl, get a clue. this is not how to run a business.
author: Russell B.

description:
I'm still building my list of good places to go for happy hour after work, but this place should definitely be on your list.  B flies under the radar without any signage and a keen location overlooking the Yerba Buena Gardens. 

Better yet, its perfect size and glass exterior made for a perfect after work setting. If you are looking for some good appetizers, I'd recommend the truffle fries and bruschetta ($6 each or 3 for $15 during happy hour). The sangria is delicious and a bit cinnamony? Cinnamony, is that a word? For all intents and purposes, I proclaim it a word.

To summarize: Small, quaint setting. Nice view. Cinnamony.
author: D L.

description:
Amazing patio - wonderful place to get happy hour. I wish there was a bit more on the menu in terms of small bites, but its really a jewel in the middle of downtown.

Will be back soon!
author: Serene M.

description:
Bottom line...this place is awesome!

My company recently hosted a cocktail reception at the B for about 60 people.  Location could not have been better...above Moscone!  Our customers just had to walk upstairs from the convention center to this beautiful restaurant.  The B is all glass, so you feel like you are a million miles from the convention center dungeon.

Originally, we had planned something at a conference hotel, but the prices were insane (and really, who wants to stand around some ugly hotel ballroom?).  So we started looking for bars/restaurants around Moscone.  I'm so glad we found the B!  Misty was amazingly helpful in getting the contract organized and we came in UNDER budget!  

At the event, the B blocked off the walkway with VIP signs, so our guests felt very special.  My poor crew had to sit outside in the SF mist to check people into the event, so the servers provided hand warmers and food!

Inside the bar, we set up special "stations" for our customers to play with our products while the servers walked around with appetizers and the bar served beer/wine.  This is the first event I can remember where the services was so great that I could actually relax and enjoy the event myself.

We'll definitely have our next event in SF at the B. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

P.S. A few of us went to the B the night before the event to check it out.  We tried everything on the Happy Hour menu!  I especially loved the fries!  Oh, and the risotto off the regular menu is the stuff dreams are made of...yum!!
author: M M.

description:
I ate at B today.  It was okay.

The outside seating is nice.  The service was a little slow for lunch time, but probably would have been fine at dinner.  The sandwich I ordered was dry and seemed to be missing ingredients.  The fries were great.

Maybe it was an off day as a lot of my friends' reviews seem to be better.
author: Ben B.

description: Went to the B Restaurant for the first time this morning for brunch with two friends. We were so impressed. It is the cutest, chic little place we've seen in a while. Perfect location and rooftop environment. The staff is helpful and friendly and the food was great! I ordered the Polentas & Prawns with the bottomless mimosas. It was amazing! I cant wait to go back!
author: Jenn S.

description:
Sunny days in SF always call for Happy Hour at B Bar.  This rooftop bar overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens is the perfect setting for drinks and appetizers.   

For Happy Hour, B Bar has a variety of $5 cocktails and some really tasty appetizers.  I really like their sangria--fruity with a hint of spice. It goes quite well with any of the appetizers... I recommend the truffle fries, the mussels, or the $1 oysters.

The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating.  B Bar aims to please.
author: Anne A.

description:
Found this place thanks to Yelp & had a delicious late brunch on a lazy Sunday.  It wasn't very busy, which is kind of surprising because the brioche french toast and the special smoked salmon hash were well worth making a trip for.  

I also got a Bloody Mary ('cause I really needed that).  It was good although it had a seafood cocktail flavor that made Ms. A & me think it was made with Clamato, in which case it would be a Caesar, rather than a Mary.  Which is not to say I left any in the glass.

There were only a few other small parties in the place and the service was good - friendly and attentive without hovering.  Next time I'm staying in that neighborhood I'll have to check out the happy hour!
author: Tom A.

description:
First let me say, I didn't actually try the food or drink here which looked absolutely amazing and was the main reason why I walked in. 

While walking in Yerba Buena Gardens I got a bit parched and thought it would be a good idea to try out B Bar. It was a Saturday afternoon making it completely acceptable to have an adult beverage at noon. I sat at the bar with my two friends and waited.....and waited....and waited....and waited....for the bartender to come ask us what we want. The bar was about half way full, so it's just not possible that he didn't see us or didn't have time to come take our order! 

I don't know what was going on, but after 15 minutes of politely glaring at the waiter (you know, the international sign for "get over here! I need something") we walked out. 

I'm kinda sad about this because Yerba Buena Gardens is one of my favorite places in the city, so I'm there a lot! I'm guessing I'll try B Bar again, but not anytime soon!
author: Casi C.

description:
The space was either too small or there were too many people in the space.  I was elbow to elbow with randoms and had a hard time following conversation.  

I was there for a cocktail event, and expected appetizers to be there but didn't see much of them.  The one cocktail waitress I did spot with apps I made a grab for her chicken skewers.  They were good, with some kind of sauce.  But I was so hungry anything could have been on that skewer and I would have devoured it.  

On the plus side, the drinks were pretty good and the bartenders were attentive.  So it didn't matter if I could hear or eat much, I could still drink like a fish.  The bartenders were also very good at keeping my water full.
author: Gina S.

description:
I have come here after work for happy hour twice. It is a beautiful space in Yerba Buena and has great Happy Hour specials until 7:30pm. I am a big fan of their specialty cocktail, the Ginger Rickey. I also highly recommend the truffle fries.

They also have outdoor seating if it is nice out.

The downsides: They often unpredictably close for private parties. The salted caramel tart was terrible.

I hope to return many times for some more Ginger Rickeys.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
You'd think a sunny afternoon, 3 friends, a living social coupon to B Restaurant & Bar and outdoor seating would make for a terrific brunch. Well, that's what I thought too.

Our server was awkward; we could barely hear the daily specials he muttered under his breath, and it took him a long time to understand our (rather simple) orders. The other servers who randomly came to check on us were also a bit off. 

The food was fine, but nothing to rave about.  Also, I thought their coffee was way too weak for my taste. The only thing I would recommend are the truffle fries. But the rest of my meal was nothing above par. If it weren't for the coupon, I would think my meal was a rip-off.

This will not  be my staple brunch place, even if they have great outdoor seating in Yerba Buena.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Met a friend here for lunch the other day.  This place is nice for a sunny day.  The weather happened to be perfect when I was there.  We weren't able to make a reservation because there were only two of us so we had to sit inside but we could still see outside.   

The food was really good.  My favorite thing we had were the truffled french fries.  They are a must have.  I couldn't stop eating them.  

Some of the waiters weren't all that friendly but the food and atmosphere was really good.  I love the decor too.  I'll be back for a happy hour soon.
author: Sooner S.

description:
Blood orange mimosa + sunshiney 65 degree weather + fresh perfectly balanced goat cheese, arugula, little gem & apple reduction salad + garlic fries + fennel something or other soup + chocolate CARAMEL tart with balsamic reduction & sea salt  = wildly happy tastebuds = Perfect way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon alone (or with friends, I'm sure).  

I'm surprised at how much I enjoyed sitting there alone, drinking my mimosa and admiring the beautiful weather and smiling people on the terrace. 

I guess the nice day bug bit me ;-) That was rather enjoyable!
author: Jodie B.

description: Best place for happy hour, hands down. The drinks are a little pricy, but the view you get and the vibe you get from the place is amazing. I take all of my friends out to this place after work and they absolutely love it!
author: Brian N.

description: Dragged here by my co-worker as she wanted to sit outside on a nice day. Since my last time here, I felt the same discrimination I felt before by my server as she attended to every one and was mostly absent. The male HOST was amazing. I saw him more than my actual server; it was him refilling my water without request and offering suggestions. Their happy hour has $1 oysters and sangria. My negative opinion of this place changed mostly because of their host.
author: A W.

description:
My review is strictly for Happy Hour and Drinks.
Went there for the first time on a Tuesday night. I certainly did not expect such a nice bar with very high ceilings, huge windows, and a perfect patio and water fountain in front.. It feels so different from the overly commercialized Metreon next door. Got a martini (vodka, olives) and the bartender was more than generous (even piut extra vodka in an additional glass). My friend got 2 of their sangrias and seemed to enjoy them as well. I think I am going to bring friends there for after meeting or happy hour. Love the setting and it was not crowded around 630pm.
author: Jean-Francois R.

description:
Pleasant ambiance, friendly staff and good food and drink are why B Restaurant & Bar deserves a solid 4 stars! 

A group of six girls and myself came together for a girlie night of food and drink to end the work week. I arrive a bit early, as did a few others, but our table was ready, so we were seated immediately. The outdoor seating area is lovely; nice view of the downtown/FiD. If it were a warm night, I would have liked it even more. It was a bit chilly that evening, and unfortunately they did not have heat lamps. Luckily, as soon as a table inside that could accommodate us was open, we were seated. Pretty smooth transition, as staff assisted with our plates and drinks. 

The table we sat in was against the window and did not comfortably seat all 7 of us, but we let it go, as the inside was warmer and ambiance was nice. It's a cozy, lil dining area that has a sleek look with the marble bar, dark wood paneling, white stones/brick walls, lanterns that that hang above the bar, and floor to ceiling windows that line the one side of the restaurant. 

The menu's fun with special pricing such as $6 each or $15 for three or $7 each or $18 for three.  With a couple exceptions, all the food we ordered was on point.  Here's the verdict: The truffle fries were simple, but done right! The same can be said about the hamburger, crab cake, vegetable brushetta, buffalo mozzarella. The halibut ceviche and duck confit were way off. Too fishy and limey and bland respectively. Sadly, the ceviche went to waste. 

Again, B Restaurant and Bar is definitely a lovely venue from food to ambiance to service. Just stay clear from the ceviche and request to be seated indoors if it's not warm enough outside.
author: Marie B.

description:
Tasty drinks and a beautiful view - what more could you want from a happy hour place? Their Ginger Rickey cocktail is delicious and refreshing (and was a nice strong pour!) and the Love On would be a good call on a warm, sunny day (pineapple juice makes the drink taste like candy). 

I came here for a Yelp event and liked the intimate atmosphere and vibe. The restaurant is secluded (up in Yerba Buena garden near the fountain) but it still feels like you're in the middle of the city - which I think is the perfect combination. 

I'd definitely come back to check out more of the food/appetizers. I sampled some of the garlic truffle fries and they were prettttyyyyy good. Prettttyyyyy....prettyyyyy.....prett-tteyyyyyy good. (Curb Your Enthusiasm anyone?)
author: Hannah L.

description:
I never knew this bar existed until recently when Yelp held an event there. I liked how the bar was secluded and located on the promenade level, across from Yerba Buena. 

The bartenders were really nice and helpful in suggesting the best drinks to try out with the complimentary SKYY offered. I enjoyed the oh so beloved cranvodka for the night.

My boyfriend and I began to crave some food and decided to try out the truffle fries and man did we enjoy it! B Bar is a place I would definitely stop by again to enjoy a drink and small appetizer because it has a relaxing and quiet ambiance, unlike some other bars. Plus it helps that the service is great!
author: Surge C.

description:
Yay for happy hour oysters!!! $1??? Hell yea give me 2 dozens!!
Love this place, great bartenders yummy drinks. Very chill and cool ambiance great friday hang out.
author: Dang L.

description:
Lovely spot with an excellent location overlooking Yerba Buena. The happy hour wines and sangria were very good, though the bar won't win any races. 

We had the cheese plate, the meatballs, and the heirloom salad with shrimp. All delicious, though we were easy marks watching the sun set over the city. Good service.
author: Robert J.

description:
I went here for Brunch after a movie. Nice view outside but the music inside was too loud.

The Crab Benedict I was told was fried lightly, it cam out more like a luke warm scoop of filler and crab and the eggs were cold. 

But mostly the potatoes that came with it were half fingerlings that looked like they were from yesterdays meal. they were halved and in the middle of the halves was a crease like what old potatoes sitting out look like. And they where hard and stale. I told the bus boy and nobody got back to me.

I will not go back ever for food. 

But if you want a drink after a movie and you can get a table in the sun, I recommend it. That's why i give 2 stars
author: fritz k.

description:
I called. I made a reservation for 9. 5 adults and 4 toddlers. You knew. The manager was wonderful. The beet sandwich was a HUGE step down from last years. As in - last year I had to come back 2 times to have it, this time, I don't think I'd recommend it at all or get it again (which means the veg options are near nil). And the service? Your waiter treated us like dirt. Even though the kids were amazingly well behaved, we ordered enough food/drinks that he shouldn't have worried about his tip (until he treated us like dirt). He literally lifted his eyebrows when he came out the first time and was like, "Ok, we will try to accommodate you." As if this was a huge service. Right before, the manager had come out and had been immensely pleasant, thanking us for coming and reserving at B.
