Anyhow, unless there is new wait staff and a new veg item, we will not be visiting again. We will take our adorable and well-behaved children and hungry mom's somewhere else to spend money on people who actually are accommodating everyone.
author: May D.

description:
Strong cocktails (great happy price at $5 a drink). The Ginger Ricky is good, light and sweet. B-Completo (bloody mary) pretty fantastic. And the best part $1 oysters during happy hour.

Bad part: It's kinda small, there's only two bartenders and I was waiting for at least 15 mins to get another drink due to the rush.
author: Betty C.

description:
Sadly, this B Restaurant rates a 'C' or less on the food. 

Ambience/views are A+ on a warm sunny day, seated outdoors. 

Foodwise, the overall brunch left much to be desired.

Truffle fries were delicious, yet they were not the main course.

French toast was 'meh'. 

Salmon eggs benedict was similarly 'meh'. Potatoes on the side didn't do much to help. Plus it was all crammed on a tiny plate. 

Sausage 'burgers' were slightly undercooked (which would be fine if we ordered steak tartare) & lacking much flavor. 

Wanted to like this place but won't be back for a meal. Drinks, perhaps!
author: D L.

description:
They do not have an extensive menu, but it doesn't matter.

Everything I've had here has been effing phenomenal, even the buffalo mozzarella plate with the salami and the fried herbs (OMG FRIED! NOM NOM NOM) is delicious, and a steal at only $6. The cocktails are great, especially their Manhattans and I hear their Gin Fizzboobles, or whatever they're called are good too.

On Friday they had a special potato soup with BACON! seriously, love explosion in my mouth, best soup I have EVER had, like ever.

Service is good too, especially the dude with the long-hair, beard and glasses. He may look like a 70's porn star but he's awesome. 

Seriously, go here.
author: William W.

description:
What a great place... I didn't find it without some looking coming from the street level.
Great drinks and happy hour specials are tasty.
We also ordered dinner.
Asparagus salad very yummie
Beef tenderloin was especially delicious and the crispy fries .. perfect
Pork chop was also nicely prepared but a little raw near the bone.. flavorful and juicy.
This place has got the right combination of good drinks, food and atmosphere. If only they could warm up the cold gale force winds blowing through the garden so you can sit outside.
author: Lawrence T.

description: B-Bar is just one of those spots that make a sunny warm day in SF really special. I went for happy hour with some friends and had a great time. As far as service I never really expect upstanding service from a bar. I order my drinks, I pay for my drinks and get drinks, quite simple. The Sangria is really Amazing and the atmosphere is really spectacular. The floor to ceiling glass windows looking out over the patio, over looking Yerba Buena and the downtown skyline is just freaking cool, add a tasty drink to that and Im happy!
author: David H.

description: B definitely gets an extra star for being the location for the Yelp Elite Newbies Shindig for Feb '10, . Having said that this place is cool. One of the better choices available in Moscone ctr. Because of their location however, B doesnt have to try very hard or offer great value. So it doesn't (notwithstanding Yelp event.).
author: Oleg H.

description: I've been here a few times and for the most part I enjoy this little place, but the one thing I want to advise is that the little gem salad is not worth it. It's essentially $10 for a head of lettuce. It's totally unsubstantial.
author: S W.

description:
My husband and I hosted a post wedding brunch at B Restaurant and we were really happy with the experience B Restaurant provided.  We rented the entire restaurant and had about 60 people show up over a 3-4 hour brunch.

For us, the most compelling aspect of B Restaurant was the venue.  It's an oasis up above the dense, urban SOMA neighborhood.  Dramatic cityscape views tie together nicely with the green grass of Yerba Buena Gardens.  The event was in November so we mostly stayed indoors (however, I've also eaten lunch during the summer and the patio is pretty fantastic on a nice day).  Additionally, many of our guests were staying at either the W Hotel or the ITC so B Restaurant was a perfect location in between the hotels.  For all other guests, the Mission Street Garage was ~1 block away.

We worked with Misty and everything was pretty straightforward when it came to ordering food and renting the space (an absolute blessing when there were so many not-so-straightforward negotiations during the wedding planning phase).  It was nice that they were well versed in renting the entire space and had menu's set up for us to choose from.  The food was good and our friends/family left full and happy!

One note on cost: we looked into using a banquet room in either of the hotels noted above and the prices were just ridiculous when compared to renting B Restaurant.  I was so happy to have found a cost effective, local business alternative!
author: Heather A.

description:
This place has some potential, it just needs better management. We went there for a Sunday brunch and throughout the experience became more and more annoyed. After waiting outside for about 20 minutes with 3 or 4 other groups and watching the wait staff wander around empty tables, we ended up taking a seat at the bar. 

It took awhile for anyone to come over and acknowledge we were there, which is surprising since the inside of this place is not very big. The kitchen was pretty busy and apparently this requires a manager to  stand and shout orders to the chefs. He scolded a chef in front of everyone and most people at the bar could hear. I know it's a restaurant and things like this happen, but please keep it in the kitchen and not out in front of your customers.

The food was good. The lady had the burger and a side of truffle fries, both were very good. I had prosciutto & avocado benedict, it came out cold but at that point I didn't care. Their French press coffee is very good as well. At this point we were going to give them the benefit of the doubt because of the food. However, we ended up sitting for the next hour or so as each member of the staff walked by us (we even stacked our plates in hopes they would notice). We did get to witness them running out of practically everything on the menu as a group of 6 was seated by the hostess. 

Overall, service needs a lot of work. Maybe we caught them on a bad day but from reading other reviews it sounds pretty common. It wouldn't hurt them to clean up some of the junk around the place either (empty tv box, clutter, fruit flies). Be prepared for shoddy service and cold food. At least the view is nice.
author: Aaron R.

description:
Sunny service + sunny seating outside + sunny, spicy spirits (Bloody Marys)  = super sunny Sunday smiles.

I used to go here to escape the office on Fridays for lunch and was upset to not see my favorite chicken panini on the Sunday brunch menu. Much to my delight, our server offered to have the kitchen make one for me anyway. 

-Bloody Marys are fantastic and house made down to the fresh tomato juice. 
-Panini hits the spot every time: perfectly grilled chicken, avocado, tomato, and garlicky aioli sandwiched between two toasted sourdough slices. 
-Burgers are delicious, too. Go all out and order it with the bacon, avocado, and bleu. You know you want to.

YUM. I'm okay paying the premium for the food because they're paying the premium for the location. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for.
author: Claire Q.

description:
This patio will surely become the go-to on sun drenched friday afternoons this spring. We had an awesome sassy waitress who, in a moment of clairvoyance, pointed me towards the Jones' Grimace - a bourbon cocktail featuring my favorite dessert sherry, barbadillo PX, and a thyme sprig.

Remarkable cheese plate too, with all the accouterments.
author: Alex B.

description:
I'm giving this place 1 star for its great location and fantastic outdoor space, and 1 star for its yummy truffle fries. After that, they fall flat. 

I had their chicken salad sandwich which was very bland; it tasted like it came from the local Safeway. The bread it was served on was even blander -- just a hunk of dough with no flavor. My friend ordered a sandwich that was supposed to have mozzarella cheese on it, which was the reason why she ordered it, and neither one of us could find the elusive cheese. To his credit, the waiter asked the kitchen about it and their response was that it was melted mozzarella so that's why she didn't see it. I thought that was a lame response, and they did nothing to adjust her bill or even apologize for the fact that she was dissatisfied.

This won't be on my short list of places to revisit unless I'm going there strictly for the truffle fries.
author: Lori M.

description: Good ambience. The food is sub par. Our waitress had to take away half our dishes because it wasn't what we ordered.
author: Bharat V.

description: Walked in here with a friend after a day of shopping around Union Square and I immediately smelled bacon cooking when we walked in. That alone is worth 5 stars. We walked in just at the start of happy hour so we were the only ones at the bar, but it was still a fun vibe because the bartenders were lively and kept experimenting with cocktails which was fun to watch.  Happy hour sangrias were $5 and they were so good! We were going to leave, but decided to stay for another cocktail, which weren't on the happy hour menu.  I had the Aviator, which was an interesting mix that included creme de violette, which gave it a really floral taste.  That cocktail alone changed my opinion of gin!  My friend had a gin gimlet, and both cocktails were made pretty strong, which left us with a nice little buzz to walk to the Ferry Building with!
author: Julie C.

description:
Came here for the Playdom cocktail party during GDC, and was more than PLEASED! First off, the location and view are prime.....smack dab in the middle of Yerba Buena. Gardens! Unfortunately, i did not have an opportunity to sample the food, but the drinks were fabulous. The bartenders are very generous with the alcohol....2 cocktails and i was feeling pretty damn good =) The service was quick with a friendly, and personable staff. 

I'll definitely swing back by this joint!
author: Marie L.

description:
I absolutely love this place!!! I've always wanted to find a place like CHEERS where everyone knows your name. I found it here, granted I only work a block away which makes it easy to stop in after a long days work and sit down by myself and enjoy a good drink! If you enjoy good R&B soul, old school, classics, grove music... this is the place to be! Music gets you in the mood, food is delicious, but they are a restaurant so, there's good days and bad days... The place is charming and is at a beautiful spot in SF, hidden gem. 

What I recommend for drinks, try the LOVE ON, happy hour is only $5!! 
They also have a great selection of wines too. 
FOOD: Flank Steak, Pork Loin, geez the entired menu! 
I second the outdoor seating is a plus, but get there before the sun sets! There's no heating outside, park rules, but when the weather is nice it's gorgeous!!!

BTW, Happy Hour is from 4:30 pm- 7:30 pm.
author: Judi K.

description:
With the exception of the fantastic outdoor seating, B Restaurant & Bar doesn't have much going for them.  

Case in point, when the next door Samovar was bustling with people trying to get a table on the Sunday of the San Francisco Marathon, B Star Bar was curiously empty. 

But I was famished from having run 13 miles and at that point I was ready to swallow a cow.  So I settled for their burger with overcooked patty and hard bun. 

I then had the food envy and tried picking at the hub's meal (soft scrambled egg - $11 with a side of two overcooked bacon - at an exorbitant price of $5).  no better.  

Sigh.... 

I went home and cooked myself a bowl of Sapporo Ichiban ramen.  Sad to say that it was actually far more satisfying (at less than a buck!).
author: Ange L.

description:
Went for my first time and took my parents for lunch. This place is really great! The truffle fries were amazing!!! My mom order the chicken Caesar salad and was completely satisfied. My father and I had the soup of the day: parsnip and asparagus puree, which was seriously perfect for that rainy cold day. Also the mimosas are great too. The front glass wall opens for a great view!
This place is definitely worth checking out.
author: Stephen N.

description:
Conveniently located just above Moscone Center North, the B Restaurant and Bar is the perfect location for a cocktail party following an event at Moscone.  I recently organized such a party, in which we (my company) hosted a cocktail party (hors d'oeuvres and drinks) for about 125 people.  

Everything about this event was easy and flawless, from planning - thanks to B's, Misty Rasche; to the actual event - thanks to Ross, B's manager, Ben - our main server, the bartenders and others servers, as well as Don, the co-owner who was there to make sure everything was going well.  

The food was great.  The ambiance (especially after the sun went down) is gorgeous.  More than one guest told me they loved the space - someone said it was a "classy" party.  Compared to other bars/restaurants in the area, the prices were extremely reasonable.    

But, above all else, the SERVICE was fantastic.  My colleagues and I were treated like VIPs. (Some of us braved the cold SF weather to welcome our guests as they arrived.  Ross and Ben gave us "hand warmers" - heated water bottles wrapped in white cloth napkins which we could hold to keep warm.  How thoughtful is that?)   We all love B Restaurant and Bar, and definitely plan to return next year to host another party.
author: Heidi M.

description: Cool vibe. Excellent food and drinks. After work, late night, both great.
author: Anthony K.

description:
We celebrated my daughter's 16th bday on Saturday and everything was great. My daughter had been to this restaurant once before and fell in love with its beautiful location, views and ambiance. When deciding where to go for her birthday she knew exactly where she wanted to celebrate with her friends. After speaking with Don he help us arrange a beautiful lunch that included a beautiful set table with age appropriate virgin drinks that made the girls feel special and grown up. They had prepared a delicious cesear salad, fries and sandwiches from the menu. Everything looked beautiful and tasted delicious. The service we received from Don, Tuesday and 2 other wonderful waiters was superb, they all had a smile on their face and made sure everything was perfect.
We love this place and will visit anytime we're in the city, what a beautiful and delicious restaurant.  Thanks for making my daughter's special day a great one!
author: C. E.

description: The all glass windows are pretty cool during the day but we went during the night. Service was so-so as our waiter was feeling kind of grumpy that day I guess. Drinks were strong though.. which is good b/c they were pretty expensive. The food itself was kind of average but well above average on price. Loved the truffle fries though.
author: Henry W.

description:
Came here to celebrate a birthday. Great/beautiful location overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens. Outdoor and indoor seating. Lots of open light (perfect for all you foodie photographers). Small and large tables makes it good for groups (although space gets limited if one large group is seated (ahem sorry guys)). There's also a long bar for seating. 5 stars for decor/ambiance.

Service was also great. Very accomodating towards our group, including last minute order additions. Refilled our water frequently, brought us plates for our family-style meal without our prompting. Also brought us special birthday dessert on the house. Helped me out with wine selection.

Food was almost perfect. We ordered almost everything on the menu.
Recommended: artisan cheese board, wings (although not spicy, still tasty), truffle fries (yum!), mussels (especially broth), pesto risotto.
Not bad: duck confit, ceviche, flat iron steak.
Skip: crab cake (not bad, but just one? not worth it), chicken panini (not bad, but nothing special).

Overall, 4.5-star food and service, but 5-star ambiance. Will definitely come back to just shoot the breeze and enjoy nice weather with good drinks and tasty food.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Been here on a Saturday morning around 11am for Brunch/ Breakfast. The weather was beautiful and we were sitting outside with a great view on Yerba Buena. 
We ordered an charcuterie plate and some sparkling wine and both was great. The charcuterie selection was exactly described on the menu and very tasty. The sparkling wine had the right cool temperature and price/quality combination worked well.
The service was excellent and I had overall a very pleasant experience.
author: Sonja S.

description:
This is a very nice rooftop bar/cafe. Came here for Happy Hour with a couple friends before watching a movie at the Metreon.

Happy hour has some apps, like truffle fries, and $5 well drinks. The app selection wasn't large, but I can't remember what else they had. I ordered the carafe of sangria. I just wish the carafe was bigger. I also ordered a dinner entree, the flatiron steak. It was cooked perfectly, but the portion was a bit small. The topping on the steak was a red wine butter which was an amazing complement to the meat.

As for the service and ambiance, almost the whole building is made out of glass, so there is plenty of sunlight. The brightness keeps the place simple, yet tasteful. The wait staff was attentive and helpful.

I'll most likely be coming back to B Restaurant for another happy hour!
author: Jeff C.

description:
The other reviews are pretty accurate but I had a great time and would definitely come back to this place. We went during happy hour so the prices were reasonable. If it was dinner time it may loose a start based on cost performance. 

It is small and most seating is outdoors. As noted, I didn't see any heat lamps so evenings would be difficult. Indoors it is cozy and warm. There was a large group hanging out (~25 people) so it was all packed except for the bar. 

Overall the food was good. We ordered several things and shared, like tapas and that worked well. The fish & chips were a little to heavy on the battery and light on fish but not too bad. The oysters were VERY good. 

Drinks were well made and well drinks at happy hour are $5 so how wrong can you go.
author: John Z.

description:
I go to B Bar with co-workers quite frequently for either lunch or happy hour since it's across the street from our office. $1 happy hour oysters? Fantastic. Drinks? Yes, and in fact I might have another.

But the service? Next.

This afternoon I got back from a lunch that lasted way too long, even if it was great company on a sunny Friday before Memorial Day Weekend. When we finally got our cocktails, it took forever to order our food, and when we finally ordered our food, it took forever to get our food (and so forth, all the way to the bill).

As for the food, I miss the chicken avocado sandwich on the previous menu, and even though they can add avocado to the current chicken pannini but it's incredibly dry and disappointing.

I do love their wedge salad and burger, and the Love On cocktail is just as tasty as it is pretty. I'll come here for convenience, and today most certainly won't be my last, but SPEED IT UP, people!
author: Brianna H.

description: I actually really liked the space and the happy drinks and the food were really tasty and the host was really nice but our waiter was not cool.  We totally get we are a large party so we're going to try to split up and have the boys stand at the bar and the girls sit and be civilized.  We don't need to be reminded twice to order from you instead of the bar but can't the boys who don't have a seat at the table still order from the bar.  And we know you told the host that you can tell our table was going to be a problem...not cool.
author: Jen C.

description:
I love B. Especially if done right...

Go for happy hour, when the weather is nice and you can enjoy the patio and killer sangria!

Go with out-of-town guests for a casual meal if you're in the area and need to dazzle them with a spectacular view of downtown - definitely more of a "locals" spot in a very touristy part of town.

And most importantly...

Go for the BEST burger in the city, and get it with truffle fries! And some oysters, of course.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
The food was good - but not for the price (Turkey sandwich, Diet Coke was $15 before tip). I went for lunch and first problem was host took over 5mins to notice me standing (and waving off and on) to get a seat. He ended up seating some other couple first - who arrived after we did.

All of the staff look hung over or currently wasted: unshaven, droopy watery eyes, and demeanor of sick old men. They are all slow. Bored. Act completely as if their job is the last place they want to be.

After waving them down to order, food came an hour and twenty min later. They forgot extras we ordered - french fries. By the time they arrived we had already finished eating. (On the plus side they comped those - but it could have been they forgot to add to our bill)

Never checked for refills for my diet coke (until I asked for check to leave) - other guests were never asked if they wanted another beer. They never approached a table without being waved at repeatedly.

Food was good. Awesome location. Everything else was terrible - sucking all joy that this place was able to squeeze out.
author: Bryan W.

description: Happy hour is $6 house wine and house cocktail, but no specials on well drinks or any other wine.  The food specials for happy hour aren't great either.  I love the glass-enclosed bar area with wonderful city views, but I'd prefer happy hour prices.
author: Sona P.

description:
We went here to celebrate my friends birthday. They were more than accommodating. They even made a special desert that was not on the menu for the birthday girl. Ben greeted us with a "love cocktail" and even made us a special table. We were given excellent service. The food wasn't a ten but it was pretty good. We really enjoyed the happy hour menu (definitely the way to go if you can get there b4 730) the salads were large and tasty. 
Overall I would definitely come back here for happy hour and make sure you you ask for Ben if you have any special requests.
author: Ally P.

description:
This is a great place for Happy Hour on a nice night. It was hard to find at first...right up the steps of Moscone Center North off Howard. 

Pros:
* Happy hour goes until 7:30 so I can actually make it in time to get more than one drink at happy hour prices
* Tasty apps that were 3 for $15 ($5/each). The truffle oils fries were great.
* OUTDOORS

Cons:
* Happy Hour drink choices seemed limited...I wished wine was included- though the sangria was a great value at $10/carafe

If it is nice out, bring sunglasses!
author: Katie W.

description: Well.....where should I begin? I think this is usually my default place for HH.....their sangria is not strong at all....it's nice to look at but doesn't get the job done. The onion rings aren't bad, but how hard is it to make onion rings right? The only good thing here is the short rib pizetta. I feel kind of bad....so I took 2 of my good friends here yesterday for oysters since they wanted it so bad and we got like 2 dozen raw ones.....they were ok...but i get a text from my friend today asking me "did u get diarrhea?" and I was like hmm no since I only had like 5? And she was like well me and our other friend had diarrhea....and i was thinking fml.....it's probably the oysters since they did eat like the rest of the 2 dozen that I skipped out on....I kind of remember the texture looking weird as well....I don't think we will be coming here at all after this....
author: Diane L.

description: The food is decent, the staff is friendly, but the busboy dropped a pitcher of water on my friend, and then our waitress dropped a coffee carafe on her ten minutes later!  We weren't comped at all and had to go straight back to my place to throw her clothes in the washing machine.  I might go back, but am left feeling not so warm and fuzzy about this pretty brunch spot.
author: Tasha D.

description: Found this place on yelp; ordered a burger and it arrived cold and uncooked, I spit the raw beef out, sent the burger back (with 1 bite) and the waitress still tried to charge me for it. This place has great potential, but between the raw hamburger and the poor service, I would never return here.
author: Jordan A.

description:
I forgot I had been here. I  used to live just a few blocks away. 

The drinks are good, fun, creative and the staff is nice. But, verrrrrry slow. I've also had apps here and they were so-so.
author: Art A.

description:
The boy and I were on vacay in SF and stayed in a hotel on Market Street. We were exploring our surroundings and stumbled across this cute glass house of a restaurant. Of course the first thing i did was order a cocktail (who cares that it was 11 AM). My poison of choice was "Love On" which was made with Grey Goose Vodka, Raspberry Puree and Pineapple Juice. Delish. Other must tries: Halibut Ceviche & Prosciutto Panini.

yummmmy. A San Francisco Treat indeed.
author: Carmen K.

description:
I'm a big fan of B Bar. One of the best happy hour spots in downtown/SOMA area, especially on a warm day. 

We sat outside and sipped happy hour cocktails (not a huge selection during happy hour though) and munched delicious snacks. Strozzopretti pasta w/ pork was yummy, as was the buffalo mozzarella w/ salami and truffle fries. There are a lot of other good looking things on the menu I'd try.

The view and atmosphere is really wonderful if it's not too cold outside. Inside is cozy too. Service is never particularly attentive, but they don't mind if you linger a while.
author: Allison S.

description:
I ate here last night before a show my friend and I were seeing at the Novellus Theatre at YBCA, We made it during happy hour, which goes until 7:30 (big plus!) We split the cheese board, truffle fries and duck confit. The cheese and fries were amazing, and while the duck confit wasn't bad, it could've been a bit better.

The service was excellent. Both bartenders were prompt and on it. Ours, Lance, introduced himself at the end too! I had the Ginger Rickey, which didn't even taste like it had gin. And my friend had the sangria special, which I named Super Sangria because the brandy in it made it so strong. 

I'll be back to this place, hopefully for a summer night happy hour when I can sit on the patio that overlooks the garden plaza and enjoy my Ginger Rickey.
author: Jenna H.

description: Coming here for lunch or dinner is overrated. The portions of food are small, the food is just okay, and the prices are high. However I do enjoy coming here for happy hour (4:30 pm-7:30 pm). They have dollar oysters and other food/drink specials. The sangria is a great value at $10 a carafe and I highly recommend ordering their truffle fries.
author: Alice J.

description:
We recently had a birthday party at the B Restaurant & Bar. On a Friday night, the area seemed a tad bit deserted so we had good luck securing seating for our large party of 18.

On the plus side, the wait staff was very friendly, from drinks, to food, to photo taking. The truffle fries were pretty tasty. They kept playing 80's music, which was nice.

On the down side, the price is slightly higher than average, but probably the norm for the area.

On the neutral side, the food was well prepared but forgettable (sans aforementioned fries).
author: Walter W.

description:
I would love to have given this place a great review but the service was just plain terrible.  Ambiance was awesome though.

We could not have hoped for a better day in San Francisco.  It was a sunny day with a light breeze and we went there with a group of 8 people for a birthday brunch.  What a great idea, sitting outside drinking bottomless mimosas and bloody marys.

It started with really slow service.  We were warned right away that you can't switch between bloody marys and mimosas which is understandable.  Then they brought out our drinks and started to mix a pitcher of sangria at our table... we were all thinking... excellent.  But then the other server came and said it was for a different table and they took it away.

Then we ordered the cheese plate, the meat plate and truffled french fries.  They brought the meat plate plate right away.  Then 20 minutes later they arrived with another meat plate, the cheese plate and the truffled fries...

And then the guy dropped the ketchup from the fries onto my friend's purse and chair.  

We weren't ready to give up though.  Once again, beautiful day with bottomless mimosas.

We ordered brunch and I got your standard burger; can't go wrong.  When it was delivered it was pink inside and I ordered it medium.  I am a medium rare kind of guy so I am not afraid of a little blood.  BUT this was pink, through and through, and I sent it back after one bite.  They took it away and said that they were "going to fix it."

I am not sure what they did but my exact same burger came back with the bite out of it and my bleu cheese still barely melted on top... maybe microwave.  The inside was now a grey-ish pink and I just gave up.  Didn't make a big deal about it since I was there for someone else's b-day party.

Then my very next bloody tasted completely wrong.  Thought maybe it was just a heavier pour.  Took a another drink and figured it out; they used tequila instead of vodka.  Had some friends try it and they agreed.  Sent it back.

Got another bloody mary and we were then told that they must have pushed the wrong button... vodka/tequila out of a pouring gun, must be some dirt cheap vodka.  My friends got another bloody as well and then we were told that they were out of blood mary mix... we would need to switch to the mimosas.

We were done but all of us had another round while we waited for our check.

After all of the mix-ups and screw-ups and undercooked food, there was not even a discount.  Full-priced with a 20% automatic gratuity b/c of the party size.

It was such a horrible customer service experience at such a potentially amazing venue.
author: Scott R.

description: Honestly, I would really give this a B-.  The atmosphere and service were definitely A+.  It's really just the food that was poor and cold.  Not good and way over salted.  But like I said, the atmosphere was really good.  I'd go back for drinks and or maybe another meal??  We'll see...
author: Ryan B.

description:
B Bar used to be one of my favorite happy hour spots in the city. However, now I wouldn't recommend it if it was the last place on earth serving beer. I wish I could give it negative stars. In fact, I finally created a Yelp profile just so I could write this review...

I've been there a bunch over the past couple of months. The happy hour itself isn't that good - the cocktails are lousy and the appetizers are mediocre (with the exception of the $1/oysters.) However, the outdoor patio overlooking Yerba Buena gardens is breath taking. The wait staff was very courteous and sweet.

Then ... I met the manager. He is one of those people who seriously should never roam a dining room floor... My advice to him: sit in the backroom and count your money, but whatever you do - don't interact with the guests. You are spectacularly bad at it.

He meets us at the door and informs us that we can't have an outdoor table until our entire party of four arrives. (Two of us were there.) Now - it was already 7p, half the outdoor tables were empty and the fog was rolling in. Within an hour, we would have moved inside anyways. All the outdoor tables seat four, we had two already, two more were coming... but he refused. He said, "If I seat you two now, I won't seat your friends with you!" ... Really? Really? Once again, the outside are was only half full and he knows better than most that the fog rolling in would make the outdoor seats so much less appealing.

So... we hung out at the bar instead and I vowed to never come back. What kind of bar manager treats a regular guest that way? While at the bar, we saw the bartender and the manager handle two other guests in similar ways. 

All in all, with the number of great HH spots in SOMA, why would you go to a place that treated patrons like dirt. Hasta, B-Bar!
author: Nilay P.

description:
First off, beautiful, fabulous location. Smack dab in the middle of Yerba Buena Gardens, with outdoor seating overlooking a fountain. The service was overall good, although we did have to wait a bit to be greeted by a host, and then again to be greeted by a server. But the server was very nice and friendly, and not overbearing. Giant, healthy looking burger (yes, I said healthy-looking BURGER) and a beautiful sandwich with arugula and of course, truffle fries. 
The fries were pretty nice, but the sandwich was SOOOO good. My boyfriend ordered the gin rickey (Made with house-made gingerale) and it was FABULOUS! 
Price was fitting for the fare and the location.
author: Marisa O.

description:
LOVE. Love, love this place.
BBar is a locovore gem, with  100mile-sourced organic ingredients prepared and served with style; this is fab SF gastronomy with a view. Veges and vegans will not be disappointed, as much of their fare is V-friendly. The menu changes with regularity, and the wine/cocktail list has yet to disappoint.
The vista from atop Yerba Buena Center is breathtaking. If you want an panoramic view of the downtown skyline to wow out-of-town guests, look no further. This is the perfect place.
Drinks from BBar deserve special attention. Each is hand-crafted, often with flourishes like a heart drawn in strawberry syrup on the champagne foam of the "Love-On," and feature delectable pairings of top-shelf alcohol with fresh juices. Drinks here are as strong as they are flavorful, and are definitely bound to impress.
author: Jay A.

description:
B used to hold a special place in my part with the best. best. best BLT ever. But after my friend had an extremely awful experience here this weekend, I'll probably never step foot in this place again... and neither should you. I won't try to tell the whole story but just know that he and two of his friends were refused service by the manager for no reason and were called some pretty awful homophobic slurs. 

No really.... the manager... homophobic slurs... in San Francisco.
author: Derek B.

description:
Overall: B+
Great place to chill when it's sunny and warm. Good happy hour. Can't see myself really hanging out here too long.

Food: C
The warm marinated olives were large enough for 2 people. I found the oysters to be quite tasty. I really liked that they had some healthier options. 

Service: B
Fast and friendly.

Value: A
Happy hour $1 oysters can't be beat. 

Decor: A
Lots of sunlight. DJs on Friday night spinning old school. That really started my night strong!
author: Roger H.

description:
This is one of those gems which I've always walked past but never took much notice of since I always thought of it as just a bar and I'm not that much into alcohol.  On my last day of Macworld 2010, I decided to take a chance and drop by for brunch since it was Saturday and located just above Moscone North where MacWorld 2010 was winding down.  

The service was pleasant and the glass walls made sitting inside almost like sitting outside, just without any inconvenient breezes to spoil anything. I didn't have any expectations but the Crabcake and  Eggs were superlatively superb, if I may double-up on my praise.  Many restaurants I've been to always overcook the scrambled eggs (probably in fear of salmonella; turning them into little yellow rocks) and that always turned me off.  It takes an expert hand to get scrambled eggs just to the point of doneness so it keeps from being overly runny (and potentially a salmonella hazard), yet fluffy enough to bring out the flavor of good eggs that is totally missing in a cooked-to-death, leather-like omelette.  This place, Ladies and Gentlemen, has somebody in the kitchen that has such an expert hand and I was in gastronomic ecstasy. The eggs were so good that they almost eclipsed the beautifully sauteed crabcake with an excellent light filler that, while it wasn't "lump crab meat" as advertised in the brunch menu, had a decent amount of crabmeat in it.   And the freshly squeezed orange juice wasn't bad either!

If I only had more time before my trip ended, I would've come back to eat my way through their menu.  But one must leave something for later trips, no?  I append a photograph as limited gustatory proof but even through the visuals one can see the beauty of the dish showing through.  Bravo!
author: Tanster M.

description: Another great place in San Francisco.  The drinks were sublime and the appetizers were very good.  I love the ceviche trio with the banana chips and the bartender kept making one amazing drink after another!!  A great night indeed!!
author: Well Gnome Chef f.

description:
The beautiful glass walls and high ceiling gave this small restaurant a spacious feel. The owner (or manager, I'm not sure), knew my companion and greeted us very kindly. There had been a "reserved" sign on our table when we arrived which was removed as we were being seated. 

Our server was incredibly sweet and soft-spoken, yet helpful and knowledgeable. She explained the drinks and shared her recommendations on the food. 

The burger came out looking large and delicious while the plate of three large cheese-stuffed ravioli came out looking like it wouldn't be enough, but was surprisingly filling.
author: Carol Y.

description:
HORRIBLE OWNER!!  
I normally frequent this place since I live across the street.  The food is relatively ok. However, what draws me to this place is the outdoor seating on warm, sunny days in city. 

Today's experience was Terrible and SURPRISING! I ordered the citrus salad (only salad on menu). The waiter claimed that they will no longer be carrying this item and they forgot to remove it from the menu. Ok fine I'm ok with that so I ordered something else. 

But oddly enough the table behind us got the salad which they were sat after we were. it gets better. Then the table next  to us  gets seated and tries to order the salad. The waiter tells  them the same story as me. After the waiter leaves the table the women says to guy she was with " look at that table they have a salad, let's ask again if we can get one"

At this point I'm leaving the restaurant. As I'm leaving I pass a guy and ask "are u the manager?" he states "No I'm one of the owners" I'm thinking oh good maybe I should let him no that his waiter may be telling customers the wrong information since another table was able to get an item that was suppose to be discontinued. I proceed to tell him and his response was "the reason that table got a salad was because they are his valued customers and he went down to his storage to specially dig out the salad for them and that his waiter is correct in stated they do not have salad on the menu".  He was very rude in his response and at first danced around the issue before just saying that he made an exception for good customers.  I guess my regular business isn't good enough. He never once apologized. 

With the average food and average service the owner should really step it up. But I guess it's a reflection of him.
author: CJ H.

description: Went to B Restaurant for brunch on Saturday.  They have bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's which are very good.  However the food and service were sub-par.  It took at least 10 min for them to take our order.  We ordered the Tortada and Blackstone Benedict.  It took a really long time for the food to come out and it was just average.  Clearly people come here for the nice outdoor scenery, not the food.
author: Ben M.

description: I think I need to come back and try B again. Came on a rainy day so we couldn't sit outside. The place was pretty dead but can see how it gets packed as he interior is quite small but cute. The wine was fine. The food was ok too. Nothing I would go back for, but willing to go back and try something else. My friend ordered the Vegan Pizzetta, and while she said it was still good, it came with nothing that it actually said it would on the menu.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Happy hour is a really good deal.  Great drinks and great appetizer type dishes.  I would only aim for happy hour cause the prices are slightly steep normally.  

Don't forget the view and sunshine.  It 's a really great location and I hope that whatever happens at the Metreon doesn't put them out of business.
author: Corey V.

description: I got a Living Social deal which expires on 8/8. Called on 8/3 to make sure they are open on Sat. 8/6; the guy said they are. Arrived at the restaurant Saturday and found out they are closed for a private event. Great. Wish the person I spoke with had told me.
author: Karen N.

description: This restaurant treats customers like crap, I bought a drink and was eating my food, at the table outside and the waiter asked me not to eat there and I have to move. I was in the middle of my lunch and with a friend. It was totally embarrassing. They told us to find a place in the bar as 2 people can't sit at the table. Never coming back here again :( Not to mention overly priced and the quality of food and drinks are sub par.
author: S J.

description:
This has always been one of my favorite SOMA happy hour spots - good HH menu with fresh cocktails and beer selection. Plus, their truffle fries are really delish. It's perfect on a night with good weather to sit outside and enjoy a drink.

My company recently rented this place out for a Thursday night event and it was great - the food (apps and a pasta entree) were pretty tasty and they made sure we didn't go hungry and the staff was really accommodating. It's a great location above Moscone for when you're putting on an event in SF. You feel like you're away from the hustle and bustle of the city while still being in a primo location.
author: Sandy G.

description:
B Restaurant & Bar is definitely group-friendly. Two waiters were very attentive to all our needs/ demands and only a call away when we needed to order an extra drink or dish. Actually the place is very small, so it's not like they had anywhere to run/ hide. They were basically STUCK with us. 

In terms of decor, the best way to describe this establishment would be... hmm what's that phrase really old and sagacious people say... ? Oh yes,  "the carpet doesn't match the drapes." two of the chairs that my friends were sitting on had one arm missing. I guess if you are into modern and/or questionable art, then you'd consider having one arm dangling in the air while eating dinner as an artistic expression, but not my friends!

Food was either a hit or a miss. But I'd say mostly misses... Truffle fries? Four Seasons has better. The shrimp? Rock hard and not in a good way. Gazpacho? Why was it accompanied with those artisan chips from Wholefoods/  Trader Joe's? 

Overall, would I go back? Maybe just because it is so close to my apartment, but I don't think I'll go back for any other reason other than convenience.
author: Andrew C.

description: Our company had a private event at the Yerba Buena Bowling Center and B Restaurant provided the catering.  To say that it was top notch is an understatement! From the initial engagement with the owner, Misty; to her providing customized menu suggestions; to the yummy food at the event and the on-site staff - everyone at B was outstanding!  Our event attendees raved about the food, as well as how attentive the staff was.  I would highly recommend B to cater anyone's event as they are true professionals.  Thank you for helping to make our event such a success!
author: Lori P.

description: Great outdoor seating/venue for warmer days in SF....
author: David C.

description: Yay! I'm a fan. This is the perfecto no-fail happy hour spot. I love the $5 cocktails and apps. I will say though, we went recently and hung out for a few hours there...we got a little too happy and racked up quite the bill! I guess those Love Ons add up after a while.  Either way, service was great, scenery is superb-- B Bar is easily one of my favorite happy hour spots in the city!
author: Ieesha C.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  You have to order the halibut ceviche with thick cut chips (these chips aren't like kettle chips, think THICKER) and truffle fries!  Their dishes are in really small portions (feeds approximately two people).  So order a bunch of little dishes and pig out.  The cocktails are really good too, I always get the "love on", it's extremely girlie and they draw a syrup heart in the middle of the foam, what can I say I have a soft spot for cute food.  They once had an Asian pear cocktail that was really good, but I haven't seen it on the menu since.   

Pros: really consistent yummy food in a chill relax environment.

Cons: they close really early for a bar.
author: Amy C.

description:
The Ginger Rickey is great!  Gin in ginger ale with some refreshing lime juice and not too much sugar -- just the way I like it.

And B has an amazing location sitting above the waterfall in Yerba Buena Gardens -- it's an oasis in downtown SF.
author: Christine P.

description:
This was my very first Happy Hour in San Francisco with my friend A.V.  I would have to say I enjoyed the well-priced $1 oysters during the happy hour.  

We ordered a total of 36 oysters, I believe we shared 6 and 6 on each type of oyster ordered.  However, there was one dozen that was really bad in particular, too much low tide maybe.  It gave my friend the unpleasant need for a bit of upchucking.  I was happy with about 14 out of the 18 oysters, given 3 sets of different oysters to try out. 

Other than that, the $15 deal for 3 plates ($5 each) was good, appetizers that I've never seen before came out.  Some with crunchy breads and pepperoni-like meats.  I would most definitely recommend coming down here.  I enjoyed the Hefeweizen, it was locally brewed and smooth.

-mc
author: Morris C.

description:
GREAT views. Eating outside, looking at the tall city buildings behind the beautiful Yerba Buena gardens, watching tourists walk back and forth. It's all very entertaining. 
We ate on a Saturday evening, and there was plenty of outside seating.
The food and the drinks were OK, nothing mind blowing. Prices are high, but it's what you would expect for a bar with such a great view. I found the servers to be attentive, but the bar wasn't very crowded either.
author: Grace Y.

description:
I don't like the service there. The host is arrogant and rude. The waitress forgets about everything. The food is just past the minimum viable bar - we had French toast, smoked salmon Benedict and 4-egg omelet and truffle fries...nothing really exceptional and memorable. Coffee tastes almost like sewer water :-/

The outdoor seating was nice tho...right on Yerba Buena center. Nice view.
author: Penfan S.

description:
Talk about airy.  For a light lunch on a sunny day (what I like to call an "iced tea" lunch), you can't beat B's modern space with all-glass walls overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens.  (How this aesthetic fares in the chill and fog, I'm not so sure).

But the 5-star ambiance is offset by rather forgettable 3-star food.  We assembled several daintily-sized dishes into a rather pricey lunch: duck confit, crab cakes, prawns with gazpacho sauce, veggie soup, and chocolate bread pudding.  But of these, only the dessert really stood out.  Heck, even the mango iced tea was lacking in flavor, and that's what's supposed to hold the lunch together.  Oh, and what's with the only *one* crab cake?  Given its size, I think two is only fair.  

Still, if the price-to-quality ratio doesn't bother you, it's a pretty unique setting (or semi-unique, that is; Samovar offers something of a twin vibe next door, and *their* food/beverages I'll vouch for).
author: Wes M.

description:
I came here with my husband for happy hour and $1 oysters. Overall, the happy hour food is pretty good.  We ordered a few dozens of oysters, sangria, beer, truffle garlic fries, and a few other happy hour items.  

The service is great too, friendly waiter/waitress; however, I did not give it a higher rating because the restaurant looks dirty.  The tile slap floor looks like its never been mopped, the chairs look beat up, and the cushion are stained.  These could be improved easily.
author: Lily L.

description: So disappointed because the location is very nice and the restaurant is good looking too but the food.....oh my....just terribly bland.  I had to literally (and I am NOT using this word to express figuratively) add a tablespoon of salt and it was still bland.
author: Lev E.

description:
I've been to B a few times and usually have a good time. However, after an experience this weekend, I am inclined to boycott this place. 

A group of men came onto the patio and motioned to the bartender that they were going to sit outside. The group sat down and the waitress came over and was very snippy to the group, lecturing them about sitting down without waiting for a table. Another group approached, asked her about a table and she went to the group of men and asked them to leave, stating that she needed the table for her other guests -- even though there were plenty of other tables. As the men left, I overheard the waitress refer to the men in a derogatory  and homophobic manner. There is no excuse for this type of attitude, I encourage all to think twice before going to B.
author: Joy E.

description:
Cool place for happy hour with $1 oysters, good fries and a great view. It gets pretty loud in here but you want a lively place for happy hour right? 

Service is good, and the beer is cheap. I'd like to try out more of the menu.
author: Derrick V.

description: I have been here on a few occasions, and enjoy my time here. This is a great place to go to on a sunny afternoon in the city for happy hour. I enjoy sitting outside when the weather is nice and catching up with friends. Check out oysters, truffle fries and sangria.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Riddle me this:  What do you do as a restaurant owner if a table for two asks for a split bill, your waiter brings out two receipts, but accidentally charges both transactions to one customer's card?

If you're the co-owner of B Restaurant & Bar, you beleaguer that customer until he ALMOST lets you off the hook.  Yes, dear reader, your eyes are not deceiving you.  Customer service has apparently become a battle of attrition.  So, I say why not fight back the best way a Yelper knows how and give you the highlights of what went down--

* When I showed up to handle the situation last night, B was in the process of shutting down an hour early.  Instead of offering sympathy and a quick resolution to the problem, the owner kept trying to continue his cell phone conversation and finally stopped to complain to me about how he doesn't get a lot of personal time.
Adam's Anger Level:  5

*  Once I got him to look at the receipts and verify the problem, I got a line of questioning that went a little something like this:  "Well, didn't you have a good time with your date?", "Is she someone you can approach about the money?", and "I'm just a regular guy, what do you expect me to do about it?"  Um, I expect a refund!  You fucked up, not me!  Alas, at that time I caved, because I felt bad about this guy losing $50 given their lack of business.  
Adam's Anger Level:  8

*  After I wrote a scathing review last night, I've gotten a series of SEEMINGLY professional replies today that are rigged with all sorts of guilt traps, including but not limited to:  telling me that I was hard to read and he didn't know I was that upset, suggesting that I didn't communicate what I wanted, discussing how a refund will have to come out of the waiter's pay, telling me that processing a refund through the credit card clearinghouse will be a 45 minute hassle for him, and--I shit you not--to keep in mind that the owner's MOTHER reads Yelp.  
Adam's Anger Level:  10,000

I hope this restaurant fails.  In fact, I hope it fails worse than a Tommy Chong drug test.  And given that they find themselves closing early for lack of customers and have a crappy location, I'm guessing it will happen sooner rather than later.

I mean, seriously, how many more chances does an owner need to make things right?  I feel totally played.  So, I'm going to keep this review updated with the number of days it takes for me to actually get my refund.  (Took 8 days, but I finally got it.)
author: Adam W.

description:
Beautiful views ... cough cough ... classy decor ... cough hack cough ... nice selection of wines by the glass ... hack hack (where's that cough drop I threw in my purse?) ... fresh and tasty menu ... wheeze ... thoughtfully prepared glass of hot lemon water and honey ... ahhhhhhhh.

After a bed-ridden week with the flu that turned into bronchitis which brought another week of anti-biotics, I still had a nasty cough - the kind that tickles persistently at the back of your throat.  And instead of kicking me out for disturbing the quite perfect peaceful ambiance with my hacking, the nice guy that's always working there fixed me up his lemon and honey elixir - out of sheer sympathy.  I looked at him abashedly apologizing for my coughing and without any reprimand, all he said was "Colds suck.  Drink this - it's got lemon and orange and a little bit of honey - it's hot though - careful!"  How sweet is that?  Just the right sweetness, that's how.  

B's got this perfect mix of nice ambiance, interesting food, great bar, and down-to-earth, non-uppity, no frills niceness.  Thank goodness it's only a block and a half away from work.  Can we say "summer happy hours!"

And their Ludovicus (not Leviticus) by the glass is absolutely delightful (I had that my first time there, no alcohol for me this time with the anti-b's).
author: Audrey T.

description:
Great food and service. Just make sure you say hi to Mickey, Minnie, and Speedy Gonzalez when you sit outside.

I do plan to go back, but I will make sure I sit inside.
author: Jorge S.

description:
I am a romantic. Smile at me [not in a skeevy/creepy way, of course!]. Treat me well. It's that easy [I'm not easy!]. I fall in love so easily with people, places, and ideas. I did so again, staring at the bottom of the Love On. It was truly beautiful. [http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3028/2651218452_829ef290f4_m.jpg]

It was a wonderful Tuesday afternoon, much warmer than the usual San Francisco summer day. I had the day off from work, and I was in a skirt, a rare occasion. I wandered over to B, atop the Moscone Center in the Yerba Buena Gardens. Great company, drinks, and conversation. A charming bartender named Paul. A personable owner named Don. We had oysters, a tasty shrimp cocktail [YUM!], and sandwiches. Did you know that they run Boxed Foods Company [http://www.yelp.com/biz/boxed-foods-company-san-francisco] as well?

I'll gladly return to sit at the bar on another Tuesday afternoon. I've challenged Don to create a black/white cocktail and then name it "The Panda," but I doubt that he actually remembers that. Their drinks are delicious. I imagine that dinner here in the evening when not too crowded can be very romantic indeed.

If you intend to stay for several hours, parking by Club One [a block away] is $10.
author: Tinna H.

description:
I came here for happy hour a week ago with two friends.  It was absolutely gorgeous out and we wanted to sit outside but there weren't any tables.  Then we went to order food and drink but apparently their power was out so we could only get select food.  It was disappointing but the cheese and meat platters, as well as the oysters (the only options available) were pretty delicious.  We got a carafe of sangria, which was perfectly strong and fruity.  By the time we finished the carafe, the power was back on and we got beers as well as truffle fries.  The truffle fries were absolutely amazing, I highly recommend.
I don't remember exactly what the price came out to but it was a great deal for how much food and drink we had.  I will definitely be coming back here again- great food and drink, and even with the power out and having to sit inside, the experience was more than enjoyable.
author: Samantha B.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Yerba Beuna and I kinda like the fact that most people forget this place exists above the Metreon. On a pretty day, it's awesome. Sit outside, enjoy the weather, grab a cocktail, eat some good food.
The service was great, the food was tasty and the cocktails were strong (though I couldn't tell until I stood up). Best time to come... happy hour. $5 drinks and $1 oysters. That's all I need to hear.
author: shadi m.

description: Meh. Went here for Happy Hour on a random Thursday. I heard great things about this place (think they were on Check Please) and was expecting a bang up job. Instead the somewhat rude staff, combined with the overpriced, cold food and medicore sangria (with no fruit in it) left a bad taste.  I won't be returning.
author: Allison M.

description:
I went here a couple of months ago with a friend, and I was really presently surprised.  As it it located in Yerba Buena Center, I expected it to be a tourist trap with poor quality food, and I picked it mostly because it was a short walk away and was open for a late brunch, unlike most restaurants in this area.

It's safe to say that my expectations were greatly surpassed by the wonderful meal and good service I enjoyed at B.  My friend and I shared a tasty charcuterie and cheese board.  Initially, we had ordered both, but our server very helpfully suggested that each board was quite large and that we could do half and half.  I'm not used to SF restaurants downselling, but was glad we took her advice, as it would have been far too much food for an appetizer.  I had the prosciutto & avocado eggs benedict, which was absolutely perfect.  My friend's dish was also very good - I believe she had the summer squash eggs benedict.  I disagree with the reviews that say the portions are small.  I consider myself... a big eater, and I was not able to finish my serving.  My friend and I also each had a couple of their specialty cocktails which were delicious and potent -- I'd felt the $9 price tags were too high until my first drink came and I realized how boozy it was.

I felt service was well paced, even though we'd arrived near the tale end of their weekend business hours, we were not rushed at all, and our server waited until we'd put a good dent in our appetizer before bringing our entrees.  We ate outdoors, as it was a rare warm November afternoon, but the indoor seating looked pleasant as well.  We laughed a bit over the strange music selection... they were playing dance/pop type songs from the late 80's and early 90's.  After a couple of cocktails, I rather wanted to get up and dance around the patio, but... somehow I restrained myself. ;)

Prices for brunch were a bit steep:  an appetizer, entree and two drinks ran each of us $35-40 not including tip.  But the food was delicious and I'll definitely be back when the weather is nice enough to eat outdoors again.
author: Heidi M.

description:
Tofu Bucco. I don't know what it is, exactly, but it's on the menu at B, and it's really good. 

It was so good, as was this totally-vegan eggplant spread appetizer thing we ordered, that I'm giving them four stars. Anyway... Even though... In spite of the fact....

THAT! I could not find this place for the life of me. I thought I was going to wander around until I died of starvation. WHICH! Would take a while. Because I've got some meat on my bones. (Yup - for all you weirdo girls out there who think becoming veggie or vegan will make you skinny - THINK AGAIN.)

They really shouldn't list their address as "Howard Street." They need to be a little more up front about the fact that they're definitely NOT "on Howard." They're inside Yerba Buena, upstairs, facing away from the street. Like, they need flashing bold red 14-point arial font on their yelp page: WARNING! IT'S REALLY HARD TO FIND OUR RESTAURANT! ONLY IQS OF 125 AND ABOVE SHOULD ATTEMPT! 

There's no way you would ever know they existed, merely from walking down Howard. Or from asking anyone in the neighborhood, for that matter. But I do realize that I get dumber the hungrier I get. So I'm going to try to keep the fact that I got THAT lost in perspective.

Back to the tofu bucco. REALLY good. And the eggplant thing: AWESOME. And the view: lovely. Sparkly. You're basically in a glass box in the middle of Yerba Buena. 

I'll definitely be back, now that I know the way.
author: Lisa T.

description:
These warm SF days are rare, so we make sure our lunch hours are spent outside the office. We're quite lucky to be next to Yerba Buena Gardens, so today, we walked through the park, where there was live jazz playing, and had lunch at B.

It was too hot to sit outside in the sun, and with all the convention traffic, our only option was to sit at the bar. Nicole and I split the "boxed" chicken salad sandwich and a side of the truffle fries. It was the perfect amount for the both of us, and I really enjoyed the pesto and apple slices in the sandwich. Had it not been a work day, we probably could have spent hours here having oysters, pork chops and cocktails. 

The location is what really makes B special, and on days like this, it makes me feel very lucky to be just steps away.
author: Connie C.

description:
Rooftop Happy Hour overlooking gardens = top notch. 
The menu is artistic and the price, fair. I was happy with the creativeness and portions on the menu, although I just had apps, I am very open to trying a larger meal. Our service was fast, a waiter was always passing by which made them easy to find

and of course $1 oysters are not to be passed up
author: Christina C.

description:
I've been in a review drought.  I haven't been anywhere new in a while, and in fact I just really haven't been anywhere.  Eating my lunches at the desk, no time to Yelp, and spending evenings at home with roommates and friends, so who better to get me out of this slump than the one person who had her own personal self-inflicted slump when she waited for me to get ROTD before she wrote again.  That's right, I got the privilege of lunching with Drue.  I ain't one to name drop in reviews either, so you know it must have been good.

With Drue being new to the FiDi/Soma area, I had her choose somewhere by her office...somewhere neither of us had been to before.  She suggested B.  I had been here once, after the Elite event ages ago, but that was just drinks and a few appetizers.  This was lunch.  A meal worth writing about.  A place worthy of 4 stars for now....however, I think it is 5 star potential.

With a server who was super accommodating, a beautiful view, and a great dining companion I knew I was in for a treat.  We split the soup of the day.  It was this delicious cauliflower soup, with pieces of cauliflower in it, topped with truffle oil.  The server made sure it came out split, and it was just as lovely as he had described it.  I opted to order a butter leaf lettuce salad, topped with blue cheese, bacon, tomatoes and onions.  It was a little heavy on the dressing, but it wasn't anything I couldn't let drip off the leaves.  Drue had a burger, and she seemed pleased.  Our water glasses were never left unfilled.

Their cocktails from what I remember were worth talking about as well...but alas, no drinky on lunch break....

It's a little on the pricier side for a lunch in Soma for a girl on a budget, I'm not used to spending $15 for lunch....but I would treat myself to lunch at B again....if the right opportunity came up.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Oh James C, why ya gotta hate on this place?

I loved it! And while I didn't eat here, I did drink several of their tasty libations and ya know what, they rock! This location is sooo choice. I mean it is open and airy, you have a lovely breeze that whips through the corridors as you sit outside and sip drinks and hang with a totally eclectic group on after work folks and it's just chill and exactly what you need after a day of work.

It's the kind of place nice weather happy hours are made for and we definitely enjoyed ourselves. The one person I feel sorry for here though is the bartender. The way the joint is set up, they are baking in the afternoon sun as they serve up drinks. That isn't cool, in fact, I would last all of 2 minutes behind that bar with those trench like conditions.

As for the happy hour they have a handful of drink specials and one is this Love martini thingamajig and it comes with a red heart that floats on top of the drink. Hey, I was impressed, heh. So if you work in the Financial District and it's a nice day and you wanna sit outside, have a drink and freeload off of the park's free wireless, then go for it. :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
When my friend Josh and I walked into B on Thursday evening for happy hour we were confused.  Where was everyone?  

We took a seat in the corner and settled in to enjoy the low lit ambience and warm surroundings.  With a view of Yerba Buena gardens through the torrential rain, we were content.

The servers, who looked like they had just stepped out of a hair salon, cranked up the new wave and proceeded to take care of us like we were their only customers.  Oh yeah, we were.

We took full advantage of the $5 cocktail and $7 appetizer menu.  The "Love" drink, a rasberry puree vodka concoction, was to die for, and I lost count after a while.  The tuna tartare on the other hand was memorably mediocre.

The verdict on B?

View -- Breathtaking.
Drinks -- Beyond words.
Music -- Brilliantly curated.
Food -- Bleh.
author: Nicole G.

description: Really nice place for brunch.  Great oysters!  I had the roasted squash salad and the smoked salmon benedict, you have to try both!  The best smoked salmon I have had.  Great drinks menu, and a wonderful view especially on a warm day.
author: Rebecca W.

description: The food here was alright...the menu was pretty interesting. I had the french toast and salmon benedict for brunch.  I liked it how all the food came out at the same time as the other people in our party, but it was cold and it seemed like it was just sitting other a warmer for a little while... I would like to see my food come out fresh and warm not dry and soggy. I wouldn't come here again...but maybe for the bottomless mimosas and bloody mary's.
author: Karissa B.

description:
B has a great location, and at the same time, a tragic location.  I work a block away and had no idea that it was here, but once I arrived (for a Yelp sponsored event, I must confide), I found a gorgeous little spot with a fantastic patio, friendly staff, and free beer.  Wait, maybe the free beer was just for the event.  I can't imagine the place would be so empty if they always had free beer.  

Colleagues who felt the urge to pay for drinks said the cocktails were tasty, and the little bits and bites that they laid out for us were delectable.  The bar staff were a jovial bunch and I never waited more than thirty seconds for a drink.  They even offered up a cardboard box when the drunken break-dancing started. 

The blessing/curse is that B is set far back from the hustle and bustle of the Yerba Buena, so it is secluded and peaceful, but at the same time, it feels as though it is set so far back that nobody will find it.  For those of you now in the know, I recommend this peaceful spot in the heart of the city.
author: Quinn S.

description:
After a company happy hour here, I've decided that B Restaurant & Bar is going to be my "Go-To" cocktail drinking after work spot. Finally, a place close to the office where I can sit outside on a sunny San Francisco evening and enjoy a cocktail .

While I must try the rest of the cocktail menu like that whiskey drink with the muddled mangoes in it, the star drink has got to be the Don Riley: Citrus Vodka, Mint & Rooibos Liqueur... Mohitos have nothing on that drink!

What would I improve: Being all glass, the inside of that placed is hot as heck. Dang, open a door!

And BTW: What the heck is up with using a carafe as the drinking container for the sangria.  Even if the goal of your cocktail drinking may be to get toasted, no one wants to look like a wino doing it!
author: Natasha R.

description:
Always have a great experience here. 

Inventive food menu and creative drinks - I love their bloody mary. 

it's the perfect spot to get a bite to eat and a drink on a gorgeous, sunny San Francisco day. The waitstaff is always friendly and helpful.
author: Melissa J.

description:
hh review only 
came here on a wednesday night and we were able to fit a huge party when they moved some tables together. hh was until 7, which is great, plus they have a food menu in addition to drinks! the truffle fries were greatttt!! my friends also ordered the raw and cooked oysters and said the raw ones were  yummier but i think that just depends on what you like. they also have daily drinnk specials!
on a nice day/night they also have a beautiful patio/outdoor seating area!
author: Jen S.

description:
I've been here twice and both times, I had a great time!

VISIT #1
One of my coworkers was leaving the company so there was a goodbye lunch for him here.  We close to here so we just walk, and when we went it was still nice (September...or, SF Indian Summer haha) so we got to eat outside.  The wait staff was very nice and friendly and vibed well with the entire group.  We ordered the appetizer deals so we got to sample a lot of the appetizers - it was over once I tasted the truffle fries, i tell ya!  For lunch I had a chicken pesto sammich with a salad to accompany it - very tasty and filling.

VISIT #2
It was this past week actually, my boss was leaving the company so there was a happy hour planned here.  Coincidentally it was ALSO the same night as the Yelp Elite Newbie event so imagine my surprise to walk up and see Jessica T greet us!  I was with Jimmy H (he and I are 2nd year elites) so we of course were not invited to the event but it was nice getting to mingle with Yelp Elite newbies and for me to finally meet Jessica and Ruggy in person - perfect event to meet them as it was very small and intimate for the Yelp Elite newbies.

Ok so back to the menu - the drinks are heavenly.  I tried some ginger thing but opted for the old standby - red red wiiiiine.  The guy behind the bar was one of the waiters who served my group the first time I came here and he actually recognized me - major major points and kudos to him for picking me out of a crowded bar.  Throughout the course of the evening we ordered lots of drinks, lots of the 3 for $15 apptizers (again with the truffle fries - YUM YUM - and my new favorite, Buffalo Mozarella), and grooved to great music while mingling with coworkers and the occasional Yelper.

I am so glad that I work within walking distance of this place because I see myself stopping by here many many more times.
author: Sonya T.

description: Went back last night after an amazing time at the Etsy craft lab nearby. So in between this review and my last I went back to B and they disappointed me that day. Their chips were soggy, no more halibut so they had to replace it with shrimp in the ceviche, the duck confit had too much sauce on it, it was a drenched mess! VERY OFF day! I went back today hoping for my 1st experience and I got it. Tasted the mushroom soup, happy I didn't order it, bland! The Lemon Ricotta ravioli was very good, ceviche was good and fries always good. Oh yeah one more thing, shout out to Grant the Wannabe Comedian with Threes Company Glasses, YEAH! He rocks! haha. We were talking about Yelp, that's right! He was wondering what I was going to write heehee.
author: Karen T.

description:
The rumors are true... we go to B for the outstanding scenery and to add a little green in the mix of our daily concrete jungle. 

We don't go for the service. It took forever to seat two of us when many a table were open. Also, in the time it took to get us water I could have filled up at our glasses myself with the pitcher which was viable but just out of reach. The posse of guys hosting, bar tending and serving weren't rude but they seemed frazzled and not in any hurry at the same time. This is hard to accomplish, but they did it well.

The food was just okay as well. The $12 cheese plate was good, but set before us without as much as the name of each cheese. We were forced to guess. The $1 Special Oysters were good and the homemade chips delicious. The ceviche was not so good.

I'd go back to enjoy the atmosphere, but maybe would do appetizers and drinks only, and not a whole meal.
author: Natalie N.

description:
"Love On" cocktail?....eh, the gimmick was worth the happy hour price, but the taste was mellower than I expected.

The truffle fries?...Hellz yeah!  Had two orders of the those lick-the-extra-aioli-off-your-lip sticks o' goodness.

Fresh oysters - three types - for a dollar a piece?...Shiiiiiiit.  A dozen and a half to share and now in the mood for lovin'!
author: Tamar D.

description:
I went to B Restaurant a few weeks ago prior to a performance at Yerba Buena. Why did it take me so long to review it? My meal was so uninspiring that I just haven't felt the urge to write.

What I remember:  
- Hot, crispy fries sitting next to overcooked slices of meat.  
- A cool space that must be a fantastic spot to grab a drink on a warm   evening (ha, like we have any of those in SF!)
- A waiter that must have majored in Upsell 101

I would pop in to B for a cocktail and perhaps an order of fries but doubt I'd return for a full on meal.
author: phil h.

description:
Because Preeti S knows how to treat a lady, I was taken here in honor of my 500th review.  Funny how no one in the Yelp home office has offered to do the same, ahem. 

And what a treat this place was because it was one part dinner, one part dinner theater and one part adventure. Had I not seen Preet standing on the corner, I would have never found this place nestled like a rare jewel in the inner and upper working of Yerba Buena.  So we made our way around the ridiculous blocks of Soma, one way here, nope the other way there, taking 20 minutes to wind up in the same very spot we were before at a time when there were few other cars around.  I recommend Muni.  

That said we hiked through Yerba Buena to it, and  when found (hint, its past the fountain, around the corner from the MLK tribute, up the stairs, down the corridor, and to the right, whew!) it looks like a jewel box on the outside.  On the inside it has a long, long bar that was empty but looks like it should hold down quite a happy hour and a small dining area that has maybe 20 tables.

With this setting you might think the service would be fast with two waiters on board and only two other tables occupied. However, you would think wrong.  We were seated promptly by our homolicious waiter whose hands talk twice as fast as he does and though he has comments on all the food looks like he burns it off in a heartbeat.  I hate bitches like that. 

We were given menus and we ordered drinks.  A half hour or so later, these drinks arrived.  I knew my drink was going to be sweet, I ordered the Love On with pureed raspberries and this was a mistake. 
The other drink was sweeter than expected and we actually sent back because we were told "it is not sweet at all" and sure enough it was like a sugar salad in a drink.  

When the drinks came we made it clear that we were in a rush and had to G-O, hello bitches we had the Yelp Elite party at Supperclub to make and fashionably late is one thing but really late limits our ability to make it home at a decent hour., I digress again...

Then they picked it up quite a notch and out came a complimentary soup in a champagne glass,  It was a soup with crab in it so my vegetarian palate wasn't having it but the truffle oil in it was robust in the air.  Our beet salad was worth the raves I had heard.  The beets were soft but firm, a real challenge for anyone whose struggled to cook beets.  

I had a Tofu Bucco, their nod to the vegetarians.  I looked at it, its lovely presention and all but I was sure I was going to be disappointed.

For Tofu eaters, often the tofu prepared at restaurants as their one attempt to satisfy you actually tastes fine on the first bite, the outer edge is good but then inside all moist and chalky.  NOT So here.  The Tofu was flavorful and crisp all the way through.  The crisp basil was an inspiration.  The chicken dish with cheese was well presented also.

The plates were nice but then Julie L showed up and pointed out you can get those plates at Ikea. Ouch B, ouch, did you hear what she just said about you?

We didn't have time for dessert but as our waiter dramatically pointed out, we were out at 9:28 when we wanted to be out at 9:30.  So maybe the service wasn't that bad after all.
author: Sean S.

description:
I've gone to B a good number of times but my experience there last night made me a big fan. It was one of the hotter evenings in SF and a group of us decided to try and have beers outdoors and decided to check out B. We ended up with a table on the patio that allowed us to take in a fantastic view of the SF skyline. The sun was setting as we sat down and it was really cool to take in the transition from evening to night and see all the buildings light up. It's easily one of the best spots to sit outside and enjoy a cocktail or beer downtown.

Their burger is pretty tasty and they had some interesting cocktails as part of their happy hour last night (it went till 7:30pm). After happy hour a group of us switched between their solid beer selection and their cocktail selection.

I've also come here for lunch and it is definitely a good spot to have a lunch meeting, although I wouldn't go on a super hot day since you'll likely end up baking (not much shade on their patio).
author: Bryan B.

description:
Gorgeous gorgeous gorgeous. I wish it had been sunny when I came here because the view would have been amazing. As it was, slightly overcast, it was still a great view. My friend Ivanne T. and I came here for happy hour and snacks before heading to a ballet performance at the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts. 

Really great atmosphere and decent food.

Alcohol: The wine list wasn't too extensive for happy hour, in fact, I don't actually recall ever looking at a list. But nonetheless, both of us were very pleased with the wines we received.

Now to the snacks:
OMG truffle fries! SO AMAZING! You are my new love! Apparently I have only had awful wannabe truffle fries before *coughfrjtzcough*, because these were amazing and like nothing I've ever experienced. So delicious! We also had the salmon rilette which I have to say was quite delicious, despite the initial disappointment we both experienced when it arrived and consisted of only 3 pieces.
