Portions are TINY. Ivanne kept saying we needed real people sized portions haha. Anyway, the salmon rilette, quite tasty. Radishes and salmon, what an excellent combination! We also ordered the crab cake, iron skillet meatballs, and another order of truffle fries because we like to eat. Don't judge. Like Ivanne said, we need real people portions!
The crab cake I thought was overrated - it had been recommended to us by the server. It was good, but not amazing. The capers were a wonderful flavor to pair with the crab cake but I didn't think it was as amazing as the server made it to sound. The iron skillet meatballs were good and came in a tasty creamy tomato sauce, but again, nothing spectacular. 

Highlight: TRUFFLE FRIES. And the salmon rilette. Order them!
author: Claire L.

description:
Had lunch outside the other day, it was one of those surprisingly warm winter days in SF (you know, when it was in the high 60's?) that you just HAD to be outdoors.

I had a very pleasant experience here, from the easy/comfortable service, delicious cocktails (they have caipirinhas! Although they're made with vodka... it was still very good and my waiter was genuinely interested in my candid feedback and suggested other cocktails he thought better represented the talents of their bartenders), and tasty salads and sandwiches.

My only recommendation if you want to eat lunch outside here, definitely bring your sunglasses or else you'll be squinting the whole time... will be back again for sure, and looking forward to checking out their HH!
author: Nenette Y.

description:
What an absolutely delightful spot to enjoy a professional lunch indoor or outdoor on a bright sunny day in San Francisco's Yerba Buena.

I've eaten here twice, and the atmosphere is casual, elegant, and chill all at once.  The food is straight-forward and good and the service is attentive but not cloying.

If you are looking for a spot that feels above the fray (literally and figuratively) for a lunch and a conversation, B is a place to go.

The portions are modest, so if you're hungry, get the burger.
author: Brad P.

description:
People on Yelp are truly moronic. Giving a place a 1 star review, and then going on to say "but it's great..." Reviews should reflect an expreience (or several of them) in its entirety. So you thought the place was beautiful and the drinks were good, but the food was sub-par? How about 3 stars, you idiot? 

Anyway. B is a great spot for Happy Hour--Fun drinks, good little menu including $1 oysters and the staff is friendly, if TOTALLY slammed because..wait for it... IT"S AN AWESOME HAPPY HOUR, AND THEREFORE, BUSY!  Now that we have that covered, I hope you'll try B for yourself and see what I mean.
author: Eryn S.

description:
1st time here

Hard to find. - Going with traffic on third, left at Howard (right handside) after the first building go up the stairs.
Out door seating available - It was cold that night so everyone was inside
Only two bartenders - can be difficult to get a drink (5-10 wait)
Decent happy hour - Select food and drink (if you order food at the bar you have to wait for it)
$1 Oysters - not to bad, but needed more than 6
Tight space inside - packed on a Friday
Cool space - you are surrounded by glass on 4 sides (ceiling & 3 walls)
Friendly - Bartenders that is
Drinks - Good
Bathroom - Don't you measure a place by their bathroom?  Clean

I would come here again.
author: Po L.

description:
I had to work on the Fourth of July this year, so I took the day off on the Friday following.  Reveling in my lady of leisure status for the day, I made my way to B for a mid-day cocktail (and some food, but fancy drink was decidedly more important).   

It felt like destiny when I plopped myself down at the bar and saw the hot dog on the menu.  That along with two other American classics -- a martini and a friendly bartender  -- made for a sixth of July that could rival any fourth.
author: L W.

description:
-The only thing special about this place is the view.

We get there and the first thing you notice is that the view is AMAZING.  Other than that, that's about where our awe ended.  There was no one around to seat us after we stood around for quite a while, so we sat at an outdoor table.  It took about 10 minutes for someone (we found out later it was the manager) to get to us.  We ordered wine, clams, and salads, those were good.  After that, things went downhill.  The chicken was dry and the food was just "eh."  Our neighbor at the next table over agreed.  They are disorganized!  Throughout our meal several waiters, bus boys, the manager came to ask us for our order after the previous waiter, bus boy, manager, etc. had just done so.  They were thorough, but this happened at least 5 times and after a while it got annoying.  The worst part was that the manager came to us and asked how we heard about the restaurant and if it was from Living Social.  We replied, "yes," to which the manager replied, "I could tell.  You guys seem to fit that bill perfectly" in a rather snooty manner.  What the heck was that about?  We were dressed fine, hadn't complained about anything, and we were nothing but friendly with the staff despite all the problems.  He made us feel like people of Living Social were akin to People of Walmart!  Later, we asked if we could use more than one Living Social coupon to pay for our $112 bill, to which the manager promptly, and rudely, denied us.  Bummer.  I understand rules are rules, but our coupons are going to expire soon.  His only solution was to come back some other time and use the other coupons later for face value.  That's really too bad, now I have to go back two more times.  Other than being forced to, the only thing that would bring me back to that place is the amazing view.
author: Sara M.

description:
"You'll see it, just keep looking up!  Keep looking up!"

So this is how I found my friend who was waiting for me at B Bar.  He gave me the best possible directions from his cell, and there it was, twinkling and beckoning to me from above like a sky oasis.

We had a perfectly lovely evening enjoying some drinks and delicious food in a very cool, open, modern, laid-back environment.  We sat at the bar and the bartender could not have been nicer - recommending wine, talking about his favorite dishes, telling us about the place, etc.  

The food was really stood out.  We ordered 3 dishes to share and dessert, and we were very full after wards.  The bread with the olive oil for dipping is a great starter, and the olive oil has a rich, smoky flavor (dunk deep).  We shared a catfish dish that came in an iron skillet, with some kind of mashed potato that was SCRUMPTIOUS (we would not let the plate be removed until we scraped it clean), a baked winter vegetable dish, and a third plate that I cannot remember at this moment.  I do remember loving everything.  Did I mention the delicious wine? ;)

And for dessert - we ordered the nilla wafer bread pudding which had a root beer sauce - the sauce came in a little mug (a la A & W) and the sauce was drizzled on the dessert from this cute container - it was great.  The nilla wafers were well-disguised - you just have to believe that they're there somewhere.

It was the perfect environment to have a good talk and a few laughs.  After wards, we went out and looked over the Yerba Buena gardens, which were so pretty on a clear December night.  I hear the place gets crowded, but when we were there, there was only one other party in the place which was perfect.  I'd definitely go back again on such a night.  So grab a friend or a date and check it out - and remember, keep looking up!
author: Liz S.

description: Wanted to try this place for a while.  Finally did a couple of weeks ago.  Well, I'm really not impressed.  The only good thing was the interiors and location.  The wine was so-so, the truffle fries had no truffle oil on them whatsoever but worse of all, the service was unfriendly, inexperienced and a bit rude.  The fact that I was sitting at the bar and the door kept opening and being left open in the chilly SF weather didn't help the experience either.  I shall not return I'm afraid.
author: Manuela P.

description:
People who are eating lunch outside here: wear sunscreen!  Seriously people.  and by people, i really mean me.  

I had a great lunch here last thursday.  Their heirloom tomato salad special was quite yummy.  I recall whatever chicken sandwich I got as being quite enjoyable too -- and on really good bread.  And they managed not to over sweeten their fresh lemonade -- which is impressive coming from me.  My sugar tolerance has gone way down since I've more or less given up all sugar other than dark chocolate.

But yes. to my earlier point.  Wear sunscreen.  I've just gotten to the peeling phase (about a week later).  San Francisco sun was so bad that day that even my scalp got burnt where my hair was parted.  Its the first time ever that that's happened.  

4 stars because 5 is reserved for my most favorite places...  this is good, but not yet up there.  repeat visits may change things one way or another.
author: Hilary K.

description:
$1 oyster happy hour is awesome (I think it is mon-Fri through 7pm)!  It is such a good deal.  I also recommend the truffle oil flavored french fries.  

Our waitress was also super friendly.  This is a great pick if you are in the Yerba Buena gardens area.  One thing... they do have special events sometimes, so be sure to call before heading out there.
author: Francis W.

description:
The location is unfortunate for such a great place.  Its not that easy to find and is out of the way for many after-work happy hour seekers. Luckily, we are an industrious bunch in search of organic drinks and snacks, so we climbed the stairs in YB Gardens to this little oasis.

B has $5 organic cocktails from 4-7pm, what a deal!  They serve Belgian ales and delicious, albeit tiny, $5 snacks.  We went on a Friday after work and it was medium-busy, but it could be much busier, I am out to spread the word- go to B for affordable organic drinks!  
The atmosphere is lovely as well and the bartenders were great- my friend, who will remain nameless, knocked his beer over and they handed him another one, free of charge. Thats the kind of good people they are over at B, so check them out.
author: Jessica P.

description:
A friend invited me to have lunch here and I was very impressed. Beautiful, simple and stylish decor inside...candles on the walls, which is always a plus especially when you bring a date :-) I ordered a Greek salad, which was excellent in my opinion. It was fresh, spiced well, but the only thing that I would change is to include olives (important) and quality tomatoes --- mine were bland like the ones they usually sell at Safeway. Since it may not be the season yet for the yummy tomatoes, I would substitute with the cherry tomatoes that at least have flavor and some taste, otherwise a perfect portioned salad. 

Second time I took my friend there but for dinner now. At night the location looks even more amazing with all the lighting outside...quite romantic and secretly hidden (wonderful place to make out after dinner) :-))))) So, back to the food...we had mushroom soup, which was absolutely delicious and it gets 5-stars from me. Also, we ordered Sashimi Scallop --- did not impress me at all, overcooked and I could feel the oil it was fried in; then we had some Seared Ahi Tuna --- it was just alright, I had much better ahi tuna before. So, my overall impression is that lunch it the way to go with them. 

The dinner menu seems a bit limited; I would love to see more choices of both meat and poultry dishes to make it a little more exciting.
author: Katja S.

description:
Rather than throw stones at glass houses, why not drink in them?

Beautiful location -- glimpse out at the sward of greenery garnishing the lower half of the cityscape.  The bar is made from recycled wood and the chairs are made from old wine barrels.  

B Restaurant nestles like a secret about to be discovered.  The food is delicious.  The drinks are strong.  The beer and wine selection solid.
author: Abendigo R.

description:
B Bar is the type of place I imagined my Adult self hanging out at when I was little: a chic cocktail joint in the middle of a big city.  It's actually the type of place that would be featured in a Kate Hudson or Meg Ryan movie -- Kate and the gals enjoying happy hour overlooking the park!  It would work too because movie viewers wouldn't have to eat B Bar's food.

I unfortunately did eat B Bar's food, which left much to be desired.  My $11 "Bufalo" mozzarella was a tiny, over-seasoned pile of mush that tasted like 7-11 brand mozz.  My companion's MR burger was extremely overcooked.  The truffle fries were, though, very good.  Stick to drinks and fries and people watching if you want the movie version.
author: Abby M.

description:
Great place to hang out with friends on a sunny, warm afternoon for HH.  $1 oysters.  Delicious sangria.  Low key music.   The food is mediocre, but the view of the Yerba Buena garden against the backdrop of SF skyscrapers makes up for it. 

It's a day like this that reminds me why I came to San Francisco on a vacation and just never left...
author: Shirley F.

description:
I do not get the hype about B Restaurant.  Went for happy hour last night, and the crowd seemed blah, the food was blah, and the sangria that is supposedly what they're known for was blah.  So I ordered up a martini.  Points for the martini, which was pretty strong and did the trick, but I wouldn't eat the food off the happy hour menu.

We ordered the honey-glazed chicken wings, the shrimp, the truffle fries, and the crab cake.  All were lacking in flavor and size.  In fact, I nearly whipped out my magnifying glass while trying to search for the lone, miniscule crab cake that was supposedly sitting on the plate in front of me...and that alone was $7.  Oh, and don't EVER order the "crème brûlée."  The item that came out claiming to be crème brûlée was too thick and goopy in consistency, and much to citrus-y.

Definitely not worth it coming here for happy hour; can't speak for any other time of day.  But if the happy hour menu speaks at all for the restaurant, be warned!
author: Kira K.

description:
Came here for happy hour with some friends to try out the dollar oysters.  First of all, this is a great location.  The all glass restaurant over looks the Yerba Buena garden and its great view while you eat.  We each had a half dozen oysters and a carafe of sangria.  The oysters were really small, but were fresh and tasted great.  The sangria not too sweet, had good flavor and was a great deal at $10/carafe.  We didn't try anything else on the menu because this was just our first stop of the night.  

The service was great, the bartender was very attentive and always available if we needed anything even with a packed bar.  

Overall, B Restaurant is a great spot for happy hour with cheap oysters and sangria.  The view makes the experience at B restaurant even better.
author: steve w.

description:
Wandered in here one Friday after work.  The place was busting out the seems with Bridge'n'Tunnel folk.  The staff gave me 'tude from the time I walked in.  After 15 minutes, I could not get the bar tender to make eye contact to save my life.  So I left and enjoyed some place pricier and quieter.

Too bad.  I'd heard great things and they'd been on my list to try.
author: Amy A.

description:
It's no secret that me likey (no, LOVEY) happy hour so I tend to rate happy hour places as seen through my cocktail goggles which means 1 extra star just for the buzz factor.

I didn't need to give B any gratuitous happy hour bump up because it earned all 4 stars on its own.  Great location - the space has a nice feel and offers a great view of the city skyline.  The happy hour specials are quite generous and offered from 4:30 to 7:30.  $5 selected cocktails (with fresh squeezed juice) and draft beer and a selection of $7 appetizers - NICE!

Great place for cocktails and conversations after a long day's work.  Also a place to consider for a drink and a bite before or after a movie at the Metreon.
author: mia s.

description:
Date night!!

I had been to B before and had not been overwhelmed with amazement.  However, having come here for a critical date numero dos, I can now enumerate the following plusses:

*Plus #1 - fantastic music - my date is a part-time DJ and he was truly tripping (only phrase) on the mix the manager had put together after hours.

*Plus #2 - servers who enjoy their job, and their clientele - we were there late and the service was not only good, it was friendly and personal.  I geeked out with our main server who also liked wine, while my companion had a great moment with another server about the music.

*Plus #3 - great space - all that glass, wow!  This is a wonderful place for a date that may, or may not, pan out.  There's so much to see, comment upon and distract.

Three plusses = three stars.

On that note...fingers are crossed for critical date #3.  Now, where to go, where to go?
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Seated outside in the slight sunny breezy day sipping tomato soup with crumbled canadian bacon, parsley a dolp of creme. I asked for a shirley temple and it was bright red on the rocks. I asked for a burger med rare- tillamock sharp cheddar cheese , tamarind scented pickles and canadian bacon with a small green salad- It was very, very close to the best burger I've had in my life. I ordered fries and thank goodness our lovely waitress ( very cute btw) did not bring them because i was full. I paid the bill and the cutie pie waitress asked if I wanted dessert. I smiled and said "yes." She told me about cheese cake and a chocolate thing and she said creme brulee and I stopped her- no need for description- just bring it to me. Creamy crunchy sweet- I'm still eatting it here at work. I was not charged for the creme brulee because they forgot the fries.
These guys are awesome! MUAH!
author: linda l.

description:
Well, I have to say that I had a great time here although I don't quite remember getting home - I guess that's why it had to be a good night.

It started off when we got there after happy hour but the great bartender there hooked us up with the happy hour specials regardless.  So my friend Kara and I enjoyed quite a few cocktails that evening and ended up having a great time of it.

From the bar you can see the tops of the Bay Bridge too so if it's a clear night out like it was then, it's a neat view.  Didn't eat anything here so we can't comment on the vittles, but the cocktails were fantastic!
author: Gene X.

description:
my updated review..

you have got to get the buffalo mozarella plate. comes with salami and the mozarella is topped off with some olive oil, rosemary and salt. divine. 

and the lemon ricotta ravioli, to die for. comes on a bed of arugula and the flavor between the tartness of the lemon juice and the creaminess of the sauce, mmmmm. also nice and salty, just the way i love it! 

lovely bar with creative drinks, friendly service, great outdoor dining overlooking yerba buena park. amazing on a clear sunny day, what more can you ask for.
author: Anh P.

description:
The B must stand for breezy because I felt just like a cover girl as the wind danced in my hair (as it does) while I sat outside last Friday enjoying lunch. The urban garden view created a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere that complimented the fresh food. I had the pear and brie pressed sandwich with a mixed green salad. Everything tasted simple but delicious. Even the Arnold Palmer was refreshingly tart and not too sweet. Unfortunately the waiter was a bit stalkerish and odd, and they were out of a couple of dishes on the menu that sounded tempting. Otherwise, B is for beautiful when it comes to a lunch spot with outdoor seating on a warm, San Franciscan day.

Go ahead and steal that Cover Girl slogan, B Restaurant, because you are indeed easy, breezy and beautiful.
author: Michie L.

description: Love their happy hour. Amazing small plates, and my favorite place for sangria! Love coming here before an event at the SF MoMA or YBCA. And ugh, their truffle fries...need I say more?
author: Bridget B.

description:
So, if I could put an office anywhere, it'd be in the exact spot where B is. Damn. How cool would it be to sit at your desk, overlooking Yerba Buena shooting the shit with one of your clients? Man, sounds cool to me. And by the looks of it, they didn't skimp on the interior decorating. 

They still have some kinks to work out, however. We dropped in for lunch and there was nobody in there. Granted, it was a little late in the afternoon, but that should have given the waitstaff plenty of time to asses the beer situation. Well, they were a little rusty in that department, but very accomodating all the same, so you can't fault them too much.

My prosciutto sandwich was pretty tasty, I have to say albeit a little salty for my tastes, but still good. Like Samovar, it won't be a regular lunch hangout for me but it seems like a hot spot to relax every other Friday afternoon or so a little too long on my lunch hour (hopefully Jeremy doesn't see this) and drink an extra beer or three...
author: Michael E.

description:
So we were headed to the Yelp Elite Event Cultural Extravaganza at the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, but damn we were early and we were hungry.  So we decided to have brunch at B and check it out incognito before all the Yelpers showed up.

They have done an amazing job wiping away all traces of Clouds, which is a good thing.  I love their new decor, very subtle and calming in a way that Clouds always tried but never achieved.

We were greeted immediately from the very attentive owner and dotting parent of a fairly new venture.  The menu was inventive and the bar selection extensive.

I had the spicy sausage frittata, which was amazing, piping hot served in a mini cast iron skillet, the hubby had Peet's pasta which was this awesome spaghetti pasta, egg battered and buttered with herbs and stuff and topped with a fried egg on top - wow!

Just when we thought we were had our Yelp status in check, in walks Nish and Jessica, blowing our cover!  You know we like to keep it real, but it was all good, we were already pretty impressed with the service.

Everything was amazing even the presentation of the hot herb tea that I had, which was a in a gauze bag tied with string.  This a great place for ladies who lunch.  Just don't come famished cause the portions are too small for these two ladies with facial hair who lunch.

Food is very deserving of 5 stars but the portions bring it to 3 stars but the warmth of the staff brings it back to 4 stars.
author: A P.

description:
I came here for happy hour last Friday. Definitely, a cool hang out place with a nice outdoor that overlook Yerba Buena. The indoor is a bar and lots of standing area. I was curious about this place because they offers $1 oyster (one of my biggest weakness) and $3 cocktails (who is going to complain about that). 
I think what I enjoy most is the music, the view and people watching. B restaurant is full of good-looking people. Maybe I was just there on a good day. This is definitely my new favorite HH spot now.
author: Ervinna L.

description:
great food, great ambiance, and great views!

i ordered the fries (secret ingredient is sea salt!), which was phenomenal. these are the best fries i have ever had!  the chicken sandwich was unique- chicken with bacon and pesto, giving it a nice crunch.

it might be a hard to find. it's inside the yerba buene complex, so be prepared to dig around unless you have someone who knows the place to guide you.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Came here for happy hour one day.  Eh.. it was all right.  The biggest problem was that they had discontinued the happy hour menu that was still posted on their website.  So I came looking forward to oysters, truffle fries, and chicken wings.  Sadly, truffle fries were no longer at happy hour prices, and they didn't have the chicken wings at all.  When we asked if we could get the truffle fries for the happy hour price, the waitress wasn't really excited to help us out.  She came back later and agreed to take $1 off for us.  What a disappointment.

The $1 oysters were still available, but what we got were not quality oysters.  They were poorly shucked with all sorts of stuff inside that didn't belong there.

To add insult to injury, when we got our truffle fries, they had placed cut up pieces of the old happy hour menu under the bowl of fries as decor.  +1 for recycling old menus, -1 for reminding me that I can't have the chicken wings I came here for.

More positives: The view is amazing.  If you sit outside the trees in Yerba Buena park frame the church across Mission St. perfectly.  It feels like you are somewhere else, and not in the middle of a bustling city.  I'd go back just for the view and the ambiance.
author: Idin K.

description:
You may want to skip my review; I am biased since my husband DJ's here every Friday happy hour (for you indie/bossanova/60s soul and ye-ye fans)....

+ FOOD: they have a delightful offering of oysters with 3 choices of sauce. happy hour features a couple food specials as well. Been there for lunch and enjoyed a lovely beet salad.

+ DRINK: happy hour gets you half off on a couple of normally pricey but yummy drinks. i would like to convince them to carry Aperol, but thats actually I try to do with most bars.

+ AMBIANCE: it may turn you off at first being so beautiful and moderne. but its actually warm and inviting once you settle at the bar with a crowd of friends and listen to the cute DJ and chat up the very nice bartenders.  Also, last week i went there after suffering through happy hour at DaDa after work. It was like a warm hug after coming in from an ice storm, to walk into B Bar.

oh, and Rob Lowe was there? Really? Is that true??
author: Olivia W.

description: We only had drinks there last night - but whoa they make a beautiful (and tasty) cocktail!  And you can get it for only $5 during happy hours!
author: Kristen S.

description:
Came here for happy hour after work.  The menu was easy to read and order.  I had the sangria which was really good and made just perfect.  For apps, we had:

truffle fries - nice and crispy; I could have eaten this all by myself
spiced nuts - served warm with a kick; 
fried oysters - served w/ a spicy sauce; this wasn't my favorite
$1 oysters

On a warm spring or summer day, this place would be great to enjoy.  The building is all glass windows to enjoy the sunshine pouring in.

I can't wait to come back to try out more of the menu and for another happy hour.
author: Jessica C.

description:
SO sad to review this place with 2 stars as I feel it has so much potential...

The location and look/feel give this place its first star.  

The fact  that there's a decently stocked bar and a few good munchies on the menu (cod served over mashed potatoes in a skillet?!  AWEsome) give it a second star.

But that's where it ends, I'm afraid.  

Our service at lunch was abysmal.  We were forgotten by our server on numerous occasions and when a replacement was nabbed, he was oblivious to the notion of "service."  When we hailed him, his response was, "Do I look like Bob?  Cause I'm not."  (We should have snapped back with, "No, you looked aimless and like you weren't doing anything, so I guess you look more like a jackass than a Bob.")

We ordered a few sandwiches and were dismayed at the bun-to-meat ratio.  A portobello mushroom sandwich with a mushroom that doesn't reach the ends of the bun?  Or a pulled pork sandwich that had two spoonfulls of pork?  Argh!  And get some decent buns or at LEAST toast them - they tasted like they were off a grocery store shelf and pulled right out of the bag.  

Lastly, the menu needs...more.  More munchies, especially if you'll be drinking out on their marvelous outdoor seating area.  A few finger foods or group appetizers wouldn't kill them. But why bother making recommendations when "Bob" is likely to berate you for mistaking him for someone that cared?
author: Nils E.

description:
What a super day fellow yelpers.  Incredibly blue and sunny...actually felt a bit of warmth from the sun...this spot was just choice because of the near-greenhouse-type feel ya get from within.  The comp'd nibbles were very tasty, the bartenders were straight pros and well hey, beers and sodas were on Nish!!!  Hooray =)  

Had to spend some more time outside and got to chill a bit with A P, Sav, and Stanley who were all just as laxed and stoked as i was 4 the prime elements.  Oh my gosh.......A P's lil poochie was sooo adorable just gettin mad-friendly with everyone =d 

Anna and I were super hungry sooo we moved on to Jeremy's spot at XYZ.
author: omar b.

description:
I don't even remember if the food's any good, cause the view is just so damned nice.

I jest, of course.  I've been to B a number of times lately, including a company-sponsored get-to-know-your-colleagues lunch, and I remember the food quite well.  It's really good.  

In theory.  

I've had this chicken lime sandwich a couple times and it is *structured* really well, like it's a really good idea, if they could just remember to include all the ingredients - last time I was there they somehow forgot the avocado on /two/ of our sandwiches, but we were in enough of a rush after waiting 25 minutes to be served that we just let it slide.  Stuff like that is more a pattern than an exception.

B is like some really hot girls: the view is absolutely incredible and in the name of that you agree to overlook some of its shortcomings, but it lacks good qualities for a real relationship.  It's basically grandfathered into one of the nicest accessible SOMA/FiDi spots and for that reason alone I'm a repeat offender - and I'd recommend it to anyone for a lunch any time - but be aware that beneath its impeccable surface, B seems to suffer from some operational deficiencies.
author: Oliver N.

description:
One of the better Bloody Mary's I've had. 

This place is all windows; don't forget your shades.
author: Deanna T.

description:
One of the best places in the city! Not only great food...but the view..it is tough to beat. GREAT skyline views!
The place itself is small but beautiful! The bar is super nice!
The menu is top-notch. Everything is great! I have been here numerous times and never had a bad meal.
The music is always always good. Sometimes they have a DJ spinning!
Ask the bartender for a 'White Spider'---great refreshing drink!
author: Matt L.

description:
I am 2 for 2 at B!
Great on a sunny day - sit outside - it is a little oasis in the heart of the city.
Went there today for a lunch date - had the chicken salad sandwich which was fabulous.  I took half of it to go for a snack this afternoon - was back at my desk about 20 minutes before I ate the rest of it.  Yum!
The server I have had both times - so friendly - made me laugh.
Want to go back for cocktails on a nice night.
author: Catherine B.

description:
I'll give this place 3 stars for happy hour and will easily return for the same, though I wasn't inspired to go back for dinner.

Friends beat me here one perfect sunny Friday afternoon and wrestled an outdoor table for happy hour.  And then they took the liberty of ordering me a most pink and pretty cocktail.  Still cold and composed (unlike me) when I showed up half an hour late, this "love of vodka" stood the test of time but not of taste.  Ambiguous sweetness with undertones of acetone distracted from a playful foamy texture. The sangria was better, but not great.

The cheese platter is outstanding and a great deal $12 for 4 perfect cheeses, though, as usual, not enough toasts.  Mixed nuts disappointed with too many peanuts and an odd mixture of rosemary and cayenne.  Truffle fries were dangerously blissful.  Service was very slow, an aid to our over-ordering, over-drinking, and over-laughing.

Overall, happy hour was hit or miss on flavor, but difficult to complain about given the company and the weather.  A nice place to stop in before something more exciting.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
$1 oyster and $3 beer before 7:30, with lovely water front outdoor seating and tasteful decors indoor...  Why hasn't this place generated enough buzz to be the #1 destination for the happy hour crowd?

Perhaps the location is a little off.  It is so hidden at the corner, with NO signs.  The best way to ID the restaurant is to say "next to the Samovar tea lounge."

So now all you kids know about this place.  I'll see you there--- just don't come all at once--- in and out like waves is better, as to help this cool venue sustain.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
I was brought to B Restaurant by a friend this past Saturday after seeing the musical "In-significant  Others" at the Zuem theatre. I didn't know this is a place owned by the same people who own Box Lunch in the Financial District..."yummy yummy in my tummy"! 

I LOVE this place...and the co-owner, Don, is the best ever! Helpful...easy on the eyes...and very knowledgable about wine and spirits. They even fed us after practically closing up the kitchen (we wandered in a little late), maybe because my friend is such a hot mama :-)

So, I give all stars possible to this lovely place. Great Staff and beautiful atmoshpere! Get in here!!!
author: Dee C.

description:
1st and foremost, the bartender, IVAN...the best in the world! Sweet, friendly, intelligent, accommodating, genuine...the list goes on and on!

2nd...the fresh mojitos, BEST EVER! sangria...BEST EVER! both worth every penny!

the specialty drinks are inventive as well as good tasting. 

the ambiance is fantastic. Althought it gets super crowded, once you find a seat you will not want to leave.

the food is delicious. I go for the appetizers usually and can never pick one! we ususally end up sharing 3 or 4 different ones! the fries are excellent and the oxtails...WOW! ceviche...OMG!

all the staff is friendly and hard working. 

no complaints. great for a date or drinks and snacks with friends.
author: Monica T.

description:
My sister and I ate at B Restaurant on one of the ickiest, ugliest days in San Francisco.  I was hoping we would have a nice sister lunch, enjoying the sunshine and views at the Yerba Buena Center...  Not so much; sometimes I forget I live in San Francisco.

Nonetheless, B Restaurant is perfect for those days you WISH the weather was nice and you want to feel like you were actually eating outside; this is as close as it gets to eating outside...without eating outside.  The 360 degree glass windows (and walls) make it seem like you're outside but it's nice and cozy inside.  I was also surprised by how reasonable it was given the great service (since lunch was on my sister...maybe I should've picked a more expensive place! :-) ), and really, a $9 burger is just a couple of dollars more than what you would expect to pay at any standard to-go place in SoMa/FiDi.

Alike in look and alike in taste, my sister and I both ordered the same thing - French onion soup to start and burgers for our entrees.  Since I'm the "healthy" one, I got greens with my (bacon-less) burger instead of fries.  The French onion soup was not as "beefy" and salty as I had hoped/expected but still tasty (and strangely...served in a small, water glass..?).  Burger was also solid, but I was put off by the greens.  I took the first bite, and they were incredibly bitter...not from the greens being bitter but it was incredibly salty.  I wasn't sure if I was just reeling from the salty French onion soup aftertaste (?), so I went in for another.  Bleh.  Then I made my sister try them too, and she verified what my taste buds were telling me.  I sent the greens back - the waiter was very confused - and he came back and told me they had salted and dressed the greens.  What?  When did people start salting their salads???  And this, my friends, was not a light dusting of salt.  Despite all of this, the waitstaff was gracious about swapping out the salty greens and were incredibly quick with their service.

When you order a salad, ask them to hold the sale.  You'll thank me for it.
author: Wendy L.

description: B is a great place to have a drink in the afternoon, perched up above Yerba Buena Park. Definitely go here if a) you're in the area, b) it's a nice day, and c) you want to relax outside and grab a drink.
author: Mike O.

description: I'm giving 5 stars because their menu is totally unique (rattlesnake ceviche, tofu bucco, 16 oz pork w/ peach bread pudding, and crowd-pleasing more conventional dishes), they use "85%" organic ingredients, and it's a moderny design with a big, long bar and a killer view of Yerba Buena Gardens....  And a friendly, laid-back staff.   Just have to tell more people about it...
author: Melanie C.

description:
The joke about B Bar is that they are often out of whatever you want. We laughed about it with our waiter, Leonard, as I ordered a half dozen oysters from three different regions. "We don't have any of those tonight," he said. "BUT we have some others," he soothed. 

Deliciously served with a blood orange concoction rather than cocktail sauce, they were cold, briney but sweet, and really a perfect way to start dinner.  The crab cake appetizer is ample enough for dinner, 3 small medallions served on a bed of local greens and grilled asparagus. Accompanied with two glasses of sparkling wine, and complimentary dessert of berries and frothy cream, I will definitely be back. 

Sit in Leonard's section if you can. He feigns indifference, but the service is quick and his sense of humor even quicker.
author: Addy L.

description: We loved this place! Oysters, fabulous sangria, friendly and welcoming staff, and great urban view. The outdoor setting is a treat. Everything was delightful!
author: Marie W.

description:
This place is an O.K. happy hour if you just want a place with a view, but it goes downhill from there.

The downside is the poorly planned happy hour menu: beers are not priced for happy hour ($5/pint) and they only had Trumer and Hef on tap (out of anchor steam).  I need good beer to wash my oysters down!  They also have mini carafes of sangria for $10 each.  Beyond the drinks, their staff of 8 (nearing the 12 patrons in the restaurant) did a terrible job with service and timeliness.

However, the ambiance is really nice, which earns it a star.  They also had quality Fanny Bay and Kumamoto oysters (I would stick with the Fanny Bay breed since they are the best they offer).  If you go here, just grab some oysters and go.  If they replanned this happy hour, it would be a much better.  It's one of those places that you just drop that $20 and after you get snubbed by the bartenders when you are obviously done.

Also unconfirmed: is this a gay happy hour?  They offer a variety of pounding gay club hits which is great if you want to venture away from the Castro to hear Devo, Men Without Hats, etc or if you miss the 80s.
author: Joey S.

description:
This review is about the bar.

I went here last Friday an was very disappointed. It's great that the drinks were organic (that's what I've been told, although i didn't see any certifications anywhere), but none of the three beers they offered where. Additionally, I have never had to wait so long in such an uncrowded atmosphere to get my drink. I literally waited 20 minutes while the bartender tried three times to make a good lemon twist to put on someone else's drink. There is no reason two bartenders could not deal with the moderate crowd at this place. And they had three!

Final word - don't go. It's overcrowded, it's seriously (seriously) yuppie, and you will spend half an hour waiting for your drink.
author: Adam W.

description: I have to bump B Bar down a star because the bargain $10 sangria carafe is GONE!  $5 glasses of red sangria only, and a larger pitcher is now $40ish.  $1 oysters and cheap fries are still there.  Sadly, HOT SF weather to enjoy the sangria outside is still MIA.
author: Kevin W.

description: One of the best drinks with a view in the city! Great happy hour spot if your looking for an urban paradise in soma, and decent bar apps to boot. check it.
author: Jeremi M.

description:
What a little gem of a place to spend a Friday afternoon happy hour in the rare San Francisco sunshine.  I got dragged here in a T-shirt and hoodie thinking we were going diving in SOMA but the well-dressed jet set didn't seem to mind.

I love the architecture.  It's mostly glass which enhances the sunny day by making you feel out side even when you're standing indoors by the bar.  The staff was efficient and they have Trummer Pils on tap, which is always a treat.

Auf
author: Dave K.

description: This place has an amazing view of the city.  I like the location of this bar/restaurant.  I'd imagine it'd be pretty rowdy on busy days.  You can sit outside or inside and look out over the city from there.  I didn't have any food and the drinks were free (on Yelp) so I couldn't tell you how much it'd cost.  I'd come here on a nice day just to sit and watch the crowd.  Nice place to just sit and take it all in.
author: Amy J.

description:
Just had lunch there today. 
It's the perfect little spot overlooking Yerba Buena.
Pretty flowers and greenery outside- makes you forget that you are downtown.
The menu, has great salads and sandwiches to choose from. I have to recommend the chicken salad sandwich with diced apples and bacon.
Everything out of the kitchen is so fresh and you can definitely taste it.
What more could you ask for?
A little bit of sun outside and it's a great day!
author: Valarie A.

description:
I love this part of SOMA. The Yerba Buena gardens feel like a little oasis in the middle of the city and B Restaurant is the perfect place for an afternoon lunch on a nice day. The walls are entirely made of glass so it's lovely to look outside and enjoy the skyline as well as the gardens themselves. The restaurant itself has a great summery feeling and a nice bar in addition to indoor and outdoor tables.

Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I had a hard time narrowing it down. I finally decided on the chicken salad sandwich, which was very tasty, and at $9 not all that much more expensive than many of the takeaway places in the FiDi and SOMA. 

Our server was a little out there and wanted to talk too much, but other than that it was a great experience. I'd definitely like to come back at night for drinks.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
We came here on Friday night for a couple of drinks and it was so sad to see this place empty!! The location and decor is perfect! It's located at the beautiful and serene Yueba Buena Gardens and you can either sit outside on a sunny day or inside where there are high glass windows thatlook over the downtown. 

Since it was a chilly night, we decided to sit at the bar. I ordered the Asian Pear cocktail. Delicious! It was so refreshing and it literally tasted like an Asian pear. Very dangerous. Next, I had the sangria, which was also really good. We nibbled on a small plate of grilled catfish and polenta. It was pretty good. The menu different look that enticing to come back for dinner, but I'd love to come back during the afternoon to sit outside on a sunny day.
author: Denise L.

description:
Sometimes packaging is better than what's inside. I love this little glass boite - I'm thinking it would be cool to have a small party near sundown. Lighting would be awesome. Drinks and appetizers would be perfect. 

Dinner is mediocre, with the best dish being the first course. I liked their mixed heirloom salad with Laura Chenel's chevre - light with lots of heirloom goodness to savor. My grilled flank steak was nearly raw - no one ever asked how I like it done, and I forgot to ask as I was too busy mingling (so my bad too). Anyway, thank god I do like it medium well to rare so, once in a blue moon, I can deal with a vampire-like meal. After recently attending a goat cheese course where the instructor gushed about a goat cheese cake recipe... I had to get B's goat cheese mousse with cabernet reduction, chopped walnuts, and orange zest. The consistency was right, but I couldn't get past the sober flavors. I wanted something to pop.

Yes, I'll be back but just for drinks and atmosphere.
author: Lizelle G.

description:
4 stars is for happy hour at b bar only!  great indoor meets outdoor atmosphere here.  lots of windows and glass ceiling lets is some great light, when the weather permits.  this isn't a very large space so it's not ideal for large groups of more than 10 unless you want to split up.  

they have $5 apps and drinks specials.  the sangria was interesting...not sure if i liked it, had a hint of cinnamon or something spicy in there.
author: Wendy S.

description: Ugh.  Great location.  Its a shame this place sucks.  Service was slow. The food was not only mediocre but came out luke warm.  I came here because Zero Zero was full.  I probably should have waited.
author: Ash T.

description:
I've had lunch here several times and the food has been pretty good, especially the bacon burger & sea salt truffle fries.  

It was Mother's Day and I surprised Theresa and Alyson by going downtown for lunch and shopping.  Can you believe it, I hyped up the burger and they were all sold out.  Total bummer!

Since our 1st choice was gone, decided to settle on a light snack and ordered: chicken ceasar salad, truffle fries, soup, chocolate cake, and a anchor steam.  The salad was tasty, soup salty, and cake dry.  We sat inside it was like a wind tunnel.  The staff was friendly it was a fair experience not awesome.

We ended up snacking at the mall.
author: Rich W.

description: I have been wanting to stop in for a wile now, and so glad that I did last night. Food, drink and service was fantastic. I had two great beers, a short rib pizzeta (don't think I spelled that correctly), and great comversation with the bartender and one of the managers. The atmosphere was relaxing, and you can't beat the view. High five B!
author: Damien B.

description: This is a nice restaurant and with great views depending where sit.  Because of the glass walls of the restaurant, it is sort of like eating in a green house. The food was excellent and the service was very good.  I had the Charcuterie Prosciutto plate, soup, and Truffle fries, Duck Confit, Chocolate Caramel Sea Salt Tort with balsamic reduction. Prosciutto plate was pretty good, meat tasted fresh and it was not bland. The soup was okay, nothing special.  The truffle fries were good.  It was hot, crispy, and filling.  I like the Duck Confit. It was filling, juicy, tender, crispy, and cooked just right.  The chocolate caramel tort was fabulous.  The portion was incredibly small, but it tasted great. It was full of flavor, not too sweet.  I  recommend putting a tiny bit of the balsamic reduction (the two or three drops of dark fluid on the plate next to tort, which I initially thought was a splattering of chocolate) on each spoonful of the tort.  The balsamic reduction complements and enhances the flavor of the chocolate tort, giving it an unique flavor.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Whilst the drinks were good and the bar staff pleasant, the music was very loud for the small space and made us want to leave as soon as we had finished one drink. It is a beautiful, almost serene location and the music volume and choice was totally wrong. They even had a huge, ugly speaker on the patio, so there was no respite from the noise wherever you sat!
author: Rachel P.

description:
Does B stand for Beautiful? Bucolic? Bewitching? 

B Bar STUNS even the most seasoned SF happy hour hunter with its ridiculously enchanting setting that beguilingly beckons on a sunny afternoon. 

With bountiful cocktails abounding served up by non-bungling mixmasters, and DJ's like trax bending Martin, B Bar is a full-blown destination of big, big proportions that is also quite beneficent to nonprofits. 

Perched atop Yerba Buena Gardens, muy bueno B Bar is the perfect blend of scenery and scene, you scene-sters! 

So BART if you must, but head to B Bar bright bnow -- bdon't bwait!!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Not sure how often I'd go out of my way to eat at a place that's basically a part of Moscone, but if you're attending an event there, it's good alternative to conference fare for sure.  They weren't lying about the boxed chicken sandwich. It's a delish blend of chicken, pears, bacon and just the right amount of pesto.

Would recommend coming in the evening - the lighting at night helps you forget you are at Moscone, and it's actually quite nice for a small cocktail reception.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
Went here with a large group, 10+ for dinner. Since they've only been open a week, I think some hiccups are to be expected so I won't be too critical. 

Got here before most of the group and had a couple drinks at the bar. The drinks were good and we had a few appetizers, also good. Ordered a caiparinha which, according to the barkeep, was made the old fashioned way. Not too sweet like others, very good. The smell of bacon cooking for their sandwiches the next day was too good to resist, and we even got a plate of bacon to munch on! Nothing beats crispy bacon... mmmmm bacon....

Rest of the group showed up and we had dinner. Ordered another round, they didn't have one of the ingredients for a drink and substituted a similar drink. The waiter brought it and let the person know what they were out of. I'm torn, in a way I think it's good to make the quick substitution so that you can drink with everyone else. Conversely, what if you hate the substitute? Anyway... dinner was good. Several people shared some of the smaller plates, all of them were good. I had the smoked trout, which was tasty but not fully deboned. General consensus was that the food was really good. 

Like I said, since it's brand new there are bound to be a few issues. We didn't get bread until we asked for it, and by then our mains were almost ready. The restaurant wasn't crowded, but the wait for drinks or little things like water was a little longer than it should've been under the circumstances. I think that they will work thru all this though. The staff is incredibly hospitable and friendly. The location makes it difficult to find for dinner. You just don't get the foot traffic on that side. But I think that's part of the charm, you feel like you are in a little corner of the city. It still has that hidden spot charm, and personally I hope it stays that way. I just might not like it as much having to fight for reservations!

Update 11/06: So I went back for dinner to see how it is with a smaller group. While I still like the charm, the kinks aren't worked out yet. There was only one other party in the place and it still took a while to get drinks. And what's with the no bread? I know they have it, why not bring it or at least ask if you'd like bread? We shared 4 of the small plates between the two of us. They brought out the first two in a normal amount of time. But then proceeded to wait until we had finished those off. That would be ok if they came back and checked whether or not we were finished with the first plates... The second pair was ok, not what I expected. That probably made me not like them. I still want to like this place, but I have to knock it down a star for this last experience...
author: The Sock S.

description:
We went here for brunch this past weekend and overall it was very good.  

At first, I was shocked by their brunch menu, because lets just say it was "exotic", but we decided to give it a try.

First of all, the coffee was very good....I like it strong, so this place didn't dissapoint.

I ordered the eggs diablo....basically, its poached eggs with spicy tomato sauce and potatoes.  It was very tasty, although a little too spicy and fairly small overall for a complete meal.  I was still a little hungry afterwards.

My girlfriend ordered the bagel with cream cheese and lox, which she said was one of the best she's ever had.

The views were great and I love the modern, minimalist decor inside, the garden setting, and the view, from the giant menus.

I'd definitely come back here again.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I like the B bar after work for a peaceful outdoorsey type of place.  The food is not overpriced and the food has different flavors that make you say oooh, ahhhh, and hmmm--that's different.  I like foods that give you that experience...I had the :

Ravioli with truffle oil (every bite was delish!)
Truffle fries (who doesn't like fries with truffle :))
The duck salad (ehhh, it had apples in it, different but would not order again)
Their LOVE drink (it's just cool to look at the hearts drawn on top of the drink itself)

Yah and pricecs were great---there were many appetizer like dishes for under $10...

Great place before a movie...It's convenient, prices are reasonable and industrial trendy....
author: Q A.

description:
It's airy, it's bright, it is like eating in the outdoors, but it is a lot warmer. B is a petite eatery and it has glass walls so it does not have a claustrophobic  feel at all. 

I had a Greek salad at this charming little restaurant . It came with potatoes and it was the first time I had potatoes in my Greek salad, but I thought the two went well together. Luckily, I wasn't very hungry when I dined here because my salad was pretty light. It came sans chicken (I can't complain, most Greek salads do). 

The service here was excellent. I was pretty parched when I cam here for lunch and the waiter promptly refilled my ice tea multiple times. 

I can't imagine coming here for a big dinner party, but this is the perfect place to go for a tranquil, light lunch.
author: Christine C.

description:
The place is beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous - definitely bring your sunglasses if it's a nice day. HH prices are very reasonable, and it definitely gets crowded after work - we went on for a Friday HH, right after the Chronicle's Bar Bites column on B Bar came out. 

I'm going to echo what other people said - with only two bartenders, you're definitely going to be waiting for a drink. All of the specialty drinks take a good amount of time to make. The drinks are ok (not mindblowing) but the truffle fries are amazing! Those were probably my favorite part of our trip to B Bar. I have to say, the $1 oysters are a good price but I wouldn't try them again - when we got them, they were on the warm side and one of them was GROSS (it was gooey-slimey and I had to spit it out...half of it was literally liquified. I have no idea how that particular oyster made it out of the kitchen).
author: Adrienne C.

description:
4 stars for the sangria.  I loved sitting outside and being able to kick it with a group of 8+ people.  Just not sure if I can get this to a 4 star.  But I'd definitely go back and see if it moves me.  It's in a very cool location.  Appetizers were a bit pricey so not sure if it's a regular place for happy hour...at least for those who do happy hour alot.

Had to check the waiter but he came into line after that.  It was all good after a scolding.  Service was a bit slow but it's after work and once we got one thing of sangria we were cool.

But check it out for the atmosphere and sangria.  I hear they will start dj during happy hour.
author: anna l.

description:
I am surprised to have had such a poor experience at B, with all the positive feedback. It was absolutely gorgeous out and I had visitors in from LA (love showing off SF) so we sat in the sun for Sunday brunch. The bagels and lox were a disaster... for all 3 of us. 

The toasted bagels were cold and soggy, not to mention they tasted like Lenders... yes like the ones that come in a bag. They were out of lox, so they had a house cured Hawaiian fish in stead. Was rather tasty... but was only one one half of the bagel. The cream cheese was mixed with chives... not sure if that was supposed to be the pickled red onions described on the menu. 

 I am too nice to make jabs at the service.... he tried but just did not quite "get " it. It was a shame to have a $44 breakfast and not eat what we ordered or what was on the menu.
author: Amelia L.

description: I went here for an ad:tech HH and it was great! I got to try a lot of h'orduerves. They have tables on the patio when the weather is nice, and tables inside for when it gets cold. I would definitely come back here!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Cool spot for lunch.  On a nice day, theres no better place than to eat outside on their patio.  They have amazing burgers and some awesome truffle fries.  

They have a DJ for happy hour but it usually gets really busy.  There aren't enough bar tenders for the crowd.  It took me about 30 min to get a drink.
author: gareth l.

description:
Went to B for lunch today and I have a short and sweet synopsis to share.

Food analysis: I had the "boxed" chicken salad and it was very tasty.  It was lightly dressed with enough chicken and bacon to make it hearty but still healthy.  They do a good job with the presentation too.  Salads can sometimes look the same anywhere you go, so I was pleased when ours came out looking full of color and richness.

Service analysis: As most of the reviews report, the service is amazing - because it is so incredibly slow.  I wish I didn't have to say that but it's true.  We waited a tad too long than we should have for our food and the waiter seemed to be not present for the entire first 10 minutes that we were there. 

Nonetheless, I liked the place enough to want to go back again.
author: Denise G.

description:
I'd give it a 4 and half if I could.

Really great place on a sunny day! Ample people watching and good drinks on a good day at fair price. I'll vouch for the sangria and Love something or other (forget the name) drink. We also had the $1 oysters (Miyagis were good, others only ok) and the ceviche was pretty tasty with the house-made potato chips! Service was friendly and attentive.

Side story: I found a bit of glass in my drink (it's scary! but it happens) and they handled it well. They replaced my drink immediately with apologies.

There were only of three of us that day and we came pretty early (5ish) so we had no problems finding a table - this could be an issue a bit later though especially with a larger group. It was pretty busy around 6 - people were spreading out to the surrounding area by the time we left. But it seems like you can drink you drinks in the area around the bar so it works, just something to keep in mind with a larger group.

The sun, people watching and good music from the DJ really make this place a go-to on my list of happy hours. It's hard to find a place with this nice a combo around the Fi-Di/Union Square area.
author: Sherrie D.

description: This is a very cute and cozy little place in the Yerba Buena gardens with a nice outside seating area too, which would be great on a nice day out. I came here for my friend's private bday party and got to try one of their martinis, which was named after my friend for the night. It had all kinds of yummies and was very tasty. Their appetizers were also decent. Didn't really get to try their food yet but I'll definitely come back for real happy hour sometime =)
author: Louisa L.

description:
One of my favorite places in the 'hood.  Down to 4 stars because they need to get the draft beers kickin - every time we've gone they've had some sort of issue with the beer selection.  The wine list is enormous and rather fabulous.

The eggs diablo are =awesome= as is the beet salad.  It is a beautiful location, and eating outside in the sun is the perfect way to spend the morning.  

Haven't eaten dinner - only brunch.
author: Lis W.

description:
I came to B Restaurant for lunch a few months ago with some coworkers. The sun was shining, so we sat out on the patio overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens. To do that, however, we needed some of the buff waiters to move the umbrella for us. Thank you buff B Restaurant waiters!

We started out with cocktails that were quite simply amazing. My cocktail ("love" something or other) had the most beautiful pink syrup heart floating in the middle of the glass. Gorgeous! The food was more than satisfying as well. I had a delicious salad with bacon in it - mmmmm bacon. 

Plus, our waiter was a cutie-patooty! How can you go wrong with that?
author: Ava S.

description:
i had a great roasted chicken here the other night! ALSO, i am obsessed with the "love on" cocktail i had with rasberry, pineapple and vodka. yumyumyum. they drew a heart on top of the drink with rasberry sauce- as a former barista, i am a sucker for drink top art...
the happy hour prices are a good incentive to come here after work. the view of the buildings around yerba buena gardens is positively delightful and the service was great. it was comfortably full of people without feeling overly stuffed.
it is not so poppin on a weekend. when we went one sat night we were the only customers there for dinner...
author: Julie D.

description:
My experience here - I say was average...nothing magical. The location above Yerba Buena was a bit strange. If my friend's husband had not called me to tell me where it was, I would have never have found it - probably. Let me break it down:

Food: 3.5 Stars.I liked my pork chop.  My BF had the steak - pretty tasty. I'm no expert but the oysters just didn't taste right. French fries - well, they were soggy - 
Service: 3.5 Stars - When I asked for a recommendation for a side dish, the waiter said the carrots. When it came out, the dish ALREADY had carrots! (it didn't say  that on the menu). But the guy was nice and attentive. 
Ambiance: 4 Stars - Architecture was nice. You do have a nice view. It's a nice date place. But the dining area was a lot smaller than the bar and there was no one at the bar.
author: Jen R.

description: The setting was wonderful, which is why I gave this place one star.  We arrived at the restaurant a little before 1:00 pm.  It was a beautiful sunny afternoon, so we opted to sit on the patio.  The waitress was friendly, and offered several suggestions.  I ordered the heirloom tomato salad, and added steak for an additional $7.99.  My companions ordered burgers and fries cooked in truffle oil to share.  I ordered a flavored ice tea to drink, and one companion ordered a Pepsi, but they substituted with coke.  We were served water fairly quickly, but we waited at least 15 minutes for our drinks.  It was at least 30 minutes before the fries were served, and at least an hour before we received our food.  My salad consisted of a mound of arugula with three small pieces of tomato, and 4 tiny slices of steak.  Oh, there was part of a strawberry and half a fig under the arugula, too.  There were more tomatoes on the burgers than what was in my salad.  I think the burgers tasted ok, and the fries were, well, fries. Next time we will just order take out at the food court in the Metreon.  It was fortunate that we were visiting the city, and not on our lunch hour, as we needed at least 2 hours for this less than adequate meal.
author: Wendy H.

description:
I hosted a large group here for happy hour, which is 4:30 - 7:30 Tues - Fri.  It was a lovely day, and we sat outside.  Spanking views and a beautiful space made me feel like we were on vacation.  Awesome!

They have really delicious $1 oysters for happy hour. A lot of places put out crappy, cheap oysters when they discount them, but these were really wonderful. I will definitely go back for that! We also ordered the truffle fries which were good, but nothing to rave about.

The happy hour menu is very limited and they do not offer special pricing for wine, so that was a bummer.  Well drinks are $5, which is nice, but still how happy can the hour be without a special on wine?  Also, once the sun started to go down, it was COLD out there. A few heating lamps would do the place wonders.
author: Indigo W.

description:
Warm and sunny day in San Francisco?  Head to B for lunch and you will be able to take in Yerba Buena gardens and all its activity while eating a solid meal.  The restaurant has a lot of seating outdoors on the terrace above the waterfall.

The cool Sangria adds some nice spice to a lunch where either the burger or chicken sandwich is a key staple.  They also have dollar oysters for happy hour which can be pretty happening with the SOMA after work crowd when warm.  I look forward to my next visit!
author: Lemar H.

description:
A really fabulous little find downtown amid Tourist Central.  Really yummy contemporary dishes that are mostly organic...hip, beautiful interior...We talked with one of the owners Don, a very cool, funny
guy who was spinning old skool funk, R&B and hip hop in between waiting tables. The cocktails are really excellent too...I highly recommend
the "Love On."  It would be perfect for a private party.
author: Syd H.

description: My server/bartender Vincent was fantatic and the only reason I may return in the future.  I went for brunch which took 2 hours from when we sat down and mind you this restaurant is not large!  I ordered an egg scramble that was cold to the touch and toast that I never received.  My friend had a hamburger that was barely warm on the inside and cut almost in half to test the consistency, her fries also never arrived.  All in all the food was good but I left hungry and unsatisfied.  I arrived when they opened and from the moment I arrived they were running behind and trying to catch up.  Additionaly on a very limited brunch menu that were out of some very key ingrediants ...umm have you not heard of someone going out and picking up the one key ingredient??
author: Karen C.

description: I thought this place was pretty dope. The view and the ambiance complement the great happy hour specials. My friend raved about the truffle fries and they were absolutely delicious. We also got a pitcher of sangria....it was the perfect way to spend a beautiful day in the city after work. I will definitely stop by B bar when I return to SF.
author: Julian J.

description: Great view, maybe one of the best in the city -- unfortunately this is probably the only reason to visit here. The weekend hours and lacking bunch and regular menu leaves much to be desired. Props to the wait staff -- they have a good attitude and recognize the decline over the last year or two.
author: Justen S.

description:
this place is GREAT for oyster happy hours... $1 oysters every weekday til 730 with no limits and you always get a selection of 3 different oysters... fanny bay's my favorite!  

Atmosphere is cool... drinks specials are always different... and the small plates are frosting to the cake!  

I've only been here for HH, so can't speak for their actual entrees..... 

but if you like oysters and a place outside of the embaracdero/Fidi crowd... b's the place to be
author: Kelly H.

description: Good food, great drink selection and friendly staff. Hosted a corporate event here and would do it here again.
author: Lance K.

description: I came here on Sunday for a meeting and loved the crisp air and view of the clear skies - reminded me of a perfect fall day back east.  I can't believe I've never been here before.  It was delicious!  I ordered the french toast, which came with roasted fruit and too much whipped cream.  Our servers were extremely helpful and attentive.  I can't wait to come back here and try all the other delicious sounding menu items!
author: Lynnie P.

description:
Took a client here for lunch one sunny San Francisco afternoon...

Was perfect.  Great outdoor seating, 'custom-ordered' sun, friendly + attentive staff, food fresh + tasty.

Go here for a mini-break from the hustle+bustle of everyday.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Incompetent service, lousy food. A waste of a gorgeous space at Yuerba Buena.

Our server had no clue what he was doing. We ended up placing our order with a nice lady who checked in with us about 30 minutes after we were seated. Our food didn't show up for another 45 minutes.

The boarish busser was too busy flirting with customers and always seemed to approach our table with dirty dishes from other tables to realize how imposing he was.

Our food arrived. The "chilled" soup arrived warm. The charcuterie plate was a joke.

The manager clearly sensed our displeasure and comped a glass of wine, so this one star review is for them actually noticing something was awry. And the nice outdoor seating.
author: Harrison M.

description:
Lawdy I wanted to love this place.  I did, I did!  I showed up for Sunday brunch around 1:00 with my friend Peter.   That I was hungover goes without saying.  Bloody Marys for all!  Peter rejected his and took at Blood Orange mimosa instead.  Too warm.  Bloody Marys too peppery and watery (and not boozy 'nuff for the alcoholics in the crowd).  Oysters: not good. Salad: tasty. Shrimp & Grits: good.  Service: horribly slow.

Now, the atmosphere at this place is awesome.  All glass walls, nice patio.   Close to my house.  Weird location (above the waterfall in Yerba Buena Gardens).  But I just couldn't. . .

I did forget to leave the waiter a tip.  I paid with my CC and was going to give him cash, but I left it in my pocket.  I thought of returning and giving it to him belatedly. . . but will I go back?  Hoho.  Guilt, or luck?  We'll never know.
author: Mark J.

description:
It's a very crowded bar but the view is gorgeous. My friend and I got a table rather quickly during Happy Hour on a warm Friday afternoon. "They do take their Happy Hour in SF seriously, don't they?" 

Raw oysters, salami, cheese platters is available and is delicious. My favorite was their TRUFFLE FRIES. The sangria was tasteful but not the best I've ever had. Don't expect wonderful service because with all those people craving for an alcoholic beverage, your server will be fighting with the bartender to get your drink ready on time.
author: Oanh N.

description:
I am but one of San Francisco's many commuters. Everyday I trek from SF down to San Jose and back, through sun, rain, wind and sleet. And Traffic . LOTS of traffic.

That is, I commute every day but one. Fridays. Oh Friday! Friday is my day of relaxed working, merely making way over to the small, local SF office of my company and basking in the glow of the city. And of course, being able to choose where to eat for lunch.

Now being able to choose from all the nearby places to eat is both blessing and curse. Where to go? What cuisine? What price range? Normally, my colleagues and I end up at the Metreon or the Mall out of a sheer inability to choose. This cannot go on...

And so today I found myself in B Resteraunt & Bar. It's perched just atop the Moscone Center and looks over the gardens next to the Metreon. It's pleasantly designed, with understated yet classy decor. The Lunch menu is a little limited however, mainly restricted to decent sandwiches. Being a small location, even at lunch time it's a good idea to reserve if you want to eat indoors - otherwise, wrap up warm and take an outdoor table.

Portions are not huge, which is actually a relief in American culture - they do give you just the right amount... And so it was that I enjoyed my lunch on the blessed friday, not hungry, not full... Just right.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Met a few friends here last night for happy hour and to pregame for the Prince show!!  Been wanting to check it out since I have been a fan of the company's cafe on Kearny, Boxed Foods, for years, and just love their concept and their aesthetic.  B does not disappoint!  Beautiful space, friendly and attentive staff, great cocktails and if the appetizers are any indication, the food I did have was superb.  I didn't have a full meal because of time constraints, but I will definitely be back to have a proper dinner.  The happy hour specials are great, and I love that they run from 4-7:30! I would advise getting there early though, it fills up fast.  The ginger rickey is amazing (it's a happy hour drink special).  I also had to try the drifter's compass (one of their regular cocktails), which totally blew my mind.  I couldn't believe that combination of ingredients could taste so good and go down so smoothly.  Couldn't have too many of those though, wanted to be conscious for His Purple Majesty. 
In short - great spot, planning to go back soon, encourage all to try it!
author: Kate C.

description:
Last Friday I went to B for a Broad's night with my two best broads.  We were able to sit outside (even though it was raining at bit) under the trellis and enjoy the view.  I would love to give 4 stars for that alone, but I can't because of the food.  Not that is was terrible, it was just boring.

First, our server, Anthony, was awesome.  He was charming and attentive and even knew that a real Manhattan is made with Rye Bourbon.  

Secondly, our drinks were perfect even if they were a little slow in getting them out (order the next one while you're halfway through the first if you can).

And then there was the food.  We went with the Charcuterie Platter and the charcuterie itself was not good.  The radishes and cornishons were great, but the meats... bleh.  It was about 10 slices of deli ham and about 5 slices of salam"i".  A quick suggestion in order to make it better?  Prosciutto, Mortadella, and pick one of the 15 varieties of Salame that is out there (other than the one kind that our mom's put in our sandwiches as kids).

Then there was the cheese platter.  Plenty of beautiful berries and walnuts which could have been the main focus.  That was nice.  But the cheeses were boring.  Brie, soft Goat and some unidentified cow's milk cheese.  Boring.  An easy fix... Cowgirl Creamery's Red Hawk, Roaring 40's Blue, and maybe a hard goat's milk cheese for something different.

Overall, I'll have to go back and try an entree or two.  Maybe I'll get wowed by the main courses.  But until then, 3 stars.  It was an enjoyable experience with forgettable food.
author: Jessica B.

description:
John the bartender makes great Martinis (and any other drink as well, I'm sure). The $1 happy hour oysters were great (4:30-7:30 Tues-Fri. BUT. I advise going as early as you can (and definitely NOT on a Fruiday) unless you like it crowded and fairly impossible to carry on a conversation due to the noise level of the patrons. the inside is fairly small and I woudl recommend for groups to go outside.

 They have a great Charcuterie plate (sausage, prosciutto, etc.) and a wonderful cheese plate as well as an excellent vegetable crostini. The servings of those are plenty to make it a dinner (with the possible addition of a salad) for  two. ON a nice day, there is a lovely covered patio area overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens and some of the city skyline.

The rest of the staff is cordial and personable.
author: Lee S.

description: This my first time ever writing a review. The only reason I signed up for this is to tell everyone how bad this place is. It literally took 45 minutes for our waiter to even acknowledge us then they never checked on us till the food came. The food was not worth it at all in n out kills this place. Maybe I just had a bad experience but I will never go back or recommend it to anyone.
author: Chad N.

description: 4.5 stars really and the missing .5 stars is b/c not all the food blew me away (it was all solid but not mind-blowing) and one of the waiters SUCKED!  I was mesmerized but it had a lot to do with going on a BEAUTIFUL summer day in San Francisco. The bar itself is small but that's b/c you are supposed to spill out onto the chairs & benches outside, in the Yuerba Buena gardens.  They have great happy hour prices & selection, they make fresh Caipirinha & sangria and a good selection selection of happy hour food.  Didn't try the entrees.  Now that I've found this place near my work, the problem will be trying to figure out how to get out of work every day by 4:30pm when Happy Hour starts...
author: Barndi K.

description: We read a review from the San Francisco Chronicle several months ago, and decided to give it a shot ($1 oysters during happy hour!).  It is located on the upper level of Yerba Buena Gardens, which gives you a nice view of part of downtown.  The food...not impressive.  It's a place to hang out for some drinks, but not for the food...
author: Franklin W.

description:
I came here a while ago for a newbie yelp elite event/meet and greet and thought the space was really cool.  I had a real hard time finding the place because it is kind of tucked away in a quiet location right atop the Yerba Buena Gardens but the view was very cool.  They also have what looks like amazing outdoor seating that I was unable to take advantage of that particular night because it was pretty cold.

After talking to the manager at length I learned that they have really great happy hour specials, so when I do go back it will definitely be for happy hour.  I personally am more of a t-shirt and jeans kind of a guy and I think that this place is more dressy than that but I think that on the rare occasion that I dress up a little bit I'll be there for happy hour.
author: Anthony Y.

description: Thanks fellow Yelpers!  I put a call on Yelp to find a good bar for cocktails and appetizers before heading over the SF Shopping Center for Sex and the City 2.  You responded - some with Annabelle's (next time) and some with B Bar at the top of the Yerba Buena building.  Perfect.  They saved us 7 seats at the bar for starters - and then we got great cocktails and appetizers for 7 for $150, which I thought was pretty good considering we did not hold back.  A bit on the sunny and warm side at the inside bar but we managed.  The bar was clean and bright and the service very friendly and quick.  We had lemondrops, prosecco, Cosmopolitans, bruschetta, truffle fries, large salads, cheese plate,  another cheese plate and more truffle fries!l  I would definitely go back - and thanks for the tip, Yelpers!!
author: Jan C.

description:
Showed up here for happy hour on Friday.  Nice decor, wish they had heat lamps outside because they're located on the second level with an amazing view overlooking Yerba Buena Garden.

Drinks were awesome! Sangria was spiced!  The gin and ginger drink was great.

Their truffle fries...YUM! (had two orders of that)  Can't get any better than $1 fresh oysters.  Their grilled oysters were pretty amazing also.  Beet salad was ehhh, but then not much into beets.

Overall a great place to spend happy hour at, especially on a nice day where you can sit outside on the patio area, but don't expect to eat a full meal here.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
If you are in need of a new nickname this is place to go: Birthday, Lion, Flower and Smile. Our friendly waitress named us all. 

The outdoor seating with umbrellas stopped us in our tracks as we were venturing toward Samovar. We then evaluated the menu and  it looked pretty good so we decided to roll the dice.  Texted our 4th as to the change of plans and promptly sat down. 

The food was good, tried the artichoke salad , w/ chix , also tried the cold fennel orange, tomato soup which was good, just a little heavy for me. Our waitress was very friendly as I mentioned above just the service was a tad slow- had to get up and ask for the check , maybe we need to work on our professional get-ups. I wish we were all ladies of leisure but  not the case.  Def give it go, especially if you are looking for sun and a new nickname.
author: Sarah B.

description:
