Call me a sucker for a good crabcake, see if I care. Everything I've eaten or imbibed here during the course of 2 visits has been first rate.  Friendly and efficient service. I usually don't care about restaurants in such public zones, but I would love to see this place get the traffic they deserve.

They may well be finding their needed groove and it is indeed, groovaliscious.
author: Amy J.

description: I simply love this place and it should get much more recognition! The view over the Yerba Buena Garden is terrific, great outdoor seating, the interior is beautiful and the staff always lovely. They have a good wine selection, the menue which is not so big is good (I tried it all) and so far I always found a table. Love it!
author: Angela R.

description:
I went to B Restaurant today during a nice Spring lunch hour, it was gorgeous so I decided to sit outside.  The view is amazing and the sandwiches and salads are delicious.  The staff is uber friendly and very at tentative.  I wasn't rushed and the service is fast.  I definitely recommend esp on any gorgeous day.  
I do want to note that I left my credit card on the chair and I went back and they knew exactly who I was and returned it to me so they get extra stars if that were possible.
author: Ben L.

description: This review is for their happy hour.  They have dollar oysters, with a 6 oyster minimum.  No problem for us, since we love oysters.  They were very fresh and meaty.  You do have to get a table to order oysters.  So when it's sunny, there's very little seats since the place gets packed.
author: Rose C.

description:
3 1/2 Stars

Perfect spot to have lunch on a sunny day (like we did today!) or to take in the beautiful skyscraper scenery at night while having a drink.

Their Chicken Salad Sandwich (sliced apples were a nice touch!) and Poached Egg Jambalaya had me feenin' for more even after we were done eating. Good god was it AMAZING. Even the lemonade I had was delish. Everything else on the menu sounded pretty tempting.

The only downsides were the slooow service & the eyelash I found in the jambalaya. I'm just hoping the eyelash was mine. Service started off flawless w/ our amicable waiter, but once the surrounding tables filled up, he pretty much peaced out on us. Our poor server looked like he could've used an extra hand to help him out.

Love their logo & semi-hidden location. Menus were super beat up.=(

I'll most definitely be coming back soon and hopefully the service will blow me away.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I really enjoyed their Love (pineapple, raspberry, vodka) concoction.  Very tasty and the bartender drew a super cute heart on top too!  

It was that one day in SF that was perfectly warm and sunny and as I gazed over the edge of the infinity fountain I caught myself daydreaming of my newfound urban-outdoor wedding location...

Hmm, that Love drink may have been more potent than I thought.  Look out for that one.
author: Krystle S.

description:
This is in a weird out of the way cursed spot.  I'm pretty sure this is the 10th different business in this spot.  Unless they change their vibe, this one won't last either.  B doesn't seem like it knows what it wants to be - it needs to make up its mind and move in that direction.

Went for a happy hour and I'm not sure how to review this place.  Let's start with what I loved: $1 oysters, $5 drink specials, a huge patio with a lovely view. The ambiance indoors looked really fun.  

What was mediocre?  The french fries were about a half inch long.  They were too tiny to dip and very hard to hold - in short, they were crumbs.  The waiter warned us against the peppers, letting us know they were "hot."  When we finished them, he commented "wow, most people only eat one or two."  Honestly, if I wasn't starved, my limit would have been lower.  They just weren't that great.  

What did I hate?  Service was very slow, but that was nothing compared to the true horror.  The DJ.  He took in the mellow mood of the spot and felt compelled to blast the patrons out of their seats with the best of 80s lite hip hop.  You could hear the music from a half block away and I couldn't hear my companion who was sitting about a foot away from me.  Are this many people going out with people they don't want to talk to?  Do we really need to make it impossible to hear each other?  Ditch the DJ on weekdays and replace him with an ipod, but please make sure that the volume is turned way down.  Let's enjoy the tranquility.  As for the DJ, on weekend nights, let's ditch the tables on the patio and turn it into a dance floor!  

B - if you lost the DJ,  (or turned down the volume by at least one half) this would have been a four star review, easy.
author: She-Ra ..

description: Had mussels and fries with a bottle of Telegraph white ale, plus some wild shrimp and the duck confit. All approved, all delicious. Only wish the portions were bigger.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
This is a great place for happy hour, what with its patio dining and decent food and cocktail specials. It's not a very big place, but the staff are great about trying to accommodate parties of any size. My only qualm is that the $1 oysters come out on a bed of salt instead of ice, so on warmer days (like the past few days), you're sort of pressing your luck, if you know what i mean.

otherwise, this is definitely a great option for after work drinks!
author: Andrey C.

description: Came here with a Living Social deal and still thought I wasted my money. Be aware, this place does open on random days as they say they are on their glass door.
author: William C.

description:
This place was simply great. I also attended the yelp event yesterday and IMHO i could not think of anything that could have been down better. The owner was very friendly and provided great conversation. Thanks again for having us!

The Yelpatizers tasted so good! I could not get enough of the pecorino veggie tarts. I took a peek at the menu at it all sounded good and look forward to coming back to have a go at it.

I loved that they had beats playing in the background. The service was awesome. This would be a great place to stop by on a date for dinner before a movie or for some drinks afterward This will definitely be my list of places that will attend on a regular basis

PS: thanks for the beers Nish!
author: Alfredo N.

description:
A perfectly-situated bar & restaurant atop YBCA (Center for Performing Arts) with stunning floor-to-ceiling glass walls that drench its guests in the warmth of sunlight on a sunny afternoon.

As a vegetarian, I was able to have  2 out of 3 "Yelpatizers," as the previous reviewers call them (e.g. namely the pecorino veggie& cheese tarts, endive with blue cheese & candied nuts). BTW, Sunday was my 1st yelp event as an Elite.  What fun!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I think the setting in here is beautiful and the staff (esp the owner) very friendly!! I'd go back just because he was so cool to our party.  I went here for a friend's birthday dinner and we were treated very very well.  They kept the restaurant open late for us, it was so fun.  The food is good too. 

My short ribs were awesome, get those.  Friends also told be the sea bass was good, but the portion looked too small for me.  The greek salad was flavorful, but very peppery and it was too much for my friend.  The Buffalo wings need a little work, they are served covered in a marinara sauce that lack any zip.  The cherry cheesecake dessert was fantastic!  

Overall, awesome spot that I highly recommend checking out.
author: George M.

description:
To actually eat dinner, this place is over priced with very small portions. I left hungry, but paid $40. However, given that there really aren't any other restaurants in the vicinity, they don't have much competition. 

This place seems like it'd be a better place for drinks, a happy hour, and snacks.
author: Joyce L.

description:
The happy hour from 4:30 - 7:30 is a sweet deal with a selection of specialty cocktails and sangria. The dollar oysters were okay..one had a bit of a funny yellowish color so we sent it back and they gave us two in it's place. In general the bar staff was very attentive. There are also some reasonably priced bar food too (fries, ceviche, mussels, and shrimp cocktail). 

On a nice sunny day it's a great spot to drop by.
author: Nikke G.

description: You can't do zero stars, so I guess my 1 star will be for appearance. Other than that, this place was a complete let down. I had the tortata which is an egg based dish served in an un-cured cast iron skillet. So about 1/4 of the meal is stuck to the skillet and inedible. What remains is bland and completely lacks excitement for you pallet. The service was slow and pretentious. I sat through my entire meal without anything to drink. Definitely not worth the price and I certainly will not return.
author: Keith E.

description:
Update: OK, went there last week with two friends for dinner--we were off to see Wayward Sway at Hotel Utah, so it seemed like a good logistic decision. Unfortunately we got a bit of the attitude Julie C wrote about. Food was fine, but my friend ordered a glass of Chardonnay, and it was really, really sweet--Reisling sweet, so she told our server she didn't like it, and asked for something drier. I tasted it--it was aweful and I be likin' me some wine. 

She totally was nice about it. He then began to tell her that she had an under-developed palate and that the wine was a classic: not made like any of the junk from Napa--WTF dude--just get her another fucking glass of wine. He just kept on and on, and it ticked me off. Everyone's palate is different; we are talking a $10 glass of wine--get her want she wants.

I only take one star off because that was just one dude who obviously would love to be working at a higher class place and had a wine list as long as California coast. I will go back--but I will make sure it is for lunch when all us folks with under-develop palates order Chicken Sandos.

This is one of my favorite place to meet my GF for lunch when I am "working" from home. I hop BART to New Monty and walk a few blocks to B's. We sat outside a few weeks ago and it was fabulous. My Chicken Salad Sando and glass of Sancerre complimented the weather. Prices are good and the quality of food and service are great for a lunch rendezvous.
author: Deborah S.

description:
I've only been here for lunch so can only attest to this one meal.  I have been here twice and both times, the food has been solid.  First time there, I had a burger which was tasty and juicy.  The second time, I went w/ the lime chicken sando per a recommendation of a coworker and that was great if you're in the mood for something light.  

This restaurant looks gorgeous since it's basically the walls and ceiling are all glass.  I imagine this would be a nice romantic date spot at night given its architecture but I'll have to find out another time.  

DSKO favs:  the burger w/ mushrooms and avocado and fries
author: Dik Shun K.

description:
Lovely on a sunny day.  Sit in the sun, drink fruity, yet not-too-sweet cocktails.  A few short blocks from my office.

If the food were better, I'd be in love (read: give it 5 stars).
author: S J.

description:
The Ceviche!! Sooo good. If you go during happy hour, make sure to order more than one bc they ran out as soon as we discovered how great it was! =( The sangria, $1 oysters, and the burger were also a hit.

The decor and large windows overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens were also really relaxing and pretty.   The wait staff were extremely nice and friendly even though they looked a little under-staffed.
author: Becka T.

description: In a word "rough" - had to turn back the horrible NOCA wine, the pasta with pork was like dog food - not that I've eaten dog food - they were out of most wines and small dishes, and the arm on chair was broken off. Oh and I've before had the truffle fries which were horribly stale and "off." Alas, no mas visits.
author: I. V.

description: A close friend mentioned this place when he said oysters are $1 each during happy hour. Okay, we came on a Friday...Hello??? hella crowded, and really stuffy there. We wanted to get the sangria, but they told us that it was sold out.  Bummer! so my friend had red wine...no big deal. I'm not an alcohol drinker. We had truffle fries and it was really good. We had two dozen of the oysters...not the best, but where can you get $1 oysters in the bay area, right? We wanted an outdoor seating, but ended up seating us inside the restaurant. The wait was hella long, and the service was just ok. When I'm about to have a nice conversation, they turned up the music...which makes it even harder to have a listen to the conversation. At one point, I wanted to leave just because the seats are so close together, I was beginning to get clausophobic. Anyways, it will be the last time I go there.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Food and service were at times inconsistent.  For the location, I expected more.  Some dishes were tasty, but others were just not quite right.

Great space, a cool bar, and awesome view of the 3rd Street high-rises: Four Seasons, St. Regis, MOMA...

A good alternative to other restaurant possibilities on a Friday night.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
You finish a long week at work and what sounds better than a beer outside? A few friends suggest that you all meet up at B. You head over and see that the table's a bit cramped. Not jammed but a little lacking in room. You grab a chair and squeeze in. A few seconds later the waiter approaches and barks, "that is so not gonna work". Not, "Sorry, but that's slightly blocking our path. Let's see what else we can do". He basically chastises me and walks away.

So now I'm standing at our table.

Ten minutes pass.

Waitress arrives and pleasantly asks if I'd like a drink. I order a drink.

Twenty minutes later still no drink. Waitress is jovially walking around the restaurant taking drink orders and chatting people up.

I leave.

Thanks for doing everything imaginable to ruin my night, B. Lovely place.

Two stars because I've gone other times and had decent experiences.
author: K F.

description:
Just went there last Friday for Happy Hour drinks and was terribly disappointed.  This place is in a great location and could be a lot more than it is.  The bartenders have a really hauty attitude because they are probably used to dealing with tourists, as they are located in Yerba Buena gardens.  Service is reprehensible and the bartenders don't know their drinks from their backsides!  Lots of mistakes and they refuse to make drinks like their customers ask.  I can only hope that these folks are not around long and give up the really choice space to a deserving establishment.  

If you are a local, opt for the hundreds of other bars in the area that are way better and know how to treat a customer.
author: D H.

description: Beautiful view of YBGC.  Clean, hip interior.  If I lived or worked closer i could see enjoying this place after work.  The truffle fries are superb and the raw oysters were great, as oysters often are.  I'd enjoy coming here for happy hour and I'd be sure to load up on the fries while I take in the view.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: This is just a tough location for a bar.  Not a lot of walking traffic and the Metreon doesn't really act as a draw.  The room is small but comfortable.  Not recommended for a full dinner but works fine for casual food.  Solid happy hour pricing.
author: Laurence H.

description:
I have come here a few times and this place has a pretty cool vibe to it. Overlooks Yurba Buena park and has a really nice outdoor seating area. The server who is usually there is pretty nice. Like this one time, since it's the park right over the side, he offered to take half off our orders if we beatboxed our orders to him because someone in the park was blaring some hiphop music pretty much 15 feet away from us. The humor was much appreciated.
They are a little pricey but they have some good food. I have had the burger so far and the chicken avocado sandwich. Both are delicious but I actually like the chicken avocado the best so far. The burger is good but not the greatest. It's about a 12+ dollar burger from what I remember ... and it's decent but not worth that in my opinion. This place is also right next to work too so it wins in proximity. I like this place overall. It also has a pretty cool looking interior with a sort of modern bar.
author: Greg G.

description:
Love love love the setting, indoor or outdoor, especially when the sun is out. Bread is great. Moses, the bus guy is great and some (not all of the servers are good too).  Love the soundtrack. Happy Memories....

Loved their previous version of risotto (runny and with fava beans). Not such a big fan of the current version, mushrooms with too many scallions. Burgers are juicy. Truffle fries are yummy and crisp and they bring mayo (I hate ketchup) without asking.....Bread is delicious. Vegetable soup looked good (didn't taste it).

Gets crowded when Moscone Center is crowded hosting a conference. But truly a really nice place in SF.....blue sky, green grass, sunshine, nice wine....
author: Hayley S.

description: Came back to B today for lunch with Willie R.  We had a good meal at the bar, wait was a little long for the food but the meal was tasty as usual.
author: Todd F.

description:
B Restaurant is in a fantastic location for meeting up after work for a drink or a lingering weekend meal at the outside tables.  The restaurant has a beautiful bar area.  Servers are friendly.  I tried the scallop ceviche, crab cakes, fillet mignon roulette with Gorgonzola - all of it delicious!!  They are so into seasonal foods, even the cocktails use seasonal ingredients.   Prices are very reasonable for the quality of food you get.  

Try them now before everyone else discovers this gem.

I will definitely be back.
author: Lily C.

description:
Food: 4
atmosphere: 4+!
service: 4

enjoying the open space of Yerba Buena gardens over anything consumable gets a "kick ass" in my book!

portions are dainty and the food good. Drinks, nothing necessarily spectacular, but quite good! 

Bonus: working on your tan over lunch
author: Miss C.

description:
great location for after work cocktails.  the service needs some work, they didn't really seem to know what was going on.  i didn't care much except that every time we needed another drink we had to flag her down.  we sat outside and enjoyed a little serenade from a homeless man.  thanks man, you were rockin it!
the only food we had was the huge pig in a blanket.  i don't really know why people try to make this dish fancy, because really it's just so good just as it is.
author: cristina t.

description:
I went to this place yesterday for the first time with a good friend/relative and his former crush (who, coincidentally, now works for Yelp... but shall remain nameless to protect the innocent).

B Bar is pretty cool... First off, the building itself is impressive. It's a relatively small space with giant windows that look out to the cityscape of downtown SF. And the internal architecture design is very hip and modern. I felt like I was in a trendy NYC bar, or even one in London.

You can either sit at the long bar that takes up more than half the space, or you can grab a table (but good luck doing so after work, 5-7 p.m.). The bar space (where we sat) facilitates good one-on-one conversation, but I imagine it'd be tough to strike up a conversation with random strangers.

There's a DJ, who was great, and really added to the atmosphere. I think every 'chill' after work bar should have a DJ spinning, and B Bar doesn't disappoint here.

Our group didn't have dinner, but we did have a pretty delicious salami/meats plate that I would have again (in fact, folks at B Bar -- Put more salami on the plate!). The manager also sent our group a bowl of fries, which were delicious. 

Speaking of the manager and the rest of the staff, this group is extremely friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable about the wines and such.

Price-wise, B Bar is more on the pricier side. But considering where it's located and the audience it markets to, the prices don't shock me ($7 for a Chimay; $14 for a glass of red, etc.).

B Bar's a nice alternative to the St. Regis after work, and a nice date spot. Just beware the seats at the bar and in the restaurant fill up quickly.
author: Mitch S.

description: hoot for service...and receiving snoot 'n' pout....soma/financial happy hours....$five drinks and small plates....$dollar grimy shucked oysters....$five watery sangria...$ten sangria carafe the better deal (equals three full iced glasses)...following popular earthy truffle fries trends fine....poor order of sliced meats drowning in pool of own grease....sub-par bites and drinks, and service lacking honest cheerful disposition....
author: Hen A.

description:
Went last night for happy hour - my first visit.

- Happy hour goes until 7:30 PM - big draw for me.

- $1 oysters were top notch. Got my choice of 3 kinds.

- $5 Gin Rickey was not awesome, but I didn't really care b/c it was a $5 cocktail.

- Also has the arugula salad and truffle fries for $5 each.

- Bartender was friendly and attentive. However, I did notice some frustration from the folks sitting at tables b/c their server wasn't always around.

- Great spot for locals or tourists - but don't go if there is a convention in town.

Overall, I really liked that they were kind of slow and that the place wasn't a scene. I'll definitely go back for happy hour, but I'm not sure I would be as excited about my experience if I was paying full price.
author: Sarah G.

description: This is a perfect place for Happy Hour! My fave has to be the carafe of Sangria...made the true Spanish way; with rum and brandy. Yummy goodness describes the hh app menu. Also, this is a great place to take the out of town guests....beautiful view of YB Gardens AND you're in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown. Thanks for always making my Friday evenings enjoyable, B Bar :-)
author: Annalies H.

description: Spent a long weekend in San Francisco with my husband and a really good friend. The weather was incredible, so we decided to check this place out after hearing about the view. It was a Friday around 4:30pm and our timing was excellent! We were immediately seated at a table outside and within 30min, the place was packed and people were waiting for seating. It was happy hour, so we ordered some food and drinks. I had the Ginger Rickey, which was refreshing and not too sweet. My husband and friend ordered the Sangria which I also thought was pretty good. Food: they had $1 oysters, so I ordered 4 which were nicely presented and a bargain. We shared the truffle fries, mussels and the buffalo mozzarella. We LOVED the Truffle fries. The outdoor seating scenery is absolutely beautiful! A MUST on a nice day!
author: Windy S.

description: I've been to B Bar for happy hour several times and it's always really fun. There's always an energetic and younger working professional crowd on week nights. There's a good selection of wine and they make very fancy mixed drinks. The truffle fries are amazing! Definitely a fun place to go on a warm day because there are tons of tables and benches outside with a view of the large fountain and the flowers that are in the middle of the Yerba Buena Gardens plaza.
author: Gina C.

description:
Wow....What a controversial place! Where do I being???

Good Points:

-Great view
-Our waiter was very nice and comfortably social (not the moments of weird silence, nervous chatter, etc that you get from some waiters elsewhere)
-My halibut was good
-The mussels were good
-The "love on" drink was pretty good and looked cute with a heart on the top of it made out of syrup

Bad Points:

-My boyfriends tri-tip was cold
-The waiter must have been having a bad night. He tipped over a glass while filling another one with water, spilling water all over our table and us. He also dropped a glass off of a tray while talking to us and broke it.
-My boyfriends alcoholic beverage had a napkin in it! He drank a bit of it and then noticed that what he thought was ice was actually a crinkled up napkin. 
-The menu options are not all that great. As far as "main" courses go, they have tri-tip, a burger, halibut and pork chops. Everything else is appetizer size or smaller.
-I felt that it was a bit pricey for the quantity that you get.
-I am a creme brulee critic and there's had this weird tangy taste to it....Wouldn't order it again.

Although my food was good, the experience in general was awful. Fortunately, I was with a group and we were all able to laugh about it. I will not, however, be going back for round two.
author: Faith H.

description:
Great Happy Hour, but they are getting sloppy.  I've been there a few times since my office is really close by...but 3 mis-haps in one night: 

a) Drink Cocktail (Vodka & Grapefruit), the grapefruit had gone bad...I ordered another drink, which i paid for both

b) Food my colleague ordered had not 1 but 2 hairs on it

c) The bartender while trying to pour beer for someone from the tap...had a mishap and poured beer all over us, though he was too busy to notice, apologize or anything else.  


Again, I've been here a lot...always really good (except their food has never been great...) but this time...so maybe a fluke...or its the beginning of the end.
author: Rebecca W B.

description: Came here for Happy Hour (HH) and ordered  from the HH menu. I had the $1 oysters, french fries, shrimp, arugula salad, and their red sangria.  Everything was delicious.  The space is very nice, as you are surrounded by windows that allows natural lighting into the restaurant.  It's a great spot for when the weather is warm in the Bay Area.  The day that we went, it was cold and so the restaurant was a bit nippy.
author: J G.

description: $1 HH oysters.   $1 HH oyster experience at B is better then at Hog Island or Yabbie's.
author: Wakako U.

description:
This bar has so much potential... unique location, great food, fun cocktails.  It's too bad that the service is awful and the staff is absolutely rude.  I've been here at least 6 or 7 times, and over half of those, we were given unnecessary attitude both from the bartenders and the hostess. 

Some examples:
We missed happy hour and asked if they still served Burrata on the regular menu.  The bartender scoffed at us saying no and that we were too late.  Interestingly enough, they do have a mozzarella/prosciutto item on the regular menu that is the SAME THING as Burrata- he could have just suggested that instead of making us feel stupid for asking if they had an alternative.

On another occasion, we had a group of 8 people that wanted to sit outside.  It was a very foggy/cold day, and NO ONE was in the outdoor seating area.  However, we were told that they couldn't guarantee having enough room outside for a group that size and we couldn't sit together. WTF? Eventually someone figured out that was ridiculous & let us have a table -- it's funny how we were the ONLY ones out there the whole evening. 

I have met the GM, and voiced my concerns to him- he was actually a very nice guy and was extremely apologetic.  It's too bad that when he's not there, his staff ruins the place for him.
author: S K.

description:
On Mother's Day I took both of my maternal units (natural-born and mother-in-law) to B and we were seated at a lovely outdoor table with a million dollar view.  

I can't really give B credit for the atypically San Francisco, sunny & 70 degree day.  But I can say all of their dishes were perfectly executed, their menu was well conceived, and our waiter (and front house staff) was spot on and genuinely cordial. 

I had the pork chop and polenta with scrambled eggs, which may not sound like brunch fare, but completely made sense when I tasted it.  All of our entrees were beautifully prepared and served.  Every diner was perfectly content and satisfied with their meal.

We only ordered from the brunch menu, but I had a look at the dinner menu and was intrigued.  It's not my first choice for location, but when downtown or shopping, B offers a nice little hideaway from the bustle of the city and first-rate food.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is based on one visit for dinner.

First the positives: The space is beautiful-- Nice long bar; comfy bar stools; Tall windows facing Yerba Buena is lovely. Nice wine list. Had a really yummy soup. Conveniently located. I can see it being a great place for happy hour or an after work function.

Then some feedback:
Service: When my table of 6 was there there was only another table of 4 having dinner. Given that it was relatively empty I expected better service. They had given each of us different menus so we had to clarify which menu was the one we should be using.  

Food: I found my ribs chewy. My vegatarian friends thought the one vegetarian entree, the tofu dish, was fine. Taste was not bad, but it was strange to have the tofu dish try to resemble a meat (there was a lotus root in the center to make it look like a bone). Usually vegetarians aren't really into their dishes resembling meat. 
Some cocktails were a hit; some were a miss. One cocktail was great the first time we ordered it and the second time was not very good.  I tried everyone's dishes and in general, it was OK. Like I said though the soup, was really good.

By the way, I frequent the B Restaurant in Oakland and the food/ service really is quite a bit better.  Perhaps the one in SOMA will work out these kinks as they are open longer.
author: Sue P.

description: My sister and I came here for lunch today and were extremely disappointed!  The location was a little bit difficult to find.  I had the spinach benedict and my sister had the lump crab cake.  The restaurant was not crowded, yet it still took more than 20 minutes to get our entrees.  My spinach benedict was pretty good and my sister's crab cake was tasty, but one thing I can't stand is bad service and long waits!
author: Jen P.

description: Given B's location it could easily turn into a commercial, convention center dive.  Instead it's a streamlined, clean cocktail joint in spectacular surroundings.  Drinks are good, balanced, and sometimes clever.  Would you care for a Lemony Snicket, a phrase which here means "a mixture of citrus, vodka, and mint"?   I recommend B during the day as an alternative to the stuffier and more touristy The View Lounge when you want a nice cocktail and some nicer scenery.
author: Luke M.

description:
was very upscale and id imagine that if there was sun during the day it could get very hot inside.

The drinks during happy hour were reasonable priced. good place to stop after movie at metreon
author: ryan g.

description:
First off, the bar is gorgeous.  The atmosphere is fun and perfect for a few drinks after work.  Unfortunately after the drinks, you absolutely must go somewhere else to eat.  The food is horrible.  

On my recent visit, all of the people I dined with were really disappointed with their meals.  The mussels were overcooked to the texture of rubber bands and the broth had no depth of flavor.  We ordered the asparagus and poached egg.  The egg was completely overcooked.  The overdressed cesar salads were made of chopped iceberg lettuce instead of Romaine.  And the gazpacho....    I don't even know where to begin.  It was completely inedible.  It was thick and somewhat pungent, I gagged when I tasted.  

Go for the drinks and the atmosphere.   There are a million better places to grab a meal.  In fact, any place would be better than B for a meal.
author: Aldo G.

description: We came for Happy hour & it was SOOOOO CROWDED!  Seating is very limited, so expect to order at the bar and hover.  You can order drinks and take them outside, but not the food.  The service was quick and efficient and I enjoyed the oysters, so I'll come back during a non happy hour time to relax and enjoy the beautiful location.
author: Autumn C.

description: This is a great place for happy hour, it's really open & light in there as there are no walls just windows! Great if you need a quick cheap spot to impress an out of towner, I have the $5 happy hour cocktails Love on is a great  drink and I like that they use a decent vodka (skyy) so you wont feel like you just fell from it the next morning, as alot of places do with house or happy hour drinks. bar food is good, they have $1 oysters (im not a fan) but my girlfriend ordered them and said they were good.
author: Courtney D.

description: I used to come here fairly often because my bf at the time is a dj and he threw some summer parties during the day.  I love their spicy bloody Mary with the piece of bacon.  And, I love bacon so much I usually just order a side of bacon with every meal there.  Their truffle fries are my favorite.  So you can't go wrong with the bloody mary's but they have/had two types:  Spicy and extra spicy.  Both are yum but the spicier one helped me pace myself through the day.  Oh, and during the day, on a nice sunny day, the place heats up like a green house!  Talk about a sauna!
author: Rosalind S.

description: He says (about women), "Hot, smart or not crazy. Pick two." I think similarly regarding restaurants: cool ambiance, tasty eats or good service. At B, the space is understated and filled with sunshine, perched at the top of the good weed gardens with killer view from the terrace. The menu reflects the environment, simple but wonderfully fresh and delectable. Full bar too. Yip. Now I adore the beloved Boxed Foods & Oakland B crew (who brought us this new B) and I understand it takes a bit to get in the groove especially when eight of us wander in unexpectedly, but if the food comes out at the rate it did Yelp would have to extend my lunch hour. Umm, so which two is it? And wait, what about me?!
author: Ligaya T.

description: If you're wondering what B stands for, it's not really Burger but darn it all, it should be. You get a big hunk of ground chuck, seasoned and grilled to perfect. While in the past I've been a medium rare sort of character,  I'm moving towards medium in my old age. However you like, get some cheddar on that thing, chow down, and say hello to owner Don for me.
author: Nish N.

description:
Okay okay, me too.  What a FANTASTIC spot!  They were so wonderful to us at the Yelp event yesterday - Don was great and we were spoiled rotten.  
The inside space is beautifully designed - sleek and serene.  The cocktails were great and the menu sounds scrummy.  I know the steak skewers and endive cups with blue cheese and nuts that I had were both excellent.
I love that it's somewhat hidden and that on a nice day I can get a bottle of wine and sit outside enjoying this fantastically beautiful city from the shelter of Yerba Buena Gardens.  Now who do I need to see about ordering up some nice days. . ?
**Edit**
Okay, I've been back to try the food.  My menage a chicken was good, and the most fun chicken three way ever.  Who knew chicken could be so kinky?  The airplane kind was drryyyyy and I will kick your ass if you try to eat even the tiniest bite of the tempura one, or the thigh, just so you know.  You can have the airplane kind.  The white chocolate mousse dessert was amazing, but even more impressive was the grouping of flavors in the chocolate cake - walnuts, apples and lavender syrup?  Holy hotcakes it was good.  Especially with the lip smackin' madeira Saucy Yelper picked out (to the delight of the bartender).  The service was excellent, yet again (thanks for the mousse guys!  Yum!).
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Perched atop of Moscone Center North and overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens, B is a great place to grab a meal. Its proximity to Moscone Center makes it ideal for those attending a conference there, and the garden location provides tranquility in the middle of the city. Seating inside is a bit limited, but you don't want to dine in there anyway. Grab a table on the outside patio! The view is spectacular!

Service was good (aside from the fact that they refused to split the bill for the table over more than three credit cards) and the food was pleasant. The portions were perfect and left me feeling satisfied, though not overstuffed. I had the Farfalle Pasta with the Vegetable Bruschetta as an appetizer. I also tried some of one of their paninis. It wasn't what I was expecting, but in a good way!  The food was all very wholesome. Definitely consider B if you're near Moscone Center.
author: David W.

description: I'm no so sure what to think about this place. I love the outdoor seating and the location, but no heat lamps? In San Francisco?? And the wines by the glass list was really slim. But I did enjoy my wine while surrounded by wonderful friends. I'll give this place another shot when it warms up again.
author: Jen D.

description: Great location with nice views (2 stars for that), but we had extremely unfriendly service. Our server was just really rude from the moment we sat down until we left.  For some reason, he treated us like he was annoyed we were even there. We're always friendly (extra friendly actually, since my father used to work in a restaurant), and we weren't annoying drunks (only one drink apiece), so I don't know what his problem was. From what we observed, it seemed like he was that way with most of his tables. We were so tempted not to leave a tip, but we didn't want to gyp the other staff who actually did their jobs. As for the food, I had the strawberry salad with shrimp. The salad was decent, but the shrimp was WAY over salted, almost like putting spoonfuls of salt in my mouth. My friend liked her arancini with crab and the polenta appetizer. Based on our first-time experience, we won't return here. There are just too many other places in the area that have good service and good food without the attitude.
author: Maria V.

description:
yelp advertiser or not, sorry  darling jeremy s, this place was just plain awful.

i shall never return to this place again.  and i never look back.  there are way too many good places in sf, why put myself through the same torture twice? and for me to write in CAPS means serious business. B Bar is officially on my blacklist.

our server RYAN never served us.

1. RYAN tells us he will be back in a few minutes

2. after no service and 20 mins later, RYAN comes back and RUDELY yells at us that we should never have been seated by the hostess.

3. Now, we were the only table not served and somehow, any table with guys were served by lovely RYAN.  we were all girls...now, i'm not alluding to anything but...i may have had better service has i been a guy.

4.  we asked the hostess for the manager who NEVER came by until we asked twice.  his name is KEVIN BEST. he apologizes but it's wasted.
do a better job and you won't have to apologize sweetheart. 

why they get one star...
for the frazzled and sweaty bartender TROY who was a doll and served our table from behind the bar even though he would get in trouble.  He felt bad that he had to break the news that they were out of the oysters after we waited 45mins.

So, on a lovely sf day and if you still want to come here despite my warnings...buy a drink at the bar and seat your fabulous selves.
author: Anh V.

description: Fantastic!  I love the setting for happy hour after work and the pulled pork sandwich at lunchtime can't be beat!
author: Melissa D.

description: Great atmosphere, great food and bartender Grant makes a mean martini. For summertime, the Ginger Rickey is a welcome distraction from the bustling foot traffic of Moscone Center.
author: John G.

description: Wow what terrible service - very poor bartending. Some friends and I went here for a couple drinks after work. It was packed with people so we stuffed ourselves in a corner. Waited to order drinks, waited a little longer. Asked for a vodka cranberry, got a vodka tonic. Were served martinis that were overpowered with vermouth. Vermouth is great in a martini, just not in excess. Went back to the bar asked to get a tastier martini, bartender replies that he served us a "classic cocktail" and refuses to remake them. I don't want to devote any more effort writing a review for this place. I've already spent more than enough attention (& money) on B bar. It sucks.
author: Kevan M.

description: This bar has a great location, great scenery, great architecture and a really great bar menu. We went for happy hour on a Friday and by 6pm it was packed with locals. The happy hour menu was very reasonable with $5 drinks. We didn't eat but saw some of the food that was served and it looked good. The bar is located in the Financial/Museum district and has a lovely view of the city and is well worth the trip down to that part of town.
author: Aunny B.

description:
It's one of the hottest days of the year and my coworker and I are going back and forth about where to go for lunch. I recall B restaurant and bar. OK! agreed! OMG it's like already 11:30AM. Let's hurry and beat the lunch rush, because on a day like today every lunch place outdoors and with aircon is going to be crowded. We were there by noon. All the tables inside had been taken, but that's OK. There were plenty of seats at the bar and outside. My co-worker and I decided to sit outside and work on our tan. 
Our server was really prompt and poured us each a pint glass filled with ice water. He was back promptly to take our order. Sadly the fish monger did not show up yet. They were out of Halibut and shrimp. However, they still had mussels. We opted to split the chicken sandwich ( which was divine) , share the mussels and arugula salad. Yum! hit the spot. Full but now weighed down. 
Enjoyed the sun while walking back to the office. Now enjoying the nice cool aircon. burr perhaps I need to put a sweater on.
author: Jennifer S.

description: What I really like about B Bar is the summer courtyard feel that this place gives off.  Very cool vibe.  The sangria was ok, but I ended up sticking with beers after the first carafe.  One thing I have to point out is that they didnt have any Trumer available that day and that they ran out of Sangria after a few orders.  Not cool.  Stay stocked up.  Nevertheless, I would still come back for happy hour, complete with a few orders of truffle fries, on a nice sunny day.
author: Bert N.

description: Oh, of course the service is attractive; it features that cute girl from Boxed Foods.  Does anyone know her name?  Do you think she would be my best friend?  And, yes, the interior is damn fine too.  Jeremy nails it; hard to go wrong with a view of city lights from any bar stool.  And the outside tables (how DID they do that?  Those owners must be really savvy)...the farthest table in the back (outside), on a warm night, is quite possibly the loveliest place in the City.  And that guy who is always there - Don?  (I think he might be the manager?)  So nice!
author: Pammy C.

description:
I'm conflicted about B but I've been enough times that I owe it to them and my elite status to review it. 

I give them props for the location and view. If you want to impress a visitor, let them marvel in the beauty of gardens and fancy architecture here. Food is hit or miss. The burger is the clear winner of the establishment but be prepared for a hefty, greasy mess in the process. Chicken sandwich is a disappointment and the BLT looked pretty average. Beer selection is respectable for a pseudo-schmancy place. What really drops B down to 3 stars is the service. With Moscone, several hotels, and office buildings in the surroundings, this place fills up for lunch. Half of the seating (excluding outside) is at the bar. Having only one bartender to service the entire bar of 15+ patrons, plus make the drinks for the entire restaurant, is unacceptable and plain stupid. For the sake of using the 'sandwich' method for providing critical feedback, B is a great place to grab a drink, sit for a while, and soak in the sun. :)
author: Susan L.

description: If you are looking for an after work hang out, this should be it!  They have a great happy hour, including their sangria that is cheap and delicious.  Their other special happy hour cocktails live up to the bar as well.  The light bites are quite nice too, the spring rolls were a great bar snack!  The space is small but if you get there earlier enough a spot at the bar is ideal.  The location is also amazing, it's right over the park and the bar is nothing but windows, which adds to the setting.  B Bar rocks!
author: Steven K.

description:
B Bar makes me sound like I have a stutter. 
But it also makes me really happy.
One of my dearest introduced me to this beautiful and oh so romantic spot one night.
As we climbed the steps and looked out over the view, I told her "I might fall in love with you tonight." Ha.
We ordered a couple glasses of delicious rosé and a wonderful assortment of (my favorite!) cheese.
Factor in the always wonderfully insightful and intelligent conversation with the girl, and you have a recipe for five stars. 
You will have to provide your own friend, but B Bar will provide the wine, cheese, view and friendly service.
Cheers!
author: A W.

description:
B Restaurant located in Yerba Buena Gardens is a great little "gastro pub" type place. Food is great and consistent and you get a filling meal for the price (important during these times!). Happy hour is packed, but don't be daunted by the crowds, get your 1$ oysters and 5$ cocktails, I have paid far more for a mixologist type cocktail in this city and you really can't complain about the wait to get a bartender with you know your paying 1/2 of what you would pay else where. 
The only downfall of this place is the lack of heat lamps, I actually asked them about this on one of my visits and they would LOVE the have heat lamps, but it is a Yerba Buena rule that they cannot have them unless they pay someone to sit there and "watch" the heat lamps to make sure there are no accidents or whatever. Sounds silly to me but sometimes city parks & venues have ridiculous rules. 
Over all a great, casual, mellow, delicious place to eat!

PS for all you Oakland peeps check out their sister restaurant in Old town, same great vibe, name & happy hour but with a more diverse dinner menu.
author: Eden F.

description:
It's always nice to have a pleasant experience at a restaurant I stumble across accidentally.

Some friends and I went to B to have drinks for a birthday. I had never heard of it before, nor did I know where it was. I was impressed the moment I walked in to the restaurant, which is perched on top of Yerba Buena Gardens. B's interior is sophisticated, modern and elegant while also managing to be warm and inviting. It's a hard combination to turn out, but B does it with ease. Sitting by candlelight surrounded by the restaurant's glass walls with downtown SF sparkling in the background was a decidedly glamorous experience.

So after tipping back a few of B's cocktail specials (more details below), we were naturally hungry. The menu looked promising, so we decided to stay and eat. I'm glad we did. I started out with the roasted beet and blue cheese salad, which was very good. There were many interesting choices on the menu for my main course, but the one that jumped out at me was the burger. This is partly because I just so happened to feel like eating a burger that night (a rare occurrence for me) and partly because said burger was topped with fried feta, fried basil leaves and a roasted tomato sauce. It was totally over the top and utterly delicious. The accompanying potato and bacon salad was a tasty, if very decadent, complement.

The table shared three desserts: a milk chocolate mousse with strawberries, a cabernet sorbet with apples and meringue, and a bread pudding with root beer reduction. Other people at my table liked the mousse; I didn't. I like dark chocolate, and the mousse wasn't chocolaty enough for me. The cabernet sorbet was a very interesting flavor/texture combination -- the icy sorbet, the crisp apples, and the crunchy meringue. Overall, I liked it very much. The bread pudding with vanilla ice cream and root beer reduction could have been truly spectacular; the flavors were beautiful together, but the texture had problems. It arrived at the table with the reduction in a miniature root beer mug. (Nice touch.) Once the reduction was poured over the pudding and ice cream, though, it hardened and stuck to everything -- plate, spoons, teeth. Still, the flavors went so well together that I went back for numerous bites and just dealt with the stickiness. Really, though, the chef should play with this recipe a bit, because fully realized, it would be one of the best desserts I've had in a while.

The cocktail menu was fun. I ordered several "Thunder Kats" -- tequila and grapefruit juice served up with a cilantro salt rim. It was tasty and strong, but I would have loved to have tasted more cilantro on the rim. The real standout, though, was the dill Gibson. The gin, dill and cocktail onions were quite a combo.

Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable, and the host was very accommodating, especially considering our last-minute party of 9.

Recommended.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description: Great for brunch! Try the smokey-vodka Bloody Mary.
author: Heirloom Z.

description: B has a lot of promise and I'm really excited about the location, the food and the restaurant itself.   We stopped in on Saturday for the opening party.  Loved the crowd (eclectic SF at its best, with a bike crew in the corner and mixed age groups throughout), and the nibbles we tried were so yummy they left us wanting more.  Three stars for now b/c we didn't eat much, but I'm looking forward to going back for lunch or dinner!
author: Kristen N.

description: Great happy hour hangout with some of the best $5 cocktails I've ever had! Now, I'm normally a purist--only beer and wine for this girl--but B's Love drink with champagne, vodka and raspberry puree topped off with a cute (or cheesy?) heart made of strawberry syrup just might have me converted! Great rendezvous spot to meet that special someone or that random tech guy you met at the Moscone center during some conference.
author: Natalie T.

description: I've only had the complimentary Yelpatizers here, they were delicious: endive with blue cheese & candied nuts, BBQ steak skewers and pecorino veggie tarts. The space is just gorgeous, I think it used to house "Clouds" but now it's got a modern, classic feel. I like the vast airy feel of the space and enjoying a Trumer Pils outside in the sunshine.
author: Colleen B.

description: Happy Hour till 7pm!!!  That's all.  Wait!  Few more words...I work till 6pm.  Other places have happy hour from 4-6pm. =(  No one thinks of the little Asian girl.  Last thing: great homemade potato chips.
author: Lisa L.

description: I make it a point to not judge a place solely on their lunch menu and service, unless of course it's strictly a lunch-type place (or only has one menu). So, before I could make any real judgment on B Restaurant, I went twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. I have to say, dinner was better, although lunch was good. My recollection of lunch is a little hazy, but I do remember having delicious fries. Dinner was fantastic... great soup, yummy sauces for the oysters and a yummy yummy tofu dish as my entree. I really appreciated the fact that B Restaurant even had a strictly vegetarian entree on the menu that wasn't risotto or portobello mushrooms (which I like, but for the love of god I get tired of eating them). Overall it was great and the location is really beautiful.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Been here twice and plan to keep coming back! Lunch is tasty, had their sandwhich with a salad and my coworkers grabbed the hot dog, flank steak, and the rest of the food with tons of personality. 

Went back the other night with a friend, we ordered a pitcher of their sangria but they were sold out! poo. But fear not, they know how to run a joint, we got a cocktail on the house, their drink with love on top (trademark pink drink that can get anyone shitfaced after probably 3 or 4) was absolutely tasty! That night I ordered their burger...lean, tasty and juicy and complimented with their "adult ketchup" which was laced with tequila....genius. The ambiance is absolutely the coolest, the service kinda lags when it gets busy, but the servings for a swanky place like this is hearty, menu choices are fun and different, drinks are tasty, the servers all have a great sense of humor and the prices for the downtown area are great! Seriously, candle lit glass room that is beautiful both during the day and evening is one thing, but to lace your condiments with tequila and still keep it classy? I like this place.
author: Kristen R.

description: If you go for no other reason, go for their homemade sangria and their truffle fries.  Amazing, really amazing.  They have happy hour specials too, and their view is very unusual and pretty for the city.
author: Jenn K.

description: They have unique drinks, but I was expecting the place to be bigger. The waiter was a bit anal. We were not allowed to order drinks from the bar b/c we had the waiter, but what about those people who were only staying for a drink, wouldn't that make life a little easier when splitting the bill? peculiar!
author: Anita C.

description: this place is pretty tight. it is located inside the yerba buena gardens, next to the metreon. the view is fantastic and the happy hour specials are awesome. we had the sangria, which was only $10 for a huge carafe. didn't try any food, but what i saw looked good and fancy. prices for food and drinks are very reasonable during happy hour, especially considering where you are. this is definitely a place to check out if you work downtown and need a bite & a drink after work, especially on a nice/sunny day.
author: Andrew T.

description: Went here Monday after work (who am I kidding - I've been jobless for years now!) for a drink or two with friends.  A friendly bartender mixed with great views of Yerba Buena from their outside patio.  Yes, it was pleasant, but they weren't serving food (no food service on Mondays)!  This place seems to be popular among the after-work business crowds.  Shmeah.
author: Scott G.

description:
b bar is perched on the second level of moscone center, adjacent to the metreon and right above yerba buena gardens.  it makes for an interesting juxtaposition, because it feels like you're nestled in a serene little oasis in the middle of an urban jungle.  the surrounding high rises are a constant reminder that you're very much in the center of the city, but somehow when you're here, the pace just slows down.

because i love the location so much, i've been here for brunch, dinner, and several happy hours ($7 appetizers and $5 specialty drinks from the list... their pear shandy - pilsner with fresh pear juice - is refreshingly good), and while the food is decent, its not the most memorable.  

but the service... eh,  the staff just never seems to warm up.   

last night we were there to celebrate a friends birthday and we were the only group in the restaurant the whole time from 6-9pm.  while it was nice having the place to ourselves, the service should have been more attentive.  when you're the only patrons, its pretty hard to justify slow service.

i brought in a cake, and the hostess was nice enough to offer to cut and plate it for us in the kitchen.  as a thank you, i told her and the 2 guys in the kitchen to feel free to have some, and her response was...

"oh we already did, thanks."

ummm, what?
  
first of all... awkward!  how does one even respond to that?    
second... what if i wasn't okay with you digging into our cake?

sigh.  

it's such a disconnect.  i just wish i could love this restaurant as much as i love the space and location.
author: Helen L.

description: This B restaurant deserves a C-!! Sure the view is fantastic but the service was mediocre and the food so so. I ordered an Anchor Steam and ended up with a Heffy instead. Reason being from the wait staff was that they were out of the Anchor Steam and just decided to give me another beer instead. ..without any of my decision. Ceviche was good and the truffle fries were so so but waiting for them took fooooorrreevvvver! yikes!
author: Djoe p.

description:
They call it B Bar, not A+ Bar, and that's about right.
I LOVED B Bar's location - in Yerba Buena Gardens, next to Samovar Tea Lounge - it overlooked the whole city, and I went on a beautiful, sunny Friday afternoon. The happy hour drinks were $5.00 each, which I consider a steal anywhere outside of the mission. I had a ginger/gin cocktail, which was perfect in the heat. Sure, it was a little a yuppy, but what place downtown during happy hour isn't? 

The one that TOTALLY lacked about this place was the totally inept service. Before the place got busy the bartender was a pretty nice guy. But he (and the other bartender, and bar back, and GM) all cracked under the pressure of the 6 o'clock cocktail rush, resulting in really terrible service. A friend and I watched him try to perfect a lemon curl three times - he finally gave up after 10 minutes.

I am hoping this is just growing pains, and they'll get their act together asap, because I really liked the location and drinks, but the service was the pits.
author: Hilary W.

description: Great spot for happy hour! If it's sunny especially great as tons of nice outdoor seating. Loved the $1 oysters and highly recommend the truffle fries as well. Not too crowded which is a treat.
author: Sarah R.

description: I have been coming back to this place five times so far and found it to be great location with very good food. I especially like the way no one has discovered it yet. The bartenders are personable, prices are very modest, but the music could use some work. This is a great place to go when you are hungry or thirsty and the SFMOMA cafe is full.  If you have not gone yet I suggest you do before you can't get a seat without waiting. Afterall, not waiting is the best part of anywhere you go in SF.
author: Brian J.

description: Amazing atmosphere because of all the glass and the outdoor seating.  It was a nice warm night when we went and the sunset was awesome.  The drinks weren't horrible.  The food wasn't horrible but not amazing.  Go here for drinks.
author: Christopher L.

description: I did enjoy the food but the ambiance is what really got me.  I especially enjoyed all the windows around the restaurant.  If the weather is nice you can sit outside and appreciate the city view.  Service was great also.
author: Christina C.

description: The restaurant & bar had beautiful decor and a spectacular view of the city, but that did not make up for the shitty waiter service and the restaurant's lack of preparation.  The waiter seem like a little punk that they just yanked from the street and put to work.  He was rude and impatient.  On top of that, it was a Saturday night around 7-ish, and they were out of quite a few items on the menu.  Since we had a party of 8, the punk waiter had the nerve to charge us full gratuity for bad servcie. If I was the owner of this place, I would be seriously worried.  Needless to say, we will not be coming back here again.
author: V 2.

description: On a sunny afternoon, came here with some coworkers and had a drink, pomme frites, and mixed nuts.  The pommes frites was delicious!  It's nice and relaxing to sit outside and just chat.  Would recommend going if you're in the area, but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to go.
author: Irene C.

description:
Disappointing experience.  I showed up at 7:05 for a 7:00 reservation, and the maitre'd/manager looked blankly at me and said, "You're late."  He looked at his reservation book (a spiral notebook) and commented that someone had bad handwriting; he clearly thought our reservation was for an earlier time.  A group was already seated at our table.
We sat at the bar and were comp'd a salad, until we sat down at around 7:40.  Service was mediocre, food passable.  Wouldn't go back, I'm afraid.
author: Lauren J.

description:
I have been here a few times and will come back.  Came for happy hour with co-workers, great drinks and good times.   Came back for brunch, was fine.  I think my fellow 'brunchers' were happy.   I thought the service was fine, not too slow, not overly obnoxious.  (But then again after NYC, any customer service in the restaurant business is step up).

I gave it  only four stars because I came back again on a Monday to find it closed (at 6pm).  No reason why, no note, nothing.....just closed.  Was bummed, because it was a beautiful day and I really needed a drink and the sun.

I am torn because I want this place to succeed and therefore you need people to come, however one of the reasons why I like this place is that it is hardly ever packed at happy hour......which is a welcome change from the crowded, obnoxious situations you find in the financial district (which is why I run away after work!)

I am sure I will again venture here, I just hope it is open next time.

Follow-up: I changed this to 3 stars because they need to post their actual hours!  I went again on Monday and it was closed again (perhaps I need to learn my lesson),  It is just a little misleading that their hours clearly posted on their door include Monday and they are clearly not open on that day!  It just sucks to waste a nice outdoor happy hour sitting indoors.
author: Lara F.

description: I love this place for cocktails, it has nice modern ambiance, nice staff. Not pretentious at all. We have had a couple of our company parties there, at night, and they treated us like royalty. I loved it. The food was not ALL five stars (we had several different appetizers), but when paired with the service and ambiance, overall I would return again and again.
author: sophia c.

description: The food did not sit so well with me here and it took us about 10 years to get our second round of drinks, which we ordered to pair with the meal but didn't arrive until we were all done.
author: Leigh M.

description:
I rented out B Restaurant for a private event (my big birthday party!) - everything was fabulous and I honestly cannot imagine how the party could've gone any better. All the guests enjoyed the food, I tried it all myself and it was superb - just what I was looking for, interesting and delicious.  I also got tons of compliments from my guests on the service from the waitstaff and bartenders - everyone amazed at how courteous and helpful the staff was - and some of the staff had to stay until 2 AM and clean up at the end.  Misty, the event planner, is awesome - I was very particular about food and she helped me get exactly what I wanted , and arranged a tasting of hour d'oeuvres;  she took care of heater rental, worked with me on the custom drink menu, arranged for the waitstaff to chill and pour the huge 9L bottle of champagne we bought, let our DJ use the restaurant's sound system, and generally helped me make my birthday into a smashing success.

The space is unique, because it opens right into Yerba Buena Gardens and you have this gorgeous huge outdoor terrace with stunning views (on a clear night - I lucked out!)  Also there are no residential neighbors so you can play music and be as loud as you want - we had one of our speakers outside and most of the dancing was actually on the terrace, there aren't many places in SF you can do that in.

If you are looking for a venue in SF to have a private cocktail/dance party with food for 70+ people, this is it - sure it ain't cheap, and all our guests were having such a great time at the open bar we blew through our budget and then some - but it will make for one memorable event.
author: Jane N.

description: I've been here a handful of times, looking for an oasis from the Metreon's harsh lighting. It's always been very nice. The service last night, though, was so good it seems worth mentioning. We came in almost at closing, ordered extremely cheap fare, and instead of being rushed out, we were allowed to remain and treated very graciously. Also, I haven't eaten here but I can report that the drinks are very good and the location, interior design and location are awesome.
author: V. J. L.

description:
Ok. So I'm not Yelp Elite. I don't have half a million Yelp reviews.  The one Yelp review I wrote was found useful by only 2 persons. Blah blah blah. What can I say? This girl stays busy. Nahwhattamean? But you'll never guess what happened. My BFF, Valarie, invited me to a Yelp event and you know I was all over it. (I know what your thinking. Ugh, this girl's a user. Whatev!)  I was priviliged to meet all these uber cool Yelp employees, including the Stoppleman brothers.  Dem kids are some cool cats, btw. Jeremy didn't say much. All he wanted to know was "How many reviews have you written?" My mouth dropped. I thought to myself "Oh shit. They are serious about reviews. WTH, am I doing here?!" Indeed, I felt like such a poser, an imposter. But only for a split second. What could I say? The Yelp CEO was asking how many reviews I had. Only one, goddamn it, I thought. But I lied and said I had 170. Yes, a far cry from the one review that I wrote 2 years ago.  But Mike Stoppleman blew my cover. Damn you,  Mike! Then Jeremy, without flinching, said "You're lying!" And all I could do was blush. Sigh... Another Chimay please. PRONTO!

Oh yeah, B's cool. The horsd'oeuvres were ok. The sangria was good and I was introduced to Chimay beer. Yummy. The ambiance in that place is nice. Chic.  You know? Good place to be seen. Ooh la la. They have party nights which I plan to check out in the very near future.

It also  tends to draw in escapees from Shafter & Bakersfield.  What's up with that?!

Love ya, Yelp!
author: Judith S.

description: What a cool place for drinks!  Their hours were a little annoying in the beginning as they always seemed to be closed during peak periods but seems that's been worked out.  Had such a fun time - happy hour prices are a deal and yet another groovy spot in the city w/ $1 oysters!  The setting is what makes the place ... sipping well-made cocktails outdoors while hearing the waterfall and gazing out at the city as the sun sets ... hmmm, I don't think I can wait till Friday!
author: Sara M.

description:
This place serves, hands-down, the juiciest and thickest pork chop.  I normally eat very small servings of meat, but I honestly wanted to take this thing by the fist and eat it caveman-style.  Even when I had it the next day (it was too big to finish in one sitting), it was still very flavorful and moist.  I am impressed at how B was able to infuse flavor into the center of the thick chop without causing the outer portions of the chop to become overly salty.   

The other items our group tried were much more disappointing, expensive, and rather gimmicky (e.g., the rattlesnake salad).  The waitress failed to tell members in our group that some of the entrees were actually small plates; they had entree-like prices, so it was confusing.
author: Ana L.

description: Tasty tapas and a great view!  The Halibut Ceviche is magnificent... great flavor and served with a side of giant potato chip medallions.  Great for lunch or dinner.  An elegant way to enjoy Yerba Beuna Gardens.
author: Seth G.

description: On a nice day, this has to be one of the best happy hour spots. In fact, I'm getting happy right now just thinking about happy hour. I've always loved Yerba Buena gardens for its great location and lovely view of downtown, so naturally putting a bar on the roof is a great idea. Standard happy hour drinks and appetizer otherwise, but service with a smile will keep me coming back here for sure.
author: Keyvan R.

description: The food was amazing! I had a mimosa, soft scrambled eggs (weekend brunch menu), and the strawberry sorbet. I went the day after my birthday and they comped the sorbet...very cool! The only downfall was the wait. I didn't feel forgotten, just that the staff was slow to bring my sorbet and my check. I was clearly done with my meal and I still had to ask for the check. The outdoor seating area was wonderful...lots of sunshine. Overall, great experience.
author: Jenna T.

description:
i had brunch post-viewing of the delightful "waitress" over at the metreon.  my best friend had been eyeing the place and we finally went in.  the place was pretty much empty with a few couples sprinkled for good measure.  started off with the pear pilsner cocktail.  the last drops the best with all the pear puree settling to the bottom.  not so classy stirring with my butter knife, but i do so anyhow.  

i had the fritatta because of all the lovely pies i had seen on the big screen.  it was artfully displayed.  an A for presentation!  the favors were a little bland despite the spicy sausage.  the waiter was very attentive coming by every 10 minutes.  very chatty and curious about our thoughts on the menu since it's still "evoloving".  would go back to check out how it has evolved.
author: Sharlene C.

description:
if you've got out-of-towners visiting, get them up here quick.  you could go to see the Frida Kahlo exhibit at MOMA then cross the street and have oysters and cocktails here and enjoy the breeze across the patio and the view of the park.

my friend and i sizzled in the sun on the patio next to a giant skylight, but i wouldn't worry about that on the other 364 days of the year.  my friend ordered a blood orange juice and vodka screwdriver and it was delish!  we tried all the oysters and they were all nice and fresh, but i loved the mignonette sauce with shallots and vinegar. 

the crowd was definitely classy (business types in suits), but not too classy for your momma and her pretty muumuu.
author: Holly B.

description: We came for lunch on a quiet Sunday after visiting SFMOMA across the street. Four of us were quickly seated inside.  A pitcher of fresh pressed coffee, and excellent cream of asparagus soup soon arrived.  Our choices of salmon tar-tine, hamburger, and eggs Benedict on brioche were good.  Then things went downhill: Caesar salad with chicken was terrible, --all romaine lettuce (cheap) and chewy, stringy chicken (possibly previously frozen?).  I wanted to send the salad back, but the wait staff basically ignored us after delivering the food.  No staff member asked us the standard "Is everything all right."   There are so many other far better comparably priced restaurants within a very short walking distance (Lulu, Oola, Zero Zero, Samovar, etc.), that I would not return here.
author: Larry H.

description: Really Good Food...perhaps the best hamburger ever.  A little pricey, but hey it's San Francisco, and like I said...best hamburger ever.  They also have a nice selection of scotch and tequila.  Good service, seating inside and out.  It is definitely a bar although a somewhat classy one, so don't come if you are looking for either 5 star ambiance or homey San Francisco curl up in a corner cafe.
author: E R.

description: pre-thanksgiving cocktails! my bloody mary was spiced up with sriracha, which had a great kick with the horseradish, but i asked for it dirty and i don't think they realized i literally meant for some olive juice. either way, it was tasty and the truffle fries were a great finger food. but, really, it's the location and looking over the park that makes this place awesome!
author: Marjie T.

description: The similarity to a Bgrade movie is useful. Actors/actresses posing as waiters until Cassavetes discovers them in a beautiful lunch counter as they exude that attitude of "ennui" until the bit part to be filmed for that  Edvard Munch like SCREAM..."where is my SANGRIA, PUTA?! Venga, Venga, Venga!!!" The day rate is high, but looks count in the Bgrade movie and professionalism, meh....LOOKS always count for at least two stars ...in terms of location, location hunting....think of the number of times JUST the orange Golden Gate Bridge needs to get flashed for people around the world to immediately visually know the location is San Francisco, Californicated.
author: miriam b.

description: Been here twice because I love the fries and my friend loves oysters.  All the food I've tried is pretty good.  Their signature pink cocktail (Love On?) tastes like cough syrup but I really liked this mango concoction on their happy hour menu.  It does get crowded around 6-7 but I haven't found the service to be bad at all.  Nice views and location.  The people seem to be a slightly older crowd - most come in groups to have dinner and drinks.
author: Nilar H.

description: Came here for brunch with a fairly large group.  Service was nice, though a bit slow.  The food was terrible.  I felt sick all day after eating here.  The only reason I would go back is for the location.
author: S S.

description:
Looking for lunch before a MOMA visit, we decided on B, and were very glad we did.   They rearranged seating a bit so we could have a table inside, as it was still chilly on the lovely patio.
Service could not have been nicer, and the food was very good.  Excellent crab cakes, and smoked salmon.  Loved this place, looking forward to going back.
author: Trina O.

description: Went there for happy hour, not such as good deal. $1 oysters were a bit small. $5 truffles fries were good. $5 sangria was pretty good too. The waiter was even super nice to give me a free refill. I gave it two stars because there wasn't anything on the menu llike sliders or something that would fill me up.
author: David M.

description:
This place is kind of scitzo. When we got there they had a sign at the outside host stand that said, "please wait to be seated." We waited behind another couple for over 10 mins in the misty cold. No one ever came out so we finally went in. We asked a guy (who turned out to be the manager) if there was a host and his response was "we all kind of host." Obviously not a perfect system. He took our name and told us 30 min for a table, but 10 min later a busser came over to ask again because the manager had forgotten my name (and obviously hadn't written it down yet.) At that point, at least 2 other parties were ahead of us. 

We ordered drinks and appetizers from the bar. The bartenders were very nice but their drink specials were odd. Mixing wines with alcohol is kind of strange. Other people were commenting that their drinks were funny tasting, too. In the mean time, dining tables opened up and people who has just walked in were seated. We reminded the bartender that we were waiting, as were the other people ahead of us. He said that the people were moved from outside tables because they were cold and since we were at the bar he assumed we didn't want a table anymore. Really? We all opted not to sit outside for just that reason and somebody who comes after us and is dumb enough to try the outside gets our table?  I thought the bar was where most restaurants wanted us to wait. I've worked in restaurants for years and never heard that you loose your table if you order from the bar. He could tell we were upset so he comped the first round of drinks and our appetizer. Good man. 

There also seemed to be some sort of strange music war going on. The music kept switching between a Rolling Stones CD and more modern stuff, with the volume going crazy high at times and songs getting cut off abruptly in the middle. The music wasn't bad, but the up and down, back and forth was distracting.

When we finally got a table (70 min later) there was some confusion with the check, we didn't actually have a server, no one checked on us at all. We asked for a check with a to-go box and some water. It took 10 minutes for the box to arrive, but had to get up to get our own water and we had to ask a 2nd time for the check.

The food was very good, and came out in a reasonable amount of time, so it seems like the kitchen folks were on their game. And again, the bartenders were very nice and seemed to care that things were going wrong, so that is why we are giving 2 stars instead of none.

I had a similar experience at the Oakland B, too, so I think this is probably a case of bad management/systems, not bad employees.

If you have three hours to spare and want to hang out with some very freindly bartenders and experience good food, then please give them a shot. Not the best place if you are super hungry or in a hurry,
author: Tobie M.

description: This is a great place to go for a drink or two and some light snacks before hitting up SFMoma's Thursday night 1/2 price deal!!!!  We swung by B for a few sangria's (delicious!!!) and some pupus before we hit the Friedlander exhibit.  B was psuedo-swanky - service was good, food was decent.  I'll definitely be back to B in June prior to checking out the upcoming Frieda Kahlo exhibit!!!
author: Curtis H.

description: Good place for a drink and appetizers if you are in SOMA at happy hour. Went here for dinner and everyone who works here is super nice. The mussels in cream sauce are awesome, with lots of garlic toast to dunk in the sauce. I wasn't that impressed by the cheese plate and service was a little slow. But I would def go back again to try more stuff.  Also they serve Shandys which I like and you don't see much. They have a fancy one with pilsner and pear puree.
author: Katie M.

description: I've only been once, but the pulled pork sandwich was unreal.  Seriously one of the tastiest meals I've had in awhile.  Go there for lunch.  I've also heard good things about their brunch.  Outdoor seating overlooking Yerba Buena Park is a plus.
author: Andrew R.

description: The first time we attempted, we were turned off by an Incredibly rude waiter. It was crowded, and his attitude said go away- which we did, gladly! He might have been OUR waiter, no thanks! Try #2 we greeted by professional, polite Matre-d!. The food is good, the menu is creative, small, and changing.  Mikha, the waitress was sweet, accomodating, ever present when we needed something, but not intrusive.  HER attitude said, please relax, have a a good time enjoy, I am glad you are here.  Lovely view, glad we gave it a second try.
author: Carol K.

description: We love the B restaurant, me and some work buddies regularly pass through on our way home from work for the happy hour  especially on a Wednesday, if only for the music alone, we have decided the music the DJ spins on Wednesdays is by far the best, never too commercial, never mainstream. And he spins records not some laptop.  The food is fantastic too!  Best Burgers in SF imo, pure beef patty with cheese and fries!!! MMmmMMMmMMMMMmm!  I want one now!  during the happy hour the $5 cocktails are superb, the place gets quite busy on a Wednesday so arrive early for good service.
author: Tim M.

description: ..for happy hour...great spot to chill on a gorgeous day in SF..quite a trek (versus poppin into a bar right off the sidewalk)..but definitely well worth it!
author: Syonora A.

description: Great place to hang out for happy hour on a Friday. The sun pours down outside. They have a few good specialty drinks, but also some good beers. Appetizers consist of cheese and meet boards. All is good. Really like the hidden quality of the restaurant while still being in the middle of the city.
author: Russ M.

description: Beautiful glass space.  Every seat in the house has a view of the outside.  I had appetizers there with my friend.  The drinks that we had rock!
