I had a mango old fashioned and yum, it may have converted me to whiskey-based drinks.  The drink was laced with cherries and mangos.  The beet salad was amazing.  The cheese platter was also very good.  This would be a wonderful place to grab a beverage and small bite.  Can't wait to be back for drinks!
author: Uimuim B.

description: I love B!  I love the SF one, and its Oakland sister restaurant as well.  The SF location is lovely, especially on a nice day.  You can't beat the views, and the food is great, and the drinks are awesome.  My favorite drink there is the "Love On" - one of their specialties.  The service has always been impeccable - from the owner to the bartenders to the wait staff!  I give B an A!
author: Akemi Y.

description: I was in awe of the floor-to-ceiling windows that are framed by the city scape. Lovely!  The sangria is FABULOUS!!!  We just had appetizers, so I can't judge the food completely.  This is a great bar to meet up with friends after work.
author: Kim S.

description: Great lunch spot, right above Yerba Buena and outside seating is really nice.  I've been here quite a few times, and the staff is always very friendly, the food has been really good and reasonably priced.  My food complaint was the one time I came for dinner ... "over presented" and not great if you're really hungry.  Think, artsy presentation, almost too artsy to eat.
author: erin c.

description: I had a very good time at this place.  The location was good; the decor was elegant; and the food was surprisingly tasty!  I had the tofu bucco and was impressed and thankful at the same time that a non-vegetarian restaurant actually bothered to make such a delicious dish.  I'd love to go back next time with a big group of friends for happy hour~
author: Vivian H.

description: I came here for happy hour a few times with some friends.  Very nice setting.  Pretty friendly as well with good service!   They do have dj providing music, which is always cool.  but, it can get crowded.  It's get crazy cold outside, so try and get a table inside.
author: Ryan K.

description: The service is hit or miss here but the food is excellent and the happy hour prices are good. I always get the truffle fries and a handful of $1 oysters, but go before 6 or they'll run out! The pilsner/seltzer mix reminds me of Spanish claras, they're super good.
author: Pallu S.

description:
It's all about the ambiance at B.  The light-filled space perched atop the Yerba Buena gardens is like a gem in the middle of the city - simply gorgeous!  
This is a really fantastic spot to round up a small crew for happy hour since they feature great deals on cocktails and appetizers.
author: Marta T.

description: This is a really cool place that folks should take advantage of, especially if you are going to a performance at YBCA or killing time before or after a movie.  The happy hour is awesome and they have a pretty creative drink menu. The staff and the owner are really nice!  Rain or shine, it's a good time.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Is this a restaurant, bar or nightclub? I'm not really sure?

 My recent experience having dinner there with two older ladies before going to a performance at the Yerba Buena Theater turned out to be an experiment in patience and reading lips.  They had a DJ that was playing electro drum and bass so loudly that you would think you were in a club, even though it was only like 7pm. Oh, they also had a "limited" menu because they are getting a new chef or something like that, so the food was fairly disappointing.  I think it might only be a temporary menu though.
Overall, I think the DJ being in this tiny little closet like space was completely inappropriate especially for this kind of setting.  It sort of has that high end restaurant set up going on.  B "Restaurant" might be a good place to meet friends after work for drinks, but I wouldn't recommend having dinner there. I have been there for Happy Hour with a co-worker and the drinks were great and the bartender was super cute.

Now that I have actually been there for dinner I will stop recommending it to patrons that come to the theater asking me where to eat dinner before performances, especially cute little old ladies.
author: Jessica W.

description: A spot here in the sun after a long week is heavenly, with flowers, water or and highrises at each angle. Luckily it's not easy to find unless you're already familiar. Don't tell anyone, because by mid-evening on a warm day, the bottleneck and soundtrack can be unbearable. Indoors, large windows enhance the airy feel. Mellow days best. $1 oysters.
author: elsa m.

description: one star for posting a menu on their  web site with braised ribs for $15 then charging $23 with their "New" menu.  The risotto was 1/3 more expensive as well.  The manager, refused to honor their advertised pricing, said last Thursday that they "just" changed the prices.  It has been 3 days since our visit, they continue to advertise on their web page the old prices they choose not to honor.   Their food is average at best.
author: David R.

description: best kept happy hour spot in the hood. I loved B Oakland, so was excited to hear that they were opening a place in Yuerba Buena. Gathered a bunch of my work friends and headed over there for a few drinks and apps. The consensus was that this place has great drink specials, really good apps, awesome view, solid music and attentive staff..I highly recommend ir..
author: Sharon L.

description:
'B' for BLAND.

The descriptions for the items on the dinner menu vs. what comes out don't correlate whatsoever.  The food here is bland (I had the 'Chicken threesome' with cream of mushroom soup).  Very very bland.  I wanted to really enjoy the food after reading the way they were being described on the menu, but the food fell way short.  The menu, imo, is misrepresented, and  I was glad I didn't end up ordering more.

The soup, a puree of button mushrooms, had a bitter taste.  The chicken, a roasted breast, smoked thigh, and fried leg, were tasteless.  No flavor, or seasoning, or even a hint of chicken flavor.

My wife had the Heirloom Tomato Salad, and Sea Bass.  The tomato's were barely heirloom quality/taste.  It was 6 slices, 3 of which resembled a beef steak tomato!  The other looked like they could have been heirlooms, because of color, but it was hard to tell because they were sliced up thinly.  The sea bass wasn't terrible, but it wasn't good either.  Again, seasoning played a big part here, and the lack of it is why I give B 1 star.

Our server, on the other hand, was excellent.  He was attentive, and pleasant.

And this is NOT a restaurant.   It's a large glass enclosed Bar,  which takes up about 75% of the space.  There is outdoor seating, and some seating inside as well for diners.
author: james c.

description:
don't you think it's weird that this place gets ROTD all the time?
could it possibly be a Yelp sponsor?

i've got to say i thinks it's rigged.  Yelp here's a challenge for you guys: prove to me it's not. I want to see the stats
author: SatisFahYing A.

description:
Based on dinner:

Let's start with that I'm not a picky eater and as long as food comes out reasonably on time, eatable, and you don't have to ask a waiter twice...I'm good.  

First thing we learned once seated was that oysters, crab cakes, and their house fries were all out.  The menu is limited and they really did not have any replacements for the oysters or crab cakes.  To make things worse, they were also out of fries and brought a replacement without asking our group first whether the substitute would be adequate.

Top off the dining experience with waiting 50+ mins for our food (mostly burgers and salads)....and I think you get the point.  Go elsewhere for dinner.  * Would give zero stars though waiter was fine...not his fault that the kitchen had nothing.
author: Hotung T.

description: If nothing else, just go for the truffle fries!!!  This is a great place to sit outside and enjoy the gardens before walking over to SFMoMA. The happy hour menu has some good eats and the drinks are good too, although we were a bit disapointed in the "shandy" which just tasted like a beer with a squeeze of lime. Snaps for the ceviche--very tasty!
author: Gloss E.

description: Perfect location on the top of Yerba Buena park.  Lots of glass.  Views around the park, to the metron, and to the old church and new Jewish heritage museum across the street.  Food is light and tasty.
author: Kurosh H.

description:
One word sums this place up:  HORRIBLE!

What an awful experience!  Went there on Wednesday after work for drinks.  Horrible, horrible service - inexperienced Bartender who couldn't even make a martini!  Took forever to get a drink and even longer to get an order of fries.  How hard is it to make a cocktail and serve fries?  Host was running around like a sweaty chicken without a head serving food.  Just gross!

This place is not a hidden gem.  Overall, poorly runned with inexperienced staff.  Don't waste your time here - there are so may better places in SF to experience!
author: Felix M.

description: This was my first time a B Restaurant & Bar and it was so fun! I take one star away for limited spacing, but overall, its a great place to hang out with friends and meet people. The Miyagi oysters were delicious and fresh, sangria was super yummy but a little but strong for my taste, and the truffle fries were Di...wait for it...VINE! Definitely recommend!
author: Wendy W.

description: I usually come here whenever at Moscone for a tradeshow.  Nice atmosphere and usually good food.  Last time though, 3 of us, and they were 0 for 3.  tasteless shortrib sloppy joes.  blah rissoto.  couldn't even get a decent capucino.  very disappointing.
author: vafer t.

description: When it's a beautiful warm and sunny day out, hit this place up for lunch of brunch.  Clean, comfortable, and chic.  I've only had brunch there, but they have a good selection on their menu, and their staff is sweet and friendly.  Don't expect to come here if you're in a hurry though.
author: K N.

description: Words can't explain how great this place is. It a shame if you haven't been there. Foods, drinks, service, you won't be disappointed. Try their Happy Hour menu, I swear you will want to go back there for lunch, dinner, even for desert!  I wish I could give them 100 stars, five is not enough!
author: Jelly G.

description:
wow..sat outside on sat afternoon.
best oysters i have ever had in my life !! 1 dollar each, as well.
great spicy bloody marys, too.
author: mick j.

description:
All of you Elites must have been taken care of a little differently as part of your shindig.  My experience was completely different.
First, the service was nice and professional, no qualms.
The restaurant was completely empty at 7:30 on a Saturday night. (Bad omen).

As another reviewer mentioned, we had the Tofu Bucco, it was basically grilled tofu (which I can get actually seasoned and herbed for a buck fifty at a deli) with spaghetti sauce.

The snapper was extremely salty, the purple potatoes, a limp, tepid afterthought.  The accompanying scallops were dry, chewy, almost like a Scallop Jerky?  It came with some hollandaise-like butter sauce and some sticky red sauce.  They had absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  I didn't find a single fresh herb in our entire meal. Maybe a sprinkle of basil in the spaghetti sauce (sorry milanaise sauce).

 This for a range of $15 to $18 an entree???  

A big minus goes for no bread. Maybe it's too haute to serve bread.  But like Keller from Canteen said (i think), it really shows the quality of a restaurant and its chef by the simple things like how the bread tastes.

An atrocity in San Francisco
author: Dave Z.

description: Single digit and teen prices for tasty food. Chaotic service outdoors was kind of charming.
author: Sean F.

description:
B Restaurant & Bar


Neighborhood: SOMA Yerba Buena Gardens - Upper Terrace 
720 Howard St
San Francisco, CA 94103 
(415) 495-9800 



In the Know: As I am sure you all know (statement directed towards the SF locals), if the weather is nice, enjoying a glass of wine outside is a real treat. Of course, unless you want to be shunned while wearing your best business casual at Zeitgeist, pile into your minivan and trek over to The Ramp, or go into battle royale mode to snag one of probably only two spots outside any number of small pubs downtown, B Restaurant & Bar should be your new love affair. The designers, *insert designers names after the restaurant emails me back with it*, really used the surrounding environment to their advantage. Yerba Buena Gardens is such a lovely place, and even more lovely under the foliage lined, barrel vaulted colonnade outside the restaurant sipping on cocktails. They split the seating; half enclosed behind wall to wall glass and half outside, overlooking the gardens serene waterfall. (and sigh)*picture taken by Jaime K. from yelp..and very well done job I might add. 


During the day the restaurant's boast an organic look, the neutral colors blend well with the surrounding vegetation. The unnecessarily, ridiculously large (and quite amazing) pendant lighting over the bar fills the overhead air space, acting as a dividing element from the bar life to the dining life. And, I might add, something fun to gawk at. The space and locale is perfect for a calming business luncheon. During the night those unnecessarily, ridiculously large pendants do wonders for the interior materials. The mixture of lights and candles dance off what I am assuming is sandstone walls and dark wood based bar. Oh, the dramatic effect!


Whose Who: PG rating. You can pretty much enjoy this spot for all ages. Could even be nice to take your kids to during the day; you enjoy a sip of wine, they frolic around the water fountain (under your close supervision of course). Really just fun for the whole family. Happy hour is extremely nice for the after work crowd. Night time is a little more PG-13 to NC 17. Take a date. Oogle at eachother across the table. Walk along the waterfall after dinner holding hands. Make sure to mind the bums. And enjoy!
author: Sheyna G.

description: I hear the place is OK but I've tried to go there 3 times all at normal bidness hours and they have been closed, what gives. I'm surprised Yerba Buena allows them to have such strange hours.
author: Howard L.

description:
I'm an admin for a company that goes out to lunch everyday. We frequent restaurants around 2nd and Howard whose prices are about $8-$12 for a lunch entree.  
A few times we walked up past our good old Thirsty Bear and headed toward Yerba Buena Gardens to B Restaurant.  The first 2 times we went we were happy, they had good food, good location, nice outside seating.
But, and this is a big BUT, the last time we went will be the final time we visit B Restaurant.  We arrived at 11:45a (the time of our reservation), I had 3 stragglers but I knew what they wanted to order. We waited 10 minutes for our menus, thats right, 10 min just for the menus. Just to glance down and not see any of the items that used to be on the menu. We were told by our waiter that they had a completely different menu now and were not serving sandwiches at all any longer.  We all had to order items that were much more expensive then lunch entrees, food took about 45 min to come out, and we were one of the only tables seated for lunch. At one point I told our waiter that we had been waiting for a long time and he actually told me that we hadn't been waiting that long. I told him that I had folks that needed to get back to the office for 1o'clock meetings and he said that I shouldn't have expected to make a 12 o'clock reservation and get out by 1 but my reservation was actually 11:45a . I beg your pardon sir, but we can do it at Osha, Umbria, Thirsty Bear, Prana, everywhere else. When our order finally did come out it came out in pieces and dishes were missing. The waiter was complaining about the kitchen and blaming them for everything. I don't think that is very good customer service, a waiter should be the buffer between the kitchen and the customers. Our waiter did not do a good job.
At the end, my co-workers had to leave early, I complained to the manger who wasn't really listening. and found out that they had a supplemental lunch menu that had all our sandwiches on them. Jeesh! The manager said "oh, you didn't get the supplemental menu". I refused to pay the 18% gratuity automatically added to our check and gave the waiter what I thought he deserved.
author: Claudia M.

description:
this place has so much potential, but their owners are running things like hacks.  sorry, that was a bit mean, but those guys got such potential and they don't seem to have their hearts in it!  it's too bad because the bar has a great location close to downtown, views of YB and the city, a outdoor terrace, and nice interior space.  

what brings this place down are the inconsistencies, like the operation hours and the food.  the apps are solid, but the food was pretty bad.  our steaks came out with a fatty sheen looking plastic cover from sitting too long.  the steaks were also terribly over cooked.  then there was a pork loin issue.  the menu said 14 oz, but the loin that came out was about half the size.  we let the owner know, who then asked the chef, and he later informed us that the chef reduced the portion size without telling him.  they just didn't get around to changing the menu.  finally, you never know when this place is going to close...sometimes 12am sometimes 9pm.  

bottom line, until they straighten up, stick to just happy hour at the bar b.
author: Kazuo L.

description:
a man dines alone....dressed in his armani collezioni charcoal pinstripe, wool-blend, 3-button suit....had just finished his dinner.  he awaits for the dessert menu.  he can't help but notice a stunningly beautiful silhouette standing at the bar.  

sexy - brunette....
smart - she wears glasses like a hot. sexy. librarian.
beautiful tanned glowing skin....like sweet candy....
young - she looks mature, but younger...than his wife....
wavy hair with volume - he imagines, she must really know how to blow.....
devilish looking red stiletto heels - could really hurt if she should ever decide to sabotage the family jewels....

he decides to admire her from across the way just "a little" longer....she looks like someone who he could fall head over heels for.  he thought of the perfect pick up line....

then, she turned around... 

she looked like the girl at speed:  00:26 in: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e7Gniuxh7O8&feature=related  

THIS is exactly how i feel about "b restaurant".  

it's located in yerba buena gardens.  nice stroll just getting there.  beautiful architecture inside and out.  lovely water trickling structure right outside.  lots of area for you to walk around or sit just to enjoy the city view.  bar off to the left of the restaurant.  approx. 8 tables sorta cramped to the right corner.  extremely poor and unsatisfactory customer service, and there were only 4 parties at most while we were there.  hostess was sorta bitchy and stuck up.  our server was indeed hung over.  the meal, oh the meal was....absolutely. ridiculously. gawd awful.  all our food came out either cold or luke warm, when it should be hot.  the bread was untoasted, but it didn't matter coz it was stale.  the juice was so tart (but i drank it anyway cuz i'm sweet enuf).  the poached eggs were stone cold.  the greens were YELLOW!  i was driving by lake merced on my way to the bookstore and the brownish yellow grass that i saw by the side of the lake reminded of the greens in our salad - they cleverly stuck some of the yellower greens inside our sandwiches, but i fished them out.  my steak and eggs were bland and boring, meat was not fresh and my eggs, ughhh!  probably the most shocking thing was....even after we commented about the yellow greens, we were not comped for those dishes.  i could really go on and on....but who needs more convincing that this establishment is a negative 5 stars?  

it's a real shame that "b restaurant" is located in such a unique and beautiful part of the city, but does not live up to it in food or service.  without a doubt, good looks do not mean a damn thang when personality and substance is no where to be found.  with so many great restaurants that are competing for my love, i will not be returning here.    

the. worst. brunch. ever. [classified]
author: Paulina C.

description:
if i could give "NO STARS", i would... this place has the worst attitude, ever.  i hope it closes down very soon.  a place that cops such a horrendous superior attitude towards its customers will not be open very long... 

we live nearby and frequent all the restaurants in the yerba buena garden/soma area - we take our 18 mo old toddler with us and many times, go out with friends in larger groups, with or without our kids.

i walked into this place, hoping to make a reservation for that night.  it was COMPLETELY empty on a friday night at around 5:30 pm - even though it was "happy hour".  i thought it looked promising and asked about dinner, then asked whether they had high chairs for my toddler.

the owner walked up and said "uh... high chairs weren't high on the priority list when i opened a BAR", in a very sarcastic way.  

then a couple of his wait staff start LAUGHING as i had turned by back to walk out.  when i turned around and called them on it - they looked down and denied laughing and then owner then pretended that he made his sarcastic remark "sincerely".  no apology.  no offer to BUY some high chairs at $30 a piece.    

PATHETIC and RUDE!!!!  we are never dining here and we will tell all of our friends and neighbors to never dine here, if they ever hear about  this place since it's empty and so poorly located.

i mean - you have a paying customer willing to bring in a group when you are COMPLETELY EMPTY and you LAUGH at them??????????  what kind of businesspeople are you?  

FOR YOUR INFORMATION - all of the top restaurants in the area welcome kids with high chairs, check in your stroller, provide crayons/paper/toys for kids to play with.  from the top of my head, there 's Lulu, Tres Agaves, Straits, Out the Door, Le Charm, Ozumo...  all of these restaurants are SUPERIOR in reputation and quality to "B" and they have all been extremely accommodating and welcoming to us and we have gone back over and over again.

if you are going to shun parents in such a condescending way - then you are total idiots.  parents take their kids (when they do take their kids out) to dine out at restaurants at all price points and many different types of restaurants, not just chuckie cheese, you ignorant frat boys - we take our kids to BARS/RESTAURANTS (so ridiculous, i still don't know what this idiotic sarcastic remark is supposed to mean - doesn't B serve dinner????  you think kids don't EAT???).

parents generally go early, like 5:30 to 7 pm before the big dinner rush so the kids can get home to sleep.  restaurants who are smart about it will cater to this demographic since few other people will dine that early.  it's easy money because we don't linger for hours and hours.  our kids have short attention spans and we need to eat and get out quick.  but we do want to enjoy a good meal and expose our kids to great food.  

unbelievable.  if you're going to be non-kid-friendly, at least don't LAUGH at your potential customers as they're trying to make a reservation.  

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE.  will never ever come here.
author: J C.

description: this is my go-to thursday happy hour spot.  the dj plays my jams, chauncy is a fun server, the dollar oysters are okay, and the all-glass windows and outdoor seating are perfect on a sunny day.
author: jane d.

description: had a poor salad with chicken today..tasted three days old...the owner of this place should be more present with the quality of the food consistently meeting the quality of the beautiful view.
author: LaMott A.

description: Hosted a bridal shower here and couldn't have been more pleased with the service, quality of food and friendly staff. The events coordinator, manager and waitstaff went ABOVE AND BEYOND their call of duty. I arrived late, with only 10 minutes to set up the tablescape and flowers. Members of staff MET ME STREETSIDE and schlepped the flowers and decorations upstairs to the restaurant while I parked my car in a nearby garage. By the time I got to the venue, THE STAFF HAD SET UP THE DECOR AND TABLE FOR ME!!! They did a beautiful job with no instruction. I was amazed. The three-course meal was fresh and excellent. All 20 in our group LOVED THE FOOD. We enjoyed bottomless drinks with our brunch and the server kept up with us all, replenishing drinks right as they emptied. From the beautiful outdoor seating and location, to the reasonably priced, yet delish meal to the excellent service, I COULDN'T HAVE ASKED FOR MORE. HUGE THANKS to Misty, Jack and the whole staff at B.
author: erika s.

description: The only negative I could possibly come up with about my dining experience at B last night was that my date and I were too drooly from his amazing porkchop and my perfect smoked trout to be much in the way of conversation. Our fabulous server, Leonard, would beg to differ I'm sure. We loved the place so much that we couldn't resist asking him a ton of questions. We got answers (fun fact: the gorgeous interior design was done entirely by B's three owners); we also got fantastic service.  He was friendly without being invasive and he made excellent recommendations of wine, oysters and drinks. The ginger rickeys we started with were heavenly. Dinner was supurb-- B's greek salad has roasted new potatoes and doesn't go too heavy of the feta, giving the dish a light, nicoise kind of feel. The pork and the trout were drooly-outstanding and even the black-eyed peas that came with the fish were incredible. Of course the best thing about B is the view of Yerba Buena and the fog-socked buildings that surround it. I can't wait to go back for lunch on the patio some sunny day.
author: Kirsten B.

description: The rain was pounding the glass walls and ceiling as I sipped my $5 happy hour champagne cocktail served with a raspberry drizzled heart floating on top at dusk, surrounded by the cityscape and bay bridge views. I feel as if I'm outside, but am not getting wet. I imagine on a sunny day, this same spot gets drenched in sun and filled with people in shades enjoying happy hour. I also imagine this place (only 4 months old) will soon be ultra popular. It is quite unique as it promotes a sort of 'fish bowl' feeling. The style is a modern minimal zen feel with natural and recycled materials. A DJ was setting up but we had to leave to get to to the MOMA. Nice to know they have live music. The bartender was helpful and friendly. We had a couple plates to share. They were on the small side, but tasty - my favorite was a scallop dish served in a shell, creamy and delicious. The open kitchen is a nice touch as I like to see the behind the scenes action. I would suggest getting to B -- and soon - if you want to beat the crowds that I predict will soon be invading!
author: Amy E.

description: good stiff drinks at a decent price. tasty appetizers. good soul music when my friend, skip, spins records here. i don't come here very often at all (probably only been here 3 times during the last year or two), but i'm never dissapointed. it's a nice change to come here every so often to start off your night.
author: James J.

description: I was happy with the Oakland B and now I'm happy with the San Francisco B!  I felt like I was eating in a glass house overlooking the city - a gorgeous nighttime view.  I look forward to the summer when it'll be warm enough to eat dinner outside.  And they never fail to amuse me with their off the wall entrees.  In Oakland, they hooked me with their Lobster Pot Pie.  In SF, it was their chicken breast cooked three ways.  An amusing part of the entree:  one of the ways the chicken was cooked was tempura-style.  I don't know why I was so amused.  Maybe it was because whenever I see chicken cooked this way, it's always in an asian restaurant.  It was nice seeing it elsewhere.  Anyway, battered and deep fried, it was a good balance with the bbq'd chicken and seared (?) chicken (which I have to add, was perfectly moist and seasoned, sitting on a bed of sauce and mushrooms).  I was extremely satisfied with my dinner.  Too bad their flambe dessert doesn't come with a fiery, flambe presentation.  I would've been all over that!
author: Eileen M.

description: For my 50th review, I wanted to review a place in S.F. that I miss now that I've moved to Phoenix. This place is not easily visible from the main street, but its hidden and quiet location (on the second story of Yerba Buena Gardens) is part of what makes it so charming. It has a spectacular view of the surrounding buildings of the Financial District, and if the day is warm (which is pretty rare in S.F.), their large outdoor seating area is an ideal spot for an after-work drink or an early dinner. I have not gone there during true dinner hours, but I have been there 3-4 times for happy hour, when they feature $5 selected drinks and selected appetizer specials (you can still order off the main menu, though, and if you do, I highly recommend the pork sandwich and the baked oysters!). The two drinks that I adore from the happy menu are the "Love On," which is a shockingly pink concoction that shockingly, is not overly sweet. It has quite a nice kick to it, actually. The other great drink is the fresh grapefruit or blood orange juice with vodka. I used to work a few blocks from here on Market Street, and it was my favorite spot for a sophisticated but casual happy hour. I will definitely stop by next time I'm back in San Francisco. One other note - I think happy hour on Thursday and Friday features a D.J.
author: Christine O.

description: I have been to the sister restaurant in Oakland a long time ago, but last night I got to experience the newer one by my work. I was meeting a friend for a drink after work, then another friend would join us for dinner. I showed up first and the place was almost totally empty. FIrst thing you notice is how big and airy and bright the room is, then you realize there are only a few tables and a big bar. The bartender was stylish and attentive and the happy hour choices were cheap and delicious. My friend showed up and our third shortly after. We continued to sip our drinks as we ordered dinner. I started wioth the cesar salad (I am pretty traditional). I guess I didn't read the fine print because after I had started chowing down on this delicious and beautifully presented salad my friend mentioned that the sauce was made with tofu (I have a very childish reaction to the wonder-soy-food . .."blech") but it was too late, I loved it! Next came my burger. Yeah, I know, i ordered the burger. Man was it good. Angus beef and fried feta! it also came with diced potatos in traditional color and purple, they were seasoned well and a perfect compliment to the burger (I think it had some homemade sauces as well). I gobbled everything up and felt very satisfied without being too full. The dinn er was a tad ont he pricey side, but considering the area and the food, it was a deal. I definitely recommend this place, but I am afriad once it starts getting crowdedit might be too small and a turn off.
author: Jessica O.

description: so after all the stellar reviews on here maybe i had my expectations too high? the drinks were great and the prices were okay. the service at the bar was prompt and fine... but when we tried to sit down it all rapidly went downhill. they didn't have enough tables or chairs apparently, and seemed annoyed at trying to accommodate 6 of us. when 2 more friends showed up they seemed even more annoyed. it definitely WAS crowded on a friday night. the service was slow, we explained that we had an 8 o 'clock show and ended up having the cancel the last part of our order when it had not arrived by 7:50. as we anxiously waited for our check at 8:02, i watched our waiter serve another table before bothering to bring it over to us. overall, it wasn't a terribly pleasant experience! sorry to say... i was excited to try it out.
author: Erin S.

description: No one came to our table so I finally got in line for our drinks at the bar. I waited for over 10 mins after about 7 at the table. Then, I kid you not, the bartender didn't give me change! I asked him for him my change and he rolled his eyes and then put $1.75 on the counter.  I was going to leave $2 bills and wanted the quarters for parking, but after his unilateral decision I didn't leave a tip at all.  He gave me a dirty look. I said, "Well, thieves don't get tips."  He looked at some guy at the other end of the counter and made a slashing motion across his throat.  The other guy said, "Those will be your last drinks and then you can leave."   What the F is this world coming to?!  I would NEVER go there again, and I told my sizable group of alumni party friends all about it afterward.  We'll celebrate the day this overpriced, entitled joke of a "restaurant" closes. A slashing motion, really? It's my friggin money!  Sorry you were under-staffed, but have some decency!
author: L I.

description: This place is great for drinks and happy hour...hands down.  BUT, they server great lunch!  It is quiet, friendly service, and light.  I have actually gone here for a few date lunches as well and the setting is perfect.  Lighter menu, but it has been perfect for my self and guests.  I highly recommend the vegetable sandwich.
author: Chris M.

description: Was meaning to go to the Samovar Tea lounge next door, and ended up here instead, since I had been here before I got the two confused! Our waitress told us where the other place was, but we decided to stay and had coffee instead of tea. Great atmosphere, attentive service, nice food.
author: Nickel P.

description: the food is stellar.  the people are nice, but a bit oblivious.  the price is low for how good of a view you get.  the seating is a bit weird outside and if you get the wrong seat your waiter can't see you from a distance and has to balance on a ledge to get to you.  the water is always warm and the table a bit wobbly, but great for a relaxing place in financial district you can't complain too much.  went with folks who wanted an inexpensive meal and a god experience... they were more or less shocked by the awesome locale.
author: Josh Z.

description: I went over the weekend, great atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and it's like you're half-outside wherever you sit in the place which I love. And the oysters were delicious!!
author: Allison W.

description:
okay... a little history behind the review...if I was just reviewing B Restaurant based on Happy hour I would give it 4-5 stars....they have great service... the bar tenders are friendly and helpful, the food is tasty and the drinks are great. 

however, I had to take a way one star and am tempted to take another away because of how difficult it is to book a larger parties at their restaurant. I had stopped by for a happy hour and saw the lovely set up the restaurant was doing for a group and wanted to do something nice for an event i was planning. I was given the name and contact information of  their events coordinator, to check availability.  I contacted her 3 times, (phone and email) and never received a response.  granted the date i was looking for was short notice however it would have been nice to receive and acknowledgment of my tries to contact her.  especially since I  plan large dinners ever y2 to three months and if I couldn't use them this time around I would have used them in the future. hugely disappointing, and I doubt I will try to make contact again.
author: Joy Y.

description: Decided to try B for lunch the other day because it was so nice out. It was wonderful to get away from the hustle of the city and sit in a calm, quiet setting ( I love the waterfall). A quick summary of the visit: the service was poor; food pretty good, but overpriced for what you get. Even though my friend stated what she wanted on her burger twice and the waiter wrote it down and repeated it outloud, it did not come out correctly. It took a while to get it because our waiter was mia. We actually had to flag down a bus boy. Because of food allergies, I asked if I could get a side from an entree for one of my 3 sides combo. The waiter immediately said no. Eventually this was overturned. Unfortunately our food did not come out together, quite possibly because it was not called in. It took a good 15 min for my friend's burger extras and the rest of our order to come out. The truffle fries needed more truffle flavor. I probably won't come back. I can always order food togo from some place in the metreon and still eat outside near B, saving ALOT of $.
author: Ginger K.

description: If you want a drink in the sun after work, this is SO going to be the place for you.
author: Mark P.

description: While I admit I'm relatively new to the downtown dining scene, I was by turns impressed and amused by this particular establishment. I met a friend for tea at the neighboring Samovar, and we didn't much feel like walking so we settled on dinner at B. The service had the fantastic double whammy of being both pretentious and slow, though I couldn't help but love the guy for his lyrical descriptions of the menu items ("Airline" chicken being my favorite). I chose the flank steak, which was beautifully presented (Iron Chef style plating, very impressive)... but cold!! My irritation was complete when I realized two other parties sat after us and were served their food before. So my plate was in the kitchen cooling off as I was starving in the dining room. I've worked in restaurants, so I never send things back, but upon leaving I realized I really should have. If this had been done right -- faster service the main sticking point -- I could have really enjoyed the place. But a cold steak just isn't worth the money for me. The three stars are for the beautiful ambience, great bar scene and healthy, local sustainable ingredients. I might give it another try, but I'd likely avoid the dinner service and just stay for happy hour.
author: Isabel D.

description: Atmosphere was the highest point of my meal.  I sat down at my table at 7:08p.m. and told the waiter that we had an 8 o'clock show at YBCA.  So we ordered right away.  7:50 p.m our meal arrives.  Needless to say I was not happy and I shoved it down in 5 min and ran to the concert.  Disorganized staff and poor time management in the kitchen.
author: DHVA S.

description: This is hidden gem in Yerba Buena gardens, we had a going away party a few months ago and really enjoyed ourselves!  Great decor, service, and food - a definite place to check out in the city.  Happy hour is fabulous there too, my friends and I agree that they serve the best ceviche!  Three partners with a passion and believe me it shows...go treat yourself and enjoy.  See you there!
author: Sar L.

description: "excuse me, there is a hair in my fries"...2 minutes passes..."let me es-plain. chu know the potato? it has hair. the cook, no hair"..um yea, a bunch of b.s. mr. don't know what the hell yer talkin' bout. I've never seen this kinda "potato hair" in my food before nor do I want to see that ever again.
author: shanon w.

description: this place is kinda funny, but also kind of fun. there's a lively (and loud) happy hour crowd and pretty good food in an interesting spot, good view over yerba buena gardens, feels kind of hidden.
author: Wangston P.

description: amazing view, good/above average food, terrible service. i'm not too picky about service, but they brought us 3 of one order instead of 2 and forgot 2 of our main courses completely and had to reorder them. it's obvious they didn't really care about their mistake too much and were only too happy for us to pay for their mistake.  it's annoying that we were forced to pay 18% gratuity bc they didn't deserve it....
author: Q Q.
